en: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
ff: Nyau koronaviriis je ɗon dogga e ɗon fittina ndu (COVID-19) haa Kawtirol lesɗe Erop/Wakere Sigorde Erop be Kawtal lesɗe Inglisiya, 1 Zaanviye haa 15 Maars 2020

en: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
ff: Nyauɓe nyau koroonaviriis je ɗon hawti ndu (COVID-19) ɗon sappina yaɓordeji kalkal bana haa Kawtirol lesɗe Erop/Sigorde lesɗe Erop be Kawtal lesɗe Inglisiya je ɗon aanɗina ɗum, nden bo'o haa yakke feere, nyau COVID-19 ɗon doggina be jaawal haa nder lesɗe duniyaru fu.

en: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
ff: To en jooɗi ɗo ko salli haa Italy, leesɗe, cuuɗi lekki be geeɓe sukloɓe do nyauɓe sey ɓesda taskaram maɓɓe ngam limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 je emman suklare do ɓanndu maɓɓe, be suklare je feerejo ɓesdan.

en: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
ff: haa 31 Desambre 2019, woodi kawtal gilɗi ɓernde feere je inde man aandaka wangi haa Wuhan, Lamorde Hubei, Cayna.

en: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
ff: haa 9 Zaanviye 2020, Geeɓe Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesdi Cayna wi'i yo'o ko je umminata koronaviriis je keese ndu je ewnotto haande bana nyau pofɗe je koronaviriis 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

en: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
ff: Diga nden, nyau je wangi gal SARS-CoV mbiyotto nyau (COVI-19).

en: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
ff: Sappinolji haande wi'i yo'o deydey yimbe 80% ɗon mari nyau je nyaɗay masin, bana wi'ugo yo'o nyau je raɓɓatta lawol pofɓe, e burna fu ɗon nyambitta.

en: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
ff: haa nder 14% nyau, COVID-19 ɗon lata nyau je ɗon nyaɗi e emmotto jonde haa nder suudu lekki e 6% nyauɓe do nyaara bone e sey lekkitaɓe sukla masitin do maɓɓe.

en: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
ff: Mayde nyauɓe je wondi haa suudu lekki ngam COVI-19 waɗan 4%.

en: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
ff: haa nder ekkitol ndu, min ɗon larta yahde kawtal nyau COVID-19 je ɗon fitina haa kala lesdi Kawtirde Erop/Sigorde Lesde Erop (EU/EEA) be Kawtal lesee Inglisiya (UK) e larta ɗum je woni haa Lamorde Hubei, Cayna.

en: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
ff: Mi ɗon fonda bo'o limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 je jonta haa lesɗe EU/EEA be UK be ɓe'en je wondi haa Italy 31 Zaanviye haa 15 Maars 2020.

en: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
ff: Nyauɓe COVID-19 haa lesɗe EU/EEA be UK

en: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
ff: haa ɓaawo Cayna, COVID-19 hoosi wakereji feere e yahde nyau COVID-19 haa luttuɗum nukkure lesɗe haa nder duniyaru jonta ɗon tokka je lesdi ndu.

en: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
ff: haa 11 Maars 2020, Arandere Ɗowuwo Ɗowirɗe Jam ɓanndu Duniyaru (WHO) matini yo'o COVID-19 laati nyau duniyaru fu.

en: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
ff: haa wurtol Eurosurveillance je 5 Maars 2020, Spiteri al. matini do arandere nyauɓe COVID-19 je gonga haa Erop bana ko WHO mbiy.

en: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
ff: haa EU/EEA, arandere nyauɓe je tati je Faransa matini haa 24 Zaanviye 2020 haa lornooɓe berniwol Wuhan, Lamorde Hubei, Cayna.

en: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
ff: haa 15 Maars 2020, nyauɓe COVID-19 tawama haa 30 lesɓe EU/EEA e haa Kawtal lesɗe Inglisiya, je haa kunde 31 Desambre 2019 e haa wakkati ndu be tawi nyauɓe 39 768 be mayɓe 1 727 e bo'o be mayɓe 1 441 haa lesdi Italy feere mum.

en: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
ff: Keeɓɓugo kawtal limgal be kawtal nyauɓe COVID-19

en: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
ff: haa Geeɓe Aynol be Lartol Nyau haa Erop (ECDC), limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 haa kala lesdi fu haa nder duniyaru, je ɗon mofti haa yimɓe je ɗon mari amana bana Arduɓe Geeɓe Jam Ɓandu, jagorɓe lesdi nder be je berniwol be WHO latan lartama ko weeti fu be njamdi 8:00 asiri.

en: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
ff: Matinolji ndu je be huwidi be mum ngam lartol COVID-19 haa EU/EEA e haa UK, e foondugo ngu be je Italy.

en: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
ff: Bana lartol limgal nyaube je mari COVI-19, en limmi hawtirde larulaaji lanyoɓe COVID-19, ndego en limmi yahde COVID-19 haa kala lesdi je EU/EEA be lesdi UK diga nyalade 1 lewru Zaanviye haa nyalade 15 lewru Maars 2020.

en: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
ff: En sappini bo'o kawtal limgal nyauɓe je matinama haa kala lesdi haa 15 Maars 2020 be njamdi 8:00 fajiri ɗo je laarani lesdi Italy diga wakkati 31 Zaanviye haa 15 Maars 2020.

en: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
ff: Yahdeji COVID-19 haa lesɗe EU/EEA be UK.

en: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
ff: Yahdeji haa nder ta'irde kawtal limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 haa lesɗe EU/EEA nder balɗe 14 be UK tokkiti ɓurna fu je Lamorde Hubei (Cayna) (Foto 1).

en: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
ff: Ko laarani EU/EEA be UK fu, kawtal limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 fuɓɓi ɓesdugo gal 21 Feviriye e faawi gal 28 Feviriye 2020 (Kujeji feere).

en: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
ff: Ɓurna ko wartiri ndu bani ɗo ɗum wa'ugo limgal nyauɓe je matinama haa lesdi Italy, amma luttuɗum lesɗe EU/EEA fu be UK sappini irin yahdeji kawtal limgal COVID-19 (Kujeji feere).

en: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
ff: Foto 2 don sappina kawtal limgal nyaube COVID-19, haa lesɗe EU/EEA be UK to fondi be je Italy haa wakkati 31 Zaanviye haa 15 Maars 2020.

en: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
ff: Don sappina yo'o, haa 15 Maars be njamdi 8:00 fajiri, 15 lesɗe EU/EEA be UK feere matini limgal nyauɓe je foti fonda be je Italy haa nder balɓe 3 hideko malla haa ɓaawo timmi.

en: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
ff: Ko waangi don sappina yo'o limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 je matinama don wa'a be sembe EU/EEA be UK.

en: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
ff: Yaɓorde je en ɗon lara be yahidugo COVID-19 ɗon sappina nyau ɗon yahida be sappinol je foooti larta haa nder lesɗe fu.

en: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
ff: Ndu ngam lesɗe wondi haa yahde feerejo, saanjolji haa jaɓɓuji mo je suklatta do jam ɓanndu lesdi, be sappinol nyau feere-feere haa lesɗe be dabareji feere ngam suɓɓol nyauɓe je sey larta ɓanndu maɓɓe fahin ngam COVID-19, be lartol fahin.

en: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
ff: haa fuɗɗorde Maars 2020, lekkitaɓe haa nder wakkereji Itali je ɗon raɓɓi timmi sappini kuje feere je 10% cakka nyauɓe COVID-19 mari no haaje suklare maungel e hubaruuji mbiy yo'o cuuɗi lekki be geeɓe sukloɓe do nyauɓe haa nder wakereji ndu jokki hebbinol maaɗa.

en: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
ff: Matinolji do nyauɓe COVID-19 haa nder suudu lekki e/malla geeɓe suukloɓe do nyauɓe ɗon woni haa deydey EU/EEA je nyauɓe 6% be 1%, feere-feere (be sappinay matinolji).

en: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
ff: Sey, bo'o, ɓe hawta ndu fu haa baabe gooto ngam cikkugo matinolji aynol je ɗon larna limgal nyauɓe je don aandin be limtol mayɓe.

en: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
ff: Ekkitol feere haa 2010-2011 sappini saanjol maungel je woni haa nder wondugo leesoje be ordoji je suklugo do nyauɓe je ɓuri nyaɗugo be je deydey haa Erop, fuɗɗam diga leesoje 29.2 haa lesdi Jamani haa 4.2 ngam yimɓe 100 000 haa Portugal.

en: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
ff: Bana wi'ugo lesɗe ndi foti wonda be disku ɗuri malla famɗi do Italy (12.5 leeso suklare ɗuɗɗum be suklare deydey ngam ummatore 100 000 haa 2010-11).

en: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
ff: Taskugo jaahargalji je laarani dabare jaɓɓitugo, be ko foti kala lesɗe EU/EEA be UK jaɓɓa nyauɓe COVID-19 je ɗon mari haaje yahugo haa suudu lekki e je ɗon mari bo'o haaje leesoje je ngiɗi sey mara ordoji je suklugo do goɗɗo haa pettum man 90% haa nder jooweyaɓre ɗerewol lartol ECDC do lartol nyaugo ngam COVID-19.

en: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
ff: Ngam nyauɓe ɓesdi e mofti haa nder wakereji lesɗe EU/EEA be UK feere, be cuuɗi lekki be geeɓeji sukloɓe do nyauɓe ɗon huwida haa wakere je don nyukki haa nyimɓe, matinolji do nyauɓe be leesoji je ɗon mari ordoji foti wonda haa kala Marde berniwolji fu ngam haala laasafi 2 (NUTS-2).

en: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
ff: Ko salli haa Italy e hahde je jonta haa lesɗe feere ɗon sappina nyau COVID-19 ɗon dogga law haa lesɗe EU/EEA be UK.

en: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
ff: Lesɗe, cuuɗi lekki be geeɓe sukloɓe do nyauɓe sey taska hoore maɓɓe do dabare wallugo ummatore ngam naangugo SARS-CoV-2 e ɓesdare nder limgal nyauɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19 je mari haaje jam ɓanndu, be suklare je feerejo, bana je don salla haa wakereji raɓɓungel Italy.

en: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
ff: Bana ɗon limti haa nder lartol raɓɓol laugel ECDC, woodi dabare je ɗon timmi e je yahidatta be haɗol yajjugo SARS-COV-2, be dabare je yahatta diga hurgol haa ustol, bana limgal nyauɓe je ɗon no ɓesda footay hokka wakkati deydey haa hoosoɓe hasduji ngam fammugo, jabbugo e haɓda dabare jabbuye maɓɓe to hasday be wakkati.

en: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
ff: Lartol raɓɓol je laugel ngu ɗon limta bo'o dabareji jam ɓanndu ngomna ngam ustugo sembe nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
ff: woodi tammunde dabare je foti walla lesɗe nder heɓɓugo dabareji besdugo sembe maɓɓe nder ustugo yajjol SARS-CoV-2 be ustol jaawal haa do suklare do jam ɓanndu.

en: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
ff: To sallay bana ni, laati bana dabare suklugo do jam ɓanndu lesɓe EU/EEA feere heɓɓan larula ngam limgal nyauɓe je mari haaje suklare je feerejo ɓesdan haa nder balɗe malla asaweji je warango.

en: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
ff: Nyau koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19), je ɗon wangi gal gilɗi larula nder foofugo (SARS) koronaviriis 2 (SARS-CoV-2), mbari kadi ɓuran yimɓe 3 000 e raɓɓi ɓuri 80 000 haa Cayna e haa nukkure lesdi feere haa nder duniyaru, je laati bana wahala haa yimɓe.

en: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
ff: Bana naandu mako, SARS-CoV, je ummini SARS haa ujeneje yimɓe haa 2003, SARS-CoV-2 foti salla diga bilwili e hokka irin mandolji nyau ndu gal irin lawol man.

en: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
ff: amma, COVID-19 lessi mbarugo e nyaɗugo do SARS amma ɓuri raɓɓugo e ɓurna fu ɗon rabba ndotti'en do sukkaɓe e ɓurna worɓe do rewɓe.

en: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
ff: Ngam jaɓɓugo do limgal nyauɓe je ɗon ɓesda law do nyau je ummi nga, batakewol ndu ɗon haɓda be hokkugo lartol be wakkati e be gongaku do ko don larti haa nder teffol ndu.

en: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
ff: Min lartan bo'o do ekkitol do raɓɓol nyau, daaɗol nyau ndu, ekkitol do viriis man, lartol, hurgol, tammunde, be aynol nyau ndu.

en: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
ff: Ko to emmolji ɗuɗɗum kebbay jabbuji, min tammi yo'o batakewol ndu don walla haa nder fammugo e wilugo nyau ndu.

en: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
ff: Spring Festival haa 25 Zaanviye 2020 laati bana ko meeɗay e yejjitatakke haa ummatore Cayna fu je be dolli be wondugo haa saare haa nder wakkati siwtare fu e asaweji haa bawo man ngam nyau viriis keese waangi.

en: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
ff: Viriis man ɗon nandi koronaviriis (CoV) je ummini nyau ɓernde je nyaɗungel (SARS) haa 2003; ngam man kadi Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu haa Duniyaru ewni dum SARS-CoV-2, e nyau man ewnotto Nyau CoV 19 (COVID-19).

en: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
ff: Nyau man fuɗɗi haa Wuhan, Cayna, e ɓaawo man raɓɓi lesdi man fu nden bo'o ɓadi lesde 50 haa nder duniyaru.

en: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
ff: Diga 2 Maars 2020, viriis man raɓɓi yimɓe 80 000 je aandin mari COVID-19, be nyauɓe 40 000 je ɗon hurgi be nyauɓe ɓuri 3 000 maynama timmi.

en: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
ff: WHO ɗon matina yo'o COVID-19 laati "aranol gaynyo yimɓe" e foti ɓura hulturol.

en: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
ff: Ko bana don sappini haa PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed), hideko leebi ɗiɗi, ɓuri ɗereji 200 ngurti do COVID-19 be aandal do gilɗi ndu, turtol, lartol, e hurgol diga aranol batakewol haa 7 Zaanviye 2020 je sappini gilɗi ndu je ɗon feeretiri haa nyauɓe ɗuɗɗum.

en: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
ff: Lartol ndu ɗon fonda wurtinugo cakare yahde teffol haa nder ekkitol keese e be jaawal bo'o

en: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
ff: Bana ko wowa, min fondan lartugol COVID-19 be SARS be nyau feere, mbiyotto Nyau Pofɗe cakare Funaange (MERS, nyau feere haa 2012).

en: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
ff: Min tamman bo'o ngewtugo do ko en ekkiti ko laarani aynol e tammunde do nyau be emmolji je laati bana jaawal haa jonta.

en: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
ff: CoV ji laati no bana gilgiji je footay mbara neɗɗo no aran, je ɗon ummina ndamba haa 15% cakka ndambaji 4.

en: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
ff: Amma, haa nder ujenere ndu, min foti be CoV ji ɗon nyaɗi nangugo neɗɗo nde ɗiɗi, bana wi'ugo, SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV, je arti be nyau feere haa lesdi Cayna haa 2003 be Arabiya haa 2012, e haa ɓaawo man yotti haa lesɗe feere be limtol e limgal wade je don hultora.

en: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
ff: Nden bo'o, COVID-19 je jonta ndu laati nyau CoV je tataɓre haa nder tariya neɗɗo.

en: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
ff: Bana ɗon sappini haa do Foto, Foto 1,1, samere nyau ɓernde je goɗɗo aanda daaɗi man ummiki haa Wuhan tawon haa 31 Desambre 2019 haa Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Lesdi Cayna.

en: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
ff: haa ɓaawo ɓalde joowey e ɗiɗi ta'irde CoV wurti.

en: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
ff: haa 15 Zaanviye 2020 aranol nyauɗo maayi haa Wuhan.

en: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
ff: haa wakkati nde, nyau man fuɗɗi yajjugo haa berniji, lamordeji, be lesɗe feere.

en: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
ff: haa 20 Zaanviye, be matini nyau sukloɓe do nyauɓe, je sappinatta no yo'o foti nyau man salla diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo.

en: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
ff: haa 23 Zaanviye 2020, berniwol Wuhan maɓɓakke be jaahangalji fu darnama.

en: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
ff: haa 24 Zaanviye aranol ekkitol do nyau je be larti haa suudu teffol wi'i yo'o, haa cakka nyauɓe 41 je ɗon mari nyau man timmi, sna 21 foti be lumo dabaji je Wuhan, je hoccama bana baabal fuɗɗorde nyau je wurti haa daaba feere je aandakke.

en: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
ff: haa ɓaawo 30 Zaanviye, WHO matini jaawal jam ɓanndu haa nder duniyaru.

en: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
ff: haa wakkati windol batakewol ndu, nyau ndu yajji timmi haa lesdi Cayna e ɓadi lesɗe 50 haa nder duniyaru fu (Foto (Foto 2).).

en: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
ff: Ko bana nyau man ɗon yahda law, ragare tammunde e nyaɗol nyau malla mo foti famma tawon.

en: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated ilustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
ff: haa 11 Feviriye 2020, woodi ekkitol do nyauɓe 8 866 be nyauɓe je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 timmi 4 021 haa suudu lartol feere-feere sappini sappinol keese do nyau ndu bana ni (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UIBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

en: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 rabbi yimɓe duuɓi fu, amma ɓurna be'en je mari 30 haa 65.

en: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
ff: Ɓurna reeta (47.7%) yimɓe je nangi nyau ndu ɓuri duuɓi 50, ɓe'en je maray duuɓi 20 woonay jur, e sna yimɓe 14 je ɗon mari nyau man je yottay duuɓi 10.

en: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
ff: SARS-CoV-2 raɓɓi ɓurna worɓe (0.31/100,000) do rewɓe (0.27/100,000).

en: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
ff: COVID-19 yajji nder sammere be geebeji burna haa Hubei e haa tarde man.

en: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
ff: COVID-19 hoosi no deydey balɗe 5 (2 haa 9) diga fuɗɗam haa lartol.

en: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
ff: wakkati deydey wangugo laati no balɗe 4.8 (3.0 haa 7.2)

en: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
ff: wakkati je deydey diga fuɗɗam haa waade laati no balɗe 9.5 (4.8 haa 13).

en: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
ff: Aranol lamba dayinki (R0) ɗon no 3.77 (95% CI:3.51-4.05), be R0 je lartama ɗon no 2.23-4.82.

en: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
ff: Limgal nyauɓe do wa'a ɓuri sembe hideko 23 Zaanviye 2020, je ɗon hawta wakkati yortol jaahangal hideko Spring Festival haa Cayna.

en: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
ff: Mayde nyauɓe je ɗon andi mari nyau man ɗon no 1.44% 59% CI:1.10-1.86%), be limtol mayde je nyauɓe fu lartamma ɗon no 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

en: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
ff: woodi kujeji tati je ɗon ɓuri umminugo nyau COVID-19 ɗon no baadal (gorkol), duuɓi (≥60), be nyau ɓernde je nyaɗi masitin.

en: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
ff: CoV ji laati bana geeɓe caalage e viriis je ɗon suɗɗi je ɗon mari kosɗe RNA gooto.

en: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
ff: foti senda be nde geeɓe nay, bana wi'ugo, alpha, beta, gamma, delta, e cov alpha be beta laati bana ɗon raɓɓa neɗɗo.

en: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
ff: ɓaawo laaral (S) glycoprotein ɗon takka be bawo man je ɗon jaɓɓitta angiotensin e ɗon lorna neebam 2 (ACE2) be dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) ngam SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV, feere-feere, nden kadi hawtirde ngaɗa.

en: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
ff: Genome RNA viriis yoffama haa nder cytoplasme; haa ɓaawo danyinki genome, RNA genome be laaral protein glycoproteinji be nucleocapsid ɗon ngada cuuɗi pamaron je jaɓɓitatta ɓiɓe viriis, je nastan e hawtan be neebam iyam e yooffa viriis.

en: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
ff: Aranol ta'irde SARS-CoV-2 matinama haa 10 Zaanviye 2020.

en: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 tawama bana beta-CoV keese ɓuri naandu tagɗe 99.98% haa kunde ta'irdeji 10 je be hoosi haa aranol wakere je nyau man fuɗɗi haa ton, Huanan Seafood Market haa Wuhan.

en: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 ɗon nandi gal tagol mako be SARS-CoV do MERS-CoV.

en: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
ff: Gal sappinol electron je pamaron, coolaaje SARS-CoV-2 tawamam haa nder ta'irdeji ultrethin je epithelium lawol pofɗe neɗɗo.

en: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
ff: ACE2 neɗɗo tawama bana latotto jabbowo SARS-CoV-2 bana SARS-CoV.

en: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
ff: amma, protein S je SARS-CoV-2 ɗon takka be ACE2 neɗɗo ɓuri dayugo do SARS-CoV? je hawti be je SARS-CoV-2 je nyau man nyaɗay masin do SARS-CoV.

en: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 foti bo'o tagga protein pamaron be lamba gal orf3b be protein feere je tuttama be lamba orf8.

en: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
ff: orf3b SARS-CoV-2 foti naffa nder fuɗɗorde viriis e ɗon tuta ko mbiyotto IFNβ; amma, orf8 maray kuje je foooti huwa malla mandol.

en: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
ff: haa 18 Feviriye 2020, Zhou, et al., wi'i yo'o tagol cryu-EM je darnde man foti be je neɗɗo ACE2 haa 2.9 A be hawtirde be rondowo BOAT1 neeɗam amino.

en: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
ff: Ɓe tawi yo'o hawtirde ndu, je maɓɓiti e maɓɓi tagleji ngel, hawti bana laɓɓay e hawtirde ACE2-B0AT1 foti jokkita proteinji S didi, je don hokka sappinol ngam aandugo CoV be raɓɓol.

en: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
ff: BOAT1 foti lata ko hurgol laarani ngam lartol lekki ngam mbardugo nyau SARS-CoV-2.

en: The origin and intermediate host
ff: Suudu ɗaaɗol be cakare

en: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
ff: Ɓe aandini yo'o ɗiɗi fu SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV wurti haa bilwili e sallinama haa neɗɗo gal daabaji bana paturu paaɗawu be ngeeloba, feere.

en: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
ff: Gal fondugo tagol SARS-CoV-2 be CoV ji feere, bilwili woni bana arandere cuudi SARS-CoV-2 bana viriis keese laati 96% don nandi be irin SARS CoV ji je wurtungel haa bilwili je mbiyotto bilwili-SL-CoVZX45 be bilwili-SL-CoVZX21.

en: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
ff: amma, suudu toy on mballi viriis ngam sallugo mahdi feere haa raɓɓa neɗɗo aandake, e lawal je o hoosi bo'o sey goɗɗo teffa fahin tawon.

en: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
ff: Ji et al., hoosi mboodi bana foti sallina nyau ndu diga bilwili haa neɗɗo je ɗon hawti kawtirol kalkal haa nder prootein. S

en: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
ff: haa sappinol ekkitol feere, teffoɓe haa Guanzhou, Cayna, tawi yo'o woodi daaba feere je mbiyotto pangolin je juttungel, je nyamatta hondorɗe, je laati bana lekki haa yimɓe Cayna feere, foti wona cakare suudu SARS-CoV-2 ngam tagɗe maɓɓe ɗon naandi haa 99% be CoV je be tawi haa nder pangolin be SARS-CoV-2.

en: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
ff: amma, feeretirol 1% wondan hakkunde genomeji ɗiɓi foti wona feerotirol manga; nden kadi, en don reni sappinolji ekkitol ndu (Foto (Foto 33).

en: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
ff: Hawtirde tagle SARS-CoV burna man aandaka tawon sam.

en: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 be MERS-CoV foti yeeɗita to ɗon maɓɓi haa nder njamdi 48 haa do baabal je ɗon yoori e haa balde 5 nder guldum 20 °C be peewol 40% haa 50%.

en: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 foti mara naandu be man.

en: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
ff: Ɓe mbiy yo'o, SARS-CoV-2 ɗon hulla ultraviolet be gulɗum je ɓuri 56 °C nder minti 30; ether, 75% ethanol, kuje je mbarata gilɗi be chlorine, peracetic acid, chloroform, be kuje laybugo je ɗon mari ɓeleere, amma naa chlorhexidine, foti mbarda viriis man be fakatre.

en: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
ff: Ummatore yimɓe fu wala lekki haa SARS-CoV-2 e nden kadi laati bana ni be viriis je keese ndu bo'o.

en: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Jonta, wala ekkitol be ta'irde wangi ngam ko laarani jabbuye haa do SARS-CoV-2.

en: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
ff: Nden kadi, sey en foti lartugo ekkitolji do CoV ji feere, ɓurna SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV (Foto (Foto 4).4).

en: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
ff: Ɓurna fu, to viriis nasti haa ɓanndu, fadooɓe ɓanndu famman ɗum tawon gal joɓɓe maandol aandal (PRR) be jaɓɓoɓe irin lectin C, jabbowo irinToll (TLR), jaɓɓoɓe bana NOD (NLR), be jaɓɓowo irin RIG-I (RLR).

en: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
ff: Gal laabi je feere-feere, viriis ɗon fuɗɗa sappinol ko foti ngaɗa nyau, ɓendugo cellji dendritic, cakare irin interferonji I (IFNs) je ɗon haaɗa yajjugo viriisji e ɗon yaawina mbarol ɗajji viriis ndu.

en: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
ff: Amma, protein N SARS-CoV foti mballa viriis wurta jabbuji fadol ɓanndu.

en: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
ff: Seeɗa ni, jabbuye ngam fadugo ɓanndu fuɗɗan haɓɓugo be viriis.

en: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
ff: Lymphociteji T be CD4+ be CD8+ T foti wona kandudum haa nder haɓre.

en: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
ff: CD4+ cellji T umminan cellji B ngam suuftugo fadooɓe ɓanndu je haɓɓata be viriis, e CD8+ cellji T haa mbara cellji je viriis memmi timmi.

en: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
ff: Mballowo ɓanndu T don illina cytokine je mballata bandu ngam habre.

en: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
ff: amma, CoV foti tuuta kuɗe T cell gal nastinugo apostosis T cellji.

en: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
ff: Fadol je ɓanndu wangini be kujeji bana C3a be C5a be ko ɓe ɗon waɗa habre haa nder iyam laati kandudum nder hurgol nyau viriis.

en: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
ff: Bana sappinol, fadowo ɓanndu je jo'inama haa sera haa nyauɓo je nyambitti naatini no MERS-CoV.

en: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
ff: haa yakke feere, turtol kuje je fadata ɓanndu ɗon tuuta wagare limgal ɗaaɗi haa wakere ndu je foti nawna fuffu kujeji feere, e to wala sa'a bo'o memman kujeji jur nder ɓanndu e foti wade tokka.

en: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
ff: Nyau SARS-CoV, je don fuɗɗa be sammere, foti ɓurna raɓɓa ndotti'en je ɗon mari nyau feere nder ɓanndu be rewɓe be reedu.

en: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
ff: laati bana nden haa yimɓe je ɗon haa yeeso virrisji dudum malla je sembe ɓanndu maɓɓe do tampi, ɓe ɗon mari sa'a jur nder raɓɓugo yimɓe feere haa fatude maɓɓe.

en: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
ff: wakkati wangugo je foti goɗɗo famma je SARS-CoV-2 laati balɗe 1 haa 14, ɓurna ɓalde 3 haa 7 to en dari do ekkitol nyauɓe 425 haa Wuhan.

en: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
ff: Amma, ekkitol haa do nyauɓe 1 099 sappini yo'o wakkati wangugo nyau waɗan deydey balɗe 3 e yahan diga balɗe 0 haa 24.

en: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
ff: Ekkitol feere je keese, bana don limti haa dow, ɗon sappina yo'o wakkati wangugo ndu laati no balɗe 4.8 (3.0-7.2) haa kunde limgal nyauɓe 8 866.

en: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
ff: laati kandudum haa arduɓe jam ɓanndu ngam lartugo wakkati wondugo haa sera sey foonditora be wakkati ummol nyau nder ɓanndu, ngam hebba viriis je ɗon nder iyam amma sappinay mandolji nyau tawon ta salla haa yimɓe feere.

en: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
ff: Bana ko wawi, yimɓe je ɗon foti naanga nyau, malla je naangi nyau man timmi, sey viriisji ndu wona haa sera haa nder balɗe 14.

en: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
ff: To wakkati wondugo feere mum ɓesdama haa nyalade 24?

en: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
ff: Wulugo ɓanndu ɓurna fu laati aranol mandol nyau COVID-19, je foti mandol malla mandolji feere tokkita bana sondaaru njorɗum, pofɗe bana daran, naawol ɓanndu, yirlol hoore, daande je ɗon yoori, kine je ɗon ila, naawol bernde, caarol, bana a yidi tuttugo, be tuttugo.

en: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
ff: Nyauɓe feere ɗon no mata bana pofɗe maɓɓe daran e/malla ustol hendu nder iyam asawere woore haa ɓaawo fuɗɗorde nyau.

en: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
ff: haa nyau je ɗon nyaɗi timmi, nyauɗo ɗon mari larulaaji kanduɗum be pofɗe, nawne haa nder ɓanndu fu, lammugo ko a nyammi, e iyam ɗaccatakke.

en: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
ff: Nyauɓe je ɗon mari ɓanndu ɗon wula/malla mandolji pofɗe be wulugo ɓanndu be jaw, ko to foto fuffu sappinay hudure, sey larta viriis ngam lartol be wakkati.

en: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
ff: Ekkitol feere do ummatore haa desambre 2019 sappini yo'o limtol mandolji laati 98% je wulugo ɓanndu, 76% je sondaaru joorɗum, 55% bana pofɗe daran, e 3% je caarol; 8% haa kunde nyauɓe mari no haaje mballol be hendu.

en: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
ff: Irin sappinolji tawama haa nder ekkitolji keese didi bana ni je calaaje sammere e be sammere feere wangi gal raɓɓugo gal goɗɗo je sappinay nyau ngu.

en: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
ff: Fahin bo'o, ekkitol ummatore feere haa 2012 sappini nyauɓe MERS-CoV ɗon no mari bo'o wulugo ɓanndu (98%), sondaaru joorɗum (47%), be bana pofɗe daran (55%) bana aranol matinolji nyau maɓɓe.

en: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
ff: Amma, 80% haa kunde maɓɓe mari haaje mbalol be hendu, ɓuri nyauɓe COVID-19 e ɗon tokkita be limtol mbarol MERS je ɓuri je COVID-19.

en: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
ff: Caarol (26%) be daande je ɗon yoori (26%) wangini no haa nyauɓe MERS.

en: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
ff: haa nyauɓe SARS, ɗon sappini yo'o wulugo ɓanndu (99%-100%), sondaaru joorɗum (29%-75%), pofɗe bana daran (40%-42%), caarol (20%-25%, be daande je ɗon yoori (13%-25%) laati arandere mandolji nyau e wallende be hendu emmotto gal nyauɓe 14%-20%.

en: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
ff: haa 14 Feviriye, limtol COVID-19 laati 2% to nyauɓe je ɗon aandin yotti 66 576 haa nder duniyaru fu.

en: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
ff: Bana foondu, limtol mayde SARS haa Novambre 2002 do no 10% do nyauɗe 8 096 je ɗon aandin

en: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
ff: haa MERS, do sappinol ekkitol ummatore haa Zwing 2012, limgal mayde woni no 37% haa kunde nyauɓe 2 494.

en: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
ff: Ekkitol aranol sappini yo'o R0 SARS-CoV-2 wonan 6.47 be tooɓere amana (CI) 95% je 5.71-7.23, ndego R0 SARS-CoV ɗon yaha diga 2 haa 4.

en: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
ff: Bana foondan be SARS-CoV-2 be MERS-CoV be SARA-CoV ko laarani mandolji maɓɓe, mayde, be R0 ɗon sappini haa Tabal 1.1.

en: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
ff: Limgalji je ɗon haa do ndu ɗon sappina yo'o SARS-CoV ɗon mari wawande yajjugo law do MERS-CoV be SARS-CoV, amma mbaratta jur bana je ɗiɗi je en limti ndu.

en: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
ff: Nden kadi, ɓuri sembe aynugo yahde nyau SARS-CoV-2 do ɓe'en je MERS-CoV be SARS-CoV.

en: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
ff: Fuɗɗorde sammere ɗon wanga burna haa nder calaaje gooto e haa mofturde malla moota gooto bana jaahangal.

en: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
ff: Nyauɓe ɓurna ngaɗi jaahangal malla mari baabe jonde maɓɓe haa Wuhan malla wakereji je ɗon raɓɓi timmi malla wondi be yimɓe je ɗon rondi nyau man malla je ɗon nyauɗo haa nder asaweji ɗiɗi hideko fuɗɗorde.

en: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
ff: Be man fu, be mbi'i yo'o yimɗe foti ronda viriis bila sappinugo mandolji je ɓurata asaweji didi e nyauɓe je ɗon hurgi timmi je wurti suudu lekki foti ronda viriis fahin, je yarɓinatta mandol ngam juttinugo wakkati wonugo feere mum.

en: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
ff: Nyauɓe ɗon mari limgal tooɓeji daanejum je iyam deydey malla usti (burna lymphociteji) haa fuɗɗam yahde.

en: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
ff: Bana sappinol, lymphopenia be limgal tooɓeji daanejum je iyam < 4×109/L be limgal lymphocyteji < 1×109/L, be limtol aspartate aminotransferase ɓesdi be viremia tawotto haa kunde nyauɓe COVID-19 1 099.

en: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
ff: Baabe neebam hengre be ɓanndu be myoglobin ɓesdi haa nder iyam nyauɓe feere, be protein C-reactive be sampitol erythrocyte ɓesdi.

en: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
ff: haa nyauɓe je nyau man nyaɗi masitin, ta'irde D-dimer, kuje wonnugo fibrin je wondi haa nder iyam, ɗon no ɓesdi, e limgal lymphocyte usti no be wakkati.

en: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
ff: Radio je ɓernde ɗon sappina huuduji haa ɓurna nyauɓe COVID-19 e ɗon holla bo'o bana ɗaudi gal sera-sera malla bana to a lari gal darugal haa nder yiɓre haa nder fuffu.

en: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
ff: Burna fu nyauɓe don mari nyau ɓernde, huudure do fuffu, larula be foofugo (ARDS).

en: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
ff: To ARDS yotti, huudure je footay goɗɗo larta, mofturde ndiyam, daajol kujeji nder ɓanndu je ɗon tokkitatta ɗon saɗɗina sanjol hendu.

en: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
ff: Pneumocyteji irin-1 be irin-2 je huwatta boɗɗum ndu ɗon usta ta'irde surfactant e ɗon ɓesda baabal tension, nden kadi ɗon usta wawande fuffu nder yajjugo e ɗon ɓesda foti wada fuffu sampitta.

en: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
ff: Nden kadi, fotoji ɓernde je radio foti ngurtina ɓurna ɗon naandi be nyau man je ɗon tulli timmi.

en: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
ff: haa 18 Feviriye 2020, aranol lartol nyau COVID-19 sappini yo'o pneumocyteji ɗon no ɓoora, laaral hyaline ɗon no wanga, be lymphocyteji ɗon no nasta haa nder intersticeji, e tooɓeji syncytial ɗuudum haa nder fuffu nyauɓe je maynama ngam nyau ndu, tokkitti be nawne nyau viriis be ARDS e ɗon naandi nyauɓe SARS be MERS.

en: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
ff: Tawtol RNA SARS-CoV-2 gal reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) huwidotto bana aranol dabare lartol COVID-19.

en: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
ff: Be man fu, ngam limtol je ɗon wa'i amma je wonnay gonga, je foti yaawina nyau ndu, ɓe fuɗɗi lartugo ndu be dabareji suudi lekki (je wonnay tan do RT-PCR) haa Cayna haa 13 Feviriye 2020.

en: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
ff: Irin kuje man salli bo'o haa lartol SARS.

en: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
ff: Nden kadi, hawtal tariya nyau, mandolji haa cuudi lekki, lartolji haa suudu lartol, be ko radio tawi laati kanduɗum e jaawal ngam ngaɗugo lartol je boɗɗe.

en: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
ff: haa 14 Fevriye 2020, geeɓe Feng Zhang sappini laahal CRISPR do hoosi sappinol do dabare SHERLOCK ngam fammaugo SARS-CoV-2, je ɗon famma synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA haa 20 x 10-18 mol/L haa 200 x 10-18 mol/L (fotoji 10 haa 100 nder mikoliter) be legal toɓɓugo haa nder reeta njamdi bila dabare kuje feere.

en: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
ff: Min tammi yo'o, dabare je keese ndu foti ɓesda sa'a lartol be goongaku to tawama haa nder lekkuji suudu lekki.

en: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
ff: Ngam yimɓe wooway be CoV keese, lekkitoɓe foti haa aranol yaɓorde sukla do nyauɓe COVID-19, ndego be foondugo dabareji hurgol je be huwidi be man malla je hookkama hidekko hurgol CoV ji bana SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV be nyauji viriis feere (Tabaal (Tabaal 2).2).

en: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
ff: Hurgolji ndu laarani je jonta malla je foti yotta be lekki je mbarata gilɗiji ndu, lekki je sembintinatta ɓanndu, steroidji, iyam haa nyauɓe je ɗon hurgi, lekki Cayna, be wallende gal jam woore.

en: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
ff: Ko neebam iyam haa nyauɓe je foondotto ngam hurgol.

en: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
ff: Cuuɗi maungel sippugo lekki ɗon haɓda ngam wanginugo tooɓeji be baatalji je mbaratta viriis.

en: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 don raɓɓa burna fuffu haa fuɗɗam man e naanga, amma wala nyaɗugo, kujeji ɓanndu feere je ɗon sappina ACE2, bana reedu be tettekki be ɓooye.

en: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
ff: Amma be man fu, larula besadirma nder pofɗe ɓurna fu ɗon yarna bone haa nyauɓe e kanjum laati aranol ɗaaɗol wade.

en: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
ff: Nden kadi, wallende foofugo laati boɗngol nam ustugo mandolji nyau e hisna yonkiji be hurgol gal mballol be hendu, hendu duudum, hendu je haɗatta foofugo, be hendu je ordoji ɗon fuffa ndu ko laarani sadirma nyau ndu.

en: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
ff: Nyauɓe be mandolji larulaaji be pofɗe sey keɓɓa wallende gal sallinugo hendu haa ɓaali (ECMO), dabare ummitinugo ɓernde be fuffu je ko wawi hurgugo je ɗon laarani ɓernde be saɗirma nder pofɗe be maajum.

en: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, joggugo dabare elektolyte, aynol be hurgol nyau je sera-sera be huudure nder ɓanndu, be fadol kujeji ɓanndu je ɗon kanduɗum laati boɗɗe haa nyauɓe SARS-CoV-2.

en: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
ff: Yimɓe fammi yo'o dulure cytokine ummikki gal turtol fadooɓe ɓanndu haa nyauɓe SARS be MERS.

en: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
ff: Dulure cytokine laati bana turtol ɓanndu bana jabbuye je ɗon salla gal yoffol cytokineji bana TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

en: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
ff: Cytokineji ndu ɗon ngada yo'o tooɓeji ndu yoffa ɗaadi feere-feere je ɗon ummina ɓurna nyau ARDS be nyau kujeji ɓaali feere.

en: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
ff: Immunosupression laati kanduɗum haa nder hurgol dulure cytokine, ɓurna haa nyauɓe je do nyawi masitin.

en: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
ff: Corticosteroidji be tocilizumab, anti-IL6 feere je ɗon marin fadoowo ɓanndu be klon gooto, naffi no nder hurgol cytokine.

en: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
ff: Hurgolji immunosupression feere je cytokinedon larnijabbuye fadoowo cell-T; blockade IFN-γ, IL-1, be TNF; yoffol JAK; blinatumomab; willowo cytokine signaling 4; be tuttoɓe HDAC.

en: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
ff: Steroidji, bana wulloɓe fadooɓe, ɗon no naffa jur nder hurgol SARS ngam ustugo yajjugo huuduji.

en: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
ff: Amma, steroidji to moodi masin naffata no nyauɓe je ɗon mari huudure fuffu haa nyauɓe SARS be COVID-19.

en: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
ff: Sna bo'o, foti be ɗon hokka naawolji feere, ɓurna nyollugo iyaal, je ɗon memma lartol nyau ngu.

en: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
ff: Be man fu, ekkitolji pamaron do corticosteroidji seeɗa malla deydey laati feelama e sey hoosa ɗum be hakiika ngam hurgol nyauɓe COVID-19 je ɗon yara bone masin.

en: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
ff: haa wakkati bindol ndu, wala hurgol je mbaratta viriis ndu be fakatre je tawama towon.

en: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
ff: Amma, tuffugo remdesivir haa nder lawol iyam, bana nucleotide, tawamma bana naffitirki haa nder ɓanndu nyauɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19

en: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
ff: Remdesivir laati lekki keese je mbaratta viriis je Gilead wurtini je woni no tawon je hurgol nyauji viriis Ebola be Marlburg.

en: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
ff: haa ɓaawo man, remdesivir sappini bo'o yoffol RNA viriisji feere je laarani bo'o viriisji MERS be SARS.

en: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
ff: To en joddi do ndu, Gilead hokki lekki man haa Cayna ngam foondugo do nyau je ɗon mari SARS-CoV-2, e wangi yo'o ɗon naffa masitin.

en: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
ff: Fahi bo'o, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, be ribavirin foti naffa nder hurgol nyauɓe je ɗon mari larulaaji be foofugo be mbi.

en: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
ff: Caarol, bana on tuttan, huudure hengre, be larulaaji feere-feere foti tokkita hurgol be lopinavir/ritonavir.

en: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
ff: Hawtirde hurgolji ndu be lekki feere haa nyauɓe sey wona aynama be hakiika.

en: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
ff: Neebam iyam haa nyauɓe je nyambitti be umminol fadoowo ɓanndu

en: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
ff: Iyam je ɓe hooosi haa nyauɓe je nyambitti haa ɓaawo nyau je raɓɓatta nyimɓe ngam hurgugo nyauɓe je ɗon mari irin nyau man malla fadugo yimɓe je ɗon jam ngam tatoo be naanga nyau ndu ɗon mari tariya juttungel.

en: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
ff: Kadi, nyauɓe je nyambitti burna ɗon mari limtol fadooɓe ɓanndu deydey do gilɗiji haa nder iyam maɓɓe.

en: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
ff: Fadooɓe ɓanndu laati immunoglobulin (Ig) je lymphocyteji ɗon yoffa ngam haɓɓugo be giɗdi be kujeji yaasi je nasti haa nder ɓanndu e ɓe ɗon andi toobeji je woni haa nder gilɗi ngu e natina be laugel.

en: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
ff: To en jooɗi do ndu, neebam iyam wurti nder iyam geeɓe nyauɓe je nyamɓitti COVI-19 e ɓe tuffiniɓe haa nyauɓe je ɗon nyawi masitin 10.

en: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
ff: Mandolji maɓɓe wadi damma haa nder njamdi 24, nawne lessi be limgal viriisji usti e hendu bo'o ɓesdi haa nder iyam.

en: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
ff: Amma, lartol be laɓɓinol ɗon naffa ngam hollugo dabare je foti naffa yimɓe fu hidekko hurgolji je kanduɗum wanga.

en: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, bana naffudaji nder hurgol, woodi kujeji feere je hannay je yahidatta be neebam iyam sey larta be hakiika.

en: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
ff: Bana sappinol, fadooɓe ɓanndu foti turtina jabbuye do ko fadata min e yoffa ko mbiyottoo cytokine, je foti nawna yonki neɗɗo.

en: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
ff: Hawtirde fadooɓe ɓanndu haa nder iyam burna ɗon lessi, e emmol ngam neebam iyam ɓuri ngam hurgugo nyauɓe je ɗon nyawi masin.

en: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
ff: laati caɗɗum tusnugo e ɓesdugo fadooɓe ɓanndu laugel je foti haaɓa be nyau man fu.

en: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
ff: Nden kadi, laati caɗɗum e kugal masitin ngam wurtinugo cellji B haa nyauɓe je nyambitti e manda lamba ɗaaɗol maɓɓe je ɗon yahida be fadooɓe baandu malla lartol fadobe ɓanndu do proteinji viriis je kanduɗum.

en: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
ff: Bana ni, foti en ɓesda limgal fadooɓe ɓanndu timmi.

en: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
ff: TCM laati no bana lekki hurgugo nyauji feere-feere haa Cayna diga duuɓi ujineji.

en: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
ff: Amma, naffuda man ɗon jooɗi do hawtirde kujeji jur haa nder lekki je ɗon saanja be lartol nyau je ɓe tawi do ekkitolji TCM.

en: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
ff: Ko ɓuri naffuda haa cakka kujeji man bo'o fammatakke malla wala aandugo be fakatre ngam laati caadungel wurtinugo e lartugo kujeji malla hawtirde maɓɓe.

en: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
ff: Jonta ndu, ngam hurgol COVID-19 je feerejo e gonga, TCM laati gooto haa cakka dabareji hurgol nyauɓe be mandolji nyau seeɗa haa deydey malla je be'en je nyamɓitti haa nyau je ɓuri no nyaɗugo.

en: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
ff: Bana sappinol, Shu Feng Jie Du be Lian Hua Qing Wen tawi lekki je foti hurga COVID-19 boɗɗum.

en: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
ff: Limtol hurgol je aranol nyauɓe COVID-19 tawama haa nder lamordeji Cayna duɗɗum je hokki TCM haa 87% nyauɓe maɓɓe, be Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), be Hunan (50%), nden bo'o lamorde Hubei, je ndokki TCM tan haa 30% nyauɓe COVID-19 maɓɓe, keɓɓi limtol hurgol je ɓuri lessugo (13%).

en: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
ff: amma, laati bana feeretirol caaɗum ngam woodi ujaji feere bana limgal be hakkilugo do nyauɓe sey wonda nder lartol ndu.

en: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
ff: haa 18 Feviriye 2020, Boli Zhang be huwoɓe mako wurtini ekkitol feere ngam foondugo hurgol be lekki yimɓe hirnaange (WM) feere maajum be hurgol je ɗon hawti WM be TCM.

en: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
ff: Be tawi yo'o wakkati je ɓanndu mari haaje ngam lessugo wulol maaɗa, maajol mandol nyau, be wurtugo suudu lekki juttay sam haa geeɓe WM+TWM do je geeɓe WM feere maajum.

en: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
ff: Je ɓuri tullugo bo'o, limtol mandolji je ɗon yaha ɓaawo bo'o (diga deydey haa nyaɗi) lessi fahin ngam geeɓe WM+TCM do je geeɓe WM tan (7.4% do 46.2%) e limgal wade lessi haa geeɓe WM+TCM do geeɓe WM tan (8.8% do 39%).

en: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
ff: Be man fu, naffuda e jam TCM ɗon ndeena foondolji je ɗon ayni boɗɗum haa jonta haa wakkere je maungel e haa nder ɗowirdeji feere.

en: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
ff: Wonan bo'o caɗɗungel ngam sappinugo limtol kuɗe e laɓɓina kujeji hurgugo TCM be gonga malla kawtirde maɓɓe to foti.

en: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
ff: Nyauɓe je bana ɗon mari malla je ɗon aandin timmi be COVID-19 ɓurna ɗon mari hullol nyau je ɗon halli e je ɗon mbarda masitin, e ɓe'en je ɗon mabbi bo'o ɗon matta nummol wondugo feere maɓɓe, wala ko ɓe waɗata, be haffol.

en: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
ff: Fahin bo'o, mandolji nyau bana wullugo ɓanndu, famɗugo pofɗe, be sondaaru be kujeji feere je lekki hurgol ɗon ngada bana wala ɗanugo gal corticosteroidji foti yarna haa nummol be tampere haakilo.

en: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
ff: haa fuɗɗam nyau SARS, limtol ɓe'en je ɗon mari saɗirma be tampere tumtum, nummol, hullol, duwinol ngaandi, mandolji je memmata haakilo, wolwulgo feere mum, be mbartol fu wangi no.

en: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
ff: Lartugo ko a memmi be wondugo haa sera, bana jabbuyeji haa nyau COVID-19, foti hokka nummolji e hullol haa yimɓe ngam raɓɓol, wondugo seere, be ko yimɓe wolwan do calaaje maɓɓe be sobiraɓɓe maɓɓe.

en: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
ff: Bana ni, jam haakilo sey ndokama haa nyauɓe COVID-19, ɓe'en je foti mara, be yimɓe je ɗon ngondi be maɓɓe be ummatore fu je ɗon nder haaje.

en: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
ff: Wallende gal jam woore sey larna bo'o taskinugo geeɓe jaangirdeji feere-feere hawti ngam suklugo do jam woore, ngewte je boɗɗum be lartolji matinolji wonde do nyau SARS-CoV-2 be nyau e jaahargalji hurgol e kugal be ordooji e applikasionji je aanduɓe ngam haɗɗugo wondugo haa baabal gooto oya be oya.

en: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
ff: Baatalji gonga laati kanduɗum ngam darnugo raɓɓol diga daabaji be yimɓe je don mari nyau man haa ɓe'en je foti jogga ndu nder ɓanndu maɓɓe e ɗon yahida ɓurna fu be hurgol nyau viriis haa nder aynol nyau je viriisji ngartiri.

en: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
ff: Dabareji wadama ngam wurtinugo baatal je joddi do protein S ngam tusnugo fadooɓe ɓanndu ngam natinugo e/malla fadugo ngam SARS-CoV.

en: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
ff: Baatalji je don walla yimbe foondama haa SARS je daabaji.

en: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
ff: Amma, naffuda in vivo baatalji je foondu haa ndotti'en e sappinol do mayde be fadol do nyau je nyau viriis je wangi gal daaba sey fammtirottp tawon hidekko jaangirde haa suudu teffol lekki wurta.

en: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
ff: Ndu ngam SARS majjiti wadi duuɓi 17 e wala nyau man feere je wangi fahinta diga nden.

en: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
ff: Amma, woodi nyauɓe haa wakkere feere ndego-ndego be sammere MERS ɗon tokkitta wangugo haa cakare Funaange e ɗon yajja haa nder wakereji feere je wurti gal daabaji haa gurreji je ɗon mari nyau man.

en: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
ff: Dabareji baatal wurti ngam MERS gal huwidugo be viriis je footay nawna goɗɗo, plasmidji DNA, ko je ɗon ngaɗa viirisji, coolaaje pamaron, viriis bana coolaage be geeɓeji protein je foti hawta be feere larnama haa nder daaba'en.

en: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
ff: Wurtol baatal be naffuda be kanduɗum ngam SARS-CoV do yimɓe je wala fadooɓe ɓanndu laati kugal jaawal e hakiika ngam aynugo yahde nyau ndu.

en: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
ff: Amma, laati cattudum ngam wilugo saɗirma ndu ngam ɗon emma wakkati jur (deydey leebi 18) hidekko baatal e saanjol Cov ji je tumtum.

en: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
ff: Bana nyau keese, COVID-19 fuɗɗi sappinugo mandolji mako fu haa kunde nyauɓe ujineji.

en: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
ff: haa ɓurna fu, nyauɓe foti nyambitta seeɗa be seeda bila accugo ɓataare.

en: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
ff: Amma, kalkal be SARS mers, COVID-19 ɗon yahida be limtol e limgal mayde haa nyauɓe je nyau maɓɓe ɗon nyaɗi masin.

en: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
ff: Nden kadi, wurtinugo sappinol lartol nyau laati kanduɗum haa geeɓeji je suklata do jam ɓanndu ngam aynugo do kuɗe maɓɓe, ɓurna fu haa wakereji je ɗon tardi.

en: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
ff: haa ekkitolji feere-feere je be ngaɗi haa jonta, ko ɗon limti ndu foti memma malla yahida be lartol nyauɓe COVID-19 (Tabaal (Taabal33):

en: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
ff: duuɓi: duuɓi laati kuje je ɗon kanduɗum haa lartol SARS, je laati goonga bo'o haa COVID-19.

en: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
ff: COVID-19 ɓurna don salla haa cakka duuɓi 30 haa 65 be 47.7% hakkunde nyauɓe je ɓuri duuɓi 50 haa nder ekkitol nyaube 8 866 bana ɗon limti haa dow.

en: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
ff: Nyauɓe je ɗon mari haaje ɓe sukla do maɓɓe jur ɓurna fu ɗon sappina mandolji e saɗirmaji je ɗon footitora e ɗon no mari duuɓi buri feere'en je maray (haa cakka duuɓi 66 be 51), sappinugo duuɓi bana ɗaaɗol lartol haa nyauɓe COVID-19.

en: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
ff: Baadal: SARS-CoV raɓɓi ɓurna worɓe do rewɓe (0.31/100 000 do 0.27/100 000), bana ɗon limti haa dow.

en: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
ff: Limgal mayde be saɗirmaji: Nyauɓe be COVID-19 je mari haaje ɓe sukla do maɓɓe masitin ɓurna don yara bone ngam huudure ɓernde be jiɓɓol dimbol ɓernde.

en: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
ff: Kujeji ɓernde laati bo'o aranol uja mayde haa nyauɓe SARS.

en: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
ff: Be mbi'i yo'o SARS-CoV-2 foti bo'o hawta bo'o be cholangiocyteji positive ACE2 je foti sarga kugal hengre haa nyauɓe COVID-19.

en: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
ff: woodi fammugo bo'o duuɓi be nyau je tokkitatta ɗon yahida e foti sarga oya be oya.

en: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
ff: Jabbuji teffol je yahay be lawol: wakere C-reactive protein (CRP) haa nder iyam ɗon sappina nyaɗugo huudure malla huudure laaral e foti wonna uja lartol nyau, jabbuye haa hurgol, ragare hurgol.

en: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
ff: Yahde wakere CRP be nyaɗugo e lartol COVID-19 laati sappinama.

en: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
ff: Ɓesdugo bo'o, lactate dehydrogenase je ɗon jur (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), be creatine kinase (CK) foti mballa bo'o nder fammugo ko foti wara.

en: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
ff: Neebamji ndu ɗon matinama haa nder kujeji ɓanndu jur, ɓurna haa nder ɓernde be hengre, e wurtan to bana laaral man seeki.

en: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
ff: Nden kadi, be laati bana mandolji je sappinatta ɓernde malla hengre huwatta boɗɗum.

en: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
ff: Mandolji nyau je ɓurna: radio je ɓernde be yahde mandolji nyau sey larta ɗum be kujeji feere ngam lartol sappinolji be saɗirmaji COVID-19.

en: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
ff: Huwugo be steroidji: Bana ɗon limti haa dow, steroiji laati willowo fadoowo ɓanndu je ɓe ɗon hoosa ɓurna fu bana ɓesdare hurgol haa nyauji nyaɗungel ngam ustugo nyaɗugo huduje.

en: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
ff: Nde ɓe ɗon no matta lekki korticoidji haa hurgol nyaube SARS ɓurna fu, nyauɓe je nyambitti jur yari bone ngam nyollugo iyal be saɗirma je tokkitata haa timminorde yonki maa be ɓanndu je saatay sam.

en: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
ff: Nden kadi, to woodi haaje man, steroidji sey hoosa ndu be hakiika e nder wakkati seeɗa tan haa nyauɓe COVID-19.

en: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
ff: Tampere ngaandi: bana ɗon limti haa dow, haa ngurtol COVID-19, nyauɓe ɗuɗɗum yari bone ngam tampere je wala bana man ngam ɓe ɗon no wondi feere maɓɓe nder suudu e bo'o ɓe aanda no to be hisaan malla mayan e ɓe ɗon no lara noy yimɓe saare maɓɓe ɗon maya.

en: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
