ff: laati dole ngam heɓɓinugo ɓe feelowo jam woore e wallende haa nder wakkati dey ngam wallugo nyauɓe ndu nyamɓitta e heɓta hoore maɓɓe bana nane.

en: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
ff: Bana ekkitol ummatore sappini ndu, COVID-19 laati bana woodi feeretirolji haa kunde mako be SARS.

en: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
ff: haa ɓesdugo tusnugo haa lawol pofɓe je les, SARS-CoV-2 foti tusna be boɗɗum haa nder lawol pofɗe je do e foti waɗa nyauɗo mara mandolji seeɗa malla deydey haa fuɗɗam nyau ndu bana CoV ji feere je ndokatta ndamba.

en: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
ff: Amma, nyauɓe je ɗon mari nyau haa wakkati fuɗɗam malla tusnol foti mara viriisji duɗɗum be naange, ko ɗon saaɗɗina aynol nyau ndu.

en: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
ff: Amma, raɓɓugo SARS-CoV laati bana sallan haa nyauɓe don nyawi masin, nden bo'o burna rabbol sallay haa fuddam yahde man.

en: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
ff: Nden kadi, nyau COVID-19 je jonta ɓuri nyaɗugo e saɗɗugo nder aynugo do nyau SARS.

en: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Dabareji ɗuɗɗum ɗon do lawol haa Cayna be haɗɗol wurtugo haa Wuhan be berniji je ɗon tarda ndu e tokkitol haɗɗugo ummatore wurtugo saare ɗon darna tammunde raɓɓugo SARS-CoV-2.

en: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
ff: Ko to kuɗe ndu don no sakla sigorde be lumo yimɓe be geeɓe kugal lesɗe feere-feere, limgal nyauɓe keese jippotto, ndu do holla yo'o nyau man ɗon do lawol timmugo.

en: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
ff: Ɓe'en je ɗon tammi be fakatre nummi yo'o nyau man timman gal ragare lewru Maars e jippol yahde neyban nder leebi 3 haa 4.

en: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
ff: Be man fu, aandooɓe feere tammay sam maa.

en: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
ff: Paul Hunter, et al. tammi yo'o COVID-19, je laati bana ɓuri nyaɗugo haa fuɗɗam do SARS, footay timma haa 2020.

en: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
ff: Ira Longini, et al., ngurtini sappinol je hollata lartol nyau e wi'i yo'o SARS-CoV-2 foti raɓɓa ɗiɗi do tati haa kunde ummatore duniyaru fu.

en: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
ff: Geeɓe yimɓe Kanada feere holli yo'o SARS-CoV-2 tawama ɗiɗi fu haa do leekuji je be hoosi haa cakare kine be je daande nyauɓe je nyamɓitti e je wurti suudu lekki asaweji 2 hidekko, ko ɗon sappina yo'o viriis keese je be tawi ndu latan bana ɗon tara haa baabal gooto bana ndamba.

en: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
ff: Amma, mandolji je ɗon hokka tammunde wangi haa Cayna do jippol limgal nyauɓe keese, ko don sappina yo'o dabareji jonta foti naffa.

en: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
ff: Yimɓe wi'i Ebola raɓɓan yimɓe milionre e mbardan reeta milionre.

en: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
ff: Amma, gal wondugo haa sera e feere mum, nyau ndu laati bana foti yimɓe ayni ndu bo'o.

en: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
ff: foti wona, bana SARS-CoV, yo'o sembe SARS-CoV-2 usta nder rabbugo e foti bo'o majjitta malla viriis man lata waɗatta ko sam haa neɗɗo.

en: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
ff: Foondol Nyau COVID-19 be je SARS be MERS ɗon sappini haa les ndu (Foto (Foto55).

en: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 foti raɓɓa gal sondaaru malla ɗislol, e foti bo'o gal memmugo kujeji je viriis man raɓɓi timmi.

en: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
ff: Viriis tawama bo'o haa nder buuwe, je ɗon holla yo'o foti salla gal buuwe haa hunduko bo'o.

en: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
ff: Ekkitol keese do nyauɓe 138 holli yo'o 41% nyauɓe foti nyawi gal nyau je nasti gal kine, be nyauɓe 17 be nyauji feere je ɓon no nder ɓanndu timmi e nyimɓe je suklata do jam ɓanndu 40.

en: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
ff: Nden kadi, sey huwa be hakiika ngam fadugo neɗɗo, ɓurna ɓe'en je suklata do jam ɓanndu, huwoɓe ummatore, jeeyaɓe saare, soobiraɓe, be ɓe'en je ɗon wondi be nyauɓe malla yimɓe je ɗon mari gilɗi man.

en: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
ff: Aranol dabare je foti naffa ngam ustugo raɓɓol nyau ndu sallan gal ɓornugo leepol sudugo yeeso; ɓorna leepol seekugo yimɓe be N95 je foofugo (lamba 1860s) wallan yajjinugo viriisji.

en: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
ff: Leepolji sudugo yeeso ɗon haɗɗa tude temma je goɗɗo je ɗon mari nyau man e je ɗon sala gal hendu malla toɓɓa do kujeji, foti sallina haa yimɓe feere.

en: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
ff: Amma, sna leepolji suuɗugo yeeso N95 (lamba # 1860s) foti fada ngam yarugo viriisji pamaron je nm 10 haa 80, be 5% viriisji pamaron je foti nasta fu; SARS-CoV-2 ɗon nandi SARS-CoV be juttugo e ɗiɗi fu waɗan nm 85.

en: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
ff: Bana coolaaje foti nasta haa nder leepolji suudugo gite seekkoɓe ko to hawti nde joowey, sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu je ɗon ngondi be nyauɓe sey ɓorna leepolji N95 (lamba # 1860s) amma naa leepol suudugo yeeso seekoɓe.

en: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
ff: haa ɓesdugo do leepolji suudugo yeeso, sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu sey ɓorna limse fadol je ɗon yahida ngam ustugo rondugo viriisji

en: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
ff: Viriisji man foti boo'o raɓɓa goɗɗo gal gite.

en: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
ff: haa 22 Zaanviye 2020, woodi lekkitajo feere raɓɓi nyau SARS-CoV-2 ko to o ɗon no ɓorni leepol suudugo yeeso N95; foti viriis man nasti haa nder ɓanndu mako gal gite mako je ɗon no mari huudure.

en: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
ff: Nden, sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu sey ɓorna bo'o darugal je sudata yeeso be darugal manga haa wakkati je ɓe ɓon sukla do nyauɓe.

en: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
ff: haa ummatore fu haa nder wakereji je ɗon memmi malla je foti nyau man memmi, laati kanduɗum je ko moy fu lalitta juɗe mada be sabuluji haa wakkati fu, ngaɗa dabare bana ko wowa ngam wondugo haa saare mum e usta kawtirol be yimɓe je foti ɗon ronda nyau man

en: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
ff: Meeta be reeta sey wonda haa cakka ummatore ngam dayugo be nyauɗo.

en: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
ff: Kuɗe ndu laati dabareji kanduɗum ngam ustugo raɓɓol nyau be darnugo yajjol viriis fu.

en: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
ff: Ko to SARS-CoV-2 yotti bana viriis keese haa lesdi neɗɗo bo'o, nandugo maajum be SARS-CoV bana ɗon limti haa 7 Zaanviye 2020 maɓɓitan no hakkilo Cayna ngam ko salli be nyau SARS 2003.

en: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
ff: Amma, naa hidekko 19 Zaanviye 2020 je ɗowuwo Ɗowirde Aynol Nyau Wuhan ɗon no sembintina ummatore gal wi'ugo yo'o viriis je keese raɓɓata jur e tusnata jur diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo e latay larula aynugo e natinugo nyau ndu.

en: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
ff: Matinol ndu memmi hakkilo ummatore, ɓurna bo'o be lesdi man fu ɗon no nder taskugo Spring Festival, e wakkati je be mbiy nyau man timman ndu wonnay bana be hasdi no haa Wuhan.

en: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
ff: Ɗowirdeji je suklata do aynol nyau haa lesdi Cayna foti hakila hoore mako e laritan dabareji maɓɓe haa yeeso.

en: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
ff: Bana sappinol, ɗowirdeji ndu sey (1) hakkila jur to be ɗon ngaɗa matinolji haa ummatore ngam kala wolde fu ɗon mari daraja haa gite ɓi'i lesdi e foti sanja hakkilo maɓɓe be hasduji maɓɓe; (2) wonda larnama e jabbina law haa matinolji je yahay be lawol je suudi lekki do ndenugo batakeji ngomna haa lekkitaɓe malla arduɓe; (3) heɓɓa dabare darnugo nyau haa fuɗɗam man to woodi do sembintugo ummatore; e wurtuna dabareji kanduɗum ngam taskinugo hakkiloji ummatore do nyau je raɓɓatta e larta e mo'ittina jabbuji ummatore be wakkati man.

en: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
ff: Nyau COOVID-19 je viriis keese je mbiyotto SARS-CoV-2 fuɗɗi no haa ragare Desambre 2019.

en: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
ff: haa hidekko leebi ɗiɗi, sankitti fu haa do lesdi Cayna e badi lesde 50 haa nder duniyaru fu haa wakkati bindi ndu.

en: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
ff: Ngam viriis ndu ɗon naandi SARS-CoV e mandolji nyau woni bana je COVID-19 be SARS, nyau COVID-19 laati bana umminki SARS fahin.

en: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
ff: Amma, woodi feeretirolji ɗuɗɗum haa kunde COVID-19 be SARS, je laati kanduɗum ngam darnugo nyau ndu be hurgugo nyauɓe.

en: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
ff: COVID-19 ɗon memma ɓurna ndotti'en do sukkaɓe e ɓurna worɓe do rewɓe, e nyaɗugo be limtol mayde ɓuri haa ndotti'en do sukkaɓe.

en: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
ff: SARS ɗon mbarda jur ɓuri COVID-19 (10.91% do 1.44%).

en: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
ff: Nyauɓe COVID-19 ɗo sallina viriis ko to ɓe sappinay mandolji nyau man tawon, amma nyauɓe SARS ɗon ngaɗa bana ni sey to ɓe ɗon walli timmi, ko ɗon wartira natinugo COVID-19 caɗɗungel do SARS.

en: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
ff: Ndu ɗon sappina haa yakke feere koni SARS-CoV-2 ɗon dogga e ɗon sankitta ɓuri SARS-CoV.

en: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
ff: Lartol do RNA je tumtum do SARS-CoV-2 foti tawatakke haa nyauɓe COVID-19 feere.

en: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
ff: haa wakere feere bo'o, nyauɓe je ɗon nyambitti foti mara viriis man fahin.

en: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
ff: Sappinolji ndu besdi sankitol viriis ndu jur.

en: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
ff: Ngam irin yahde nde haa nder teffol COVID-19, emmolji ɗuɗɗum sey heɓɓa jabbuji, bana:

en: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
ff: SARS-CoV-2 wangi gal toy?

en: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
ff: Ko to nandu haa 96 nder 100 tawama haa kunde SARS-CoV-2 be bilwili SARS- ɗiɗi je ɗon naandi COV, footay en yeeca yo'o SARS-CoV-2 wurti haa bilwili.

en: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
ff: Daaba toy woni suudu cakare haa kunde daabaji je sallini viriis man diga aranol suudu, mbiyotto bilwili, haa neɗɗo naa?

en: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
ff: Bila aandugo jabbuji haa #1 be 2, footay en ta'a raɓɓol, e foti nyau man fuɗɗita fahin haa wakkati fu.

en: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
ff: Ko to teffolji mbiyotto molecular modeling be biochemical sappini yo'o SARS-CoV-2 ɗon naandi be ACE2, noy be fakatre viriis man nasti haa nder cellji lawol pofɗe e saanji mandolji nyau mada?

en: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
ff: Viriis man bo'o naandi sappinol cellji ACE2 haa nder kujeji ɓanndu feere naa?

en: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
ff: To wala jabbuji laɓɗɓum haa do emmolji ndu, footay e larta law e heɓɓa hurgol je fakatre sam.

en: How long will the epidemic last?
ff: Nyau man neeɓan noy?

en: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
ff: Noy viriis man yahdi diga fuɗɗam haa yakke raɓɓol neɗɗo?

en: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
ff: Latan no nyau je memmatta duniyaru fu naa, majjitan bana SARS naa malla ummitan be wakkati bana ndamba naa?

en: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
ff: laati kanduɗum amma foti hoosa wakkati seeɗa ngam jaɓɓugo do emmolji je dow ndu be emmolji feere.

en: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
ff: Amma, be ko foti hoosatta, en wala dabare feere, sna darnugo nyau man bana ko en wawi be wakkati e wartira jonde amin bana nane.

en: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
ff: Wangol koronaviriis neɗɗo gal daabaji

en: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
ff: Sanjol be lautugo wadi yahidugo koronaviriis (CoV) be ko be ɗon jaɓɓa ndu, be ɓi adama, haa nder duuɓi ujinere do ujinere.

en: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
ff: Hideko 2003, CoV ji neɗɗo (HCoVs) ɗiɗi tawotto je ɗon aandin ɗon hokka nyau je nyaɗay jur, bana ndamba meere.

en: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
ff: Nyauji je laarani larulaaji nder pofɗe (SARS) be nyau pofɗe cakare Funaange (MERS) saanji hoore mum e sappini noy kuje man ɗon halli masitin.

en: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
ff: Wangol SARS-CoV-2 haa cakare Cayna haa ragare hittande 2019 yarɓi CoV ji ngam jayna fahin e hilni amin be raɓɓol maajum je ɗon nyaɗi amma ɓuray mbardugo do miko mako SARS-CoV.

en: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
ff: Nyau HCoV ɗon wanga gal daabaji e fammugo fuɗɗorde ko wangi gal daabaji HCoVs foti naffa amin bo'o.

en: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
ff: Ɓurna HCoV ji wurti haa bilwili e ɓe wonay no nyaɗum tawon.

en: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
ff: Cuuɗi je cakare HCoV ji feere aandotto bo'o.

en: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
ff: Maandugo daabaji je laati bana cuuɗi ɗon mari naffuda ngam aandugo heɓɓa neɗɗo famma noy o aynatta hoore maaɗa.

en: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
ff: Lartugo gikkuji CoV haa nder daabaji ɗon aandina noy fuɗɗam CoV ndu ɗon yahda haa neɗɗo bo'o.

en: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
ff: haa nder lartol ndu, min ɗon sappina ekkitol do ko en andi do HCoV ji joowey e ɗiɗi je en andi, e en ngewtan do tariyaji maɓɓe be daabaji je be wurti haa ton e raɓɓol haa kunde maɓɓe.

en: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
ff: Kanduɗum bo'o, min ɗon foonda e larta feeretirolji haa kunde HCoV ji do yahde viriis be hawtirde genome.

en: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
ff: Nyau CoV 2019 (COVID-19)je jonta ndu lartama haa nder ekkitol ndu.

en: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, en ɗon limta do ko ɗon waɗa viriisji ndu ɗon saanja ɓanndu haa nder suudu feere-feere e nyaɗugo maɓɓe nder yahde nyau maɓɓe.

en: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
ff: Koronaviriis (CoV) ɗon nder limgal Coronaviridae, je ɗon laarani geeɓe viriisji je ɗon sudi, je ɗon positive, be RNA be kosngal gooto.

en: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
ff: Irin viriisji je ɗon jaɓɓita genome je ɓuri maunugo je mari kilobase 26 haa 32 haa kunde viriis RNA mbiyottoo "CoV" ngam ɓe ɗon naandi maateleewol to be wati ɗum haa nder mikroskop.

en: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
ff: Gal larugo tagle ndu, CoV ji maray genomeji je ɗon ta'i je ɗon mari tagle gooto.

en: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
ff: Deydey ɗiɗi haa nder genome tati ɗon mari ɓanndu ɗiɗi je maungel e ɗon yajji ngam jaangugo (ORF1a be ORF1b), je ɗon lorni do pp1a be pp1ab replicase polyproteinji.

en: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
ff: Polyproteinji latan huwidotto fahin ngam heɓɓugo proteinji je wala tagle 16, je mbiyotto nsp1~16.

en: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
ff: Luttuɗum ta'irde genome ɗon mari ORF ji ngam tagle proteinji, be hoore (S), laaral (E), ɓanndu (M) be nucleoprotein (N).

en: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
ff: woodi lambaji protein je ɗon yahida be asli man ɗon mari bo'o lamba asli CoV ji feere-feere.

en: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
ff: Do feeretirol haa ta'irdeji protein, CoV ji foti nasta nder geeɓeji nay (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV be delta-CoV), haa kunde man geeɓe beta-CoV ɗon mari ɓurna CoV ji e kanjum bo'o ɗon mari ta'irdeji asngol nay (A, B, C be D).

en: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
ff: Sappinolji phylogenetic hollini yo'o bilwili be nyaamoobe laati bana aranol ɓurna suudu CoV ji-alpha be CoV ji-beta, e coolli laati aranol suudu CoV ji-gamma be CoV ji-delta.

en: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
ff: duuɓi ujeneji nay, CoV ji salli diga daaba gooto haa feere-feere e feere'en bo'o laati gilɗi je ɗon nyawa ɓanndu neɗɗo.

en: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.
ff: haa wakkati nde, woodi CoV ji neɗɗo (HCoV ji) joowey eɗiɗi je aandotto.

en: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.
ff: haa kunde maɓɓe HCoV-229E be HCoV-NL63 woni alpha-CoV ji.

en: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Luttudum beta-CoV ji je joowey feere laati HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, koronaviriis je ɗon hokka nyau ɓernde je nyaɗum (SARS-CoV), nyau koronaviriis pofɗe cakare Funaange (MERS-CoV) be SARS-CoV-2.

en: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and/or diarrhea.
ff: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 be HCoV-NL63 ɓurna ɗon ndokka mandolji nyau deydey bana peewol je tumtum e/malla caarol.

en: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and the newly-identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
ff: Amma, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV be SARS-CoV-2 je keese je be tawi ɗon nyawa yimɓe masin, e ɗon ndokka nyau lawol pofɗe je les haa ɓurna nyauɓe je ɗon mari sa'a maungel ngam naangugo nyau pofɗe je ɗon nyaɗi masitin (ARDS) be mandoolji je larnay fuffu tan.

en: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
ff: Aranol gilɗi HCoV-229E, B814, tawama haa nder ndamba nyauɓe je ɗon no mari ndamba je en andi ɗo gal hittande 1960.

en: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
ff: Diga nden, aandalji jur mofti gal jaangirdeji ɗuɗɗum do HCoV-229E be HCoV-OC43, ɗiɗi fu ɗon sappina matinolji nyau je ɗon dara feere mum.

en: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.
ff: Fakat, wolde ndu yimɓe jaɓɓi yo'o nyau be HCoV wonay nyadungel hideko fuɗɗam nyau SARS.

en: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
ff: Nyau SARS wangi haa 2003 e laati gooto cakka nyauji je ɓuri torrugo haa tariya duniyaru, je raɓɓi yimɓe 8 000 be limtol mayde je ɗon haa fatude 10%.

en: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
ff: duuɓi sappo haa bawo man, nyau pofɗe cakare Funaange (MERS) laati bana nyau je timmatakke haa do cakare lesdi Arabiya be raɓɓol ndego-ndego haa luttuɗum duniyaru.

en: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which has subsequently been renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.
ff: HCoV 2019 je keese (2019-nCoV), je innde majum saanjotto do SARS-CoV-2, on laati gilɗi nyau koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19), je mbardi yimɓe waɗan 3 100 e raɓɓi yimɓe ɓuri 91 000 haa 3 Maars 2020.

en: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.
ff: woodi matinol maungel e duniyaru sey taska ngam nyau SARS-CoV-2 je warata yeeso.

en: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
ff: HCoV fu ummi fu maɓɓe haa bilwili, doombi be daabaji saare.

en: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.
ff: Sappinolji jur ɗon mballa fammugo yo'o HCoV ummi gal bilwili, haa ton viriis saanji ɓanndu maɓɓe e hallay sam amma ɗon sappina ɗaadolji feere-feere.

en: The COVID-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to China and the world.
ff: Nyau COVID-19 sappini saɗirmaji jur haa lekkitoɓe, teffoɓe, ummatore, ngaandi haa Cayna be duniyaru fu.

en: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.
ff: Lartugo asngol gilɗi HCoV ɗon ndokka mandirɗum fammugo tariya ndu, ko ngaɗi ɗum be ko foti waɗa saanja ɓanndu maaɗa.

en: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
ff: Ndu foti sappina lawol malla lattina teffol suudu aranool, ɗiɗaɓool gilɗi ndu be daaba je laati bana suudu (cuuɗi) SARS-CoV-2 kooyeɗum be dabare aynol nyau je foti raɓɓa yimɓe.

en: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of HCoVs.
ff: haa nder batakewol ndu lartol je wangol gal daabaji, raɓɓol haa kunde geeɓeji be fuɗɗam gilɗi HCoV.

en: Particularly, we highlight and discuss the common theme that parental viruses of HCoVs are typically non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.
ff: Ɓurna fu, min ɗon sappina e ɗon ngewta do wolde je baabiraɓe viriisji HCoV laati bana footay nyawina haa nder cuuɗi maɓɓe je aranol amma nyawan goɗɗo to salli gal daabaji feere haa suudu keese.

en: We also review the trend of HCoV evolution in which the increase in transmissibility often comes with the decrease in pathogenicity.
ff: Min ɗon larta bo'o yahde HCoV je raɓɓol nyau ndu ɗon wanga be lessugo ɗaaɗol gilɗi ndi.

en: The outcome of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is also discussed in this context.
ff: Ɓe tawi yo'o nyau SARS-CoV je ɗon yahida ndu wonan lartama haa do.

en: Animal CoVs have been known since late 1930s.
ff: CoV daabaji tawotta diga hittande 1930.

en: Before the first isolation of HCoV-229E strain B814 from the nasal discharge of patients who had contracted common cold, different CoVs had been isolated in various infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat and dog.
ff: Hidekko aranol wurtinugo gilɗi HCoV-29E B814 haa sera nder ndamba nyauɓe je raɓɓi ndamba je en andi, CoV ji feere-feere haa nder daabaji ɗuɗɗum je ɗon no mari nyau bana paula, doomru, naagge, gaduuru, patuuru be raawandu.

en: In the past decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.
ff: haa nder duuɓi sappo do sappo je sallingo, ɓe tawi HCoV ji joowey e ɗiɗi.

en: A brief summary of the history of HCoV discovery in chronological order (Table ​1) would be informative and instructive.
ff: woodi tariya tawol HCoV ji ɗon limti be wakkati e hittande man (Tabaal 1) je foti naffa be matinolji e ekkitolji.

en: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year of 1966, and was subsequently adapted to grow in WI-38 lung cell lines.
ff: Aranol gilɗi HCoV-229 tawama haa aranol nder lawol pofde nyauɓe je ɗon no mari nyau lawol pofɗe maɓɓe je dow haa hittande 1966, e saanji ɓanndu mako e mawni haa nder didol cell fuffu WI-38.

en: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10~20% cases.
ff: Nyauɓe je ɗon mari HCoV-229E ɗon no mari sappinolji nyau je ɗon naandi je ndamba, be paabooje, ɗislol, bilare, daande jorɗum, be wulol ɓanndu e sondaaru haa kunde nyauɓe 10 haa 20%.

en: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.
ff: haa ɓaawo man gal 1967, be wurtini HCoV-OC43 haa sera lartol kujeji ndu be lamba sallugo ngu haa nder ngaandi doombi je ɗon musina.

en: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.
ff: Maandolji nyau HCoV-OC43 laati bana ɗon naandi be je feere'en je wangi gal HCoV-229E, je mandolji man don naandi be viriisji nyau lawol pofɗe feere bana viriisji A influenza be viriisji ndamba.

en: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are distributed globally, and they tend to be predominantly transmitted during the season of winter in temperate climate.
ff: Ɗidi fu HCoV-229E be HCoV-OC43 ɗon sankitti haa duniyaru fu, e ɓe ɗon bana ɗon raɓɓa gal dabunde winter haa wakere je wakkati ɗon boɗɗe.

en: Generally, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than one week, followed by an approximately 2-week illness.
ff: Ɓurna fu, wakkati wangugo viriisji yottata asawere woore, tokkiti ba nyau haa nder asaweji 2.

en: According to a human volunteer study, healthy individuals infected with HCoV-229E developed mild common cold.
ff: Bana ekkitol yimɓe feere holli, yimɓe je ɗon jam je jaɓɓi hoosugo HCoV-229E haa nder ɓanndu maɓɓe nangi ndamba je meere.

en: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.
ff: Sna nyauɓe seeɗa je fadooɓe ɓanndu maɓɓe sattay sappini nyau lawol pofɗe je les je nyaɗungel.

en: SARS, also known as “atypical pneumonia”, was the first well documented HCoV-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.
ff: SARS, je ewnotto bo'o "atypical pneumonia", laati aranool nyau je HCoV on hokki haa nder tariya ummatore e gilɗi etiologic ndu woni SARS-CoV, tataabre HCov je tawama.

en: The first case of SARS can be traced back to late 2002 in Guangdong Province of China.
ff: Aranol nyau SARS foti lorotto haa 2002 haa Lamorde Guangdong haa Cayna.

en: The SARS epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.
ff: Nyau SARS raɓɓi mbiyotto nyimɓe 8 096 be 774 maynama, je ɗon sankitti haa nder lesɗe e duniyaru fu.

en: Apart from the super-spreaders, it was estimated that each case could give rise to approximately two secondary cases, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the peak of viral load appearing on the 10th day of illness.
ff: haa ɓaawo ko ɗon sankitta law, ɗon sappini yo'o kala nyauɗo foti wurtina nyauji feere je sera ɗiɗi, be wakkati wangugo haa kunde balɗe 4 be 7 e limgal viriisji je ɓuri maunugo wangan haa ɓaawo balɗe 10 nyau ndu.

en: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
ff: Nyauɓe je naangi SARS-CoV ɗon sappina tawon, nawnol daande, paɓɓooje, wullugo ɓanndu, diwuunol be peewol, tokkiti be larula be foofugo, sondaaru, saɗirma nder pofɗe bana ragare mandolji.

en: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.
ff: Lymphopeniya, sargi lartolji kugal hengre, e creatine kinase laati bana ko ɗon sarga lartolji SARS haa nder suudu lartol.

en: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in SARS patients.
ff: Huudure feere nder alveolji, dimbol cell epitheliya be ɓesdol macrophageji tawama haa nyauɓe SARS.

en: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.
ff: Ɓadi 20 haa 30% nyauɓe ɗon mari haaje suklare do maɓɓe jur e sey fuffu be ordooji feere.

en: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.
ff: Ɓesdugo haa lawol pofɗe je don usti, labbi ɓanndu feere bana tetekki, fufu be hengre foti wona raɓɓanga to nyau man ɓesdi, tokkiti haa wakkati feere be duluru citokin, je foti mbara nyauɓe je ɓanndu maɓɓe maray sembe.

en: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.
ff: Viriis laati sigowo haa sera aranool man haa biopsy fuffu baabirawo nyauɗo feere je waɗi jaahangal haa Hong Kong Guangzhou.

en: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to HCoV research.
ff: Diga nden, dabareji duɗɗum ngaɗama ngam teffol HCoV.

en: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during late 2004.
ff: HCoV-NL63 laati sigowo haa sera haa ɓingel duuɓi 7 feere je ummi Netherland haa ragare hittande 2004.

en: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.
ff: haa aranool man tawama yo'o bana ɓuri wangugo haa ɓikkon pamaron, ndotti'en be nyauɓe be nyauji pofɗe je fadooɓe ɓanndu maɓɓe maray sembe.

en: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.
ff: Sappinol coryza, naawol gite, wullugo ɓanndu, be bronchiolitis ɗon woni tum haa nder nyau je HCoV-NL63.

en: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.
ff: woodi jaangirde feere ɗon sappina wurtinol irin viriis man haa sera gal leekku kine haa ɓingel gorgel pamaron lebbi 8 je ɗon no mari pneumoniya haa Netherland.

en: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
ff: Ko to tawama no haa Netherland maa, jonta kam ɗon sankitti haa nder duniyaru fu.

en: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
ff: Ɗon sappini yo'o HCoV-NL63 ɗon limma ɓadi 4.7% nyauji pofɗe je aanduɗo, e raɓɓol man je ɓuri nyaɗugo ndi ɗon salla haa summer, spring be winter.

en: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
ff: HCoV-NL63 ɗon hawti be ngeldaande je ɗon maɓɓa daande, je mbiyotto croup.

en: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.
ff: haa hittande ndu, HCoV-HKU1 watotto haa sera haa ndotti feere je ɗon no mari duuɓi 71 je nasti no haa suudu lekki ngam pneumoniya be bronchiolitis haa Hong Kong.

en: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
ff: Ɓesdugo haa nyau peewol be sondaaru, HCoV-HKU1 mbiyotto ɗon yahida be nyau dule je ɗon halli.

en: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
ff: Kalkal be HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E be HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 tawamma haa nder duniyaru fu, e ɗon hokka nyauji pofɗe.

en: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
ff: HCoV ji je raɓɓatta haa kunde ummatore ndu ɗon yahida timmi be ɓanndu neɗɗo e ɓurna fu saanjata ngam haa hokka nyauji feere je ɗon nyaɗungel, ko to woodi larulaaji salli e en andi bo'o ujaji ndu bana haa nder geeɓe HCoV-NL63 feere je caadum wanga, je be mbiy neeɓay ɗo ɗon hokka nyau lawol pofɓe je les haa Cayna.

en: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
ff: Ɓurna fu, to irin HCoV ji hebti dabareji sallinugo boɗɗum e jogga hoore maɓɓe haa nder ɓanndu neɗɗo, be latan fu nyaɗungel malla sappina mandolji nyau.

en: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
ff: MERS-CoV watotto haa sera aranool man haa 2012 haa fuffu nyau feere je ɗon no mari duuɓi 60 e je heɓɓi no pneumoniya je nyaɗungel be nyau ɓooye haa Lesdi Arabiya.

en: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
ff: Nyauɓe je suudu lartol wi'i be fakatre woni kanjuum ummi haa cakare Funaange, nyauɓe je ummi haa lesdi feere be raɓɓol sera haa wondugo haa baabal gooto matinama haa lesɗe Erop be Tunisiya.

en: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
ff: Raɓɓol feere je ɗiɗabre wangi haa Korea je Fombina haa 2015 be nyauɓe 186.

en: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
ff: Mandolji nyau MERS ɗon naandi je SARS, je ɗon yahida be pneumoniya nyaɗungel je ɗon besda tum.

en: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.
ff: Feere be SARS, nyauɓe ɗuɗɗum je ɗon mari MERS bo'o ɗon sappina nyau ɓooye je nyaɗum, je laati feerejo haa MERS haa cakka nyauji je HCoV ɗon hokka.

en: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
ff: Ɓuri 30% nyauɓe ɗon sappina mandolji nyau reedu be tettekki, bana caarol be tuttol.

en: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
ff: Diga 14 Feviiriye 2020, ɓuri nyauɓe 2500 je cuddi teffol aandititti je ɗon no mari limtol mayde haa gaɗɗa 34.4%, ndu latini MERS-CoV gotto cakka viriisji je ɓuri nyaɗugo haa nder tatiya neɗɗo.

en: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
ff: Diga cakare haa ragare lewru Desambre, sammere pneumoniya haa nyauɓe to bana lortotto ɗon aandin bana yahidatta be nyau SARS-CoV-2 tawama haa Wuhan, Lamorde Hubei, Cayna.

en: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
ff: Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu matini yo'o nyau je ɗon torra lawol pofɗe je les ngu je SARS-CoV-2 wadi laati bana Jaawal Jam ɓanndu Ummatore haa do Lesdi e ewni nyau man COVID-19.

en: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
ff: Diga nyalade 3 lewru Maars 2020, nyauɓe 90 053 tawama haa nder duniyaru fu, be limtol mayde 3.4 nder 100.

en: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
ff: Ɓurna fu, limtol mayde haa Hubei, Cayna woni 4.2%, amma je yaasi man woni 1.2%.

en: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe je nyadungel bana SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV, sappine wullol ɓanndu, sondaaru be saɗirma ngam foofugo.

en: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
ff: Caarol bo'o ɗon matittiri haa nyauɓe feere.

en: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
ff: Pneumoniya woni bana matinolji nyau je ɓuri nyaɗugo e foti lata law bana nyau pofɗe je nyaɗungel.

en: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
ff: Ko to SARS-CoV be SARS-CoV-2 ɗon naandi ngam ta'irde nucleotide maɓɓe naandotto haa 82%, ɓe samman haa asli feere-feere haa nder ɗaaɗol maɓɓe.

en: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 laati bana nyaday jur amma ɓuri raɓɓugo do SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV.

en: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
ff: Yimɓe je ɗon mari SARS-CoV-2 amma sappinay mandolji nyau tawotto e foti wonda kaanjum on waɗi nyau man ɗon dogga haa nder duniyaru.

en: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
ff: Foondugo e lartugo SARS-CoV-2 be HCoV ji joowey e go'o feere ɗon sappina naandooje be feeretirolje je ɗon ewna hakkilo.

en: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
ff: Aranol, wakkati wangol be neɓɓugo nyau HCoV ɗon naandi fu.

en: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
ff: Nden kadi, SARS-CoV-2 ɗon tokkita yahde HCoV ji fu.

en: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
ff: Ɗiɗaɓool, nyaɗugo mandolji nyau COVID-19 ɗon jooɗi haa kunde SARS-CoV be HCoV ji nay je ɗon raɓɓa ummatore (bana HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 be HCoV-NL63).

en: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
ff: haa wakere feere, nyau SARS-CoV-2 ɗon sappina mandolji je tawama ɓurna haa yakke nyau HCoV je raɓɓotto gal HCoV be sappinol mandolji je feere, deydey malla woda sam.

en: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
ff: haa wakkere feere bo'o, woodi geeɗe pamaron nyauɓe COVID-19 foti bo'o tawama bana haa nder nyau SARS-CoV, ko to limtol ɗon lessi seeɗa bo'o.

en: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
ff: Tataɓool, raɓɓol SARS-CoV-2 ɗon sappina mandolji boɗɗe je laarani raɓɓol HCoV ji be SARS-CoV gal ummatore.

en: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
ff: haa yakke feere bo'o, raɓɓol SARS-CoV-2 footan be raɓɓol HCoV ji HCoV ji haa cakka ummatore.

en: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
ff: haa yakke feere, sey lartotto fahin to raɓɓol SARS-CoV-2 ɗon lessina haa ɓaawo to sallo haa neɗɗo bana ko laarani SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV.

en: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
ff: haa ragare man, kalkal bana HCoV ji feere, SARS-CoV-2 foti tawama haa nder leekuji buuwe.

en: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
ff: To raɓɓol SARS-CoV-2 diga buuwe haa hunduko laati kanduɗum bana ko laarani SARS-CoV bana wi'ugo sey larta ndu fahin haa nder jaangirdeji je warango.

en: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
ff: To SARS-CoV-2 foti wanga be wakkati man bana ko laarani HCoV ji je raɓɓatta ummatore feere.

en: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
ff: Be man fu, mandolji SARS-CoV-2 be raɓɓol ngu, mandolji ndu, be sankitol man haa je o salli haa nder ɓanndu neɗɗo naffan ngam famtugo ko foti salla be nyau COVID-19 je jonta.

en: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
ff: HCoV ji nay fu je ɗon raɓɓa gal ummatore je ɗon wurtina mandolji je ɗon yahida boɗɗum be ɓanndu neɗɗo.

en: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
ff: Gal wakkere feere bo'o, foti wona gonga yo'o ɓaali neɗɗo wawi timmi be HCoV ji ndu fu.

en: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
ff: Bana wi'ugo yo'o, ɗiɗi fu foti wonda kisooɓe nyau HCoV je aran.

en: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
ff: HCoV ji je ɗon hokka nyauji je nyaɗungel haa neɗɗo be yimɓe je mari no nyauji HCoV aran nastay nder limgal.

en: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
ff: haa ndu salla, HCoV ji sey fufta haa nder neɗɗo ngam deydey sey jarfa hawtirde saanjolji je yahidata sam be ujaji ustol.

en: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
ff: Bana ni, to nyau SARS-CoV-2 neɓɓi e bana ni yimɓe je ɗon raɓɓi, sa'a je nyau man yahidatan be ɓanndu neɗɗo.

en: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
ff: To yahidi boɗɗum, raɓɓol ngol haa neɓɓo foti wona caɗɗum ngam darnugo wondugo sera malla dabareji aynol nyau feere.

en: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
ff: Wadi duuɓi jur, CoV ji je raɓɓatta ummatore ɗon tara haa cakka ummatore, e ɗon hokka ndamba meere haa be'en je ɓanndu maɓɓe ɗon mari fadooɓe je ɗon be sembe.

en: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
ff: Viriisji ndu maray haaje suudu haa daaba.

en: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
ff: Sna, SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV je ɗon nyaɗungel masitin yahiday boɗɗum be ɓanndu neɗɗo tawon e raɓɓol maɓɓe haa cakka ummatore footay neeɓa.

en: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
ff: Ɓe mari haaje joggugo e sankittugo haa nder cuuɗi daabaji maɓɓe e teffa dabare yahugo haa gaɗɗa neɗɗo, temma gal suudu malla cuuɗi haa mo je sendatta nyau ndu.

en: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 ɗon mari mandolji je ɗon naandi je SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV be HCoV ji je nay je raɓɓatta ummatore.

en: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
ff: Ɗon raɓɓa jur bana HCoV ji je raɓɓata ummatore, haa wakkati nde tawon bana wi'ugo.

en: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
ff: Amma, ɓuri nyaɗugo do HCoV ji je rabbatta haa nder ummatore e lessi nyaɗugo do SARS-CoV malla MERS-CoV.

en: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
ff: Sey larta fahin to foti yahida be boɗɗum haa neɗɗo e tara haa kunde ummatore bila keɓɓugo suudu malla daaba je foti siga ndu haa nder ɓanndu mada.

en: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
ff: Hidekko en ngewta do wangugo HCoV ji gal daabaji, naffan amin masin ngewtugo do ko woni HCoV ji, cuuɗi maɓɓe je aranool, je cakare e je raɓɓugo.

en: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
ff: Daaba laati bana suudu yahde HCoV to o ɗon sigga irin gildi je foti maama mako ɗon naandi masin haa wakere ta'irde nucleotide haa nder ɓanndu mako.

en: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
ff: Maama viriis ɓurna ɗon yahida boɗɗum e nyaɗay sam haa nder suudu daada man.

en: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
ff: Bana ni bo'o, suudu siggoowo ɗon jogga HCoV haa tokkita e haa neɓɓa.

en: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
ff: Ɗiɗi fu, daabaji je siggotto ndu ɗon mari gilɗi ndu haa nder ɓanndu maɓɓe e woni aranool cuuɗi HCoV ji malla maama maɓɓe.

en: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
ff: Amma, to HCoV nasti keese haa nder suudu je cakare hidekko malla haa yakke nastirde haa neɗɗo, yahidatta boɗɗum be suudu je keese e ɓurna fu ɗon nyaɗi.

en: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
ff: Suudu je cakare ndu foti wona bana ɗaaɗol raɓɓol diga daaba haa neɗɗo e ɗon huwa bana suudu raɓɓungel gal accugo viriisji ndu nufta nden sallina dum haa neɗɗo ngam yajjinugo raɓɓol ngel.

en: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
ff: HCoV foti timma feere mako to footay salla gal dabaji hideko yotta haa nder ɓanndu neɗɗo.

en: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
ff: Nden bo'o, HCoV ji foti yahida be suudu je cakare e foti raɓɓa be wakkati haa nder duuɓiji ɗuɗɗum.

en: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
ff: Nden kadi, suudu je cakare latan daaba siggoorde je aranool.

en: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
ff: Matinolji do nyau ndu sappini yo'o woodi kuje feere pamaron haa SARS je footitiri be daabaji ladde.

en: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
ff: Teffolji do yonki viriis je tokkiti holli yo'o sippoɓe daabaji ɗon no mari limtol anti-SARS-CoV IgG to en foondi be je ummatore fu.

en: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
ff: Daabaji feere bana patuuru (Paguma larvata) be rawaandu feere bana doomruweela haa nder lumo daabaji laati aranool je rondi irin viriis SARS-CoV je ɗon naandi be SARS-CoV.

en: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
ff: Ndu ngam ɗon fadi haa sera gal ngewte je wi'atta yo'o wala SARS feere je ɓe matini haa ɓaawo mbardol irin daabaji ndu fu da nder lumo.

en: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
ff: Amma, ɓe matini yo'o daabaji bana patuuru go'o je ladde malla ngeesaji je nastay lumo daabaji be gite rondaay no SARS-CoV man sam, ko ɗon holla yo'o foti irin patuuji man laati bana suudu cakare je rondi gilɗi amma wonay suudu aranool SARS-CoV.

en: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
ff: Bana wi'ugo, nde 80% daabaji feere-feere haa nder lumoji Guangzhou ɗon mari fadooɓe ɓanndu anti-SARS-CoV, foti bo'o daabaji pamaron feere lata bana cuɗɗi je cakare raɓɓol SARS-CoV.

en: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
ff: Ndu fu woni bana ragare cuɗɗi haa SARS-CoV.

en: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
ff: Teffol je tokki daaba je laati bana suudu aranool SARS-CoV sappini CoV je ɗon ɓadi be je bilwili feere, je mbiyotto bilwili CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3) je naandi be Rhinolophus, je tawama haa cakka bilwili feere haa lesdi Cayna.

en: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
ff: Bilwili ndu ɗon mari fadooɓe ɓanndu je anti-SARS-CoV be ta'irde genome SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.

en: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
ff: CoV ji bilwili ndu be feere ɗon mari 88-92% naandu ta'irde nucleotide be SARS-CoV.

en: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
ff: Jaangirdeji laati mahol ngewte keese je bilwili ɗon mari mandolji je ummi haa neɗɗo.

en: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
ff: CoV ji duɗɗum je ɗon naandi SARS (SL-CoVs) manditto haa bilwili, amma wala gooto sna je mbiyotoo WIV1 foti siggotto haa sera ba viriis je ɗon nyeeɗa.

en: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
ff: Neebam latinugo angiotensin 2 (ACE2) laati bana jabbowo SARS-CoV.

en: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
ff: WIV1 je wurti haa leeku buuwe bilwili ɗon holla bilwili, patuuru be ACE2 neɗɗo bana jaɓɓowo nastirde cell.

en: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
ff: Fahin bo'o, iyamji nyauɓe SARS je ɗon be daama foti no natina WIV1.

en: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
ff: Nden kadi, WIV1 ɗon holla maama SARS-CoV je ɓuri ɓadugo haa nder bilwili, ɓe ɗon senda 95% ta'irde naandu nucleotide.

en: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
ff: Ko to naandu laati ɗuɗɗum haa kunde viriisji didi ndu, yimɓe ɓurni tammugo yo'o WIV1 wonnay maama cakare viriis SARS-CoV e bilwili wonnay siggorde cakare SARS-CoV.

en: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
ff: Lartol phylogenetic sammere MERS-CoV be irin geeɓe be bilwili CoV-HKU4 be bilwili CoV-HKU5.

en: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
ff: Bilwili CoV-HKU4 be MERS-CoV ɗon mari jaɓɓowo gooto, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), ngam nastirde viriis.

en: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
ff: Ta'irdeji polymerase RNA je RNA-dependent MERS-CoV ɗon naandi gal ɗaaɗol maɓɓe be ko ɓe tawi haa nder beta-CoV ji bilwili je maandi haa Erop be Afirika.

en: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
ff: haa jonta, wala MERS-CoV je ɗon nyeeɗa foti tawama haa nder bilwili.

en: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
ff: MERS-CoV be bilwili baabirawo maaɗa CoV-HKU25 don mari 87% naandu ta'irde nucleotide maɓɓe.

en: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
ff: Nden kadi, bilwili footay wona suudu cakare haa MERS-CoV.

en: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
ff: haa wakere feere bo'o, jaangirdeji haa Lesdi Caakare sappini yo'o ngeeloba ɗon mari gilɗi MERS-CoV je ɗon naatina kujeji jam ɓanndu, kalkal bana ngeeloba Lesdi Caakare je wangi haa nder lesdi Afirika ɗuɗɗum.

en: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
ff: MERS-CoV je ɗon nyeeɗa je ɗon naandi viriis je tawotto haa nder neɗɗo je ɓe wurtini sera haa leekuji ngeeloba, je ɗon sappina fihin yo'o ngeelobaji laati suudu jaɓɓowo MERS-CoV je gonga.

en: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
ff: Sey famma bo'o ɓurna mandolji nyau deydey ɗon wanga nattinol viriis jur maandama haa ngeelobaji je ɓe tuffini be MERS-CoV ngam lartol.

en: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
ff: Ngeelobaji je ɗon mari nyau ɗon wurtina viriisji ndu naa gal lawol pofɗe tan amma gal lawol buuwe be hunduko, je laati bo'o lawol aranool haa wurtol viriis bilwili.

en: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
ff: Amma, haa jonta woodi emmolji feere ɗon ngam woodi geeɓeji MERS feere je ɗon andi meeɗay footugo be ngeelobaji hidekko fuɗɗam mandol nyau, bana wi'ugo yo'o neɗɗo on sallini ɗum haa neɗɗo malla labbi raɓɓol aandakke be asngol daaba je ɗon jaɓɓitatta MERS-CoV aandakke.

en: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
ff: SARS-CoV-2 ɗon mari 96.2% naandu nucleotide be bilwili CoV RaTG13 je wurti sera gal bilwili Rhinolophus affinis.

en: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
ff: Bana SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV, ta'irde feeretirol haa kunde SARS-CoV-2 be RaTG13 laati maungel ngam hoosugo ndu baabirawo maaɗa.

en: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
ff: Bana wi'ugo, bilwili footay wona suudu malla cuuɗi aranool je SARS-CoV-2 sna to CoV ji je naandi je bilwili tawama haa yeeso.

en: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
ff: En tamman yo'o, daaba je foti wona suudu cakare SARS-CoV-2 wonan haa kunde daabaji ladde je ɗon sippi malla hiirsi haa Lumo Daabaji Huanan, be ɗume ɓurna arandere nyauɓe COVID-19 ɗon laarani, je foti holla yo'o raɓɓol ngu salli diga daaba haa neɗɗo.

en: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Jaangirdeji je keese ɗuɗɗum do ta'irdeji gilɗi ngu sappini yo'o woodi geeɓeji daabaji je pamaron je mbiyotto pangolin (Manis javanica) foti jogga gilɗi beta-CoV je laati bana SARS-CoV-2.

en: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
ff: CoV genomeji pangolin je keese ɗon mari 85-92% ta'irde nucleotide ɗon naandi be je SARS-CoV-2.

en: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
ff: Amma, ɓe ɗon ɓadi masitin be RaTG13 with be 90% naandu haa ta'irde nucleotide maɓɓe.

en: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
ff: Ɓe ɗon samma haa nder asli je ɗon naandi viriisji SARS-CoV-2-didi haa nder asngol maɓɓe, gooto don naandi gal jaɓɓowo kuje hawtirde (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, be 97.4% ta'irde maandirɗum amino acid.

en: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
ff: Ko yahay bo'o, RBD ji SARS-CoV-2 be RaTG13 ɗon ɓuri feeretirigo, ko to ta'irde genome maɓɓe ɗon naandi jur bo'o.

en: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
ff: haa nder jaangirde je arti do pangolinji je mari no nyau sappini contigji viriis haa nder leeku fuffu, je ɗon naandi be SARS-CoV-2.

en: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
ff: Jaangirde ndu hoosi dabareji kawtal ɗiɗi e yiggugo be jungo ngam wurtinugo ta'irde genome feere je ɗon mari deydey 86.3% juttol genome viriis.

en: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Footay en acca bo ekkitol je sappinata pangolin laati gooto haa cakka daabaji je woni suudu cakare SARS-CoV-2.

en: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
ff: Amma, jonta kam wala sappinol je ɗon holla yo'o pangolin on woni suudu aranool SARS-CoV-2 ngam woodi feeretirol ta'irde haa kunde SARS-CoV-2 be beta-CoV SARS-CoV-2-pangolin.

en: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, dayuggo haa kunde SARS-CoV-2 be RaTG13 laati pamaron do je haa kunde SARS-CoV-2 be CoV jipangolin be beta-CoV ji SARS-CoV-2-pangolin.

en: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
ff: Yahde SARS-CoV-2 haa nder bilwili, pangolinji be daabaji feere sey larta ndu fahin.

en: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
ff: Bana ta'irde naandu je ɓuri tawama haa nder RBD ji haa kunde SARS-CoV-2 be pangolin, beta-CoV ji SARS-CoV-2, SARS-CoV-2 be RaTG13 ɗon mari naandu maungel haa ta'irde genome maɓɓe.

en: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
ff: Yimɓe jur ɗon wolwa do naandu je ɗon jur haa kunde RBD ji beta-CoV ji pangolin SARS-CoV-2 be SARS-CoV-2 ɗon jooɗi do suɓɓol ngam yahde hawtirde.

en: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
ff: woodi sappinol feere je yiɗi larta hawtirde haa kunde beta-CoV SARS-CoV-2 PANGOLIN be RaTG13 haa nder tataɓool asngol daaba.

en: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
ff: Bana sembe yahde, hawtirde ɗo sankitti haa kunde beta-CoV ji.

en: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Wakili'en ɗon larita daaba je wadi SARS-CoV-2 ndu.

en: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
ff: haa ɓesdare HCoV je ɗon nyaɗi masin, wangol HCoV-229E man gal daabaji, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 be HCoV-HKU1 laati jaanginama.

en: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
ff: Sappinol asngol holli yo'o ɗiɗi fu HCoV-NL63 be HCoV-229E foti wurti haa CoV ji bilwili, amma maama viriisji HCoV-OC43 be HCoV-HKU1 tawama haa nder nyamooɓe.

en: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
ff: Ɗon sappini yo'o CoV bilwili mbiyotto ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) je tawama nder bilwili Woila America je ɗon mari didolji tati ɗon mari no naandu HCoV-NL63.

en: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
ff: haa wakkere feere, ɗaaɗol HCoV-229E hawtama be CoV bilwili, je mbiyotto Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, je tawama haa Ghana, e bo'o ngeelobaji hoccama bana suudu cakare maaɗa.

en: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
ff: Ngam laɓɓinugo wolde, aandal je jonta do ɗaaɗol daaba je HCoV ji je ɗon aandin ɗon hawti haa nder Foto 1 be Tabaal 2.

en: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
ff: Lartol ɗaadol holli sappinol do kuje je foti sallina HCoV ji haa kunde daaba be neɗɗo haa nder tariya.

en: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
ff: To HCoV-OC43 salli daabaji haa raɓɓa neɗɗo gal daabaji saare gal 1890, woodi no nyau pofɗe je ɗon wangi.

en: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
ff: Raɓɓol daaba-neɗɗo haa nder tariya HCoV-229E laɓɓay boɗɗum.

en: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
ff: Bilwili alpha-CoV ji je ɗon naandi jur be HCoV-229E tawama.

en: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
ff: haa kunde maɓɓe woodi alpha-CoV alpaka feere.

en: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
ff: Sappinolji duɗɗum ɗon sembintina ko be wi'i viriis man salli diga bilwili haa neɗɗo ciir.

en: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
ff: Aranool, neɗɗo amma naa alpakaji foti hawta be bilwili haa nder wakere jonde gooto.

en: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
ff: Sna non, yimɓe ɗon foota be alpakaji.

en: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
ff: Ɗiɗaɓool, alpha-CoV ji HCoV-229E ɗon waagi e maray mandolji nyau haa bilwili, amma alpha-CoV alpaka wangini nyau pofɗe haa daabaji je raɓɓi viriis ndu.

en: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
ff: Timminool, alpha-CoV alpaka tawakke haa nder ɓanndu daabaji ladde.

en: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
ff: Nden, dabare footay wata ɗum haa sera je alpakaji keɓɓi alpha-CoV hcOv-229E haa neɗɗo.

en: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
ff: Mbiyotto, bilwili on woni daarol viriisji je ɗon mari mandolji nyau haa neɗɗo be viriis rabies, viriis Ebola, viriis Nipah be viriis Hendra.

en: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
ff: Hilnatta fahin je bilwili foti wona ɓe'en je sallini HCoV-229e haa neɗɗo bila lawol feere.

en: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
ff: malla bo'o, bana alpha-CoV ji bilwili ɗon woni bana ɓundu gene HCoV-229E, alpakaji be ngeelobaji foti lata bana cuudi je cakare je ɗon sallinaviriisji haa neɗɗo, bana ko don salli be MERS-CoV.

en: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
ff: MERS-CoV laati bana sappinol kanduɗum ngam sallinol nyau diga bilwili haa ngeeloba e diga ngeeloba haa neɗɗo.

en: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
ff: Ɗaadol yahde MERS-CoV diga bilwili ɗon aandin haa fuɗɗam mandirdum ndu e heɓɓi sembe gal sappinolji je tokkiti.

en: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
ff: laati gonga je bilwili laati bana ɓundu viriisji ngam sanjol ta'irdeji geneha kunde daadaji e sallinol haa neɗɗo.

en: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
ff: Juttol nyonki, hawtirde geeɓeji haa baabe gooto, wondugo haa wakkere yimɓe be dabare fiirugo do hendu laati kujeji je ɗon waɗa bilwili laati bana 'sankittowo viriis'.

en: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
ff: haa wakkere feere, MERS-CoV tuffama haa ɓanndu ngeelobaji ɓuran hittande sappo do sappo.

en: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
ff: Ɗon yahida boɗɗum be ngeelobaji je waylitti diga cakkere suudu haa siggorde aranool je ɗon jooɗi.

en: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
ff: MERS-CoV ɗon hokka nyau je nyaɗay jur e ɗon waɗa daabaji ndu wala saanjugo jur sam.

en: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
ff: Raɓɓol ngu je ɗon salla laugel haa neɗɗo woni bana larula e neɗɗo laatan bana ragare cuuɗi MERS-CoV ngam sallinol ndu footay neeɓa.

en: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
ff: naa bana kugal ngeelobaji haa nder sallinol MERS-CoV, kugal pangoliji, to woodi, haa nder sallinol SARS-CoV-2 don feerejo.

en: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
ff: Ɓurna, beta-CoV ji pangoljin don nyaɗi masitin be mandolji.

en: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
ff: foti ɓe lata ragare cuuɗi haa beta-CoV ji SARS-CoV-2, bana patuuji be nyau SARS-CoV.

en: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
ff: Dabareji ɗuɗɗum ngam sallinol SARS-CoV-2 diga daabaji haa neɗɗo sey larta nder be yaasi haa jaangirdeji je warango.

en: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Aranol, bilwili foti wona suudu aranool viriis SARS-CoV-2 je ɗon naandi jur be SARS-CoV-2.

en: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
ff: Neɗɗo foti mara wakere jonde gootoo be bilwili gal hirsugo daabaji malla waasugo lesdi.

en: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
ff: Ɗidaɓool, pangolji foti wona suudu cakare jaɓɓitol viriis SARS-CoV-2 je nasti neeɓay nder ekkitol.

en: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
ff: Neɗɗo ɗon raɓɓa viriis gal hirsugo e nyammugo kusel daabaji ladde.

en: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
ff: foti yo'o daabaji duɗɗum be daabaji saare foti raɓɓa SARS-CoV-2.

en: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
ff: Teffol do daabaji saare be je ladde ngam fadooɓe ɓanndu ɗon mari baabal mako.

en: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
ff: Tataɓool, bana ɗon matini haa dow, hawtirde be lartol SARS-CoV-2 foti salli no haa tataɓool daaba je footitiri be ɗiɗi fu bilwili be pangolinji.

en: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
ff: Teffol ɗaaɗol daabaji SARS-CoV-2 ɗon tokkiti.

en: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
ff: haa ɓaawo dabaji je feere feere je ɗon jogga gilɗi ndu, woodi ujaji maungel tati do ko laarani gilɗi laati kanduɗum nder latinugo CoV koyɗum.

en: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
ff: amma haa fuɗɗam man, ko en andi kam ɓe ɗon sanja RNA maɓɓe laugel.

en: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
ff: To en foondi be viriisji feere je ɗon mari kosɗe RNA gooto tan, limtol saanjolji CoV ji foti hoccama bana “deydey” haa “duɗɗum” be limtol saanjol je ɗon yaha diga ~10-4 haa nder hittande nder wakkere 2, do yahde lartol saanjol CoV haa cuuɗi keese.

en: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
ff: CoV ji ɗon mari jaangowo exoribonuclease, je to willi ni ɗon saanja dabajeri ɓesdol e ustol malla bo mayde maaɗa.

en: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
ff: Ko wooɗi fahin bo'o, ko mbiyotto nucleotid Remdesivir je ɗon nandi aandama yo'o naffan ngam wilugo CoV gal ilugo exoribonuclease ndu be RNA je wondi do RNA polymerase.

en: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
ff: Remdesivir woni gooto cakka kujeji anti-SARS-CoV-2 je foti larta haa yakke teffolji.

en: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
ff: Be man fu, limtol saanjol CoV ji ɓuri ɓe waɗan nde milionji do ɓe'en je cuuɗi maɓɓe.

en: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
ff: Fahin bo'o, limtol sanjol laati maungel to COV wonday boɗɗum be suudu maaɗa.

en: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
ff: To foondi be SARS-CoV je ɗon mari limtol saanjol je ɗon ɗuɗɗum, limtol saanjol SARS-CoV-2 laati bana lessi, bana wi'ugo foti yahida lau be ɓanndu neɗɗo.

en: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
ff: Ɗon tammi yo'o, laati ɗon yahida timmi be jaɓɓowo je ɗon ɓadi be neɗɗo.

en: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
ff: haa ɓesdugo haa SARS-CoV-2, ndu ɗon laarani bo'o MERS-CoV, je ɗon yahida boɗɗum be ɓanndu ngeelobaji.

en: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
ff: haa nder wolde kam, footay saanjol gene wartira baatalji malla lekki SARS-CoV-2 majja sembe mako laugel.

en: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
ff: Ɗiɗaɓool, genome je ɓuri maunugo haa CoV ji ɗon latina genome bana leeda ngam saanjol e hawtirde, ndu gal ɓesdugo yahde gilɗi ndu haa kunde daabaji feere-feere, je mari ribaji ngam wanguɗe CoV je keese to kujeji wartiri bana nane.

en: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
ff: Ndu ɗon fadi gal ɓanndu je ɗon feerejo e maɓɓiti be kude protein je mari lamba gal 3' ɗaaɗol maaɗa.
