en: We will provide 1000 serology baseline samples across all ages that reflect the varying rates of attendance by age.
ff: Min hokkan leekuji neebam iyam 1000 je larnatta dubbi fu je don sappina limtol wondugo be dubbi.

en: Additionally, we will test if we can obtain these all from virology practices to enhance the yield.
ff: haa besdugo bo'o, min tamman lartugo to en foti kebbugo dum fu haa wakkere kude lartol viriis ngam tawugo sappinol.

en: A good geographical spread is important, so PHE can advise on areas where serology will most usefully be collected.
ff: Sankittol haa do wakkere bodde don kandudum, ngam PHE foti feela haa wakkereji neebam iyam hoccotto burna.

en: This will be followed by 800 samples monthly.
ff: Ndu tokkitan be lekkuji 800 nder lewru.

en: The sample will be stratified with 200 specimens for prepandemic survey (100 for monthly) in the following age groups: < 5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years or older.
ff: Leeku wonan be ta'irdeji 200 ngam emmolji je hiddeko nyau duniyaru (100 je lewru) haa nder geebeji dubbi je don limti ndu: < dubbi 5, dubbi 5-17, dubbi 18-64, be dubbi 65 malla buri.

en: The younger patients, in many practices younger than 14 years, and in nearly all for children younger than 8 years will require pediatric serology surveillance.
ff: Nyaube je maray dubbi jur, haa nder burna wakkere kude be yottay dubbi 14, e haa burna bikkon je maray dubbi 8 sey ayna neebam iyam mabbe.

en: We will develop a new request form for practices to capture recent travel and exposure to COVID-19.
ff: Min wurtinan batakkewol emmol feere ngam hoosugo matinol jaahangal je neebay e wondugo haa wakkere COVID-19.

en: We will pilot a scheme for collecting convalescent serology from people with confirmed cases and who have had an acute virology sample at the time of their infection.
ff: Min ngadan dabare moftugo neebam iyam haa yimbe je don andi mari nyau timmi e je don no mari leeku yahde viriis nyadungel haa wakkati rabbol mabbe.

en: This is to identify a carrier state in patients who have recovered from the virus but may continue shedding the virus.
ff: Ndu ngam maandugo roondoowo haa nyaubeje nyambitti haa viriis amma foti don tokkita be hoosugo viriisji.

en: If there are a small number of cases, this may assist in developing a test kit for patients to take to their own GP and explore its acceptability to patients.
ff: To woodi limgal nyaube seeda tan, ndu foti walla nder wurtinugo kuje lartol haa nyaube ngam hebba be hoosa GP mabbe e lara jabbol nde haa nyaube.

en: If there are a large number of COVID-19 cases nationally, convalescent samples could be collected from RCGP RSC practices where there are confirmed cases, with the ability to link to the full medical record.
ff: To woodi limgal nyaube COVID-19 duddum haa nder lesdi, en foti hocca leeku yimbe je nyambitti haa wakkereji kude RCGP RSC je nyauji ndu don andi timmi, be dabare hawtugo be bindi suudu lekki.

en: This process may include checking pseudonymized NHS numbers for positive individuals at RCGP RSC practices, checking current PHE guidance regarding considerations of infectiousness for confirmed cases, and offering the patient an appointment following the previously mentioned process.
ff: Laahal ndu foti larna lartol limtolji NHS je be saanji inde haa yimbe je don mari gildi nyau haa wakkere kude RCGP RSC, lartol fadowo PHE je jonta do ko laarani rabbende nyaube je don andi mari, e hokkugo haa nyaudo wakkati ngidol bana je don limti haa laahal je sallingo.

en: This needs to be carefully coordinated nationally across the network and may require PHE to ensure individuals are not contacted by multiple agencies.
ff: Ndu yidi sey fada dum be hakiika haa do lesdi fu e foti emma PHE ngam fammugo to dowirdeji feere-feere ewnata yimbe.

en: RCGP RSC could provide a useful structure to channel the initial contact once PHE has made a request.
ff: RCGP RSC foti hokka dabare je nafatta ngam fadugo aranool ngidol haa bawo PHE ngadi emmol.

en: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of a LRTI.
ff: Kude RCGP RSC je don huwida ngam aynol yahde viriis ndamba je hittande fuddi wurtinugo lekkuji haa nyaube je don sappina mandolji nyauji LRTI.

en: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
ff: Leekuji fu laati lartama ngam ndamba be COVID-19.

en: The RCGP RSC will explore ways to collect convalescent samples from any patients tested positive for COVID-19 through the extension of the virological surveillance.
ff: RCGP RSC teffan dabareji moftugo leekuji haa nyabe je larti don mari nyau COVID-19 gal aynol yajjol viriisji.

en: From the start, we will be carefully curating data to ensure that it can be used for future studies.
ff: Diga fuddam, min suklan do lartugo matinolji ngam haa en huwida be man haa nder ekkitolji je warango.

en: Our clinical data will be linked to virology.
ff: Matinolji suudu lekki amin yahidan be yahde viriisji.

en: We will curate our data using the Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable principles.
ff: Min lartan matinolji amin gal dabareji je mbiyotto Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable.

en: To facilitate this our data set is listed with Health Data Research UK and the European Health Data Evidence Network.
ff: Ngam latinugo ndu koydum matinolji amin don limti be Health Data Research UK be Kawtirol Sappinol Matinolji Jam Baandu Erop.

en: The statistical methodology is in support of a policy approach to widespread disease outbreak, where so-called nonpharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) are used to respond to an emerging pandemic to produce disease suppression.
ff: Jaahargal kugal limgal don fadi siyasa dabare wangol nyau je don yajji, e kude je mbiyotto naa je yimbe lekki (NPIs) don huwida ngam jabbinugo do nyau duniyaru je wangi ngam nattinugo nyau ndu.

en: This policy aims to reduce contact rates in the population and thereby reduce transmission of the virus.
ff: Dabare ngu yidi ustugo limtol ngidolji haa nder ummatore e gal ndu ustugo rabbol viriis ngal.

en: To implement this the UK government has recently articulated the desire to implement population self-isolation measures.
ff: Ngam wadugo ngu ngomna lesde UK sappini dabareji neebay je ko moy fu nder ummatore ayna hoore mada.

en: By targeting the reproduction number (R) (the average number of secondary cases each case generates) and aiming to reduce the R to below 1, the policy seeks to reduce case numbers to low levels or (as seen in previous outbreaks with severe acute respiratory syndrome and Ebola) to eliminate human-to-human transmission.
ff: Gal larugo limgal nuftugo (R) (limgal je cakare nyaube sera je kala nyau don wada) be habdugo ustol R haa les 1, siyasa fon teffa ustugo limtolji nyaube haa les malla (bana don holli haa nyauji sallingo be sadirmaji ngam foofugo be Ebola) haa darnugo rabbol neddol haa neddo.

en: As the experience from the 2009 H1N1 pandemic has shown, NPIs can be a crucial component of pandemic mitigation.
ff: Bana ko salli be nyau duniyaru je 2009 H1N1, NPIs foti wona dabare unstol nyau je duniyaru fu je kandudum.

en: Key to the focus of our study will be the estimation of peak cases in the population and continual monitoring by data collection and modelling the potential growth and emergence of subsequent peaks in new cases as social distancing measures are relaxed.
ff: Ko laati kandudum haa nder ekkitol amin wonan fammugo nyadol nyauji haa cakka ummatore e lartol je don tokkiti gal moftugo be hawtugo dabareji nder yahde e wurtinol nyadol haa cakka nyaube keese to bana dabareji accugo baabe haa kunde ummatore.

en: There has already been publication of important disease epidemiological measures concerning the outbreak of COVID-19 in mainland China.
ff: woodi no timmi sappinol dabareji nyau je don rabba ngam wangol nyau COVID-19 haa lesdi Cayna.

en: A further fundamental measure in pandemic dynamics is the length of time from infection to when a person is infectious to others and the mean duration of infectiousness.
ff: Dabare feere je woni kandudum haa nder saanjol nyau ndu laati juttol wakkati diga rabbol nyau haa wakkati je goddo foti rabba be'en feere e pettum wakkati rabbol.

en: These factors, if estimated accurately, will give good predictions for the likely length of the pandemic, the final number of infected cases.
ff: Kujeji ndu, to lari be lawol man, hokkan sappinolji bodde ngam juttol nyau duniyaru ndu, ragare limtol nyaube.

en: We intend to apply approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) to (possibly spatially heterogeneous) Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR) stochastic epidemic models.
ff: Min tammi huwida be approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) haa (foti wona jilli haa nder wakkere) sappinolji nyau rabbungel je be hoosi tan je mbiyotto Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR).

en: Such techniques are highly parallelizable and have been successfully applied to many fields including disease transmission modelling.
ff: Irin dabareji don fooda masin e be huwidi be man be kandudum haa wakkereji duddum bana ngadugo leeku rabbol nyau.

en: They are particularly suited to situations where likelihood functions are absent and where more traditional approaches such as Markov chain Monte Carlo are impractical.
ff: Be buri naffugo burna haa wakkatijo je dabareji naandol wonay e je dabareji aran bana Markov chain Monte Carlo footay hokka.

en: Such an approach has been demonstrated to work effectively on the ASPREN surveillance data, a network of sentinel GPs and nurse practitioners who report deidentified information on ILIs and other conditions, where issues such as missing data and the need to model the observation process itself has been successfully addressed.
ff: Irin dabareji don holli bana foti hokka boddum haa aynol matinolji ASPREN, kawtirde sentine GPs be suklobe do jam baandu je matini matinolji je maandaka do ILIs malla nyauji feere, je kujeji bana matinolji je wonday e ngidol lartugo laahal larugo laati bodde.

en: Furthermore, peaks in new cases have been estimated by distributional methods.
ff: Fahin, nyadolji haa nyaube je keese tawama haa dabareji sankitugo.

en: Estimates of the parameters of the SEIR model are tractable on large data sets because of parallelizability, and these methods have been implemented in several R libraries; we intend to use the libraries ABSEIR (deposited on GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) and abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) to estimate epidemic measures on a weekly basis.
ff: Fopndolji dabareji SEIR foti waylitama haa do matinolji je don mauni masitin ngam yahiditugo, e dabareji ndu huwidama haa nder cuddu jaangirdeji R; min tammi huwugo be cuudi jaangirdeji ABSEIR (je jo'inama haa GitHUB: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) be abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) ngam lartugo dabareji nyau haa nder asawere.

en: Since we are fitting an SIR-epidemic model in the ABC routine, we anticipate that our results will be robust against weekly case data containing relatively small counts.
ff: Nden en don foonda sappinol nyau rabbungel SIR haa nder kude ABC, min don yaawina ngam haa sappinolji amin mara sembe do matinolji nyau haa nder asawere je don mari limtolji seeda.

en: For example, see for the ABC methodology applied to the Tristan da Cunha common cold data from 1967, where counts of I (number of infectious cases) and R (number of recovered cases) are in the tens at most.
ff: Bana sappinol, lare dabare ABC je hoccama haa nder matinolji ndamba Tristan da Cunta je 1967, je limtolji I (limgal nyaube je don rabba) be R (limgal nyaube je nyambitti) don nder sappo do sappo burna fu.

en: Finally, in addition to the above methodology we will employ the Kaplan-Meier method with two outcomes (death and recovery) to estimate the case fatality ratio.
ff: haa ragare man, besdugo haa dabareji je don limti haa dow, min huwidan be dabare Kaplan-Meier be sappinolji didi (mayde be nyambittol) ngam larugo limtol mayde.

en: This approach is independent of the ABC methodology and will allow comparisons between estimates from the two modelling approaches to judge robustness of results.
ff: Dabare nde jodday do dabareji ABC e foti hollina sappinolji haa kunde lartolji haa dabareji ngadol je didi ndu ngam foondugo sembe sappinolji.

en: RCGP RSC’s surveillance with PHE is defined as Health Protection under Regulation 3 of The Health Service (Control of Patient Information) Regulations 2002.
ff: Aynol RCGP RSC be PHE don laati bana Fadol Jam Baandu do Tawreta 3 je The Health Service (Aynol Matinol nyaudo) Regulations 2002.

en: This has been confirmed by PHE’s Caldicott Guardian’s Office.
ff: Ndu jabbotto bana ni gal Caldicott Guardian’s Office PHE.

en: We do not see any increased risk to practices or practitioners taking part in this surveillance.
ff: Min laray larula feere haa kude malla huwobe je don laarani nder aynol ndu.

en: Infection prevention and control advice will follow extant national guidance.
ff: Fadol nyau be feelore aynol tokkitan fadol lesdi je don be sembe jonta.

en: Any cases identified will be managed according to the PHE/NHS guidance in force at the time, including advice for identified contacts.
ff: Nyauji je don maandi wonan larnama bana ko fadol PHE/NSH je don be sembe haa wakkati nde yardi, be feeloji haa ngidolji je don mandi.

en: However, our training will include reminders about safe handling of specimens and revision of infection control measures anticipated to be high in our practices.
ff: Amma, ekkitol amin don laarani sifturolji do huwidu be leekuji be lartol dabareji aynol nyau je don woni bana buri haa nder wakkereji kude amin.

en: It is a key part of Regulation 12 about safe care and treatment, periodically inspected by the Care Quality Commission.
ff: laati bana kuje kandudum haa Regulation 12 do suklare be hurgol je don jam, je woni lartama be wakkati gal Geebe Suklowo do Daraja.

en: Travel History and Clinical Descriptors of the COVID-19 Infections
ff: Tariya Jaahangal be Sappinoobe Mandolji nyau COVID-19

en: The RCGP RSC practices have been advised on the clinical coding that has been made available for COVID-19 across all CMR systems.
ff: Kude RCGP RSC feelama ngam lambugo mandolji nyau je don ngondi ngam nyau COVID-19 haa do jaahargalji CMR fu.

en: This includes information on coding of clinical descriptors (Table 4) and any recent travel history.
ff: Ndu don laarani matinolji do lambugo sappinoobe mandolji nyau (Tabaal 4) be tariya jaahangal keese.

en: Establishment of Extended Virology Sampling
ff: Wurtinol Leeku Yahde Viriis je Yajji

en: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of LRTI.
ff: Kude RCGP RSC je nasti haa nder aynol yahde viriisji ndamba haa nder hittande fuddi wurtinugo leekuji nyaube je don mari mandolji nyauji LRTI.

en: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
ff: Leekuji fu je jabbotto don larti ngam ndamba be COVID-19.

en: This has led to initial early identification of background spread in low-risk patients.
ff: Ndu wadi be tawi maandirdum arandere yajjol nyau haa cakka nyaube je wala nyau feere.

en: As of March 7, 2020, the surveillance system has detected 2 cases of COVID-19 in low-risk patients with no history of travel through extended virological sampling.
ff: haa 7 Maars 2020, dabare aynol tawi nyaube COVID-19 2 haa yimbe je maray nyauji feere e je ngaday jaahangal gal lartol leeku yahde viriisji.

en: This protocol describes how we have adapted a national influenza surveillance system to monitor community spread of an unexpected infection of COVID-19.
ff: Batakkewol ndu don limta noy min waylitti jaahargal aynol ndama ngam aynugo sankittol nyau COVID-19 haa nder ummatore.

en: We have rapidly created and incorporated new codes to allow data recording, and are collecting data to monitor the effectiveness of containment strategies.
ff: Min wurtini e hokki lambaji keese ngam hoccugo matinolji, e min don mofta matinolji ngam aynugo dabareji darnol nyau ndu.

en: Through this surveillance, we intend to find out more about the epidemiology of COVID-19 in ambulatory care.
ff: Gal aynol ndu, min ngidi fammugo duddum do nyau rabbungel je mbiyotto COVID-19 nder suklare meere.

en: In particular, its rate of spread, both temporal and geographical.
ff: Burna fu, limtol sankittol muddum, didi fu nder wakkati nder wakkere.

en: Our testing of low-risk patients will also inform whether the containment strategy that is based on virology testing of high-risk patients and their contacts plus self-isolation is effective.
ff: Lartol nyaube amin je maray nyau feere matinan bo'o to dabare darnol je wondi do lartol yahde viriisji haa nyaube je don mari nyauji feere be be'en be ngidi be mabbe be wondugo haa sera do mari naffuda.

en: Containment should slow the spread, and there may be benefits in the management of spread from intense surveillance.
ff: Wondugo haa saare ustinan no sankittol, e foti ribaaji wona nder aynol do sankittolo do aynol be hakiika.

en: However, there may come a point at which the virus spreads more widely into the population, as has happened in Italy.
ff: Amma, foti tobe feere wonda je ngadatta viriis ndu sankitta laugel haa nder ummatore , bana ko salli haa Italy.

en: Surveillance of low-risk patients should inform when we reach this tipping point and when infection rates start to remit.
ff: Aynol nyaube je maray nyauji feere hokkan matinolji to en jokki tobe ndu e to limtol nyau fuddi jippugo.

en: The epidemiology of COVID-19 remains emergent.
ff: Yahde nyau COVID-19 je rabbungel don tokkita.

en: The registration-based nature of UK primary care means that we will be able to create a complete picture of the cumulative incidence and duration.
ff: Bindol arandere suklare haa lesde UK yidi wi'ugo yo'o foti e wangina foto hawtirde larulaaji fu be wakkati man bo'o.

en: The surveillance system should be able to identify areas where COVID-19 spread is taking place that might be suitable for trials of antiviral therapy.
ff: Dabare aynol sey foti maandi wakkereji je COVID-19 don sankitta je foti wonda kandudum nder foondolji hurgol lekki viriisji.

en: We could also follow up on the effectiveness or any adverse reactions to these medicines or vaccinations.
ff: En tokkitan bo'o be kugal malla kala kujeji je lekki malla baatalji foti wangina je hannay nder bandu.

en: Finally, early detection of a confirmed COVID-19 case has exemplified the rapid implementation of this enhanced surveillance in the national network.
ff: haa timminol, tawol nyau COVID-19 be wakkati sappini jaawal nder huwidugo be dabare aynol ndu haa kawtirol lesdi fu.

en: Safety of practices is our primary concern.
ff: Jam wakkereji kude laati nummol amin je aranol.

en: The RCGP RSC has operated for over 50 years and has been involved in collecting samples to monitor disease and vaccine effectiveness through the Hong Kong flu pandemic of 1968/69, the Russian flu of 1977/78, and the 2009 Swine flu pandemic.
ff: RCGP RSC don huwa diga buri dubbi 50 e don no habda be moftugo leekuji ngam aynugo nyau be naffuda baatalgal ndamba rabbungel Hong Kong je 1968/69, ndamba Russiya je 1977/78, be nyau ndamba gaduuji je 2009.

en: We are not aware of any increased risk to practice staff or other patients from involvement in surveillance.
ff: Min kebbay larulaaji gal huwobe wakkereji kude malla nyaube je don laarani be aynol tawon.

en: Pandemic preparedness is part of the role of the RCGP RSC.
ff: Taskitol ngam nyau duniyaru laati bana kugal RCGP RSC feere.

en: It is plausible that enhanced coding of information from contacts with the practices in RCGP RSC will reduce the likelihood of people who may be suspected COVID-19 cases being brought to the surgery inadvertently.
ff: laati aandotto yo'o lambugo matinolji diga ngidolji be kude haa RCGP RSC ustan naandol yimbe je foti mari nyau COVID-19 je be wadi bila fammugo ngam be seeka be.

en: Where cases are detected unexpectedly, it is probably helpful for that patient, their contacts, and the practice to know.
ff: haa baabe je nyaube tawama bila ndenugo, foti mballita haa nyaudo ndu, yimbe je o ngidi be mabbe, wakkere kude ngam aandugo.

en: The impact on practices has been to close for a day, if a case is found, for deep cleaning and then reopen.
ff: Kugal man do kude mabban no nder nyalade gooto, to woodi nyaudo tawama, ngam leybugo nden mabbita.

en: The principal limitations of our system are the number of data points.
ff: Keerolji je aranool haa nder jaahargal amin laati limgal tobeji matinolji amin.

en: We are collecting serology and virology data from 100 sites, which covers a small group of the population.
ff: Min don mofta matinolji neebam iyam be je limtol yahde viriisji haa wakkereji 100, je don sudda geebe ummatore pammaron.

en: This has been satisfactory for monitoring influenza, but we are not certain if this is a sufficiently large sample for the COVID-19 outbreak.
ff: Ndu laati bodde ngam aynugo ndamba, amma en aanda be fakatre to ndu woni lekkuji deydey je he'atta ngam nyau COVID-19.

en: Our sites (surveillance practices) are currently fixed, and it could be helpful to be able to rapidly onboard practices in regions where there are more cases.
ff: Wakkereji amin (kude aynol) don aandin timmi, e foti naffa ngam jokkittugo wakkereji kude amin haa nder wakkereji je don mari nyaube jur.

en: Currently, we will be reporting weekly.
ff: Jonta, min wanginan ndu haa asawere fu.

en: Our existing system can be enhanced to twice weekly, but maybe daily or hourly data should be our current approach.
ff: Dabare jaahargal amin foti wurtama didi haa nder asawere, amma foti bo'o matinolji balde malla je njamdi laati nummol amin je jonta.

en: Opportunistic sampling for serology in children younger than 10 years might be limited due to the overall reduced rate of blood tests in children.
ff: Hoosugo leeku meere ngam larugo gildi haa bikkon je maray dubbi 10 foti ustama ngam lartol leeku iyam don usti haa mabbe.

en: The extended surveillance using the RCGP RSC-PHE network for the emergent COVID-19 outbreak has been established rapidly.
ff: Aynol je don yajjini gal huwidugo be hawtirol RCGP RSC-PHE ngam COVID-19 je wangi go nasti lau.

en: The model of getting the appropriate informatics to enable capture of the required data has already been a success, with data recording starting the week the codes were created.
ff: Dabare kebbugo dabare je kandudum je foti hoosa matinolji je don emmi laati bana titool, be hoccugo matinolji don fudda haa nder asawere wangol lambaji ndu.

en: In addition, modifying the existing surveillance system to collect population data in a parallel way has also been effective.
ff: Fahin bo'o, waylitugo dabare aynol je don wondi ndu ngam moftugo matinolji ummatore haa yakke feere bo'o laati naffuki.

en: However, we are at present unsure as to whether the scale of this surveillance provides sufficient data to drive local containment strategies or if reporting infrequently meets the need of our information age.
ff: Amma, haa jonta en aanda be fakatre to yajjol aynol ndu don hokka matinolji je he'atta ngam umminugo dabareji wondugo sera malla sappinugo be njibbol nder wakkati don yahida be haaje dubbi matinolji amin.

en: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
ff: Lartugo dabare lartol "nyimbe je foti mara nyau" be "je don mari nyau" COVID-19 laati kandudum.

en: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
ff: haa 6 Feviriye 2020, geebe amin wurtini feeloji laugel do batakkewol lartol e hurgol nyau koronaviriis je 2019 (2019-nCoV) e batakkewol ndu sappini aandal amin e dabareji bodde ngam darnugo nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
ff: Amma, nyau koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19) laati nyau keese, taskol be aandalji amin don besda tumtum ngam wurtol sappinolji teffolji be mandolji do ko sallata haa suudu lekki; nden kadi, dabareji lartol be hurgol don lartama tumtum.

en: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
ff: haa nder batakkewol ndu, min jabbini do ngewte feere do batakkewol amin e ngam ko laarani dabareji lartol je keese "yimbe je bana don mari nyau" be "don mari nyau" bana je tawama haa nder Batakkewol Lartol e Hurgol COVID-19 (jooweydidabre wurtol) je National Health Committee lesdi Cayna wurtini.

en: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
ff: haa desambre 2019, koronaviriis 2019 je keese (2019-nCoV) wangini nyau feere, je don andi hande bana nyau koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19) e viriis ndu laati bana nyau koronaviriis 2 je pofde (SARS-CoV-2).

en: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
ff: haa 11 Maars, WHO wi'i COVID-19 laati bana nyau duniyaru fu.

en: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
ff: Ngam nattinugo nyau SARS-CoV-2, geebe amin wangini batakkewol feeloji je laugel e je eltama haa hawoo gal Teffol Jam Baandu Soje'en haa 6 Feviriye.

en: It has attracted a great attention since published.
ff: Ndu nasti nder hakkilo yimbe fu diga wurtol ngu.

en: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
ff: Famme bo'o yo'o nyau COVID-19 don keese, taskol e aandalji amin do besda tumtum ngam sappinolji teffolji be kude haa suudu lekki; nden kadi, dabareji lartol be hurgol don lartama tum.

en: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
ff: Bana sappinol, Batakkewol Lartol be Hurgol nyau COVID-19 je wurtama gal National Health Committee lesdi Cayna (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), haa cakka 6 Zaanviye 2020 be 3 Maars 2020, wurtini ekkitolji joowey e didi be matinolji feere je waylittama.

en: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
ff: Jonta batakkewol amin kebbi ngewte Zhou et al., they nastini kuje hokkugo tobeji do ko ekkiti haa nder suudu lekki.

en: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
ff: Kugal mabbe besdi sappinol keese haa batakkewol amin e don holla matinolji kandudum ngam nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
ff: Min jabbi kugal mabbe je kandudum e en yetti be masitin.

en: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
ff: Amma bo'o kugal mari mari haaje lartol bana limtama haa nder Batakkewol Lartol e Hurgol COVID-19 (Foondol joowey e didabre wurtol) be jaangirdeji keese.

en: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
ff: haa joowey e didabre wurtol (3 Maars 2020), ngam aanditugo yimbe je bana mari nyau, sey hawta kuje dadareji tariya yahde nyau ndu be jujeji mandolji didi ngam ngadugo lartolji fu, malla sey hawta kujeji mandolji tati to wala tariya yahde je don labdum:

en: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
ff: Tariya nyau raɓɓungel: (1) tariya jaahangal malla jonde haa nder berniwol Wuhan be wakkereji je ɓon tardi, be ummatoji je nyauɓe COVID-19 matinama haa nder balɗe 14 je sallingo hiddeko fuɗɗam mandolji nyau; (2) tariya ngidol be yimɓe je ɗon no ronda SARS-CoV-2 (be lartol acid nucleic je don mari gildi); (3) tariya ngidol be nyauɓe je ɗon no sappina wullugo ɓanndu malla mandolji pofɗe haa berniwol Wuhan be wakkereji je ɗon tardi, malla ummatoji je COVID-19 matinama haa nder balɗe 14 je sallingo hiddeko fuɗɗam mandolji; (4) tariya ngam ngidugo be sammere nyauɓe je ɗon andi (2 malla ɓuri be ɓanndu ɗon wulla e/malla mandolji pofɗe haa nder asaweji 2 haa wakkereji petpetel, bana saare, baabal kugal, suudu jaangirde, feere).

en: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
ff: Mandolji nyau: (1) wullugo ɓanndu/malla saɗirmaji nder pofɗe; (2) be mandolji foto nyau COVID-19; (3) limgal toɓeji iyam je daaneejum don deydey, usti, malla limtol lymphocyte je ɗon jippi haa fuɗɗam ndu.

en: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
ff: Lartugo be'en je ɗon andi mari timmi sey wonda be mijjol be kuje mandol nyau malla sappinolji neebam ɓanndu bana ndu: (1) PCR larti ɗon mari gilɗi SARS-CoV-2; (2) ta'irde genome viriis man fu ɗon sappina naandol ɗuɗɗum be koronaviriisji keese je ɗon andi; (3) ɗon mari fadoowo ɓanndu IgM je feerejo be fadoowo ɓanndu IgG haa SARS-CoV-2 haa nder lartol neebam iyam; malla waylittol fadoowo ɓanndu igG je ɗon feerejo haa SARS-CoV-2 wonay haa woni, malla ɓesdol tita ɓuri malla nde 4 haa wakkati nyamɓittol je ɗon ɓuri ko je ɗon woni haa yakke je ɗon nyaɗum.

en: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
ff: Min foti lara lartol PCR ngam nucleic acid haa nder lawol pofɗe malla leekuji iyam ɓesdotto haa wurtolji ɗiɗaɓool (18 Zaanviye 2020) be tataɓool (22 Zaanviye 2020).

en: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
ff: Tawol gilɗi haa nder lekku iyam ɓesdotto haa wurtolji nayaɓool (27 Zaanviye 2020) be jooweyaɓol (8 Feviriye 2020); e sappinolji neebam iyam ɓesdotto haa jooweyɗiɗabre wurtol.

en: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
ff: Saanjolji ndu je ɗon jooɗi do kugal teffoɓe je ɗon tokkitatta ndu nder teffugo kuje lartol nucleic acid je ɗon buri mari amana ngam lartol je do yaawi, be leekuji je hoccama haa lawol pofde be iyam, ko besdi wondugo irinji feere-feere, e don fadi je don wartira fadoowo baandu bana don mari gildi haa nder dabareji je don andi.

en: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
ff: Fahin, woodi sappinolji je ɗon ɓesda ko weeti fu je ɗon siftora amin ngam hakkilinugo do nyauɓe je ɗon sappina malla sappinatta mandolji.

en: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
ff: Nden kadi, tabaal yahde Zhou et al. sey lartotto, ngam be limti yimɓe je sappinatta mandolji nyau bana "nyaday jur".

en: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
ff: Dabare limtol toɓeji bo'o sey lartotto haa nder wakkere kuɗe be jaangirdeji.

en: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
ff: haa timmina, min ɗon tammi yo'o sappinolji ɗon do warugo e ɗon ewna jaangoɓe hokka ko be nummi do man.

en: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
ff: Ngam lartol "yimɓe je foti mara" be "yimɓe je andi mari", min ɗon feela tawtugo e ɗowtina dabareji keese lesɗe maɓɓe.

en: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
ff: Geeɓe amin matinan mon matinolji keese do dabareji amin ngam wallende.

en: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
ff: Bangladesh matini mayde joowey ngam COVID-19, NS

en: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
ff: Kenya, Bangladesh aandini mayɗe keese joowey kenya ngam COVID-19 haa nder balɗe.

en: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
ff: Ndu laati limgal je ɓuri maunugo haa nder balɗe ngam viriis.

en: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
ff: Diga kenya, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) matini limtol nyauɓe je ɗon mari nyau je sappini yimɓe 114 je mari nyau be 33 je nyamɓitti je ɗon no jooɗi haa saare.

en: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
ff: Limgal man fu waɗi 17 matinama.

en: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
ff: haa nder hubaruji haa do internati, ɗowuwo IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, wi'i haa cakka mayɓe ndu woodi worɓe nay be debbo gooto.

en: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
ff: haa ngewte Dr Meerjady, nyauɓe ɗiɗi mari no duuɓi haa gaɗa 60, ɗiɗi haa kunde 51 be 60 be gooto haa kunde 41 be 50.

en: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
ff: O wi'i bo'o ɗiɗi haa cakka nyauɓe wari diga Dhaka.

en: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
ff: Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu (WHO) matini yo'o nyau COVID-19 bana nyau duniyaru haa 11 Maars.

en: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
ff: Arduɗo suddu lekki feere wi'i haa Anadolu Agency, geeɓe hubaruji wakkere feere, yo'o gooto haa cakka mayɓe woni Jalal Saifur Rahman, ɗowuwo Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, je wondi no haa suudu lekki haa Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

en: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
ff: haa Asawe, nder matinolji vidiyo do internati, Arduɗo Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader matini yo'o hortol ummatore darnotto ɓuri wakkati je en tendini nane, haa Asawe je warango.

en: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
ff: Darnol hortol ummatore ndu fuɗɗi haa 26 Maars e daran no haa Asawe, 4 Aviril.

en: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
ff: Hortol kujeji kanduɗum, lekki, neebam be nyamɗe, ɗon jarfi.

en: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
ff: larulaaji arandere nyau COVID-19 je matinama haa Bangladesh ɗon no haa 8 Maars, haa nyauɓe ɗiɗi je warti diga Italy be debbo gooto haa cakka maɓɓe.

en: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
ff: haa 19 Maars, kamɓe tati fu nyamɓitti.

en: National Basketball Association suspends season due to COVID-19 concerns
ff: National Basketball Association darni fiijirde maaɗa ngam COVID-19

en: On Wednesday, the United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) suspended its professional basketball season due to concerns regarding COVID-19.
ff: haa alarba, National Basketball Association (NBA) Lesɗe America darni fiijirde basketball aanduɓe ngam larulaaji COVID-19.

en: The NBA's decision followed a Utah Jazz player testing positive for the COVID-19 virus.
ff: Hasduye NBA tokkiti fiijowo Utah Jazz feere larti bana mari viriis COVID-19.

en: The NBA did not release the identity of the player in question in its announcement.
ff: NBA matinay inde fiijowo ndu haa nder matinol maaɗa.

en: They did say he was not present at Chesapeake Energy Arena in Oklahoma City, where the Utah Jazz were to play against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
ff: Mbiyotto o wonay no haa Chesapeake Energy Arena haa Oklahoma City, haa wakkati je Utah Jazz fiijan no be Oklahoma City Thunder.

en: According to its press release, the NBA was "suspending game play following the conclusion of [Wednesday's] schedule of games until further notice."
ff: haa limte hubaru ndu, NBA ɗon no "darnitta fiijirde haa ɓaawo hasduye [Alarba] jaahargal fiijirde haa sey to matinol feere wurti fahin."

en: The Jazz's game was cancelled, as was another NBA game Wednesday between the Sacramento Kings and the New Orleans Pelicans.
ff: Fiijirde Jazz darnotto, bana fiijirde NBA feere haa Alarba haa kunde Sacramento Kings be New Orleans Pelicans.

en: Other games scheduled for Wednesday were still held, according to NBC News.
ff: Fiijirdeji feere je ɓe waɗi jaahargal ngal ngam Alarba saanjay no tawon, haa limte NBC News.

en: The United States' other major basketball organization, the National Collegiate Athletic Association, which runs college basketball, has cancelled its own tournament, March Madness, for both men's and women's leagues.
ff: Fiijirde basketbaal maungel feere haa Lesɗe America, National Collegiate Athletic Association, je ɗon mari jaangirde basketball, darni fiijirde maaɗa, March Madness, je worɓe be je rewɓe fu.

en: According to Johns Hopkins University, as of Wednesday, there were at least 1,279 confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the United States.
ff: haa limte Johns Hopkins University, haa Alarba, woodi pettum man nyauɓe 1 279 je ɗon andi mari nyau COVID-19 haa Lesɗe America.

en: CNBC reported there were at least 118,381 cases worldwide.
ff: CNBC wi'i woodi nyimɓe je mari nyau ndu pettum man 118 381 haa nder duniyaru.

en: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
ff: SARS-CoV-2 ɓuri nyauɓe milionre haa nder duniyaru fu.

en: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
ff: haa Alamisa, limgal yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau SARS-CoV-2 haa nder duniyaru fu waɗi milionre, ko matini matinolji Johns Hopkins University.

en: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
ff: Pettum man mayɓe ujineji 52 je laarani COVID-19, nyau je koronaviriis ɗon hokka.

en: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
ff: Ko woni kalluɗum yotti haa nder balɗe man be Malawi matini aranol nyauɗo koronaviriis maaɗa be Zambia aranool wade koronaviriis.

en: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
ff: North Korea wi'i, Lamisa, o laati gooto cakka lesɗe je maray nyauji koronaviriis haa jonta haa nder duniyaru.

en: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
ff: Kenya, Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu matini nyauɓe 1 051 635 je ɗon aandin, be nyauɓe 79 332 haa nder njamɗe cappan ɗiɗi e nay hiddeko njamdi 10 fajiri Central European Time (0800 UTC) haa 4 Aviril.

en: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
ff: haa Lesɗe Amerika, ɓuri nyauɓe koronaviriis ujenere 244 tawama, be limtol mayɗe pettum man 5 900.

en: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
ff: Hubaru gal CBS wi'i, ngam lornugo kuɗe Jam'iyare Johns Hopkins yo'o, woodi maybe ɓuri 1 000 haa nyalade Alarba je nyau koronaviriis mbardi haa Lesɗe Amerika.

en: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
ff: haa nder duniyaru fu, lesɗe matini dabareji nyaɗum ngam darnugo nyau do sanittugo.

en: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
ff: haa Alamisa, Sergei Sobyanin, marɗo lesdi Moscow, ɓesdi wakiti haɗɗol do wurtugo saare haa 1 Me.

en: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
ff: haa do lesdi man fu, Jagorɗo lesdi Vladimir Putin matini yo'o yimɓe Russiya'en tokkitan jaɓɓugo ceede maɓɓe ko to yahata kugal haa 30 Aviril.

en: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
ff: Kawtal arduɓe Portugal suɓɓi ɓesdugo wakkati jaawal lesdi be balɗe 15; suɓɓol man salli be yimɓe 215 je wi'i oho, yimɓe sappo suɓɓay, be goɗɗo gootel je wi'i kay.

en: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
ff: Saudi Arabiya juttini hasduye do wala wurtugo saare haa nder berniji seninde Makka be Madina sey neɓɓa balɗe ndu; haa aran, hasduye wurtol ndu ɗon fuɗɗa be njamdi 3 asiri haa njamdi 6 fajiri.

en: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
ff: Thailand wadi jaahargal hadugo wurtol diga njamdi 10 jemma haa njamdi 4 fajiri.

en: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
ff: Ngomna Ohio, Mike DeWine, matini haa ngomna yo'o lesdi juttini tawreta do wondugo haa saare haa 1 Me.

en: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
ff: Suuɗi filu haa Australia ustini soddugo takkarde gaɗɗa suudu.

en: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
ff: haa Alat be Asawe asiri, cuuɗi filu Australia Woolworths be Coles ustini haɗɗolji soddugo takkarde gaɗɗa suudu haa ɗiɗi be paket woore haa kalla lumo haa nder cuuɗi filu fu haa nder lesdi.

en: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
ff: ALDI bo'o wurtini soddugo paket woore, haa altine.

en: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
ff: Haɗɗolji ndu neldama bana matinolji haa baabe yoɓɓugo, daaldal Facebook cuuɗi ndi.

en: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
ff: Be mbi sodobe don soda kujeji ngam sigugo ngam be don hula COVI-19 to bana be emman yimbe wonda haa saare.

en: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
ff: haa Alarba, Woolworths bo'o ustini soddugo takkarde gaɗɗa suudu gal yimɓe wartiratta kujeji haa gooto.

en: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
ff: Saanjolji ndu tokkiti haɗɗolji je paketji nay je Woolworths be Coles nastini haa 4 be 5 Maars je sallingo.

en: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
ff: Coles, haa nder matinolji maaɗa haa 8 Maar, wi'i yo'o haɗɗolji soddugo do paketji nay je wondi, "cuuɗi filu haa jonta ɗon sippa haa kunde nyamdi woore", e ewni ewnandu ngu bana "wala naandu", haa wakkati ndu ALDI, gal matinol maaɗa haa Facebook haa Salasa, ewni ndu bana "tammay no".

en: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
ff: Fadoowo Woolworths matini yo'o sippolji "wa'i masin" haa asawere je sallingo.

en: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
ff: Suudu filu Costco haa Canberra bo'o ustini ndu haa paketji ɗiɗi haa asawere je sallingo.

en: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
ff: Ngam lessugo darnolji, Coles emmi paketji maungel haa Coles diga ɓe'en je ɗon no sippina ɓe kujeji tum, Woolworths emmi ɓesdo kujeji sippol, haa yakke man bo'o ALDI waɗi dabare moftugo kujeji ngam sippugo haa Alarba timmi.

en: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
ff: Russell Zimmerman, ɗowuwo Australian Retailers Association, wi'i yo'o sippitooɓe foondi ɓesdugo ceede kujeji, amma darnolji feelore lesdi do yarnugo kujeji haa saare haɗɗi ndu.

en: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
ff: O tammi ɓesdugo ceede wurtunugo kujeji, ngam haa yimɓe je ngaɗatta ndu heɓta hoore maɓɓe, be kujeji feerejo seeɗa.

en: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
ff: haa Salasa, ALDI matini yo'o ngam ko laarani wurtol kujeji, cuuɗi filu feere footay waɗa ko mbiyotto Alarba feerejo.

en: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
ff: haa nder matinolji News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, aandowo sippitol haa Queensland University of Technology, wi'i yo'o cuuɗi filu ɗon hebbina kujeji be jemma fu.

en: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
ff: O aandini yo'o takkarde gaɗɗa suudu laati kuje je ɗon waagi, ko ɗon lessina kujeji haa nde suudu sippol, e, to sippi timmi, ɗon acca baabe je wala kuje, ko ɗon ɓesda nummol je kuje wala.

en: Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
ff: Cooes be Woolworths tammi [yo'o] to woodi kujeji jur haa nder suudu sippol, to kujeji bana takkarde gaɗɗa be kuje laɓɓinugo foti [sodda] e ɗon waagi, on tamman hultorugo jur, Russell Zimmerman wi'i haa ABC News.

en: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
ff: Wangoowo takkarde gaɗɗa suudu Who Gives a Crap wi'i haa Alarba yo'o kujeji maɓɓe fu timmi.

en: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
ff: Kimberly-Clark, je ɗon waɗa Kleenex Toilet Tissue, be Solaris Paper je ɗon waɗa Sorbent, aandini yo'o ɓe ɗon huwa 24/7 ngam haa kujeji wona, haa limte News.com.au.

en: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
ff: Domain.com, sit je sippugo cuuɗi be daaldal, ɗon matini haa sippooɓe cuuɗi ɗon caaha takkarde gaɗɗa haa arandere soddoowo haa Melbourne, haa wakkati je kujeji seeɗa tan ngam soddooɓe maray wakkati jur haa siwtoare je juttungel Balɗe Kugal.

en: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
ff: Matinolji Alamisa NT News, batakkewol je ngurtama haa Darwin, be ɗereji joowey tati nder ton je ɓe watti ngam yahugo haa gaɗɗa suudu.

en: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
ff: Cuuɗi filu ɗon no ɗaaya ngam sallinugo darnolji, haa limte ABC Australia haa 3 Maars je ɓe wi'i ɓe wala dabareji haɗɗugo yimɓe ngam soddugo kujeji.

en: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
ff: Russell Zimmerman ɓesdi yo'o yimɓe ɗon emma kujeji feere bo'o jur, bana makji, kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe, kujeji joorɗum, lallul juɗe, be kuroori.

en: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
ff: Fahin bo'o, haa yaasi Australia, haa Alat be jemma suudu sippol Inglisiya do internati Ocado tawi bana ɗon usta sippolji takkarde gaɗɗa suudu Andres haa paketji 12 ɗiɗi.

en: US President Trump declares COVID-19 national emergency
ff: Jagorɗo Lesɗe America Trump matini jaawal lesdi COVID-19

en: On Friday, United States President Donald Trump declared a national emergency in response to the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.
ff: haa Jumɓare Jagorɗo Lesdi America Donald Trump matini jaawal lesdi bana jabbuye haa nyau viriis je wangi ndu.

en: The move came two days after the World Health Organization declared the outbreak, which causes the COVID-19 disease, to be a pandemic.
ff: Matinol ndu wangi haa ɓaawo Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu, ko waɗi koronaviriis woni bana nyau duniyaru.

en: The move gives the federal government access to around US$50 billion in extra funding to combat the pandemic, according to NBC News.
ff: Yahde nde ɗon hokka jarfuye haa ngomna lesdi keɓɓ miliarji feere US$20 ngam nattinugo nyau, bana limte NBC News.

en: The proclamation specifically said "the COVID-19 outbreak in the United States constitutes a national emergency" and said the national emergency began on March 1, almost two weeks before the proclamation itself.
ff: Limte man wi'i "nyau COVID-19 haa nder Lesɗe America laati bana Jaawal lesdi fu" e wi'i jaawal lesdi fuɗɗi haa 1 Maars, ɓadi asaweji ɗiɗi hideko wangol ngel.

en: The United States Department of Health and Human Services declared the outbreak a "public health emergency" on January 31.
ff: Department of Health and Human Services haa Lesɗe America matini nyau ndu bana "jaawal jam ɓanndu ummatore" haa 31 Zaanviye.

en: Trump did not place the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) in charge of the government's response to COVID-19, which Politico reported left some experts in disaster management disappointed.
ff: Trump hokkay haa juɗe Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) je jabbinata do COVID-19, je Politico matini bana acci aandooɓe siyasa do jaawal haa nder semtuɗum.

en: Politico quoted Tim Manning, formerly a deputy administrator at FEMA, as saying "FEMA has an important role in coordinating the larger response to the crisis" and "[i]f there's an emergency, FEMA needs to be involved."
ff: Politico limti ko Tim Manning, arduɗu ɗiɗaɓre ara haa FEMA, ba "FEMA ɗon mari kugal kanduɗum nder fadugo jabbuye do nyau duniyaru ndu" e "to woodi jaawal, sey nastina FEMA.

en: Trump made the decision under provisions of the National Emergencies Act, amongst other governing authorities.
ff: Trump hoosi jarfuye ndu do laahal National Emergencies Act, haa kunde arduɓe ngomna feere.

en: The Trump administration also announced other efforts in response to COVID-19, including waiving the interest it collects on federal student loans and increasing U.S. strategic oil reserve oil purchases.
ff: Ngomna Trump matini fahin bo'o dabareji feere ngam jabbugo do COVID-19, bana findinugo hakkilo haa do ceede jaangoɓe be ɓesdugo dabare neebam do siggorde neebam ngam sippugo.

en: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
ff: Geeɓe Lesdi do Jam ɓanndu wi'i COVID-19 laati nyau duniyaru fu

en: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
ff: haa alarba, Geeɓe Lesdi do Jam ɓanndu (WHO) wi'i yo'o nyau COVID-19, nyau je koronaviriis SARS-CoV-2 on hokki, laati bana nyau duniyaru.

en: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
ff: Ko to wolde "nyau duniyaru" yiɗi wi'ugo noy nyau man ɗon sankitti do lesdi, naa ngam ɗon halli haa nder wakkere feere, WHO matini naffuda sembintinugo ngomna'en do noy nyau man don halli haa nder wakkere je feerejo, WHO matini haaje ngomna'en huwa:

en: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
ff: Lesɗe fu foti saanja yahde nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
ff: To lesɗe tawi, larti, hurgi, wati haa sera, teffi lawol e matini ummatore maɓɓe ngam jabbinugo, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus wi'i, Ɗowuwo Aranol WHO.

en: We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction.
ff: En ɗon laarani fu ngam yahde raɓɓol je ɗon yajjina be hallende be yahde je yimɓe wala huwugo ngam man.

en: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
ff: haa nummol Dr. Tom Frieden, aran dowuwo Cuudi Aynol be Fartol Nyau Lesdi America, nyau ndu wala nandu man.

en: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
ff: O wi''i, haa siftordeji CNN haa Feviriye, haa ɓaawo ndambaji feere, wala viriis pofɗe feere tawama diga jaawal haa tokkitol yajjugo do lesdi."

en: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
ff: Ghebreyesus wolwi bo'o bana ni, gal wi'ugo, "en meeɗay larugo nyau duniyaru je wangi gal coronaviriis".

en: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
ff: O tokkiti be wi'ugo, "e en meeɗay larugo nyau duniyaru je foti en hurga haa wakkati gootel."

en: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
ff: Wonde keese haa wakkati nyau duniyaru ɗon tokkita hasduye WHO haa Zaanviye ngam wi'ugo nyau ndu laati jaawal jam ɓanndu je laarani lesɗe fu.

en: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
ff: Ɗowuwo United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease, Dr. Anthony Fauci, wolwi do nyau ndu bana, "yeccugo gonga, latan kalluɗɗum."

en: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
ff: Diga alaamisa, Associated Press matini yo'o woodi pettum man nyauɓe COVID-19, 126 000 haa nder duniyaru, je mbardi yimɓe 4 600.

en: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
ff: Nyau koronaviis 2019-20 laati nyau nyau duniyaru je koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19) je jonta, je wangi gal nyau pofɗe je nyaɗum je ewnotto koronaviriis 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

en: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
ff: Nyau ndu wangi haa Wuhan, Cayna, haa Desambre 2019, laati bana Jaawal Jam ɓanndu Lesɗe Fu haa 30 Zaanviye 2020, e laati bana nyau duniyaru fu haa 11 Maars 2020.

en: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
ff: Diga 10 Aviiril 2020, ɓadi nyauɓe COVID-19 milionre 1.61 matinama haa nder lesɗe e wakkereji 210, e mbardi bo'o yimɓe 97 000.

en: About 364,000 people have recovered.
ff: Waɗan yimɓe 364 000 nyamɓitti.

en: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
ff: Limtol mayde ɗon tara gal 4% haa Cayna, amma don haa kunde 13.04 haa Algeriya be 0.08 haa New Zealand.

en: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
ff: Mandolji nyau je ɗon aandin laati wulol ɓanndu, sondaaru be pofɗe bana daran.

en: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
ff: Saɗirmaji foti wona pneumonia be siɗirma nder pofɗe.

en: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
ff: wakkati diga raɓɓol haa fuɗɗam mandolji nyau ɗon gal balɗe joowey, amma ɗon haa kunde balɗe joowey be sappo e nay.

en: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
ff: Wala baatal malla lekki je mbaratta viriis ndu je ɗon aandin.

en: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
ff: Aranol hurgol laarani mandolji be ko sembintinatta. Dabareji je mballan ngam aynugo nyau ndu laati lallugo juɗe, suddugo hunduko to a ɗon sonda, dayugo be yimɓe feere, aynol e wondugo haa sera haa yimɓe je tammi bana ɗon mmari nyau ndu.

en: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
ff: Ngomna'en haa nder duniyaru fu jabbini gal haɗɗugo jaahangalji, wattugo yimɓe haa sera, wondugo haa saare haa ɓaawo wakkati feere, aynolji baabe kugal, e maɓɓol wakkereji.

en: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
ff: Nyau duniyaru ndu memmi jonde ummatore be risku yimɓe, yarɓol malla willol espor, mofturdeji jullurdeji, siyasa be fijirde, be ustolji kuje nyamɗe haa do lumo ngam yimɓe addi ɗum fu ngam hulol yimɓe feere timmina ɗum.

en: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent of the world's student population.
ff: Jaangirdeji be jam'iyare maɓɓakke haa nder lesdi man fu malla haa nder wakkere haa lesɗe 193, ko ɗon memma 99.4 limtol jaangoɓe duniyaru fu.

en: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
ff: Matinolji je yahay ngam viriis ndu ɗon waggare haa do hawo, e wadini saɗirmaji ɗuɗɗum je laarani fartol malla nyeebol do yimɓe Cayna, yimɓe lesdi Funaange feere be yimɓe je naandi jippi gal Southeast Asiya, be feere'en gal wakkereji je ɗon mari nyauɓe viriis man jur.

en: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
ff: Ngam ustol nder jaahangal be maɓɓol cuuɗi tagol kujeji, woodi ustol nder wonnugo hendu be curɗe e carbonji.

en: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
ff: Arduɓe jam ɓanndu haa Wuhan, Cayna (berniwol aranol lamorde Hubei) matini sammere nyauɓe pneumonia je aanda ko wangini haa 31 Desambre 2019, e woodi teffol feere fuɗɗama haa fuɗɗam Zaanviye 2020.

en: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
ff: Nyauɓe ɓurna fu salli gal Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market e ɗon tammi yo'o viriisji ndu wangi gal daabaji.

en: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
ff: Viriis ndu on ummini nyau je mbiyotto SARS-CoV-2, viriis keese je tawama ɗon laarani bilwili koronaviriis, pangolin koronaviriis, be SARS-CoV. Aranol goɗɗo je sappini mandolji nyau ndu tawama je nyawi haa 1 Desambre 2019, e goɗɗo ndu wonday no jur nder lumo daabaji be gite.

en: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
ff: haa aranool sammere nyauɓe je matinama haa Desambre 2019, ɗiɗi do tati tawama bana hawti be lumo.

en: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
ff: haa 13 Maars 2020, woodi matinol je en aanda ɗaaɗol man haa South China Morning Post wi'i yo'o woodi nyauɗo feere je ɗon lorta haa 17 Novambre 2019, ndottijo feere be duuɓi 55 haa lamorde Hubei, foti wona aranool man. haa 26 Feviriye 2020, WHO matini yo'o, bana nyauɓe keese usti haa Cayna amma ɓesdi laugel haa Italy, Iran, be South Korea, limgal nyauɓe haa yaasi Cayna ɓuri limgal nyauɓe haa nder Cayna haa wakkati aranol.

en: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
ff: foti geeɓeji matinolji feere je ɓe matinay jur, ɓurna haa kunde ɓe'en je ɗon mari mandolji nyau.

en: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
ff: haa 26 Feviriye, deydey nyauɓe matinama haa cakka sukkaɓe, je ɗon mari duuɓi 19 e je yottay, ndu ɗon ngaɗa limtol nyauɓe haa 2.4% haa nder duniyaru fu. Arduɗo feelowo aandal Lesɗe Inglisiya, Patrick Vallance, tammi yo'o 60% ummatore Inglisiya sey heɓɓa raɓɓa nyau ndu hiddeko, fadol gonga haa nder ummatore wonda.

en: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
ff: Nyauɓe laati limgal yimɓe je lartama bana mari COVID-19, e je lartol maɓɓe ɗo aanin fakat bana ɗon mari bana limtama haa nder batakeji ngomna.

en: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
ff: haa 23 Maars, wala lesdi je larti ɓuri 3% ummatore maɓɓe, e lesɗe heɓɓi siyasaji ngomna ngam ta ɓe larta ɓe'en je ɗon mari mandolji je ɗon deydey tan, bana Italy, Netherland, Spain, be Swiss.

en: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
ff: Bana wangitti haa 16 Maars tawi haa Cayna yo'o, haa 23 Zaanviye, nyauɓe waɗan 86% latama bana mari COVID-19, e nyauɓe ndu je windakka laati bana ɓundu nyau haa nyauɓe 79% je windakka.

en: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
ff: Limtol lartol je wurti haa 30 Maars wi'i yo'o limgalji nyauɓe haa Itali ɓuri be jur ɓe'en je matinikka.

en: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
ff: Aranool lartol limgal nuftol je arandere (R0) ngam COVID-19 laati 1.4 haa 2.4.

en: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
ff: Ekkitol feere gal Ɗowirɗe Lartol e Aynol Nyau hasdi yo'o foti yotta 5.7.

en: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
ff: Ɓurna yimɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19 ɗon nyamɓitta.

en: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
ff: haa yimɓe je nyamɓittay, wakkati fuɗɗam mandolji nyau haa wade ɗon no haa kunde balɗe 6 be 41, be ɓurna fu haa nder balɗe 14.

en: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
ff: Diga 10 Aviril 2020, ɓadi mayde 97 000 hokkama haa COVID-19.

en: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
ff: haa Cayna, diga 5 Feviriye deydey 80% mayde hoosi ɓe'en je ɓuri duuɓi 6, be 75% ɗon no mari nyauji feere bana nyauji ɓernde be nyau sukkar. Matinolji ngomna do mayde ngam nyau COVID-19 ɓurna fu laarani yimɓe je maayi je don no mari nyau COVID bana ko ɗon limti haa nder batakkeji ngomna.

en: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
ff: Limtol mayde ngam COVID-19 foti ɓura seeɗa, bana to footay larna yimɓe je mayatta bila lartol, bana sappinol, haa saare, haa cuuɗi suklare, feere.

en: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
ff: Matinolji sera gal Italy tawi yo'o limgal mayde je ɓuri haa yakke nyau duniyafu fu ɓuri matinolji mayde COVID-19 nde 4-5.

en: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
ff: Ngewtowo Ɗowirɗeji Lesɗe America do Aynol e Lartol Nyau (CDC) aandini yo'o "Min andi yo'o [limgal mayde je ɗon aandin] laati limgal je ɗon lessi", matinolji je batakkeji feere wurtini bo'o haa nder Lesɗe America bana lessinugo ɓurna ɗon haa yakke nyau lesdi, bana be nyau gaduru H1N1 haa 2009. Aranol wade je ɗon aandin wangi haa Wuhan haa 9 Zaanviye 2020.

en: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
ff: Aranol wade haa yaasi berniwol Cayna salli haa 1 Feviriye haa lesdi Filipiya'en, e arandere mayde haa yaasi Asiya woni haa Faransa haa 14 Feviriye.

en: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
ff: Gal 28 Feviriye, haa yaasi berniwol Cayna, ɓuri mayde sappo e ɗiɗi kala fu je ɗon windi haa Iran, South Korea, be Italy.

en: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
ff: Gal 13 maars, ɓuri lesɗe e wakkereji caappan nay matini wade, haa do geeɓe hawtirde lesdi fu sna Antarctica. Dabareji ɗuɗɗum ɗon naffa ngam limtol mayde.

en: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
ff: Limtolji ndu ɗon saanja be wakkere be wakkati, e be limgal lartolji, daraja suudu lekki, dabare hurgolji, wakkati diga arandere fuɗɗam nyau, be feeretirolji haa kunde ummatore bana duuɓi, badaal, be jam ɓandu fu. Limtol mayde do nyauɗo laati limgal mayɓe do limgal nyauɓe je lartama haa nder wakkati je ɗon aandin.

en: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
ff: To en jooɗi do limtolji Johns Hopkins University, limtol mayde do nyauɗo duniyaru fu laati 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) haa 10 Aviril 2020.

en: The number varies by region.
ff: Limgal ɗon saanja be wakkere.

en: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
ff: haa Cayna, limtol mayde do nyauɓe jippi diga 17.3% (je ɓe'en je mandolji nyau maɓɓe fuɗɗi diga 1-10 Zaanviye 2020) haa 0.07% (je ɓe'en je mandolji nyau maɓɓe fuɗɗi haa ɓaawo 1 Feviriye 2020). Dabareji feere ɗon laarani limtol mayde (CFR), je sappinata limgal ummatore je lartama timmi, je maayi ngam nyau feere be limtol mayde (IFR), je ɗon sappina limgal yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau (larti be lartay) je maayi ngam nyau feere.

en: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
ff: limtolji ndu yahay be wakkati e ɗon tokkita ummatore ngam nyau gal hurgol nyau.

en: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
ff: Jaanginooɓe jur foondi limmugo limtolji ndu haa nder ummatore je ɗon aandin.

en: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
ff: University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine tawi yo'o limtol mayde nyauɓe ngam nyau duniyaru hawti fu ɗon haa kunde 0.1% be 0.39%.

en: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
ff: Ko ɗon limti haa do ndu ɗon yahida be sappinolji je tawama haa arandere lartol COVID-19 haa Jaamani, be ekkitol limtol ɗon larta dabare lartol do limgal CFR.

en: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
ff: WHO wi'i yo'o foti darna nyau lesdi ndu.

en: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
ff: Toɓe be ragare neɓɓugo nyau footay aandin be fakatre e foti saanja be wakkere man.

en: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
ff: Maciej Boni haa Jam'iare Pen State wi'i, sey larta fahin, nyauji je rabbungel don dogga tawon, nden don lessa to nyau man timmini be cuudi je don wondi.

en: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
ff: Amma laati bana footay ngam ngaɗugo jaahargal diga jonta do ndey ndu yottan".

en: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
ff: Aranool feelowo jam ɓanndu ngomna Cayna Zhong Nanshan wi'i yo'o "foti timma fal Zwing" to lesɗe fu foti huwida ngam tokkitugo feeloji WHO do dabareji darnugo sankitol viriis.

en: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
ff: haa 17 Maars, Adam Kucharski je London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medecine wi'i yo'o SARS-CoV-2 "wancidan, temma haa nder duuɓi malla duuɓi ɗiɗi".

en: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
ff: Bana ekkitol Imperial College je ɗowama gal Neil Ferguson wi'i, danyugo be ummatore be dabareji feere emmotto "haa wakkati tawol baatal wonda (temma lebbi 18 malla ɓuri)".

en: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
ff: William Schaffner haa Jam'iare Vanderbilt wi'i, Mi tammi yo'o koronaviriis ndu, ngam foti goddo rabba ndu, footay maaja bana ni e foti lata bana nyau ja wakkati, e foti lora hittande do hittande.

en: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
ff: Sembe lortol viriis ndu wondan do wawande ɓanndu be viriis man e saanjol maaɗa.

en: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
ff: Mandolji COVID-19 foti wonda bana ni tan e yimɓe je ɗon raɓɓi foti sappinatta mandolji.

en: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
ff: Mandolji ɗiɗi je ɓurna fu laati wulol ɓanndu (88%) be sondaaru jorɗum (68%).

en: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
ff: Mandolji je wonday jur laarani tampere, wurtol ndamba (phlegm), kine haccatta fahin, pofɗe je bana daran, nawne ɓanndu, daande be huudure, paɓɓooje, peewol, tutol, iyam nder tuɗe, caarol, malla saanjol laaral ɓanndu. WHO wi'i ɓadi goɗɗo gooto do joowey go'o nyawan masitin e maran saɗirma ngam foofugo.

en: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
ff: Ɗowirɗe Lesɗe America do Aynol e Lartol Nyau CDC) ɗon limta mandolji nyau bana saɗirma be foofugo, naawol ɓernde je ɗon tokkita malla harlol, jiɓɓol, saɗirma be wancugo, yeeso be hunduko ɗon saanja; sey matina yimɓe je suklata do jam ɓanndu to woodi mandolji nyau ndu. Fahin bo'o, foti nyau man yotta haa pneumonia, nyau saɗirma be pofɗe, sepsis, septic shock be mayde.

en: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
ff: Feere'en haa cakka je ɗon mari nyau foti sappinatta mandolji amma be sappinolji lartol je ɗon aandina nyau, nden kadi teffoɓe wurtini feelore ngam ɓe'en je ngondi no be nyauɓe sey lata aynama e lartama ngam wilugo nyau ndu.

en: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
ff: Cayna tammi yo'o limtol nyauɓe je sappinata mandolji ɗon fuɗɗa diga seeɗa haa 44%.

en: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
ff: wakkati nuftol je ɗon andi ɓurna (wakkati haa kunde raɓɓol be fuɗɗam) ɗo yaha diga balɗe haa balɗe 14; ɓurna fu laati balɗe joowey. Bana sappinol je aandake be fakatre, limtol geeɓe yimɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19 je kine maɓɓe footay haccugo ɗon no aran 30% e lessi haa 15% haa ɓaawo man.

en: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
ff: Matinolji feere do noy nyau man sankitotto tawakke tawon.

en: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
ff: Nyau ndu laati bana sankitotto aranool haa yakke hawtirde be tuɗe je ɗon wurta haa yakke sondaaru, ɓislol, malla wolde; be hawtirde laati bana haa nder metaa 1 haa 2 (kosɗe 3 haa 6).

en: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
ff: Ekkitolji sappini yo'o sondaaru je sudday foti ngaɗa tuɗe yaha haa gaɗɗa metaaji 4.5 (kosɗe 15) haa metaaji 8.2 (koosɗe 27).

en: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
ff: Yimɓe feere wi'i yo'o viriis man foti salla gal tuɗe pamaron je jooɗi jur nder hendu, je foti nufta haa wakkati ngewte. Tuɗe je wurtatta gal pofɗe foti bo'o nufta haa yakke fuufugo gal yaasi, bana ngewte, ko to naa hendu on sallina viriis man.
