en: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
ff: Tuɗe foti toɓɓa haa nder hunduko malla kine yimɓe je ondi haa sera e foti bo'o yotta haa fuufu.

en: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
ff: Laahalji jam ɓandu feere bana sallinugo kardan be umminugo ɓernde je dari (CPR) foti waɗa kuje bana ndiyam nder pofɗe je foti nasta nder hendu e nden kadi sankitta haa dow.

en: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
ff: foti bo'o yaja to goddo memmi baabal je don mari gildi ndu, bana laral bandu, haa bawo man yiggi gite, kine, malla hunduko mabbe.

en: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
ff: haa yakke je larulaaji ɗon foti sankitta gal buwe, amma sa'a man bana wonday jur.

en: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
ff: Ngomna Cayna salli jaɓɓugo yo'o foti SARS-CoV-2 salla diga buwe haa hunduko. Viriis man ɓuri nyaɗugo haa arandere balɗe tati diga fuɗɗorde mandolji, ko to sankittol foti wonda hideko fuɗɗam mandolji e haa ragare yahde nyau ndu.

en: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
ff: Yimɓe woni lartama ɗon mari nyau haa balɗe tati hiddeko fuɗɗam mandolji je yiɗi wi'ugo yo'o foti sallina ndu hiddeko mandolji feere wanga.

en: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
ff: Nyauɓe seeɗa tan je suudu lartol sappini bana hollata mandolji haa nder batakkeji maɓɓe, amma sallinol bila mandolji ɗon maandi haa nder lesɗe feere gal teffolji.

en: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
ff: Ɗowirɗe Erop ngam Lartol e Aynol Nyau (ECDC) wi'i yo'o haa yakke je kuje laɓɓay do noy nyau ndu ɗon sankitta, goɗɗo gooto foti raɓɓa ɓurna yimɓe ɗiɗi malla tati. Viriis nyeeɗan njamdiji haa balɗeji haa do daldal.

en: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
ff: Ɓurna bo'o, viriis man foti tawama haa balɗe tati do leeda (polypropylene) be 304 nyama larta, balɗe gooto do takkarde, e haa njamdi nay do cardi.

en: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
ff: Ndu, be man fu, ɗon saanja do peewol be gulɗum. Daabaji saare be je ladde feere larti bana ɗon mari COVID-19.

en: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
ff: Wala sappinol je hollatta dabaji je foti sallina nyau man haa neddo, ko to ardube British don feela lalugo jude haa bawo memmugo dabaji, bana to a memmi baabe feere je nyaube memmi.

en: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
ff: Nyau saɗirma nder pofɗe je koronaviriis 2 (SARS-CoV-2) woni viriis keese, je tawama aranool man haa yimɓe tati be pneumonia hawti be sammere nyauji pofɗe je nyaɗum haa Wuhan.

en: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
ff: Mandolji viriis SARS-CoV-2 je keese salli haa koronaviriisji haa nder ladde. haa yaasi ɓanndu neɗɗo, sabulu mbardan viriis ndu, je ɗon ɓoora laaral maaɗa. SARS-CoV-2 ɗon naandi be SARS-CoV je aranool.

en: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
ff: Tammi yo'o wangi gal daabaji.

en: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
ff: Lartol gene sappini yo'o koronaviriis haa ɗaaɗol man samman be genus Betacoronavirus, haa geeɓe je pamaron Sarbecovirus (asngol B) be gilɗi je wurti haa bilwili ɗiɗi fu.

en: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
ff: Naandi haa 96% haa baabal genome be lekki bilwili feere (BatCov RaTG13).

en: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
ff: haa Feviriye 2020, teffoɓe Cayna tawi yo'o woodi feeretirol amino acid gooto tan haa kunde ta'irdeji genome haa cakka viriisji pangolinji be je neɗɗo.

en: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
ff: Foondol genome man fu haa jonta sappini ɓurna 92% kujeji gene je ɗon sendama haa kunde koronaviriis pangolin be SARS-CoV-2, je famɗi ngam hollugo yo'o pangolinji on woni suudu siggorde cakkara.

en: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
ff: Nyau gal viriis foti lata lartotto gal mandolji ndu, ko to aandinugo sey salla gal jaangugo polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) je ndiyam ɓanndu.

en: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
ff: Ekkitol je ɗon foonda PCR be CT haa Wuhan sappino yo'o CT ɓuri ɗiggugo do PCR, ko to lessi, be ɓurna mandolji foto mako ɗon sallina do laahalji pneumonia be nyauji.

en: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
ff: Diga Maars 2020, American College of Radiology yiɗi yo'o "CT tato hocca ɗum ngam lartugo malla aranool lartol nyau COVID-19".

en: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
ff: WHO wurtini batakkeji lartol RNA ɗuɗɗum ngam SARS-CoV-2, be je aranool man wurti haa 17 Zaanviye.

en: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
ff: Lartol man ɗon huwa be jaangirde polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) gal ɓaawo.

en: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
ff: Lartol ndu foti salla do lekku pofɗe be je iyam.

en: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
ff: Sappinolji ɗon wurta ɓurna haa nder njamdiji seeɗa haa balɗe.

en: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
ff: Lartol ndu ɓurna fu hoccama gal ilam kine ko to ilam daande bo'o foti hoccama. Limgal cuɗɗi lartol be cuuɗi tagle maugel ɗon haɓda ngam wurtinugo kujeji lartol neebam iyam, je ɗon maanda fadooɓe ɓanndu.

en: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
ff: Diga 6 Aviril 2020, wala haa cakka maɓɓe sappini be fakatre yo'o foti huwa be man haa nder duniyaru fu.

en: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
ff: haa lesɗe America, Cellex wurtini dabare lartol neebam iyam je jaɓɓama ngam huwugo haa nder cuuɗi lartolji je ɗon mari saaman tan.

en: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
ff: Mandolji foto do radio be ordo tomografi (CT) yimɓe je sappinata mandolji ɗon laarani watugo darugal seere-sera haa nder yiɓre e bila ilam jur haa nder fuffu.

en: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
ff: Italian Radiological Society ɗon mofta matinolji diga lesɗe feere-feere haa do hawo do sappinol fotoji nyauɓe je ɗon aandim mari nyau.

en: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
ff: Ngam naandu ba nyauji feere bana adenoviriis, foto bila aanditol gal PCR ɗon mari keerol ngam maandugo COVID-19.

en: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
ff: woodi jaangirde feere maungel haa Cayna foondi sappinol CT ɓernde be PCR e holli yo'o ko to foti larnay nyau man ciir, ɓuri yawugo e ɗiggugo, je ɗon hollina naffuda man bana kuje lartol haa nder wakkereji nyau.

en: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
ff: Aandalji ordo je mbiyotto convolutional neural networks wurtama ngam mandugo mandolji foto viriis ɗiɗi fu be radio be CT.

en: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
ff: Dabareji ngam darnol sallinol nyau laarani wondugo tum nder laɓɓinol ɓanndu, lallugo juɗe, darnugo memmugo gite, kine, malla hunduko be juɗe je lallay, be sondugo malla ɓislugo haa nder leepol e sakkinugo leepol ndu haa nder tassawo cuɗɗi.

en: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
ff: Yimɓe je foti mara nyau ndu feelama ngam ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso seekowo haa cakka ummatore.

en: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
ff: Dabareji danyugo be ummatore laati bo'o feelama haa haɗɗugo sallinol. Ngomna'en ustini malla feela ngam darnugo jaahangalji haa malla diga lesɗe be wakkereji je nyau man don memma.

en: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
ff: Amma, viriis yotti yaɓɓorde sankittol ummatore haa nder wakkereji maungel nder duniyaru.

en: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
ff: Bana wi'ugo yo'o viriis man ɗon sankitta haa nder ummatore, be jeeyaɓe ummatore feere aanda haa toy e noy ɓe nangi nyau ndu. Sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu je suklata do goɗɗo je foti raɓɓi nyau man feelama ngam huwugo be dabareji hakiika je ɗon andi, dabare ngidugo, be suddugo gite. Lortol do ngidugo laati dabare kanduɗum haa arduɓe jam ɓanndu ngam maandugo ɓundu nyau ndu e haɗɗa sallinol feere.

en: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
ff: Huwidugo be matinolji diga telefon gal ngomnaji ngam kuje ndu meemi larulaaji do amana, be Amnesty International be feere buri 100

en: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
ff: woodi applikasionji telefon jur je wondi malla ɗo feeli ngam huwidugo be man be hoore mooɗon, e diga 7 Aviiril 2020, ɓuri geeɓeji aandoɓe sappo e ɗiɗi ɗo no huwa do dabareji je ɗon suɗina hoore maɓɓe, bana Bluetooth haa nastirde ordo be yimɓe feere be telefonji feere..

en: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
ff: Marɓe ɗon keeɓɓ batakkewol to ɓe wondi be goɗɗo feere je larti mari COVID-19. Matinolji feere je yahay be lawol do noy darnugo nyau; bana sappinol, lallugo kine be lallugo daande be ndiyam lallugo wala naffuda sam.

en: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
ff: Wala baatal COVID-19, ko to geebeji jur don huwa do wanginugo ndu.

en: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
ff: Lallugo juɗe feelam ngam darnugo sankittol nyau ndu.

en: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
ff: CDC ɗon feela yo'o ummatore lalla juɗe tum be sabulu be ndiyam haa nder pettum man sekonji cappan ɗiɗi, ɓurna haa ɓaawo on yeehi haa gaɗɗa suudu malla to bana juɗe laɓɓay; hideko nyammugo; be haa ɓaawo on fuffi ndamba, sondi, malla ɓisli.

en: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
ff: Ndu ngam haa yaasi ɓanndu naɗɗo, sabulu mbardan viriis, je ɗon ɓoora laaral ɓanndu ngel je suudata mo.

en: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
ff: CDC ɗon feela bo'o huwugo be ndiyam lallugo juɗe be pettum man 60% alkol to sabulu be ndiyam wonday haa wakkere man.

en: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
ff: WHO ɗon feela ummatore ngam tato ɓe memma gite, kine, hunduko be juɗe je lalay.

en: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
ff: Daaldal foti wondi ɗon laɓɓini gal dabareji feere-feere (haa nder minti gootel to ɓe sallini kuje man do daaldal nyamta larta), bana 62-72% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.

en: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
ff: Dabereji feere bana benzalkonium chloride be chrohexidine gluconate, wala sembe jur.

en: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
ff: CDC ɗon feela yo'o to woodi goɗɗo je bana mari nyau COVID malla larti ɗon mari haa wakkere feere bana baabal kugal malla suudu lekki, wakkereji fu bana cuuɗi kugal, ccuɗi yiwugo, baabe hirugo, ordoji je ɗon sendama haa cakka yimɓe, baabe sappinol gal i'ugo, baabe windugo do ordo, telekomandji, be ordoji ATM je nyauɗo huwi be man sey laɓɓina ɗum.

en: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
ff: Arduɓe nyau ɗon feela yo'o yimɓe sudda hunduko be kine maɓɓe be tagol jungo malla be leepol to ɓe ɗon sonda malla ɓisla, e sakina kala irin leepol ndu lau.

en: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
ff: Leepol suddugo hunduko seekoɓe feelama haa yimɓe je foti raɓɓi nyau ndu, ngam ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso foti usta tuɗe be dayugo majum to en ɗon fuffa, wolwa, ɓisla, malla sonda.

en: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
ff: WHO wurtini matinolji do ndey e noy ɓornugo maskji.

en: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
ff: haa Stephen Griffin, jaanginowo viriis haa University of Leeds, "Ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso foti usta wawande yimɓe ngam memmugo yeesoji maɓɓe, je laati ɓundu aranol raɓɓugo nyau bila lallugo ndu be boɗɗum." Leepolji suddugo yeeso feelama bo'o haa yimɓe je suklata do ɓe'en je foti mara nyau ndu.

en: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
ff: WHO feeli ɓornol leepolji suddugo yeeso haa yimɓe je maray nyau man sam to be foti ɓe nanga nyau ndu, bana ɓe'en je suklata do goɗɗo je ɗon mari COVID-19, ko to ɓe andi yo'o ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso foti haɗɗa yimɓe ngam memmugo yeeso maɓɓe.

en: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
ff: Lesɗe jur fuɗɗi sembintinugo ɓornol leepol suddugo yeeso ummatore.

en: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
ff: haa lesɗe America, CDC ɗon feela ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso je ɓe waɗi be limse. Cayna feeli ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso jam ɓandu je sakkina haa ɓaawo man gal yimɓe je maray nyau, to ɓe ɗon ɓadita (metaa 1 (kosɗe 3) malla yottay) be yimɓe feere.

en: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
ff: Hong Kong ɗon feela ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso seekowo haa yakke ngewte haa nder moota be yimɓe feere malla haa baabe je ummatore ɗon wondi.

en: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
ff: Arduɓe nyau Thailand ɗon sembintina yimɓe ngam waɗugo leepol suddugo yeeso maɓɓe haa saare e lotta ɗum ko weeti fu.

en: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
ff: Czech Republic be Slovakia haɗi wurtugo yaasi bila ɓornugo leepol suddugo yeeso malla suddugo kine be hunduko.

en: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
ff: haa 16 Maars, Vietnam emmi haa ko moy fu ɓorna leepol suddugo yeeso haa wakkati yahugo haa cakka ummatore ngam fadugo hoore maɓɓe be yimɓe feere.

en: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
ff: Ngomna Ostriya feeli yo'o ko moy fu je ɗon nasta haa suudu sippugo kujeji je ɓorna leepol suddugo yeeso.

en: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
ff: Israila emmi ummatore fu ɓorna leepolji suddugo yeeso maɓɓe haa cakka yimɓe.

en: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
ff: Taiwan, je ɗon no waɗa leepolji suddugo yeeso milionji sappo ko weeti fu haa cakare Maars emmi no haa salloɓe jirki be moota je ɗon wanca berniji do berniji sey ɓorna leepol suddugo yeeso haa 1 Aviiril.

en: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
ff: Panama latini dole ɓornugo leepol suudugo yeeso ko a ɗon wurta fu, e feeli bo'o ngaɗugo leepol suddugo yeeso haa saare haa ɓe'en je footay sodda leepolji suddugo yeeso ndu.

en: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
ff: Leepol sudugo huwotto haa Zapong, Korea je Fombina, Malaysia, be Singapore.

en: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
ff: Dayugo ummatore (ɗon aandin bo'o bana dayugo ɓanndu) laarani bo'o dabare aynol nyau ngam ustugo sankittol nyau gal ngidugo be yimɓe.

en: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
ff: Dabareji laarani wondugo haa sera; darnolji jaahangalji; be maɓɓugo jaangirdeji, baabe kugal, baabe fijirde, theatres, malla cuuɗi sippugo.

en: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
ff: Yimɓe foti huwida be dabareji dayol ummatore gal wondugo haa saare, ustugo jaahangal, luttugo wakkereji je yimɓe ɗuɗɗi haa ton, sanugo bila hawtugo juɗe, be dayugo ɓanndu oya be oya.

en: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
ff: Ngomna'en jur ɗon ewna malla feela dayugo haa kunde ummatore haa nder wakkereji je nyau man memmi.

en: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
ff: Limgal yimɓe je foti hawta haa baabal gootel je arduɓe ngomna be je jam ɓanndu lesɗe America hasdi jippi diga yimɓe 250 (to bana wala sankittol COVID-19) haa yimɓe 50, e ɓaawo man haa yimɓe 10.

en: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
ff: haa ɓaawo 22 Maars 2020, Jaamani haɗi mofturde je ɓuri yimɓe ɗiɗi. Mauɓe je ɓuri ba duuɓi be ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau feere bana nyau sukkar, nyau ɓernde, nyau pofɗe, ilam iyam be sembe, dabare fadol ɓanndu je wala sembe ɗon mari sa'a keɓɓugo nyau man je nyaɗum be saɗirmaji e feelama gal CDC ɓe wonda haa saare bana ko ɓe wawi haa wakkereji raɓɓol ummatore. haa ragare Maars 2020, WHO be sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu feere fuuɗɗi saanjugo wolde "dayol ummatore" be "dayol ɓanndu", ngam laɓɓinugo yo'o bana wi'ugo ustugo hawtirde ɓanndu gal wondugo haa nder ummatore gooto, to gal ordoji malla be dayugo.

en: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
ff: Wolde " dayugo ummatore" waɗi yimɓe sey wonda feere maɓɓe nder nukkure maɓɓe, do sembintugo ɓe ngam wondugo be yimɓe feere gal dabareji feere. Yimɓe ngomna feere wurtini dabareji feere ngam jam ɓanndu nder baadal haa wakkati nyau ndu.

en: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
ff: Ndu laarani feeloji ngam joɗɗidugo be goɗɗo je a ɗon wondi be mako, je maray viriis malla mandolji viriis.

en: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
ff: Joɗɗugo haa sera be hoore mooɗon feelama haa yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 be ɓe'en je tammi raɓɓi nyau ndu.

en: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
ff: Cuuɗi je suklata do jam ɓanndu wurtini matinolji ngam joɗɗugo haa sera be hoore mum. Ngomna'en hasdi malla feeli wondugo sera be hoore mum haa ummatore je ɗon wondi haa wakkereji je ɗon mari nyau ndu.

en: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
ff: Matinolji do joɗɗugo sera be hoore mum wurti ngam geeɓeji je ɗon mari sa'a raɓɓol manga.

en: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
ff: Yimɓe je temma wondi be goɗɗo je raɓɓi COVID-19 be ɓe'en je loori jaahangal neeɓay haa lesdi malla wakkere je ɗon mari nyau ndu je ɗon sankitta lau, sey joɗɗa sera haa nder balɗe 14 diga wakkati wondugo haa baabal nyau man.

en: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
ff: Dabareji ngam aynol nyau ndu laati wondugo sera malla wilugo, be ustugo.

en: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
ff: Wondugo sera naffan haa fuɗɗorɗe nyau man e yiɗi teffa e wata ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau e wurtina dabareji feere ngam aynugo nyau be baatalji ngam darnugo nyau ndu sankitta haa luttuɗum ummatore.

en: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
ff: To footay darna yajjugo nyau ndu, sey dabareji lorotto haa yaɓɓorde ustol: dabareji hoosama ngam ɗayinugo yajjol e usta sembe mako nder siyasa jam ɓanndu be ummatore.

en: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
ff: Hawtirde dabareji ɗiɗi fu darnol be ustol foti hoccama haa wakkati gootel.

en: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
ff: Wilugo ɗon emma dabareji je ɓuri sembe fahin ngam heɓɓa lorta yahde nyau duniyaru ndu gal ustugo nuftol limtol haa 1%. Dabare feere bo'o ngam nyau je ɗon raɓɓa bo'o laarani ustugo sembe nyau, je ɗon andi bana dartinugo yahde nyau.

en: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
ff: Ndu ɗon usta raɓɓende huwoɓe jam ɓanndu e hokka ɓe wakkati deydey ngam baatal be hurgol heɓɓotto.

en: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
ff: Wallende je wonday je yimɓe jam ɓanndu je foti huwa do nyau ndu laarani dabareji aynugo hoore mum, bana lallugo juɗe, ɓornugo leepolji suddugo yeeso, be joɗɗugo sera; dabareji ummatore laarani dayugo ɓanndu bana maɓɓu jaangirdeji be haɗɗugo mofturde yimɓe; hasduye ummatore sembintinugo jaɓɓugo e huwidugo be dabareji ndu; be dabareji aynugo wakkere amin bana laɓɓugo baabe. Kuɗe feere je mari sembe laarani darnugo yajjol nyau hoccama haa Cayna haa yakke je nyaɗugo nyau man wangi, bana wattugo berniji ɗungum haa sera e haɗɗugo jaahangalji sam.

en: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
ff: Lesde feere hoosi dabareji feere ngam ustugo yajjugo viriis haa nder berniwol.

en: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
ff: South Korea nastini lartol ummatore be wattugo yimɓe wakkere feere haa sera, e wurtini aynolji do wancuru yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau man.

en: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
ff: Singapore wurtini ceede ngam wallugo ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau e je watti hoore maɓɓe haa sera e elti ɓe'en je waɗay bana ni be lamanji ɗuɗɗum.

en: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
ff: Taiwan ɓesdi wurtinugo leepol suddugo yeeso e haɗɗi siggugo kujeji jam ɓanndu. Foondurki Lesɗe Inglisiya be Lesɗe America ɗon sappina yo'o ustol (ɗon usta amma naa darnugo nyau ngam yajjugo) be wilugo (lornugo yahde nyau) ɗon mari saɗirmaji maungel.

en: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
ff: Siyasaji ustol be gonga foti usta emmol ɓe'en je ɗon sukla do jam ɓanndu nder 2/3 e mayde be reeta, amma be man fu yimɓe ujineji jur mayan e cuɗɗi lekki habban bana wala naandu man.

en: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
ff: foti ndika wilugo amma sey wonda haa wakkati je viriis man don wanca fu haa cakka ummatore (malla haa baatal man tawotto, to kanjum arti wurtugo), ngam rebbungol lorotto to lessi jude.

en: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
ff: Waɗugo dabare wilugo nyau ɗon ngada majjinol ceede haa ummatore e haa lesdi fu.

en: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
ff: Wala lekki je ɗon andi be fakatre je foti mbarda viriis COVID-19, amma dabareji jur ɗon don do lawol, je laarani bo'o lartol lekki je ɗon timmi.

en: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
ff: Hoosugo lekki ndamba, yarugo njaram, e siwtugo foti usta mandolji nyau ndu.

en: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
ff: Do nyadugo nyau ndu, hurgol be ndiyam, lekki nder iyam, be wallende gal pofde foti naffa.

en: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
ff: Huwidugo be steroidji foti wona sappinolji.

en: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
ff: Kujeji jur je naffi no haa nder hurgol nyauji viriisji feere woni lartama to foti naffa nder hurgol COVID-19.

en: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
ff: WHO wi'i yo'o woodi "lekki wuro be je saare feere" je foti usta mandolji nyau SARS-CoV-19.

en: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
ff: Suudu lekki je do yaajja e don habda ngam mballugo nyaube COVID-19 laati haa gote WHO bana dabare jabbugo haa nyau ndu.

en: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
ff: ECDC be ɗowirɗe lamorde Erop jr WHO wurtini dabareji ngam suudu lekki be wakkereji suklugo do jam ɓanndu ngam dassugo kujeji haa yaɓɓorde ɗuɗɗum, be tendinugo sembe cuuɗi lartolji gal lartol COVID-19, wilugo dabareji suɓol to foti waɗa, sendugo e wattugo yauɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19 haa sera, e ɓesdugo dabareji suklare do jam ɓanndu jur gal ekkitinugo kugal haa huwoɓe e ɓesdugo limgal ordooji fartugo hendu be leesoji.

en: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
ff: woodi ngewteji feere-feere do haa toy aranool nyauɗo (mo je mbiyotto nyauɗo arandere) foti ummi.

en: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
ff: Aranool nyauɗau je ɗon andi ngam koronaviriis keese loran haa 1 Desambre 2019 haa Wuhan, Hubei, Cayna.

en: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
ff: haa nder lewru, limgal nyauɓe koronaviriis haa Hubei ɓesdi seeɗa be seeɗa.

en: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
ff: Ndu ummiki burna gal Lumoji Dabaji je don nder ndiyam je Huan, je don no sippa dabaji be gite fu, e wolde feere je mbiyatta viriis man wangi gal gooto haa cakka dabaji ndu: , malla be wolde feere, yidi wi'ugo, wangi gal dabaji. Hudure nder fufu je en aanda dadi man tawama haa nyalade 26 lewru Desambre e hurgama gal lekkitajo Zhang Jixian haa Hubei Provincial Hospital, je matini CDC Wuhan Jianghan haa 27 Desambre.

en: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
ff: haa 30 Desambre, geeɓe lekkitaɓe haa Wuhan Central Hospital matini sobiraaɓe maɓɓe do "irin koronaviriis SARS".

en: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
ff: Joowey e tati haa kunde lekkitaɓe go, be Li Wenliang, mbiyotto gal polis yo'o ɓe ɗon doggina tufle, e feere bo'o, Ai Fen, harkinama gal jagorɓe maaɗa ngam umminugo hakkilo yimɓe.

en: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
ff: Kuɗe Jam ɓanndu Lamorde Wuhan haa ɓaawo man wurtini batakkewol haa ummatore haa 31 Desambre e matini WHO.

en: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
ff: Nyauji foofugo ɗuɗɗum je yimɓe aanda hollinama haa arduɓe jam ɓanndu haa Wuhan ngam fuɗɗorde lartol haa fuddam Zaanviye. haa fuɗɗorde nyau man, limgal nyaube ɓesdi nde ɗiɗi haa ɓaawo nyalade jowey e ɗiɗi be reeta.

en: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
ff: haa fuɗɗam be cakare Zaanviye, viriis man raɓɓi lamordeji Cayna feere, be wallende jaahangal duuɓi Keese haa Cayna e Wuhan je woni wakkere je cakkere jaahangalji be ɓurna laabi jirki haa ton.

en: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
ff: haa 20 Zaanviye, Cayna matini nyauɓe keese 140 haa nder nyalade gooto, yimɓe ɗiɗi haa Beijing be gootel haa Shenzhen.

en: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
ff: Matinolji ngomna je keese ɗon sappina yo'o, yimɓe 6 174 ɗon mari mandolji man diga 20 Zaanviye 2020. Diga 26 Maars, Lesɗe Amerika ɓuri Cayna be Italy be limgal nyauɓe ɓuri lesdi fu haa nder duniyaru. Diga 9 Aviiril 2020, ɓuri yimɗɓe milionre 1.63 don mari nyau man haa duniyaru; buri yimbe 97 000 maynama be ɓuri 364 000 yambiti.

en: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
ff: Waɗan lesɗe be wakkereji 200 mari no pettum man nyauɗo gootel.

en: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
ff: Ngam nyau duniyaru ndu haa Erop, lesɗe jur haa nder Wakkere Shengen heɓɓi darnol ngam wancugo meere-meere e wurtini aynolji keerolji.

en: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
ff: Dabareji lesdi laarani dabareji darnugol bana wondugo haa sera (je ɗon andi bana tawretaji wondu haa saare, tawretaji siwte haa baabbal gootel, malla haɗɗol wurtol) be darnol wurtugo. haa 2 Aviiril, waɗan yimɓe milionji 300, malla deydey 90% ummatore, ɗon no bana wondi haa suudu haa Lesɗe America, ɓuran yimɓe milionji 50 je ɓe haɗɗi ɓe wurtugo haa Filipiya'en, deydey yimɓe milionji 50 ɗon wondi haa suudu haa South Afirika, be yimɓe miliarre 1.3 ɗon wondi haa suudu haa Indiya.

en: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
ff: haa 26 Maars, yimɓe miliarre 1.7 haa nder duniyaru fu ɗon no bana ɗon wondi haa suudu, je ɓesdi haa ɓaawo man haa yimɓe miliarji 2.6 haa nde balɗe ɗiɗi, deydey ta'irde gooto nder tati ummatore lesdi fu.

en: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
ff: Arandere nyauɗo COVID-19 loran haa 1 Desambre 2019 haa Wuhan; batakewol woore je ɓe jaɓɓay tawon ɗon wi''a yo'o aranol nyauɗo wangi haa 17 Novambre.

en: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
ff: Lekkitajo Zhang Jixian larti nyauɓe sammere pneumonia je aanda ɗaaɗol man haa 26 Desambre, do man suudu lekki mako matini CDC Wuhan Jianghan CDC haa 27 Desambre..

en: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
ff: Aranol lartol ɗaaɗol man haa leekuji nyauɗo haa 29 Desambre 2019 sappini koronaviriis je ɗon naandi SARS.

en: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
ff: Batakkewol ummatore wurtama gal Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Lamorde Wuhan haa 31 Desambre.

en: The WHO was informed on the same day.
ff: Ɓe matini WHO haa nder balɗe man.

en: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
ff: Nde matinolji ndu wangi, lekkitoɓe haa Wuhan matinama gal polis ngam "dogginugo tufle" do nyau ndu.

en: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
ff: Geeeɓe Jam Baandu Lesdi Cayna fuɗɗi be wi'ugo yo'o wala "sappinol je gonga" do sallinol diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo tawon.

en: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
ff: haa ragare Zaanviye, ngomna Cayna fuɗɗi ewnandu je nyaɗum haa ɓaawo man je windowo aranool Chinese Communist Party bana Xi Jinping bana "konno ummatore" ngam darnugo yajjol viriis ngel.

en: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
ff: haa nder ko ɗon limtama bana "wondugo suudu je ɓuri haa nder tariya neɗɗo", keerol jam ɓanndu matinama haa 23 Zaanviye je ɗon no haɗɗa jaahangal gal nder malla gal yaasi Wuhan, haa yajjinama haa berniji feere 15 haa Hubei, je memmi hawtirde yimɓe milionji 57.

en: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
ff: Moota halal maa laati haɗɗama.

en: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
ff: Juldeji duuɓi Keese Cayna (25 Zaanviye) willakke haa wakkereji ɗuɗɗum.

en: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
ff: Yimɓe ngomna matini bo'o mahugo suudu jam ɓanndu je hiddeko, Huoshenshan Hospital, je ɓe timmini haa nder balɗe 10.

en: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
ff: haa ɓaawo man ɓe mahi suudu lekki feere, Leishenshan Hospital, ngam jaɓɓugo nyauɓe feere.

en: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
ff: Ngam ɓesdugo haa suudu lekki je ɓe mahi keesum, Cayna waylitti wakkereji 14 feere haa Wuhan, bana wakereji kawtirde, baabe fiijirde, do cuuɗi lekki je hiddeko. haa 26 Zaanviye, ngomna wurtini dabareji feere ngam darnugo nyau COVID-19, bana wanginugo ngewte ngam ɓe'en je ɗon waɗa jaahangal e ɓesdugo siwtare Spring Festival.

en: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
ff: Jam'iyare be jaangirdeji haa nder lesdi fu maɓɓotto.

en: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
ff: Wakkereji Hong Kong be Macau wurtini dabareji feere, ɓurna do ko laarani jaangirdeji be jam'iyareji.

en: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
ff: Dabare huwugo diga saare hoccama haa nder wakkereji Cayna feere.

en: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
ff: Haɗol jaahangal hoosi sembe haa nder be yaasi Hubei.

en: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
ff: Hortol ummatore saanji, e cuuɗi tariya fu haa nder lesdi Cayna maɓɓotto tawon.

en: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
ff: Aynol wancuru ummatore wangi haa berniji ɗuɗɗum, e bana yimɓe milionji 760 (ɓuri limgal ummatore fu) bana wondi haa saare. haa ɓaawo nyau man nasti haa yaɓɓorde je duniyaru fu haa Maars, yimɓe ngomna Cayna hoosi dabareji nyaɗum ngam haɗɗugo viriis "nasta" diga lesɗe feere.

en: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
ff: Bana sappinol, Beijing hasdi do wondugo haa sera haa nder balɗe 14 haa kala mo je waɗi jaahangal haa lesdi feere e je yiɗi nastugo berniwol. haa 23 Maars, mainland Cayna sna nyauɗo gooto sallini nyau ndu nder lesdi hiddeko ɓalɗe joowey, gal goɗɗo feere je warti Guangzhou diga Istanbul.

en: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
ff: haa 24 Maars 2020, Arduɗo Cayna Li Keqiang matini yo'o yajjol nyauji je salli haa nder berniwol dari e nyau man timmi no haa Cayna.

en: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
ff: Waɗugo jaahangal haa nder nyalade ndu hooyay, sna haa Wuhan, leebi ɗiɗi haa ɓaawo umrore do joɗɗugo haa saare wangi. Ardudo Cayna ngam Ko laarani Hala Lesi Feere mati haa 26 Maars 2020 yo'o jarfuye ngam visa malla ɗerewol jonde haa lesdi darnotto, diga 28 Maars haa tokkita, e o hokkay matinolji feere do ndey timmotto.

en: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
ff: Yimɓe je ɗon yardi nastugo Cayna sey emma visa haa cuuɗi ngomna Cayna haa lesɗe feere.

en: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
ff: Ngomna Cayna ɗon yardi filuji be cuuɗi tagle kujeji maɓɓita haa 30 Maars, e hokki ceede umminol haa cuuɗi tagle nde. Feelowo Lesdi matini nyalade nyurminugo e je fuɗɗata be sirure nder minti tati be njamdi 10:00 haa 4 Aviiril, je ɗon hawti bo'o be Qingming Festival, ko to ngomna je cakare emmi haa calaaje ngam sappinugo jurumɗum maɓɓe do hawo e sey ayna dayol ɓanndu ngam aynugo ta nyau COOVID-19 lora.

en: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
ff: COVID-19 laati bana sankitti haa South Korea haa 20 Zaanviye 2020 diga Cayna.

en: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
ff: Geeɓe jam ɓanndu lesdi matini yo'o limgal nyauɓe ɓesdi jur haa 20 Feviriye, ngam yimɓe mofti jur haa Daegu ngam dewal jullurde keese je ɗon andi bana Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

en: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
ff: Jeeyaɓe Shincheonji je ngillata Daegu diga Wuhan laati bana roondoɓe nyau ndu.

en: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
ff: haa 22 Feviriye, haa kunde tokkoɓe 9 336 jullurde, 1 261 malla 13% cakka maɓɓe ɗon no sappina mandolji. South Korea matini raɓɓol je ɓuri sembe haa 23 Feviriye 2020.

en: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
ff: haa 28 Feviriye, ɓuri nyauɓe 2 000 je ɗon andi mari nyau ndu matinama haa Korea, je wa'i haa 3 150 haa 29 Feviriye.

en: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
ff: Baabe jonde soje'en South Korea fu wondi haa sera haa ɓaawo lartol sappini yo'o soje'en tati mari no nyau man.

en: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
ff: Jaahargalji pireewol memmotto fu e nden kadi llati saanjama. South Korea nastini ko ɗon hoccama bana jaahargal je ɓuri maunugo e je ɓuri ba daraja haa nder duniyaru fu ngam lartugo ummatore ngam viriis, e watta ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau haa sera e teffa e sigga ɓe'en je ngidi be maɓɓe haa sera.

en: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
ff: Dabareji lartol laarani matinugo mandoolji nyau be hoore mum haa yimɓe je warti jaahangal diga lesdi feere gal applicasio telefon, lartol viriis be sappinol man je wurtata haa nder balɗe je tokkata, e ɓesdugo dabare lartol ngam heɓɓayimɓe 20 000 lartatto ko weeti fu.

en: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
ff: Jaahargal South Korea laati bana daɗol nder lartugo nyau ko to wattay berniji ɗungum haa sera. Ummatore South Korea ɗon no haa sera haa fuɗɗam ngam jabbuye Jogorɗo lesdi Moon Jae-in do saɗirma ndu.

en: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
ff: Korea'en ɗuɗɗum waɗi jungo maɓɓe do batakkewol ngam emmugol wurtol Moon ngam ɓe tammi yo'o ngomna waway hurgugo nyau, malla feere en ɗon manna jabbuye mako.

en: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
ff: haa 23 Maars, matinama yo'o South Korea ɗon no mari limgal je ɓuri lessugo nder balɗe haa nder asaweji nay.

en: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
ff: haa Maars 29 matinama yo'o fuɗɗan diga 1 Aviiril kalla nastoowo lesdi sey wonda haa sera nder asaweji ɗiɗi.

en: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
ff: Bana kubaruji matini haa 1 Aviiril, South Korea keɓɓi emmolji ngam wallende be lartol viriis haa nder lesɗe feere-feere 121.

en: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
ff: Iran matini aranool nyauɓo SARS-CoV-2 mako je ɗon larti haa 19 Feviriye haa Qom, haa, bana limtol Jagorɗo Jam ɓanndu be jaangirde Jam ɓanndu, yimɓe ɗiɗi maayi haa ɓaawo man nder balɗe ndu.

en: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
ff: Dabareji arandere matinama gal ngomna laarani darnugo konserji be kuɗe fiijirde feere, kuɗe espor, be jullugo Jumɓare, be maɓɓol jam'iare, cuuɗi jaangirdeji maungel, be jaangirdeji.

en: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
ff: Iran wurtini rials trilionji joowey haɓɓugo be viriis ndu.

en: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
ff: Jagorɗo lesdi Hassan Rouhani wi'i haa 26 Feviriye 2020 yo'o wala jaahargalji ngam wattugo wakkereji je ɗon mari nyau haa sera, e sna yimɓe tan foti wonda haa sera.

en: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
ff: Jaahargalji ngam ustugo jaahangal haa kunde berniwolji matinama haa Maars, ko to woodi jaahangalji ɗuɗɗum haa kunde berniji hiddeko New Year Nowruz Persia tokkita.

en: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
ff: Jullurdeji Shia haa Qom ɗo no maɓɓiti haa ngilloɓe haa 16 Maars 2020. Iran laati cakare sankittol viriis haa ɓaawo Cayna haa Feviriye.

en: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
ff: haa cakka ewnanduji ngam suɗɗinugo yajjol nyau ndu haa Iran, ɓuri lesɗe sappo lorti do nyauɓe maɓɓe haa Iran haa 28 Feviriye, gal matinugo yo'o yajjol nyau man foti ɓuri nyauɓe 388 je ngomna Iran matini haa jonta.

en: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
ff: Suddu fadooɓe Iran ɗon maɓɓi, be jeyaaɓe 23 do 290 matinama bana larti ɗon mari viriis haa 3 Maars.

en: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
ff: haa 12 Maars, Human Right Watch ewni yimɓe ngomna je suklata do dangay haa Iran haa ɓe wurtina ɓe'en je fadata neɗɗo je ɗon maɓɓi meere e bo'o wurtina yimɓe dangay fu je aybe maɓɓe wala ɗuɗɗum.

en: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
ff: Matinama yo'o sa'a sankittol viriis ɓuri nyaɗugo haa wakkereji je ɗon maɓɓi bana cuuɗi dangay, je maray dabareji jam ɓanndu je ɗon kanduɗum.

en: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
ff: haa 15 Maars, ngomna Iran matini mayɓe 100 haa nder balɗe gooto, je ɓuri fu diga fuɗɗorde nyau ndu.

en: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
ff: Pettum man yimɓe siyasa je jonta malla je aran haa Iran be yimɓe ngomna maynama ngam nyau ndu haa 17 Maars.

en: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
ff: haa Maars 23, Iran ɗon tawa nyauɓe keese 50 haa kala njamdi fu be mayde gooto kala minti sappo ngam koronaviriis.

en: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
ff: Bana ko arduɗo WHO feere wi'i, foti limgal nyauɓe ɓura je ɗon limti ndu nde jowey haa Iran.

en: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
ff: Mbiyotto bo'o eltareji Lesɗe America do Iran ɗo bo'o foti memma siggorde ceede lesdi maɓɓe ngam jabbinugo do wangol viriis go.

en: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
ff: High Commissioner for Human Rights UN emmi ustol eltare do risku haa lesɗe je nyau duniyaru ndu ɗon memma jur.

en: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
ff: Nyau man ɗon aandin yotti haa Itali haa 31 Zaanviye, haa wakkati je ngillooɓe Cayna ɗiɗi lartama bana ɗon mari SARS-CoV-2 haa Roma.

en: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
ff: Nyauɓe fuɗɗi wa'ugo lau, ko waɗi ngomna Italy darna jaahangal be pireewol fu haa malla diga Cayna e matini dabare jaawal.

en: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
ff: Sammere nyauɓe COVID-19 je hawtay tawama haa ɓaawo man, fuɗɗam be arandere nyauɓe 16 je ɗon andi mari nyau haa Lombardi haa 21 Feviriye. haa 22 Feviriye, Feelore arduɓe lesdi matini tawreta keese ngam darnugo nyau, be wattugo yimɓe ɓuri 50 000 haa sera haa nder lamordeji feere-feere 11 gal woila Italy.

en: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
ff: Arduɗo ardoɓe lesdi Giuseppe Conte wi'i, haa wakere nyau, nastol e wurtol wonatta.

en: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
ff: Darnol kuɗe be fiijirde espor wutama timmi haa nder wakkereji ndu. "haa 4 Maars, ngomna Italy hasdi do maɓɓugo jaangirdeji fu be jam'iare fu haa nder lesdi haa yakke je Italy jokki mayɓe 100 timmi.

en: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
ff: Kuɗe esporji ɓurna fu, bana balong je kosɗe je Serie A fu, sey salla haa nder wakkere je ɗon maɓɓi haa Aviiril, amma haa 9 Maars, esporji fu darnama fu nder pettum man lewru gooto.

en: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
ff: haa 11 Maars, Arduɗo arduɓe Conte wurtini tawreta do darnugo ɓurna lumo fu sna cuuɗi sippol maungel be cuuɗi sippol lekki. haa 6 Maars, Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) wurtini dabareji feeloji ngam jam ɓanndu do suɓɓol siyasaji je foti huwida ba man.

en: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
ff: haa 19 Maars, Italy ɓuri Cayna be limtol mayde nyauɓe koronaviriis haa nder duniyaru haa ɓaawo matinol mayɓe 3 405 ngam nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
ff: haa 22 Maars, matinama yo'o Russiya neldi pireewolji soje'en joowey e nay je ɗon hewi be lekki haa Italy.

en: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
ff: Diga 5 Aviiril, woodi nyauɓe 128 948 je ɗon andi mari nyau, 15 887 maynama, be 21815 hurgotto haa Italy, e ɓurna nyauɓe fu tawama haa wakkere Lombardi.

en: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
ff: Matinol CNN feere wi'i yo'o hawtirde ummatore Italy je ɗon neewi be wala dabare lartu ɓe'en je ɗon mari viriis man haa jonta foti ɓesda limtol mayde maɓɓe.

en: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
ff: Jabbuye Lesɗe Inglisiya do viriis fuɗɗi wangugo bana gooto haa cakka je ɓuri sankittugo haa kunde lesɗe, e haa 18 Maars 2020, ngoma lesɗe Inglisiya wurtinay dabare bana dayugo be ummatore malla wattugo yimɓe haa sera ngam ummatore maaɗa.

en: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
ff: Nden kadi, ngomna hoccama bana hoosay nyau ndu be hakiika e jabbinay do saɗiraji ummatore. haa 16 Maars, Arduɗo arduɓe Boris Johnson wurtini matinol je feelatta ngam haɗɗol waɗugo jaahangal to woda naffuda masin be ngidugo be ummatore, o feeli bo'o ummatore huwa diga saare to foti waɗa e lutta baabe bana pubs, cuuɗi nyamɗe, be theatres.

en: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
ff: haa 20 Maars, ngomna matini yo'o cuuɗi fiijirde fu bana pubs be cuuɗi espor maɓɓakke laugel, e wi'i yoɓɓan 80% ceede kugal huwooɓe amma ta ɓura £2,500 haa nder lewru ngam tato yimɓe majjina kugal maɓɓe haa wakkati saɗirma ndu. haa 23 Maars, Arduɗo arduɓe matini dabareji dayugo ummatore je ɓuri nyaɗugo, darnugo mofturde yimɓe haa gaɗɗa ɗiɗi e ustugo jaahangalji be kugal haa yaasi haa ko ɗon mari naffuda masin.

en: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
ff: Feere be dabareji sallingo, haɗolji ndu, polis on dullata yimɓe ngam dowtinugo nde gal eltareji be sankitugo mofturdeji.

en: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
ff: Filuji ɓurna fu maɓɓi ngam hasdi bana ni, sna filuji je laati bana "kanduɗum', bana cuuɗi sippol maungel, cuuɗi sippol lekki, cuuɗi siggorde ceede, cuuɗi tagle kujeji, baabe sippol neebam, be baabe mo'itinugo mootaji.

en: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
ff: haa 20 Zaanviye, arandere nyauɗo COVID-19 tawama haa lesdi Pacific Nothwest Washington haa ɓanndu gorko feere je warti Wuhan haa 15 Zaanviye.

en: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
ff: Geeɓe Koono ngam Koronaviriis je White House wurtotto haa 29 Zaanviye.

en: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
ff: haa 31 Zaanviye, ngomna Trump matini jaawal jam ɓanndu, e haɗɗi nastirde yimɓe je ummi lesdi Cayna.

en: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
ff: haa 28 Zaanviye 2020, Geeɓe Aynol Nyau, aranool suudu jam ɓanndu ummatore ngomna Lesɗe America, matini yo'o ɓe wangini kujeji lartol maɓɓe

en: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
ff: Be man fu, Lesɗe America mari no ɗoyyol nder lartol, ko suɗɗini yajjol nyau man be wakkati.

en: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
ff: Lartol heɓɓi larula ngam kujeji lartol huwata no boɗɗum je ngomna lesdi wurtina haa Feviriye, ngam ngomna lesdi jaɓɓay no kujeji lartol je wonay je ngomna (gal jam'iare, cuudi teffol be cuuɗi lekki) haa ragare Feviriye, be dabareji ustol haa yimɓe ngam heɓɓugo lartol haa fuɗɗam Maars (sey mara jarfuye lekkitajo tawon no).

en: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
ff: haa 27 Feviriye, The washington Post matini yo'o yottay lartolji 4 000 sallama haa nder Lesɗe America.

en: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
ff: haa 13 Maars, The Atlantic matini yo'o yottay lartolji 14 000 sallama.

en: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
ff: haa 22 Maars, Associated Press matini: "Yimɓe ɗuɗɗum je mari mandolji be jarfuye lekkitajo ndeni njaamɗe malla balɗe ngam lartol." haa ɓaawo aranool mayde haa Lesɗe America matinama haa Washington haa 29 Feviriye, Ngomna Jay Inslee matini jaawal jam ɓanndu, ko je lesɗe feere tokkiti seeɗa haa ɓaawo man.

en: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
ff: Jaangirdeji haa wakkere Seattle darni jaangirdeji haa 3 Maars, e gal cakare Maars, jaangirdeji haa nder lesdi ɗon no maɓɓa damuɗe maɓɓe. haa 6 Maars, Lesɗe America feelama ngam ko foti salla be koronaviriis je keese haa do lesdi gal geeɓe aandoɓe irin nyau ndu haa Imperial College London.

en: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
ff: haa nder balɗe man Jagorɗo Trump wurtini Umrore Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, je wurtini miliarji 8.3$ haa nder siggorde wallende jaawal ngam cuuɗi lesdi ngam jabbinugo do nyau ndu.

en: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
ff: Cuuɗi kuɗe wurtini ustol jaahangal ngam huwooɓe maɓɓe, darni kawtirolji, e sembintini huwooɓe ngam huwugo diga saare.

en: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
ff: Kuɗe espor be fiijirdeji darnotto. haa 11 Maars, Trump matini ustol jaahangal ngam ɓurna lesɗe Erop, sna Lesɗe Inglisiya, nder balɗe 30, diga 13 Maars.

en: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
ff: haa nyalade je tokkiti, o yajjini ustolji ndu haa Lesɗe Inglisiya be Ireland bo'o.

en: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
ff: haa 13 Maars, o matini jaawal lesdi, je waɗi ɓe wurtini ceede haa siggorde wallende ngam jabbugo do nyau ndu.

en: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
ff: Fuɗɗam haa 15 Maars, cuuɗi filu jur maɓɓi malla usti ndjamɗe haa do Lesɗe America ngam foondol ustugo yajjol viriis.

en: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
ff: Gal 17 Maars, nyau man matinama haa nder lesɗe 50 e haa nder dirstrik Columbia bo'o. haa 23 Maars, matinama yo'o New York City mari nyauɓe 10 700 ngam koronaviriis, ɓuri limtol nyauɓe fu je ɗon hawti haa South Korea.

en: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
ff: haa 5 Maars, ngomna wi'i dayugo ummatore ɗon naffa, nde limggal nyauɓe je ɗon no ɓesda jippi diga balɗe 2.0 haa 4.7.

en: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
ff: Diga 28 Maars, woodi nyauɓe 32 308 je ɗon andi mari nyau haa New York City, be yimɓe 672 maynama ngam virris. haa 26 Maars, Lesɗe America matinama bana ɓuri marugo nyauɓe koronaviriis je ɗon andi do kala lesdi feere haa nder duniyaru, bana Cayna be Italy. Diga 8 Aviril, nyauɓe 400 335 lartama bana mari nyau haa Lesɗe America, be 12 841 maynama.

en: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
ff: Bana kubaruji matini haa 30 Maars, Jagorɗo Lesɗe America Trump hasdi ngam ɓesdugo dabareji dayol ummatore haa 30 Aviiril.

en: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
ff: haa nder ɓalɗe ndu, USNS Comfort, suudu lekki bana kombeewal be leesoji 1000, dari haa New York.

en: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
ff: haa 3 Aviirl, Lesɗe America ɗon no limta mayɓe 884 ngam koronaviriis haa nder ndjamdi 24.

en: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
ff: haa nder lesdi New York limgal nyauɓe ɓuri 100 000 haa 3 Aviiril. White House tawama bana ɗon lasbina nyau ndu e ɗon ayna ngewteji gal ɗowugo arduɓe jam ɓanndu be aandoɓe ngam fadugo ngewteji ummatore be sappinolji je laarani viriis be ɗowirɗe ɗiɗaɓool Arduɗo Mike Pence.

en: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
ff: Dabareji Trump fu ngam aynol nyau ndu laati bana yimɓe ɗon hocca ɗum feere-feere.

en: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
ff: Arduɓe be ngewtoɓe Lesɗe America feere lasbini tammunde Lesɗe America do kujeji je maray daraja haa yaasi, bana lekki arandere , haa Cayna.

en: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
ff: Lartol feere do foofugo hendu hoocama ngam didugo e larugo noy yajjol ngu e wurtama haa nder Journal of Travel Medicine haa cakare lewru Zaanviye 2020.

en: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
ff: Do matinolji 2018 haa Internation Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, beTaipei ɗon no mari yimɓe je waɗatta jaahangal diga Wuhan ɗuɗɗum.

en: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
ff: Dubai, Sydney, be Melbourne matinama bo'o bana wakkere je yimɓe ummi Wuhan ɗon njaha no bo'o.

en: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
ff: Bali matinama bana je lessi aandugo bana wakkere jaahangal haa kunde berniji 20 je ɓuri waɗɗugo jaahangal ko laarani taskaram, haa wakkati feere bo'o berniji haa Australia ɓuri taskugo. Australia wurtini Jaahargal Jabbuye do Koronaviriis Keese (COVID-19) haa 7 Feviriye.

en: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
ff: Holli ɗuɗɗum tawakka tawon do COVID-19, e bo'o Australia sey ɓesda aynol keerol be ngewte haa nder jabbuye mako do nyau.

en: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
ff: haa 21 Maars, jaawal do jaam ɓanndu matinama haa Australia.

en: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
ff: Ngam wattugo yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal be dabare hortol ummatore haa Wuhan be Hubei, lesɗe ɗuɗɗum ngaɗi jaahargal wurtinugo yimɓe lesdi maɓɓe be geeɓe fadol maɓɓe haa nder wakkere ndu, aranool gal pireewol je lesdi maɓɓe ɗon hasdi ngam man, be wallende ngomna Cayna.

en: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
ff: Canada, Lesɗe America, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, Faransa, Argentina, Jaamani, be Thailand woni haa cakka arandere ɓe'en je waɗi jaahargal wurtinugoo ummatore maɓɓe.

en: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
ff: Pakistan wi'i yo'o o wurtinatta ummatore maɓɓe sam haa Cayna.

en: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
ff: haa 7 Feviriye, Brazil wurtini Braziliya'en malla yeeyaɓe saare 34 haa ɓesdugo Poleji nay, goɗɗo Cayna gooto, be jeeyaɗo Cayna gooto.

en: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
ff: Jeeyaɓe Poland, Cayna, be India jippi haa Polan, haa ton pireewol Brazil jooɗi hiddeko tokkugo lawol maaɗa haa Brazil.

en: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
ff: Ummatore Brazil je yahi haa Wuhan jo'inama haa sera haa wakkere jonde soje'en gal Brasilia.

en: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
ff: haa nder balɗe ndu, yimɓe Kanada 215 (176 haa nder aranool pireewol, be 39 haa nder ɗiɗaɓool pireewol je ngomna Lesɗe America taskitti) wurti Wuhan haa CFB Trenton heɓɓa ɓe jo'ina ɓe haa sera nder asawaji ɗiɗi.

en: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
ff: haa 11 Feviriye, woodi pireewol feere je roondi ummatore Kanada 185 diga Wuhan jippi haa CFB Trenton.

en: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
ff: Ngomna Australia wurtini ummatore mako 277 haa 3 be 4 Feviriye haa Wekkere JJo'inol Christmas Island, je lartini ɗum bana wakkere wondugo sera, e ɓe woni ton nder balɗe 14.

en: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
ff: Pireewol hortol New Zealand yotti haa Auckland haa 5 Feviriye; salloɓe (be ɓe'en feere je wurti Australia be Pacific) ngel jo'inama haa sera haa wakkere soje ndiyam Whangaparoa, woila Auckland.

en: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
ff: haa 15 Feviriye, Lesɗe America matini yo'o o wartiran ummatore America be kombeewal Diamond Princess.

en: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
ff: haa 21 Feviriye, pireewol feere je roondata ummatore Kanada 129 je wurti kombeewol Diamond Princess jippi haa Trenton, Ontario.

en: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
ff: haa fuɗɗam Maars, ngomna India fuɗɗu wartiirugo ummatore mako diga Iran. haa 14 Maars pireewol South African Airways feere je Ngomna lesdi South Afirika taski wartiri ummatoore South Afirika 112.

en: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
ff: Lartolj jam ɓanndu waɗɗotto hiddeko hortol, be yimɓe South Afirika nay je ɗon no sappina mandolji koronaviriis jooɗi haa ɓaawo ngam ustugo nyau ndu.

en: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
ff: Sna ummatore South Afirika je lartama bana maray nyau on wartiri lesdi maɓɓe.

en: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
ff: Sappinol lartolji holli ummatore South Afirika fu, be geeɓe pireewol, lanyoowo, geeɓe hotel, polis be soje'en je ɗon no huwida ngam ummatore je, bana dabare hakiika, jooɗi do aynol e ɗon wondi haa sera haa nder wakkati balɗe 14 haa Ranch Resort.

en: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
ff: haa 20 Maars, Lesɗe America fuɗɗi wartirugo geeɓeji soje'en maaɗa diga Iraq ngam nyau ndu.

en: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
ff: haa 5 Feviriye, ɗowirɗe Cayna do hoɗɓe matini yo'o lesɗe 21 (bana Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad be Tobago, Egypt, be Iran) neldi wallende haa Cayna.

en: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
ff: Jaangoɓe Cayna feere haa nder jam'iareji America mofti ngam neldugo wallende haa wakkereji Cayna je viriis memmi, be geeɓe feere haa Wakkere Chicago je maugel je haɓdi ngam nellugo leepolji suddugo yeeso N95 50 000 haa cuuɗi lekki haa lamrorde Hubei haa 30 Zaanviye.
