Geeɓe wallende ummatore Direct Relief, be huwidol be FedEx, neldi leepolji suddugo yeeso 200 000 be kujeji fadol feere, bana kujeji suddugo juɗe be ngapaleewolji, gal pireewol jaawal haa Wuhan Union Hospital haa 30 Zaanviye.

en: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
ff: haa 5 Feviriye, Bill be Melinda Gates matini wallende be milionji 100$ haa WHO ngam teffugo baatal be dabare hurgolji be aynugo "ummatore Afirika be South Asia je foti raɓɓa ndu".

en: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
ff: Interaksyon matini yo'o ngomna Cayna hokki leepolji suddugo yeeso 200 000 Filipia'en haa 6 Feviriye, haa ɓaawo Senator Richard Gordon neldi leepolji suddugo yeeso milionji 3.16 haa Wuhan.

en: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
ff: haa 19 Feviriye, Singapore Red Cross matini yo'o o neldan milionji 2.26$ bana wallende haa Cayna.

en: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
ff: Japan hokki leepolji suudugo yeeso haa Wuhan, Turki sendi ordoji jam ɓanndu, Russiya neldi lekki e kujeji jam ɓanndu ɓuri tonji 13 haa Wuhan, Malaysia matini hokkugo kujeji suddugo juɗe milionji 18 haa Cayna, Jaamani neldi kujeji jam ɓanndu feere-feere be ngapaleewol Hazmat 10 000, e Lesɗe America hokki lekki e kujeji jam ɓanndu tonji 17.8 haa Cayna e waɗi allaama ɓesdugo milionji 100$ bana wallende be ceede haa lesɗe je ɗon memmi. haa ɓaawo nyauɓe haa Cayna bana usti, lesdi ndu fuɗɗi neldugo mballol haa lesɗe feere je nyau ndu ɗon torra.

en: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
ff: haa Maars, Cayna, Kuba be Russiya neldi kujeji jam ɓanndu be lekkitaɓe ngam wallugo Italy nder haɓre be nyau koronavirus ndu.

en: Businessman Jack maa sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
ff: Diskudo Jack maa neldi ordoji lartol milionre 1.1, leepolji sudugo yeeso milionji 6, be ngapaleewol suddugo 60,000 haa Addis Ababa, Etiopia ngam sendinugo gal Kawtirde Lesɗe Afirika.

en: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
ff: haa ɓaawo man o neldi kujeji lartol 5 000, leepolji suddugo yeeso 100 000 be ordo fartugo hendu 5 haa Panama.

en: maa also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
ff: maa bo'o caahi Kanada be kujeji jam ɓanndu. Netherlands, Spain, Turki, Georgiya, be Czech Republic hollini larula maɓɓe do leepolji suddugo yeeso je ngaɗama haa Cayna be kujeji lartol.

en: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
ff: Bana sappinol, Spain wurtini kujeji lartol je ngaɗama haa Cayna 58 000 je ɗon sappina goongakku 30%, haa yakke feere bo'o, Netherlands ewnitti leepolji suddugo giite Cayna 600 000 je ɗon mari ɗaate.

en: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
ff: Belgium ewnitti leepolji suddugo yeeso je footay ɓorna 100 000, ɓaawo ɓe tawi wurti haa Columbia.

en: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
ff: haa yakke feere bo'o, wallende Cayna laati jaɓɓama haa wakkereji Latin America be Afirika feere. haa 2 Aviiril Suddu Siggorde Duniyaru fuɗɗi be kuɗe wallende jaawal haa lesɗe je ɗon tampi.

en: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
ff: WHO feeli dabareji ngomna Cayna nder aynugo e darnugo nyau ndu.

en: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
ff: WHO fammi feeretirol haa kunde nyau SARS 2002-2004, je ɓe hoosi ngomna Cayna bana kamɓe on waɗi be anya e suɗɗini dabareji aynol be darnol, be nyau ndu je ngomna cakare "ɗon hokka matinolji tum ngam tato yimɓe hultora hiddeko juldeji duuɓi Keese Lewru".

en: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
ff: haa 23 Zaanviye, ngam jabbuye haa do hasduye ngomna cakare ngam jo'inugo haɗɗol to dabareji hortol haa Wuhan, fadoowo WHO Gauden Galea fammi yo'o "wonay feelore je WHO on ngaɗi", laati "mandol kanduɗum hasduye ngam darnugo nyau ndu haa do baabal je ɓuri nyaɗugo" e ewni ndu "wala bana man haa nder tariya jam ɓanndu". haa 30 Zaanviye, haa ɓaawo aandinol sallinol diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo haa yaasi Cayna be ɓesdol lomtol nyauɓe haa nder lesɗe feere, WHO matini nyau man bana Larula Jaawal Jam ɓanndu Duniyaru fu (PHEIC), joowey e aranool PHEIC diga dabare nde ewnama haa yakke nyau ndamba gaduru 2009.

en: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
ff: Arɗuɗo Aranool WHO Tedros Adhanom wi'i PHEIC woni ngam "foti sankitta haa nder duniyaru fu, ɓurna fu haa lesɗe je njaudi maɓɓe ɗon seeɗa be deydey je maray dabareji jam ɓanndu je ɗon kanduɗum.

en: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
ff: Ngam jabbuye haa do ustol jaahangalji, Tedros wi'i yo'o "wala uja haa dabareji je ɗon sakla jaahangalji haa lesɗe feere be filu" be yo'o "WHO feelay ustugo filu malla wancuru".

en: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
ff: haa 5 Feviriye, WHO ewni ummatore duniyaru fu ngam dabareji taskugo wallende milionji 675$ ngam lesɗe je maray risku jur, gal ewnugo jaawal wallugo lesɗe je "wala dabareji lartugo yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau, ko to wangi maa".

en: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
ff: Tedros ɓesdi be wi'ugo yo'o "min ɗon mari sembe bana jokke ɓanndu amin je wala sembe" e ewni ummatore duniyaru ngam "nastiina hoore jonta malla yoɓɓita ɓuri haa yeeso". haa 11 Feviriye, WHO haa kawtirol do kubaruji suɓɓi COVID-19 bana inde nyau ndu.

en: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
ff: haa nder balɗe nde, Tedros wi'i yo'o Arduɗo Aranool UN António Guterres jaɓɓi hokkugo "sembe siyasa UN fu haa nder jabbuye".

en: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
ff: Geeɓe Dabare do Nyau UN feere ɗon huwida bana jabbuye, je ɗon fada jabbuye Hawtirde Lesɗe fu, je WHO wi'i hokkan ɓe jarfuye ngam "jabbuye do jam ɓandu haa yakke man bo'o geeɓeji feere foodi waɗa aandal maɓɓe ngam huwidugo ngam ko laarani nyau ndu haa nder ummatore fu, be marde amin fu".

en: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
ff: haa 14 Feviriye, Geeɓe Kuɗe je Hawtama be Cayna ummiki ngam hokkugo aandoɓe lesɗe feere be WHO haa lesdi Cayna ngam mballugo haa nder aynol e lartol "nyaɗol be sallinol nyau" haa do lesdi gal kude be hawtirolji be cuuɗi teffolji je daraja e ɗowa ngilli haa yaasi ngam lartugo "jabbuye kuɗe haa wakkere lamordeji be guureji, be berniji e kawuyeji". haa 25 Feviriye, WHO wi'i yo'o "sey duniyaru waɗa dabareji ngam taskugo do nyau koronaviriis je foti wara," o matini bo'o haa yakke je laati no yaawi tawon ewnugo ndu nyau je duniyaru, lesɗe sey wonda be man fu haa "yaɓɓorde taskaram".

en: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
ff: Ngam jabbuye haa nyau je ɗon doggina haa Iran, WHO neldi Geeɓe Kuɗe je Hawtama haa ton ngam lartugo ko ɗon salla haa ton. haa 28 Feviriye, arduɓe WHO wi'i yo'o lartol nyau koronaviriis haa yaɓɓorde duniyaru fu fuɗɗan diga "ɗow" haa "dow masitin", je laati ragare maunugo lartol yahde nyau ndu.

en: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
ff: Mike Ryan, ɗowuwo jaahargalji jaawal jam ɓanndu WHO, matini haa nder ngewte feere yo'o "Ndu laati bana lartol goongakku haa kala ngomna duniyaru fu: En finda.

en: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
ff: Viriis ndu foti wonda do lawol mako e sey on taska," gal waɗugo dabareji heɓɓugo jabbuye je foti waɗa duniyaru lutta "ko laati kalluɗum nder ton".

en: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
ff: Ryan ɓesdi bo'o be wi'ugo yo'o matinolji jonta ndu hokkay jarfuye haa arduɓe jam ɓanndu matina nyau duniyaru, be wi'ugo ngewte ndu yiɗi wi'ugo "min ɗon jaɓɓa ɓurna yo'o kala neɗɗo haa nder duniyaru ndu footan be viriis ndu".

en: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
ff: haa Maars, WHO matini koronaviriis bana nyau duniyaru.

en: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
ff: Arduɗo Aranool wi'i yo'o WHO laati "larnama be sembe gal yaɓɓordeji nyaɗugo be yajjugo nyau, be yaɓɓordeji sirure". WHO foti be lasbinol kanduɗum do ngam ko ɗon lari bana yahay nder suklugo do nyau duniyaru ndu, be ragare matinol bana jaawal jam ɓanndu ummatore be nastinugo viriis haa nder geeɓe nyau duniyaru.

en: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
ff: Lasbinol bo'o laarani ewnandu haa Arduɗo Aranol WHO Tedros Adhanom jo'ina batakkewol accugo kugal, je yimɓe 733 000 waɗi juɗe do man haa 6 Aviiril.

en: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
ff: haa 26 Maars 2020, aandoɓe jarfuji neɗɗo UN waɗan sappo do sappo ngewtidi ngam dowitinugo jarfuji ko moy fu haa wakkati nyau duniyaru COVID-19 ngu.

en: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
ff: Geeɓe aandoɓewi'i yo'o ko moy fu ɗon laarani ngam waɗugo dabare hissugo neɗɗo, e ngomna ɗon mari doongal ngu.

en: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
ff: Geeɓe ndu wurtini yo'o dabareji je wala malla fadol jamm ɓanndu footay wonda bana dabare lasbinugo ummatore feere.

en: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
ff: Aandoɓe siftoritti bo'o ko moy fu ɗon mari jarfuye haa jam ɓanndu, be yimɓe je mari nyau diga danyinkki, je wondi nder geeɓeji je wonday jur, ndotti'en, yimɓe je saanji baabal jonde maɓɓe haa nder lesdi, yimɓe je maray suudu, yimɓe je ɗon yeeɗa nder laffere je ɓuri sembe, yimɓe je wondi haa suudu fursina, be teffoɓe fadol be geeɓeji feere je mari haaje wallende ngomna.

en: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
ff: Geeɓeji ngomna duniyaru ɗon haɓda ngam nattinugo saɗirmaji be siggorde ceede e ummatore je nyau COVID-19 wadi.

en: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
ff: Geeɓe Kawtal ngam Yahde Siggorde wangini daaldal hokkugo matinolji fu be wakkati do dabareji siyasa haa nder lesɗe duniyaru fu, be nummolji e feeloji fu.

en: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
ff: Diga siyasaji ngam sembintinugo dabareji jam ɓanndu be siggorde duniyaru ngam yiisugo nder saɗirma wondugo haa saare be ustol waɗɗugo jaahangal, cakare kuɗe laarani Lortol Siyasa Lesdi, e yiɗi wallugo lesɗe ekkita oya haa oya e latinugo fadol jabbuye duniyaru ngam nyau korona viriis koyɗum.

en: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
ff: Ngomna Cayna ɗon lasbini gal Lesɗe America, Jagorɗo Cabinet Office Lesɗe Inglisiya Michael Gove, be Jagorɗo Brazil Jair Bolsonaro son Eduardo Bolsonaro ngam aynol do nyau duniyaru ndu, je fuɗɗi haa lamorde Hubei, haa Cayna.

en: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
ff: Arduɓe lamordeji feere je Communist Party of China (CPC) meedotto ngam ɓe waway aynugo do jo'inol yimɓe haa sera haa cakare Cayna, mandol bernde be jabbuye dabare siyasa ngam nyau ndu haa nder wakkereji ngu.

en: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
ff: Ngewtooɓe feere tammi yo'o yahde ndu naffam ngam fadugo windowo aranol Communist Party je Cayna Xi Jinping ngam turtol ummatore do nyau koronaviriis.

en: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
ff: Arɗuɓe Cayna feere, bana Zhao Lijan salli aandinol aranool do wangol koronaviriis je fuɗɗi haa Wuhan, do dabare ngewte tufle do COVID-19 je ummi haa Lesɗe America malla Italy.

en: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
ff: Ngomna Lesɗe America Donald Trump ewni koronaviriis bana "viriis Cayna" malla "viriis Wuhan" e mbiy Cayna "wanngini viriis feere je laati jonta bana nyau duniyaru fu", kanjuum bo'o je lasbinooɓe feere lasbini gal wi'ugo laati nyeebol asngol e "ɗon suɗɗina aybe arduɓe ngomna mako nder darnugo nyau".

en: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
ff: The Daily Beast keɓɓi batakkewol ngomna Lesɗe America je ɗon sappina dabareji ngewte je ummi gal Feelore Jam Lesdi, be dabare man ewnotto "Kujeji fu laarani Cayna.

en: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
ff: En limtinama yo'o sey foonda neldol ngewte ndu haa nder dabare feere, be hawrtirde ngam hubaruji be wondugo haa gite tele."Baabe sippolji bana Politico, Foreign Policy, be Bloomberg holli yo' dabareji Cayna fu ngam neldugo wallende haa lesɗe Cayna laati bana lawol hollittugo ɓanndu maaɗa haa nder duniyaru.

en: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
ff: Jagorɗo Siyasa lesdi feere Josep Borrell matini yo'o woodi "dabare wakkare be siyasa je ɗon suɗɗi haa ɓaawo man bana kaɓɓol ngam mangu gal suɗɗol be "siyasa wallende".

en: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
ff: Borrell wi'i bo'o "Cayna ɗon yarɓa matinol ndu be sembe, naa bana Lesɗe America, laati sobaajo je mari daraja be amana."

en: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
ff: Cayna ewni bo'o Lesɗe America ngam itta eltaji do Syria, Venezuela be Iran, e bo'o o ɗon nelda wallende haa ragare ɗiɗi je ɗon limti ndu.

en: Jack maa's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
ff: Wallende Jack maa be leepol suddugo yeeso 100 000 haa Cuba darnotto ngam eltare Lesɗe Ammerica haa 3 Aviiril.

en: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
ff: Ngomna Lesɗe America ngullama ngam waylittugo wallende je yarɓi haa lesɗe feere haa nder lesdi maɓɓe.

en: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
ff: E woodi haalaji feere je matinama do leepol suddugo yeeso haa kunde lesɗe feere, bana Jaamani, Ostriya, Swiss; be Czech Republic be Italy.

en: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, Turki ngawi ordoji foofugo hendu temere do temere je neldama haa Spain.

en: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
ff: haa fuɗɗam Maars, ngomna Italy lasbini Kawtal Erop ngam wala hakkilo wallende do Italy je koronaviriis ɗon torra.

en: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
ff: Maurizio Massari, fadowo Italy haa EU, wi'i yo'o "Sna Cayna on jabbi gal wakkere ɗiɗi fu.

en: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
ff: Be gonga, ndu latay mandol boɗɗe ngam kawtal Erop."

en: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
ff: haa 22 Maars, haa ɓaawo ngewte haa telefon be Arduɗo Aranool Italy Giuseppe Conte, Jagorɗo Russiya Vladimir Putin hasdi be soje'en Russiya ngam neldugo lekki soje'en, mootaji laɓɓinugo je feerejo, be ordoji lekki feere haa Italy.

en: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
ff: Batakkewol hubaruji Italy je mbiyotto La Stampa matini "ɗaaɗol siyasa je mari daraja" amma wala inde yo'o 80% wallende Russiya laati no bana "naffay malla maray naffuda jur haa Italy".

en: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
ff: Batakkewol ndu ɗon mbi'a yo'o Russiya ɗon nasta nder haɓre "siyasa be joɗɗidol" be lesdi feere.

en: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
ff: Jagorɗo Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, be Arduɗo Geeɓe Lesdi feere Luigi Di Maio sallini batakkeji kubaruji e hollini nyetore maɓɓe.

en: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
ff: Russiya bo'o neldi pireewol addugo kujeji be wallende jam ɓanndu haa ton haa Lesɗe Amerika.

en: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
ff: Matinoowo Kremlin Dmitry Peskov wi'i yo'o "haa wakkati hokkugo wallende haa sobiraaɓe Lesɗe America, [Putin] tammi yo'o to taggooɓe kujeji jam ɓanndu Lesɗe America keɓɓi sembe, ɓe foti lortira ɗum to ɓe mari dabare man."

en: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
ff: Jaahargal jaangirde soje'en NATO "Defender 2020" haa Jaamani, Poland be lesɗe Baltic, jaangirde koono je ɓuri maunugo NATO diga timminol Koono Peewɗum, ustan seeɗa.

en: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
ff: Arduɗo Aranol Ewnaandu ngam Jippinugo Baandi Kate Hudson lasbini kugal Defender 2020: "haa yakke nyau ummatore fu je jonta ndu, foti memma soje'en je ummi diga Lesɗe America be lesɗe Erop feere je ɗon huwida e bo'o be ummatore lesɗe je jaangirde ndu ɗon salla haa ton. "Ngomna Iran raɓɓotto suusey be viriis, be jeeyaɓe kawtal fadooɓe ummatore ɓuri caappan ɗiɗi je ɗon mari nyau ndu be yimɓe siyasa jonta malla aran sappo e joowey.

en: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.
ff: Jagorɗo lesdi Iran Hassan Rouhani windi batakkewol maɓɓitama haa arduɓe duniyaru naa nder ton o ɗon emma wallende haa 14 Maars 2020, gal wi'ugo yo'o lesdi mako ɗon haɓda ngam haɓɓugo be nyau ndu ngam footay o nasta haa do lumoji duniyaru feere ngam eltare je Lesɗe America jo'ini do Iran. Nyau ndu ummini ewnaanduji haa Lesɗe Amerika ngam hoosugo siyasaji gooto je sallata haa nder lesɗe diskuɓe feere, be suklare jam ɓanndu duniyaru, suklare do ɓikkon, siwtare saare je ɗon yoɓɓi, be wallende ngam jam ɓanndu be ceede e dabareji jur.

en: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.
ff: Lartooɓe siyasa aarti be wi'ugo yo'o foti lasbina sa'a suɓɓittol Donald Trump haa suɓɓol Arduɗo 2020. Jonde lesdi haa kunde Japan be South Korea sakkiti ngam nyau ndu.

en: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.
ff: South Korea lasbini "dabareji wattugo sera je ɗon jiɓɓi e je laɓɓay" haa ɓaawo Japan matini ko moy fu je ummi diga South Korea sey wonda haa sera nder asawere ɗiɗi haa wakkere je ngomna taski ngam man.

en: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
ff: Ummatore South Korea ɗon no sendi tawon do jabbuye Jagorɗo lesdi Moon Jae-In ngam nyau ndu.

en: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
ff: Korea'en waɗɗi juɗe maɓɓe do batakkewol ngam jippinugo Moon do ko ɓe mbiyotto ngomna waway aynugo nyau ndu, malla yettugo jabbuye maaɗa. Nyau duniyaru ndu waɗi lesɗe sallini umrore jaawal bana jabbuye.

en: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
ff: Ngewtooɓe feere tammi yo'o foti hokka jarfuye haa ngomna'en ngam sembintinugo sembe maɓɓe nder lamu.

en: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
ff: haa Hungary, kawtal arduɓe suɓɓi hokkugo jarfuye haa Arduɗo Aranol, Viktor Orbán, ngam sallinugo umrore ndu haa tokkita, darna kawtal arduɓe be suɓɓolji e elta ɓe'en je ɗon aandin sallini matinolji je wonay gonga do viriis be dabare je ngomna waɗɗatta ngam wurtugo nder saɗirma ngu.

en: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
ff: Nyau koronaviriis waɗi sababuji ɗuɗɗum bana ta'irdeji yite, ngam cuuɗi jam ɓanndu ɗon huwa be yite jur ngam suklugo do nyau ndu haa nder duniyaru, hulol soddugo, darnol cuuɗi tagol kujeji be jaahangal.

en: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
ff: Geeɓe Lesɗe America do Yamɗe be Lekki wurtini matinolji ngam hikkilugo do ta'irdeji lekki be ordoji jam ɓanndu ngam emmolji ɗon jur e taggooɓe usti.

en: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
ff: Wakkereji jur bo'o maati hulol soddugo je ngaɗi kujeji timmi haa nder lumoji manungel bana nyamdu, takkarde gaɗɗa suudu, ndiyam kolooba, je ngaɗi dari yottugo lumo fahin.

en: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
ff: Dabare teknik ɓurna ɗon no matina do ɗayyol nder neldol kujeji bana ordoji.

en: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
ff: haa limtol Arduɗo Aranool WHO Tedros Adhanom, emmol ngam kujeji suddugo ɓanndu ɓesdi nder 100.

en: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
ff: Emmol ndu ngaɗi kujeji nyaaɗi nde noggas e waɗi bo'o neldol kujeji bana lekki nder leebi nay haa joowey.

en: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
ff: Ngaɗi bo'o kujeji suddugo ɓanndu haa nder duniyaru laati caɗɗum tawugo, be WHO ɗon matina yo'o ndu foti memma huwoɓe ngam jam ɓanndu.

en: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
ff: haa Australia, nyau duniyaru ndu hokki sa'a haa sippooɓe daigou ngam sippinugo kujeji Australia haa Cayna.

en: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
ff: Kugal ngel waɗi kujeji ɓikkon pammaron tawatakke haa nder cuuɗi sippol maungel e bo'o darnama gal ngomna Australia. Ko to limtol nyauɓe COVID-19 haa Woila Italy be wakkere Wuhan, be ewnaanduji ngam kujeji nyamɗe ɗuɗɗum, wakkereji ɗiɗi fu maray larulaaji ngam nyamdu tawon.

en: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
ff: Dabareji gal Cayna be Italy do moftugo kujeji be filu kujeji je tawatakke je yahay be lawol ɗon yaha, ko ɗon ayna do ustolji timminol nyamɗe je aarti haa Erop be Woila America.

en: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
ff: Woila Italy be ndemri maaɗa je ɗon maungel laray ustol suɗɗol maaɗa, amma ceede man ɓesdi haa ngewte fadooɓe.

en: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
ff: Kujeji nyamɗe timmi haa wakkati seeɗa tan, ko haa nder berniwol Wuhan, haa wakkati ndu arduɓe ngomna Cayna wurtini siggorde kuusel gaduji ngam heɓɓa nyamdu he'a haa ummatore.

en: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
ff: Irin umroji ndu ɗon haa Italy je emmatta ɓe'en je ɗon waɗa kujeji nyamdu ngam jaawal.

en: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
ff: Larula haa siggorde duniyaru matinama haa Cayna: haa limtol batakkewol hubaruji feere haa 16 Maars, siggorde Cayna memmotto masin haa nder aranool leebi ɗiɗi je 2020 ngam dabareji je ngomna hoosi haa darna yajjol viriis, e sippol kujeji pamaron jippo be 20.5%.

en: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
ff: Bana lesdi Cayna woni siggorde maungel e cakare tagle kujeji, wangol nyau jiɓɓi kujeji jur haa nder yahde siggorde duniyaru fu.

en: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
ff: Agathe Demarais je Economist Intelligence Unit wi'i lumoji jiɓɓan seeɗa hidekko gite lara be boɗɗum ko foti wanga nder ton.

en: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
ff: haa Zaanviye 2020, lartooɓe feere tammi yo'o ribaji je wurtotto nder nyau ndu do yahde maunugo ɓuran je ko salli be nyau SARS je 2002-2004.

en: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
ff: Aandowo feere wi'i haa Washington University haa St. Louis yo'o ɓuran miliarji 300$ majjan haa nder dabare wurtol nyau ndu e neeɓan haa duuɓi ɗiɗi..

en: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
ff: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) mbiyotto "jiɓɓi" haa ɓaawo ceede neebam do'i bana wala naandu man sam ngam Cayna darni soddugo.

en: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
ff: Lumoji duniyaru fu do'i haa 24 Feviriye ngam limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 haa yaasi Cayna ɓesdi jur.

en: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
ff: haa 27 Feviriye, ngam nummolji je ɗon ɓesda ngam nyau koronaviriis, limgalji lumoji Lesɗe America feere be NASDAQ-100, S&P 500 Index, be Dow Jones Industrial Average yarɓi do'are maɓɓe je ɓuri diga 2007-08.

en: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
ff: Limngalji tati fu timmini asawere be ɓuri 10%

en: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
ff: haa 28 Feviriye, Scope Ratings GmbH holli limgal Cayna, amma acci bana Sappinol je Yahay.

en: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
ff: Lumoji jippi fahin ngam hulolji koronaviriis, do'are maungel je wondi haa 16 Maars.

en: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
ff: Yimɓe jur tammi yo'o foti jippol wona.

en: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
ff: Siggoowo Mohamed El-Erian yetti dabareji jaawal cuuɗi siggorde cakare be lesɗe je yotti be wakkati

en: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
ff: Cuuɗi siggorde cakare ɗon jabbina law do ko ɓe waɗi haa do'are ceede 2008.

en: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
ff: Ngilli laati wakkere kugal je ɗon memmi masin ngam darnol jaahangal, maɓɓol baabe ummatore be jaahangal ngilugo, be feelore ngomna'en tato goɗɗo waɗa jaahangal haa nder duniyaru.

en: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
ff: Bana ko tokki bo'o, jaahangal be pireewolji ɗuɗɗum darnakke ngam yimɓe ngaɗata jaahangalji, bana British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, be Qantas, haa wakkati man bo'o British regional airline Flybe do'i.

en: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
ff: Jaahangla be kombeewol bo'o andi do'are je meeɗay sallugo sam.

en: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
ff: Baabe hoosugo jirki be ferry maɓɓi dammuɗe maɓɓe.

en: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
ff: Nyau ndu hawti be Chunyun, wakkati jaahangal maungel be siwtare duuɓi Keese haa Cayna.

en: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
ff: Kujeji ɗuɗɗum be mofturde ummatore jur darnotto gal ngomna lesɗe be wakkerji, be juldeji hittande duuɓi Keese, be kawtirde je ɗon maɓɓa cuuɗi be kujeji ngilli hoore maɓɓe bana Hong Kong Disneyland be Shanghai Disneyland.

en: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
ff: Kujeji duuɓi Keese Lewru be kujeji ngilli maɓɓakke ngam tato ummatore mofta, be Forbidden City haa Beijin be baabe sappinol cuuɗi deewal wuro.

en: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
ff: haa nder lamordeji Cayna 24 do 31, berniji be wakkereji, arduɓe yarɓi siwtare duuɓi Keese haa 10 Feviriye, e emmi haa baabe jur ta ɓe maɓɓita to wakkati man yottay.

en: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
ff: Wakkereji ndu ɗon fadi no 80% GDP lesdi e 90% kuje wurtinugo lesdi.

en: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
ff: Hong Kong ɓesdini jabbuye mako do nyau je raɓɓungel haa je maungel e matini jaawal, maɓɓi jaangirdeji haa Maars, darni juldeji duuɓi Keese. Wakkereji sippol pamaron memmotto haa nder duniyaru fu, be ustolji wakkati haa nder cuuɗi sippol malla maɓɓol man fu.

en: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
ff: Ngilugo sippooɓe pamaron haa Erop be Latin Americajippi be 40%.

en: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
ff: Sippoɓe pamaron Woila America be cakare Funaange jippi be 50-6%

en: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
ff: Ndu waɗi bo'o wancuru be kosɗe haa nder cuuɗi sippol jippi be 33-43% haa Maars to foondi be Feviriye.

en: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
ff: Arduɓe cuuɗi sippol haa nder duniyaru ɓesdi dabareji feere, bana ɓesdol do aynol jam ɓanndu, jo'inol kuje hoosugo wullam ɓanndu ngam larugo wullol ɓanndu soddooɓe, be darnolji kujeji. United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America tammi yo'o, nyau ndu je waɗi kujeji usti ndu foti acca yimɓe haa kunde milioji 14 be 22 haa nder laffere haa Latin America do haa wakkati je wala no nyau duniyaru ndu sam.

en: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
ff: haa Zaanviye be Feviriye 2020, haa yakke nyau haa Wuhan wa'i masitin, yimɓe waɗan milionji 5 haa Cayna majjini kugal maɓɓe.

en: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
ff: Huwooɓe Cayna haa kawye je ummi lesdi feere waɗan milionji 300 je ɗon ruffi haa saare tan haa nder lamordeji malla ɗon woni haa nder lamorde Hubei. haa Maars 2020, ɓuri Amerika'en milionji 5 haa Cayna majjini kugal maɓɓe e ɗon no emma wallende ngomna.

en: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
ff: Nyau koronaviriis foti hoosita kugal milionji 47 haa Lesɗ America e wondugo wala kugal foti yotta 32%, bana Federal Reserve Bank St Louis tammi. Wondugo haa saare haa India itti kugal haa huwooɓe je wari lesdi feere haa India milioji sappo do sappo (je ɓe ɗon yoɓɓotto no ko weeti fu). Emmol haa Angus Reid Institute tawi yo'o 44% calaaje Kanadiya'en matti irin wondugo bila kugal. Ɓadi huwooɓe 900000 majjini kugal maɓɓe haa Spain diga ɓe emmotto wonda haa saare haa cakare Maars 2020.

en: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
ff: haa nder diɗaɓre ta'irde Maars, huwooɓe Faraansare milionji 4 emmi wallende hideko ngam ɓe wala no kugal tawon e huwooɓe Inglisiya milionre emmi dabare nyamande fu. Ɓadi reeta milionre cuuɗi tagle haa Jaamani neldi huwooɓe maɓɓe do baalal jaahargal ngomna nder wakkati seeɗa je ɗon aandin bana Kurzarbeit.

en: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
ff: Wallende nder kugal haa nder wakkati seeɗa Jaamani hoccama bo'o gal Faraansa be lesɗe Inglisiya.

en: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
ff: Wakkereji bana didugo kujeji be juɗe malla tariya wuro memmotto be boɗɗum be nyau ndu, ko ɗon memma bo'o jaahargalji kuɗe be yimɓe fu, ɗiɗi fu huwooɓe je ɓe hoosi be je halal maɓɓe, haa nder duniyaru.

en: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
ff: Wakkereji bana didugo kujeji be juɗe malla tariya wuro foondi ummitinugo kuɗe maɓɓe (je ɓurna ngomna on hokkata ceede) ngam maɓɓitnugo suudu tariya wuro haa ummatore, jogga jam huwooɓe maɓɓe be je ummatore, e walla didooɓe to foti waɗa.

en: By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.
ff: haa Maars 2020, haa nder duniyare e be yahde feere-feere, cuuɗi tariya, cuuɗi jaangirde, wakkere sappinol fiijirde, cuuɗi ummatore feere maɓɓi dammuɗe maɓɓe be sappinolji, kuɗe be kugal maɓɓe fu darnama malla yarɓotto.

en: In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.
ff: haa jabbuye dabareji jur ngaɗama ngam keɓɓugo labbi feere gal daaldal ordoji. Wangol feere je nyau ndu wadi law bo'o laati darnol kuɗe deewal, kujeji espor, be kujeji ummatore feere, bana juldeji gimmol be wommugo, kawtirdeji teknik, be sappinol samman.

en: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
ff: Suudu wurtinugo vidiyo bo'o andi darnol. Vatikan matini yo'o heɗɗitugo Asawere Seeninde haa Roma, je ɗon salla haa ragare asawere summay ummatore Allah, darnotto fu.

en: Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.
ff: Cuuɗi ɗuɗɗum feeli ummatore Allah je ɗon mari duuɓi wonda haa saare do yahugo haa suudu haykaaliru be Alat; jullurdeji feere ngaɗi deewal gal radiyo, do hawo malla gal tele haa wakkati feere bo'o yimɓe feere ɗon ngaɗa ndu nder moota.

en: With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.
ff: Suudu Haykaaliru Katolik Roma'en je Roma maɓɓi jullurdeji maaɗa be cuuɗi deewal e Baabal St. Peter wala ngilloɓe maasianko'en, yimɓe dina'en feere bo'o darni deewalji e usti kawtirde ummatore haa nder jullurdeji maasianko'en, jullurdeji yimɓe Mohammed, cuuɗi deewal be gurdwaras.

en: Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.
ff: Ɗowirɗe Geeɓe Iran matini yo'o darnol tornde Jumɓaare haa nder wakkereji je ɗon memmi be nyau ndu e haa ɓaawo man ɓe maɓɓi baabe deewal, haa wakkati man Saudi Arabiya darni nastirde ngilloɓe je ummi lesdi feere be je lesdi ndu haa wekkereji seeninde Makka be Medina.

en: The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
ff: Nyau duniyaru darni kujeji ɗuɗɗum haa nder wakkere jaahargal espor haa nder duniyaru diga Koono Maungel Ɗiɗaɓool.

en: Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.
ff: Ɓurna kujeji espor darnotto malla yarɓotto, bana 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, wakkati NBA 2019–20, be wakkati NHL 2019–20 NHL.

en: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.
ff: Nyau darni jaahargalji Summer Olympics 2020, je hasdi no tawon ngam fuɗɗan haa ragare Zwiiye; International Olympic Committee matini haa 24 Maars yo'o kuɗe man "jaahargal ngal ngaɗotto ndu haa gaɗɗa 2020 amma yottata haa cakare 2021". Casinoji be wakkereji fiijirdeji feere haa nder duniyaru maɓɓakke be caacaa poker yarɓotto malla darnottoo.

en: This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.
ff: Ndu waɗi fiijooɓe caacaa eggi do hawo, daadalji fiijirde do hawo jur matini ɓesdare kanduɗum nder limtoji yimɓe je wari. Wakkere fiijirde gal gimmol memmotto, be geeɓeji gimmol je darni malla haɗɗi kuɗe maɓɓe.

en: Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
ff: Theatreji jur bana ɓe'en je ɗon haa Broadway darni kujeji maɓɓe fu.

en: Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.
ff: Fiijooɓe feere teffi dabareji feere ngam tokkitugo be waɗugo e sendugo kugal maɓɓe do internati bana lawol feere do fiijugo haa yeeso yimɓe, bana yimmugo haa gite ummatore malla wurtinugo "juldeji" do internati, senda, e sappina kugal maɓɓe.

en: Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
ff: haa do hawo, memeji internati je ɗon laarani koronaviriis ɗuɗɗum yajji e feere en bo'o latini ɗum bana gussa be fiijirde haa cakka saɗirma.

en: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.
ff: Diga nyau COVID-19 fuɗɗi, nyeebol, gaanyol, be suɓɓol asli ɗon wagaare haa kunde yimɓe Cayna be jippooɓe asngol Funaange Asia, e do yimɓe je wurti haa wakkere je nyau man ɗon nyaɗi haa Erop, Lesɗe America be lesɗe feere.

en: Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
ff: haa nder lesɗe ɗuɗɗum bo'o en ɗon maanda hullol, hakkilol, be gaanyol ɓurna fu haa Erop, Funaange Asia, Woila America, be wakkere Asia-Pacific.

en: Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.
ff: Batakkewolji hubaru Feviriye (haa wakkati je ɓurna nyauɓe wonditti haa sera haa Cayna) maandi ngewte sakkinolji haa nder geeɓeji feere-feere do ummatore Cayna bana ndika viriis ndu yotti ɓe malla jaɓɓugo ndu bana eltare Allah.

en: Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
ff: Lesɗe feere haa Afirika bo'o sappini hakkilo larugo ummatore Cayna be gite je woɗɗay.

en: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
ff: Yimɓe Wuhan be Hubei jur matini suɓɓol je yimɓe ngaɗata no ngam asngol maɓɓe.

en: There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
ff: Ummatore Cayna keɓɓi fadol, ɗiɗi fu do hawo je be hunduko fu, be wakkereji je viriis ndu ɗon no nyaɗi.

en: Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.
ff: Ngam yahde nyau haa lesɗe je laati bana ɓundu nyau ndu, yimɓe diga Italy, aranool lesdi haa Erop je matini nyau COVID-19, foti bo'o lata bana nyebotto malla gaanyotto. Ummatore lesɗe bana Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, be South Korea fuɗɗi no be waɗɗugo juɗe do batakkeji je yiɗi no darnugo nastirde ummatore Cayna haa do lesdi maɓɓe ngam dabare darnugo nyau ndu.

en: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
ff: haa Japan, hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan doggi do Twitter.

en: Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
ff: Ummatore Cayna be Asiya'en feere haa nder lesɗe Inglisiya be Lesɗe America matini ɓesdugo huddi ngam asngol, be saɗirmaji feere.

en: U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.
ff: Jagorɗo Lesɗe America Donald Trump lasbinakke ngam o ewni no koronaviriis "viriis Cayna", wolde je laati bana huddi e gaanyo haa gite yimɓe je larti ndu.

en: Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
ff: Ummatore je ɗon turti haa Ukraine darni mootaji je hooratta Ukrainiya'en be yimɓe lesdi feere diga Wuhan haa Novy Sanzhary.

en: Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
ff: Jaangoɓe je warti Northeast India, je ɗon mari keerol gooto ba Cayna, e je ɗon jaanga haa ɓurna berniji India matinama bana yari bone ngam nyau koronaviriis.

en: The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
ff: Jagorɗo geeɓe Bharatiya Janata Party's State haa West Bengal Dilip Ghosh wi'i yo'o Cayna woni duniyaru e "ngam kanjuum Allah ɗon elta ɓe ngam man".

en: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".
ff: Mandolji ndu lasbinotto gal fadoowo ummatore Cayna haa Kolkata haa ɓaawo man, e ewni ɗum "aybe". haa Cayna, gaanyol be suɓɓol asngol ngam ummatore je wonday yimɓe Cayna ɓesdi be nyau duniyaru ndu, be hoɗɓe ewnama bana "kujeji sakkinugo cuɗɗi" je sey "sakkina".

en: Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
ff: Batakkeji hubaru jur be pawallji itti ɓe ngam matinolji feere'en malla fu do koronaviriis.

en: Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
ff: Teffooɓe batakkeji hubaru ɗuɗɗum wolwi do nyau je ɗon ndu bila suɗɗugo kuje sam.

en: Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
ff: Teffoɓe feere suɓɓi sendugo sappinolji maɓɓe lau do ordo hiddeko wurtinol do ɗereji bana bioRxiv.

en: Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
ff: Nyau je wangi keesum, nyau je ɗon raɓɓa be gilɗi keese, ɓurna keesum nger wangol yahde ngel malla lawo sallinol.

en: Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
ff: Duniyaru fu be nyau - lartol duniyaru fu be sallinol nyau

en: List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
ff: Limtol nyau raɓɓol be nyau duniyaru - Limtol mayɓe ngam nyau je raɓɓatta

en: Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
ff: Daabaji je ɗon suɗɗina be nyau je ɗon salla gal daabaji - Sababuji jam ɓanndu je yahidatta be filu daabaji je ummi lesdi feere.

en: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
ff: Lartol nyau pofɗe koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19) haa nder suudu lartol be viriis je yahidatta be SARS-CoV-2 laarani dabareji je ɗon maanda wondugo viriis be ɓe'en je ɗon maanda fadooɓe baandu je wurti bana jabbuye haa nyau ndu.

en: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus' RNA.
ff: Wondugo viriis haa nder leekuji ɗon aandin gal RT-PCR, je ɗon maanda RNA koronaviriis.

en: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
ff: Lartol ndu laati feerejo e ɗon laarani RNA viriis SARS-CoV-2.

en: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
ff: Naffan ngam aandinugo nyauji keese malla je ɗon huwa.

en: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
ff: Maandol fadooɓe ɓanndu (lartol neebam iyam) foti naffa ɗiɗi fu ngam lartol e aynol ummatore.

en: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
ff: Lartol fadoowo ɓanndu ɗon sappina yimɓe noy ɗon no mari nyau, bana ɓe'en je mandolji mman ɗuɗɗay no ngam sappinugo malla wangay no sam maa.

en: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
ff: Limtol mayde nyau je fakatre be wakkere wonde sembe ɓanndu ummatore foti aandotto gal sappinolji lartol ndu.

en: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
ff: Ngam lartol je wonay jur, haa Maars 2020 wala lesdi je marin no matinolji be amana do limtol viriis haa nder ummatore

en: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
ff: Gal 23 Maars, wala lesdi je larti ɓuri 3% ummatore maaɗa, e woodi saajolji ɗuɗɗum do lartolji noy salli haa nder lesɗe.

en: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
ff: Saanjol ndu ɗon memma limtol mayde nyauɓe je ɗon matini jur, je ɓurna fu yimɓe ɗuɗɗini ɗum be hunduko haa nder lesɗe feere.

en: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.
ff: Huwidugo be lartol jaangirde polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) gal ɓaawo foti salla do leekuji pofɗe je keɓɓama gal dabareji feere-feere, be ndamba kine malla leeku daande.

en: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
ff: Sappinolji ɓurna fu ɗon wurta haa nder njamɗe seeɗa malla nder balɗe 2.

en: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
ff: Lartol RT-PCR je salli do leekuji daande maran amana haa nder arandere asawere nyau ndu tan.

en: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
ff: haa ɓaawo man viriis foti majja haa nder daande haa wakkati man bo'o ɗon nufta haa nder fuffu.

en: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
ff: haa yimɓe je lartama haa nder ɗiɗaɓre asawere, kuje hoosugo leeku feere foti hoccama gal lawol pofɗe gal musinugo be kateeter malla kuje sondugo (ndamba).

en: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).
ff: Gooto haa cakka lartolji PCR je arandere wurtakke haa Charité haa Berlin haa 20 Zaanviye 2020 gal huwidugo be jaangugo polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) gal ɓaawo be wakkati man, e wurtini kujeji 250 000 ngam sendinugo gal Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Duniyaru (WHO).

en: The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.
ff: Lesɗe Inglisiya wangini dabare lartol haa 23 Zaanviye 2020. Suudu tagle South Korea Kogenebiotech wurtini toɓe suudu lekki, kuje lartol SARS-CoV-2 do PCR (PowerChek Coronavirus) haa 28 Zaanviye 2020.

en: It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.
ff: O ɗon teffa gene "E" je kala beta koronaviriis en ɗon mari, e gene RdRp je feerejo haa SARS-CoV-2. haa Cayna, BGI Group laati gooto haa cakka aranool cuuɗi teffol ngam jaɓɓugo jarfuye kugal jaawal haa China's National Medical Products Administration ngam kuje lartol SARS-CoV-2 do PCR. haa nder Lesɗe America, Ɗowirɗeji Aynol e Lartol Nyau (CDC) ɗon senda daaldal Lartol Koronaviriis Keese 2019 (2019-nCoV) RT-PCR be wakkati man haa cuuɗi teffol ngomna gal International Reagent Resource.

en: One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.
ff: Gooto haa cakka lartolji geneji tati haa nder dabareji kujeji lartolji ɓoyma holli sappinolji je yahay dayɗum ngam reagentji kalluɗum, be saɗirma lartol haa CDC haa Atlanta; ndu hokki limtol leekuji seeɗa yotta 100 nder balɗe lartama be boɗɗe haa nder lewru Feviriye 2020 fu.

en: Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.
ff: Lartolji be kujeji ɗiɗi hollay sappinol je mari amana haa 28 Zaanviye 2020, e sna haa ɓaawo man cuuɗi lartolji ngomna be je lesdi heɓɓi jarfuye fuɗɗogo be lartol.

en: The test was approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization.US commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.
ff: Lartol ndu jaɓɓama haa Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization. Cuuɗi teffolji ngam filu fuɗɗi lartol haa fuɗɗorde Maars 2020.

en: As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
ff: Diga 5 Maars 2020 LabCorp matini haa yeeso lesdi fu wondugo lartol COVID-19 do RT-PCR.

en: Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
ff: Quest Diagnostics bo'o matini haa lesdi fu yo'o lartol COVID-19 wondi diga 9 Maars 2020.

en: No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
ff: Wala keleewolji limgal man matinama; mofturde leeku e lartol sallan bana emmolji CDC.

en: In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
ff: haa Russiya, lartol COVID-19 wangi e wuɗɗama gal State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.

en: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.
ff: haa 11 Feviriye 2020 lartol ndu jaɓɓama gal Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare. haa 12 Maars 2020, Mayo Clinic matinama bana wurtini lartol maandugo nyau COVID-19. haa 13 Maars 2020, Roche Diagnostics Jaɓɓi jarfuye FDA ngam lartol feere je foti salla haa nder njamɗe 3.5 be wagaare, ndu ɗon hokka jarfuye haa waɗa lartolji 4 128 haa nder wakkati njamɗe 24.

en: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.
ff: haa 19 Maars 2020, FDA wurtini jarfuye kugal jaawal (EUA) haa Abbott Laboratories ngam lartol do dabare Abbott m2000; FDA wurtini no irin jarfuye haa Hologic, LabCorp, be Thermo Fisher Scientific.

en: On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
ff: haa 21 Maars 2020, Cepheid jaɓɓi EUA haa FDA ngam lartol je ɗon hoosa deydey minti 45.

en: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
ff: FDA jaɓɓi lartol feere je huwata be dabare isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology haa wakkere PCR.

en: Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
ff: Ngam emmata saanjolji yahde gulɗum be peewol dabare ndu foti hooka sappinolji boɗɗe haa nder minti joowey be sappinolji halluɗum haa nder minti 13.

en: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.
ff: woodi haande irin ordoji ndu 18 000 haa nder Lesɗe America e Abbott yiɗi yaawinugo wurtinugo ndu heɓɓa waɗa lartolji 50 000 haa nder balɗe. Lartol je ɗon huwa be fadoowo ɓanndu be kosngal gooto je ɓurna hawtirata nucleocapsid protein (N protein) koronaviriis keese ɗon huwidotto haa Taiwan, be tammunde je foti wurtina sappinolji haa nder minti 15 haa 20 bana lartol ndamba tan.

en: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."
ff: Lartol bindol feere haa Maars hollini yo'o "radioji ɓernde laati bana limtol lartol pamaron haa fuɗɗorde yahdeji, amma sappinolji CT [ta'irde foto be ordo] foti wonda bo'o hiddeko fuɗɗam mandol.

en: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
ff: Mandolji feerejo CT laarani bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities be ta'irdeji haa hunduko, haa ɓaawo be yeeso.

en: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
ff: Fahin bo'o ɓurna yajjugo haa less fuffu, huudure be sembintinol ɗon hawta to nyau man ɗon ɓesda.

en: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
ff: Ekkitol feere je ɗon foonda PCR be CT haa Wuhan haa baabal fuɗɗorde nyau duniyaru ndu sappini yo'o CT ɓuri ɗiggugo do PCR, ko to lessi be amana, be maandolji fotoji majuum ɗon saanja be pneumoniaju feere be laahalji nyau.

en: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.
ff: haa Maars 2020, American College of Radiology feeli yo'o "CT footay huwida be mum ngam lartol malla bana dabare arandere ngam lartugo COVID-19". haa Maars 2020, CDC feeli PCR ngam lartol arandere.

en: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
ff: Bana ta'irde jabbuye fadol ɓanndu do nyau laati wurtinol fadooɓe ɓanndu bana IgM be IgG.

en: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).
ff: Ndu foti naffa ngam maandugo nyau haa yimɓe diga fuɗɗam balɗe 7 malla bana ni haa ɓaawo fuɗɗam mandolji, ngam sappinugo sembe ɓanndu, e haa nder aynol ummatore. Lartolji foti salla haa nder cuuɗi lartolji cakare (CLT) malla gal lartol haa wakkere jam ɓanndu (PoCT).

en: The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
ff: Dabareji lartolji wagaare haa nder cuuɗi lartol ɗuɗɗum foti sallina lortolji ndu amma wondugo maɓɓe joɗɗan do limtol wurtol kala dabare.

en: For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
ff: Ko laarani CLT leeku iyam je laaral ɓanndu ɓurna hoccama, ko to leekuji je tokkitatta foti hoccama ngam tokkugo jabbuye fadol ɓanndu.

en: For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
ff: Ko laarani PoCT leeku tooɓe iyam gooto hoccama ɓurna fu gal tuffugo be baatal.

en: Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.
ff: Wonay bana dabareji PCR, yaɓɓorde wurtinol naffata hiddeko lartol. haa 26 Maars, 2020, FDA limti kujeji 29 je hokkata matinolji haa suudu bana emmotto e e foti jonta senda lartolji fadoowo ɓanndu maɓɓe.

en: As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.
ff: haa 7 Aviiril 2020, sna lartol gooto je FDA jaɓɓi ngam jarfuye kugal jaawal. haa ragare Maars 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics be Epitope Diagnostics he

en: The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.
ff: Limgal lartol waɗan leekuji temere do temere haa nder njamɗe e nden bo'o ɓuri yaawuyo do lartol RNA viriis PCR je ɗon aandin.

en: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
ff: Fadooɓe ɓanndu maandotto ɓurna fu haa ɓaawo balɗe 14 diga fuɗɗam nyau. haa fuɗɗorde Aviiril, Lesɗe Inglisiya taway ko gooto haa cakka kujeji lartol fadoowo ɓanndu je o soddi e kanduɗum huwugo be man.

en: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
ff: Hong Kong wurtini jaahargal feere je nyau je tammi mara nyau man wonda haa saare, "geeɓe jaawal hokkan kolooba leeku haa nyauɗo", ɓe waɗa tuɗe haa ton, lornita ɗum e heɓɓa sappinol ndu haa ɓaawo man. NHS Inglisiya matini yo'o o ɗon ɗowa jahargal lartol yimɓe je tammi mari nyau ndu haa saare, je ɗon itta larula je foti nyauɗo raɓɓa yimɓe feere to ɓe wari haa suudu lekki, malla laɓɓinugo moota hoorugo nyauɓe tum. haa nder lartol nder moota ngam nyimɓe COVID-19 je foti mara nyau, suklowo jam ɓanndu ɗon hoosa leeku be hakkikaji.

en: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
ff: Wakkereji lartol nder moota walli South Korea waɗa lartolji je ɓuri yaawugo, e yaajugo haa kala lesdi. haa Jaamani, National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians wi'i haa 2 Maars yo'o, foti wurtina lartolji 12 000 ko weeti fu haa nder wakkereji je foti hoora be moota be 10 700 lartama haa nder arandere asawere.

en: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
ff: Fadowo jam ɓanndu on yoɓɓatta lartol ndu to lekkitowo on jarfi ɗum.

en: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
ff: Bana limtol jagorɗo Robert Koch Institute, Jaamani foti mara dabare lartugo yimɓe 160 000 haa nder asawere.

en: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
ff: haa 19 Maars, lartolji nder moota salli haa nder berniji ɗuɗɗum.

en: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
ff: haa 26 Maars 2020limgal lartolji fu je salli haa Jaamani aandakke, ngam sappinolji je mari nyau tan on matinama.

en: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
ff: Aranool emmol suudu laratol sappini yo'o diga asawere 12/2020 kawtal pettum leekuji 483 295 lartama e be asawere 12/2020 be leekuji 33 491 (6.9%) je larti mari nyau SARS-CoV-2). haa israyila, teffoɓe haa Technion and Rambam Hospital wangini e larti dabare lartol leekuji feere haa nyauɓe 64 haa baabbal gootel, gal wattugo lekkuji haa nder ordo gooto e tokkita be larto to hawtirde lekku wurti mari nyau. haa Wuhan suudu maandugo jaawal je hiddeko je meetaji 2000 je ewnotto "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, malla "Gite Yite" be Fulfulde) maɓɓitama haa 5 Feviriye 2020 gal BGI, je foti larta leekuji 10 000 haa nder balɗe.

en: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
ff: Be mahdi je jagorɗo BGGI Wang Jian ɗowi e hoosan balɗe 5, sappinol holli yo'o nyauɓe haa Hubei ɓuran no be 47% e ceede suklugo do wattugo yimɓe haa sera waɗan nde ɗiɗi to limgal lartolji wangay do hawo.

en: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
ff: Wuhan Laboratory je tokkitama gal cuuɗi lartolji Huo-Yan haa Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, be Shanghai, be kawtal berniji 12 haa nder Cayna.

en: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays . These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
ff: haa Maars 2020 limgal lartolji woni 50 000 haa nder balɗe. Dabare je ɗon maɓɓiti, sappinolji feere-feere je lartolji Origami wurtama je foti larta leekuji nyauɓe COVID 1122 be lartolji 93 tan. Sappinolji ndu foti sallina haa nder cuuɗi lartolji pamaron bila sallugo huwooɓe be ndiyam robotic.

en: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
ff: haa Maars, limgal reagent timmi e famɗi ndu laati saɗirma ngam lartol ɗuɗɗum haa nder EU be lesɗe Inglisiya be Lesɗ America.

en: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
ff: Ndu waɗi wanginooɓe feere teffa dabareji taskinugo lekku je laarani wullugo lekkuji haa 98 °C (208 °F) nder minti 5 ngam yoffugo genomeji RNA ngam llartolji feere. haa 31 Maars matinama haa Kawtal Arabiya Emirates yo'o ɓe ɗon no larta ummatore maɓɓe jur ngam koronaviriis be hoore do kala lesdi feere, e woni do lawol yaawinugo lartolji yotta haa ummatore jur.

en: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
ff: Ndu gal hawtugo dabare lartol nder moota, soddugo cuuɗi lartolji je foti hocca yimɓe duɗɗum haa Group 42 be BGI (do cuuɗi lartolji jaawal "Huo Yan" maɓɓe haa Cayna).

en: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
ff: Mahidi haa nder balɗe 14, suudu lartol ndu foti jaɓɓa lartolji RT-PCR ujeneji sappo do sappo haa nder nyalade e laati bana arandere be irin maunugo haa nder yaasi Cayna.

en: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
ff: Dabareji lartolji feere-feere je laarani ta'irdeji gene koronaviriis wangi haa Cayna, Faraansa, Jaamani, Hong Kong, Japan be Lesɗe America.

en: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
ff: Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Duniyaru jaɓɓi dabare Jaamani ngam wurtinugo kujeji je neldama haa nder lesɗe je maray njaudi jur je footay wurtina je maɓɓe.

en: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
ff: Dabare Jaaman wurti haa 17 Zaanviye 2020; dabare je Ɗowirɗeji Aynol Lesɗe America wangay hiddeko 28 Zaanviye, ko ɗayyini lartolji je wondi timmi haa Lesɗe America. Cayna be Lesɗe America mari no larulaaji be amana kujeji lartol ndu haa fuɗɗam nyau, e lesɗe nde be Australia footay no wurtina kujeji lartol deydey je foti jabba do emmolji e feelore lartol aandoɓe jam ɓanndu .
