ff: Bana jabbuye haa maɓɓolji jaangirde ngam COVID-19 , UNESCO feeli dabare jaahargalji jaangirde dayindi e applikasioji be baabe ekkitolji je jaangirdeji be jaanginoɓe foti huwida do ndu ngam memmugo jaangoɓe dayindi e usta darnol ekkitol. Ngam wallugo nder ɗaayinugo sallinol COVID-19, cuuɗi ekkitolji temere do temere maɓɓakke tawon.

en: In the United States, numerous major cities announced public library closures, including Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, and New York City, affecting 221 libraries.
ff: haa nder Lesɗe America, berniji maungel jur matini maɓɓugo cuuɗi ekkitol ummatore, bana Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, be New York City, memmi cuuɗi ekkitol 221.

en: For students without internet at home, this increases the difficulty of keeping up with distance learning.
ff: haa jaangoɓe je maray internati haa saare, ndu ɓesdi saɗirma tokkitugo be ekkitol gal internati.

en: School closures puts a strain on parents and guardians to provide childcare and manage distance learning while children are out of school.
ff: Maɓɓolji jaangirde watti doongal do baabiraɓe be fadooɓe ngam suklugo do ɓikkon e waɗa dabare heɓɓa ɓikkon jokkita ekkitol do hawo bana ɓe wala haa suudu jaangirde fahin.

en: In the absence of alternative options, working parents often leave children alone when schools close and this can lead to risky behaviours, including increased influence of peer pressure and substance abuse.
ff: To wala dabareji feere, baabiraɓe je ɗon huwa ɓurna acca ɓikkon feere maɓɓe haa saare to bana jaangirde maɓɓakke e ndu foti yarna haa gikkuji kalluɗum, bana raɓɓol gikku sobiraaɓe be hoosugo wikkere.

en: Many children worldwide rely on free or discounted meals at schools.
ff: Ɓikkon ɗuɗɗum haa nder duniyaru fu ɗon limma do dabare nyamɓe meere malla je kooyɗum haa jaangirde.

en: When schools close, nutrition is compromised.Nutrition plays a critical role in cognitive development and academic performance for children.In Washington State, around 45% of the states 1.1 million students enrolled in traditional public and charter schools qualify for subsidised school meals.
ff: To jaangirdeji maɓɓi, nyamɗe wonan caɗɗum. Nyamdu laati kanduɗum haa nder yahde ekkitol e aandal ɓikkon. haa Lesdi Washington, deydey 45% milionre 1.1 jaangoɓe lesɗe je ɗon windi haa nder jaangirde ngomna malla feere mari jarfuye heɓɓugo nyamɗe je ɗon buuti haa jaangirde.

en: At least 520,000 students and their families may be affected by food insecurity as a result of school closures.School lunch programmes are the second-biggest anti-hunger initiative in the United States after food stamps.
ff: Pettum man jaangoɓe 520 000 be calaaje maɓɓe foti yara bone ngam heɓɓugo nyamdu ngam maɓɓolji jaangirde. Jaahargalji nyamdu haa jaangirde laati bana ɗiɗaɓool dabare je ɗon haɓɓa ngam weelo haa Lesɗe America haa ɓaawo batakkeji nyamdu.

en: Every year, nearly 30 million children rely on schools to provide free or low-cost meals including breakfast, lunch, snacks, and even dinner.In Alabama, where state-wide school closures as of 18 March have affected over 720,000 students, the state Superintendent announced that staff in schools disproportionately affected by poverty would create meal distribution networks to provide food for students who rely on school lunches.
ff: haa nder hittande fu, ɓadi ɓikkon milionji 30 ɗon ndeni do jaangirde ngam soddugo nyamdu kooɗum bana nyamdu fajiri, naange, je jiba, be je kikiɗe fu. haa Alabama je ɓe maɓɓi jaangirdeji haa nder wakkere ndu diga 18 Maars memmi jaangoɓe 720000, Superintendent lesdi matini yo'o huwooɓe haa jaangirdeji je laffere ɗon memma ɓe sey ngaɗa dabare keɓɓugo baabe hokkugo nyamdu haa jaangoɓe je ɗon no mari tammunde maɓɓe do nyamdu jaangirde.

en: School closures negatively impact student learning outcomes.
ff: Maɓɓol jaangirde ɗon memma sappinolji ekkitol jaangowo.

en: Schooling provides essential learning and when schools close, children and youth are deprived opportunities for growth and development.
ff: Yahugo haa suudu jaangirde ɗon hokka aandal kaanduɗum haa jaangowo e to jaangirde maɓɓi, ɓikkon be sukkaɓe maray sa'aji mawnol be aandal.

en: The disadvantages are disproportionate for under-privileged learners who tend to have fewer educational opportunities beyond school.Student drop-out rates tend to increase as an effect of school closures due to the challenge of ensuring all students return to school once school closures ends.
ff: larulaaji ɗuɗɗuni jaangooɓe je maray sa'a bana feere'en je bana tammi heɓɓugo aandal bana je o heɓɓatta no haa suudu jaangirde. Limtol jaangoɓe je accan jaangirde ɗon ɓesda ngam maɓɓolji jaangirdeji ngam saɗirma emmugo haa jaangoɓe fu lora suudu jaangirde to maɓɓitama fahin.

en: This is especially true of protracted closures.Schools are hubs of social activity and human interaction.
ff: Ndu laati gonga to ɓe juttini maɓɓolji ndu.Jaangirdeji laati bana cakare kuɗe ummatore be wondugo oya be oya.

en: When schools are closed, many children and youth miss out of on social contact that is essential to learning and development.When schools close parents are often asked to facilitate the learning of children at home and can struggle to perform this task.
ff: To jaangirdeji ɗon maɓɓi, ɓikkon be sukkaɓe ɗuɗɗum footay ngida be ummatore, kanjuum je woni no kanduɗum nder ekkitol e aandal. To jaangirdeji maɓɓakke ɓe ɗon emma baabiraɓe emmotto ngam wallugo ɓingel be ekkitol haa saare e foti haɓda ngam waɗɗugo ndu.

en: This is especially true for parents with limited education and resources.
ff: Ndu woni gonga haa baabiraɓe je jaangay jur malla je ɗon laffi.

en: Potential impacts of school closures and reliance on distance learning are not addressed in federal acts of legislation at this time.
ff: Saɗirmaji je maɓɓinolji jaangirde e ekkitolji gal internati ndu limtay haa nder umrore lesdi haa wakkati nde.

en: Formal education — as opposed to informal education or non-formal education — tends to refer to schools, colleges, universities and training institutions.
ff: Jaangirde je aandin, je hawtaw je jaangirde feere malla je aandaka, ɗon laarani suudu jaangirdeji, collegeji, jam'iareji be jaangirdeji ekkitol.

en: A 1974 report by the World Bank defined formal education as the following:Formal education: the hierarchically structured, chronologically graded ‘education system’, running from primary school through the university and including, in addition to general academic studies, a variety of specialised programmes and institutions for full-time technical and professional training.The majority of data collected on the number of students and learners impacted by COVID-19 has been calculated based on the closure of formal education systems.
ff: Batakkewol feere je 1974 gal Siggorde Ceede Duniyaru limti jaangirde je ɗon andi bana: Jaangirde je ɗon andi: dabare jaangirde je ɗon yaha be yaɓɓorde e be wakkati, fuɗɗan diga jaandirde aranool haa jam'iare be, hawti be kanjuum ekkitolji aandal feere-feere, jaahargalji feerejo be jaangirdeji je laarani kujeji makanaki be kugal. Ɓurna matinolji je moftama do limgal jaangoɓe be ekkitoɓe je COVID-19 memmi laarani maɓɓol jaahargalji jaangirde je ɗon andi.

en: The UNESCO Institute for Statistics provides figures on students impacted by COVID-19 corresponding to the number of learners enrolled at pre-primary, primary, lower-secondary, and upper-secondary levels of education [ISCED levels 0 to 3], as well as at tertiary education levels [ISCED levels 5 to 8].
ff: UNESCO Institute for Statistics ɗon hokka limgal jaangoɓe je COVID-19 memmi je laati limgal jaangoɓe je inde maɓɓe ɗon windi haa jaangirde temma je jaarne, aranool, ɗiɗaɓool les, ɗiɗaɓol do [ISCED yaɓɓorde 0 haa 3], be tataɓool [ISCED yaɓɓorde 5 haa 8].

en: Early childhood educational programmes are usually designed for children below the age of 3 and may refer to preschools, nursery schools, kindergartens, and some day care programmes.
ff: Jaahargalji ɓikkon pamaron wondi ngam ɓikkon je maray duuɓi tati e foti ewna ndu hiddeko jaangirde, jaarne, kindergartens be jaahargalji suklare haa balɗe feere.

en: While many primary and secondary schools have closed around the world due to COVID-19, measures impacting early childhood educational programmes have varied.
ff: haa wakkati je jaangirdeji aranool be ɗiɗaɓool maɓɓakke haa nder duniyaru ngam COVID-19, dabareji je memmotto jaahargalji ɓikkon pamaron saanji.

en: In some countries and territories, preschools and day cares are considered necessary services and have not closed in tandem with broader school closure measures.In the United States, the Washington State Department of Children, Youth, and Families encouraged child care and early learning centres to stay open.
ff: haa nder lesɗe feere be wakkereji, hiddeko jaangirde be balɗe suklare laati bana kanduɗum e ɗon maɓɓiti haa jonta be dabareji jaangirde mawngel ɗon maɓɓi. haa Lesɗe America, Geeɓe lesdi Washington ngam Ɓikkon, Sukkaɓe be calaaje ɗon yardi suklugo do ɓingel be wakkereji ndu ɗon maɓɓitti.

en: Some school districts may offer alternative child care options, prioritising the children of first responders and healthcare workers.
ff: Distrikji jaangirde feere foti hokka dabareji feere, e ɗon hokka arandere sa'a haa ɓe'en je ɗon haɓɓa ngam jam ɓanndu yimɓe be huwooɓe cuuɗi lekki.

en: The governor of Maryland mandated that specific child care services remain open for the children of emergency personnel while Washington State and California have left it to the discretion of care providers.
ff: Ngomna Maryland matini yo'o kuɗe suklare do ɓikkon wonan maɓɓittama ngam ɓikkon yimɓe je ɗon huwa haa suudu jam ɓanndu haa wakkati man Lesdi Washington be California accini ndu haa nder jaahargal sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu.

en: California Governor Gavin Newsom explained his state's position, saying “We need our child care facilities, our daycare centers, to operate to absorb the impact of these school closures.”
ff: Ngomna California Gavin Newsom ngewti do ko lesdi mako ɗon waɗa, be wi'ugo "Min ngiɗi wakkereji suklare do ɓikkon amin, wakkereji balɗe, ngam huwida ngam ustugo saɗirma je maɓɓol jaangirdeji amin".

en: Colorado has encouraged the development of "tool kits" for parents to use at home to emulate the lessons children would have received in their early learning programmes.In Japan, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe closed all schools throughout the country until April 8, however, children's daycare facilities were excluded.
ff: Colorado sembintini wurtinugo "tool kits" ngam baabiraɓe je huwida be man haa saare je foondata ekkitolji je ɓikkon maɓɓe jaɓɓan no haa nder jaahargalji ekkitol maɓɓe.

en: In early March, five adults associated with a nursing facility for preschool children in Kobe tested positive for coronavirus.
ff: haa fuɗɗam Maars, mawɓe joowey je ɗon no sukla do ɓikkon haa jaangirde jaarne haa Kobe larti ɗon mari nyau koronaviriis.

en: After testing over one hundred children at the facility, a preschool student was found to be carrying the virus.
ff: haa ɓaawo lartol do ɓikkon temere haa wakkere ndu, gooto cakka jaangoɓe hiddeko jaangirde tawama larti viriis man.

en: Primary or elementary education typically consists of the first four to seven years of formal education.
ff: Jaangirde arandere malla je aranool ɗon laarani ɓikkon je ɗon mari duuɓi nay haa joowey e ɗiɗi jaangirde je ɗon andi.

en: The International Baccalaureate Organization (IBO) canceled the examinations for its Diploma Programme and Career-related Programme candidates scheduled between 30 April and 22 May 2020, reportedly affecting more than 200,000 students worldwide.
ff: The International Baccalaureate Organization (IBO) darni bindi fu je larnatta jaahargalji daɗi-daɗa Diploma Programme be Career-related Programme je sallan no haa kunde 30 Aviiril be 22 Me 2020, je matinama memmi ɓuri jaangoɓe 200 000 haa nder duniyaru.

en: The IBO stated that it would award candidates their diplomas or certificates based on "their coursework" and "the established assessment expertise, rigor, and quality control already built into the programme."
ff: IBO wi'i yo'o o hokka ɗereji malla sappinolji yahde yeeso ekkitoɓe maɓɓe do "ekkitol maɓɓe" be "lartol aandal je wondi, kugal, be dabare aynol je ɗon haa nder jaahargal."

en: Tertiary education, also known as higher education, refers to the non-compulsory educational levels that follow completion of secondary school or high school.
ff: Tataɓool jaangirde, je ewnotto bo'o jaangirde je manga, laarani ta'irde jaangirde je wonday dole je tokkata timminorde jaangirde ɗiɗaɓool malla jaangirde manga.

en: Tertiary education is normally taken to include undergraduate and postgraduate education, as well as vocational education and training.
ff: Jaangirde tataɓool laati bana jaangirde undergraduate be postgraduate, be jaangirde kugal be ekkitol.

en: Individuals who complete tertiary education generally receive certificates, diplomas, or academic degrees.
ff: Yimɓe je timmini jaangirde je tataɓre ɓurna fu keɓɓan ɗereji, batakkeji malla sappinolji yahde.

en: Undergraduate education is education conducted after secondary education and prior to post-graduate education, for which the learner is typically awarded a bachelor's degree.
ff: Jaangirde undergraduate woni jaangirde je tokkatta jaangirde ɗiɗaɓre e hiddeko jaangirde post-graduate, je haa timminorde man jaangowo ɗon heɓɓa bachelor's degree.

en: Students enrolled in higher education programmes at colleges, universities, and community colleges are often refereed to in countries such as United States as "college students."The closure of colleges and universities has widespread implications for students, faculty, administrators, and the institutions themselves.
ff: Jaangoɓe je ɗon windi haa jaahargalji collegeji, jam'iareji, be collegeji ummatore ɗon ewnama haa lesɗe bana Lesɗe America bana "jaangoɓe oollege". Maɓɓolji colleji be jam'iare memmi jaangoɓe jur, geeɓe jaangirde, arduɓe, be cuuɗi feere.

en: Colleges and universities across the United States have been called upon to issue refunds to students for the cost of tuition and room and board.
ff: Collegeji be jam'iare haa Lesɗe America ewnotto ngam hokkugo ceede haa jaangoɓe ngam ceede jaangirde be je suudu be kuje windugo.

en: In the United States of America, Colleges and universities operate as "mini-cities" which generate significant revenue for cities, states, and regions.
ff: haa Lesɗe America, collegeji be jam'iareji ɗon huwa bana "berniji pamaron" je ɗon wartira risku haa berniji, lesɗe, be wakkereji.

en: For example, Princeton University contributed $1.58 billion USD to the New Jersey economy and students spent about $60 million in off-campus spending.
ff: Bana sappinol, Princeton University ɓesdini miliarji 1.58$ haa siggorde New Jersey e jaangoɓe majjini milionji 60$ haa yaasi jaangirde.

en: College and university closures have a domino effect on economies with far-reaching implications.According to Linda Bilmes of the Harvard Kennedy School, "local hotels, restaurants, cafes, shops, car rental agencies and other local businesses obtain a significant share of annual revenue from graduation week and college reunions...
ff: Maɓɓolji jam'iare ɗon memma siggorde ceede be saɗirmaji ɗuɗɗum. haa Linda Bilmes je Harvard Kennedy School, "hotelji wakkere, cuuɗi nyamɗe, Kafeji, cuuɗi sippol, geeɓe haaya mootaji be kujeji feere-feere ɗon wartira kujeji kanduɗum haa nder risku hittande gal asawere wurtol jaangirde be hawtirolji college...

en: these communities will suffer a lot of economic damage if the colleges remain closed at that time."Small towns which rely on college students to support the local economy and provide labour to local businesses are especially impacted by school closures and the exodus of students from campus.
ff: Ummatoreji ndu yaran bone masitin ngam nastirde risku to collegeji wonan maɓɓi haa wakkati nde. "Berniji pamaron ɗon limma do jaangirde college ngam wallugo risku wakkere e ɗon hokka kugal haa cuuɗi sippol je ɗon tardi memmotto gal maɓɓolji jaangirde e wurtol jaangoɓe do wakkere jaangirde.

en: In Ithaca, New York, Cornell University students spent at least $4 million a week in Tompkins county.
ff: haa Ithaca, New York, jaangoɓe Cornell University majjini milionji 4$ haa nder asawere haa lamorde Tompkins.

en: In the wake of Cornell's decision to keep students home following spring break and transition to virtual instruction, the Mayor of Ithaca called for "immediate and forceful federal action — we will see a horrific economic impact as a result of Cornell University closing."
ff: haa hasduye Cornell ngam siggugo jaangoɓe haa saare haa ɓaawo siwtare spring be sallinol haa ekkitolji be do internati, Marɗo lesdi Ithaca ewni ngam "dabare jaawal be dole lesdi, e mattan saɗirmaji ɗuɗɗum ngam maɓɓol Cornell University."

en: UNESCO is sharing 10 recommendations during this period:
ff: UNESCO ɗon senda feeloji 10 haa wakkati nnde:

en: Examine the readiness and choose the most relevant tools: Decide on the use high-technology and low-technology solutions based on the reliability of local power supplies, internet connectivity, and digital skills of teachers and students.
ff: Lartu ko je ɗon taski timmi e suɓɓu je ɓuri naffugo: Hasdu ngam dabareji je ɓuri malla je lessi naffugo do amana do yite, jokkitol internati, be aandalji jaanginoɓe be jaangoɓe ngam internati.

en: This could range through integrated digital learning platforms, video lessons, MOOCs, to broadcasting through radios and TVs.
ff: Ndu foti salla gal baabe ekkitolji, jaangirde be vidiyo, MOOC, ngewte gal radiyo be tele.

en: Ensure inclusion of the distance learning programmes: Implement measures to ensure that students including those with disabilities or from low-income backgrounds have access to distance learning programmes, if only a limited number of them have access to digital devices.
ff: Nastinol dabare jaahargalji ekkitol dayindi: Waɗugo dabareji ngam heɓɓa jaangoɓe be ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau diga danyinki malla je wurti calaaje je ɗon tampi mari dabare nastirde haa jaahargalji ekkitol dayindi, to foti ɓe'en feere foti mara dabare heɓɓugo nastirde haa ordoji internati.

en: Consider temporarily decentralising such devices from computer labs to families and support them with internet connectivity.
ff: Lartugo sankitolji ordoji bana computer labs haa calaaje e walla ɓe jokkitol internati haa nder wakkati seeɗa.

en: Protect data privacy and data security: Assess data security when uploading data or educational resources to web spaces, as well as when sharing them with other organisations or individuals.
ff: Fadugo amana matinolji be jam matinolji: Lartugo jam matinolji haa yakke nastinol matinolji malla dabareji ekkitol haa do hawo, be sendugo ndu be geeɓeji feere malla be yimɓe feere.

en: Ensure that the use of applications and platforms does not violate students’ data privacy.
ff: Waɗugo yo'o huwidol be applikasionji be daldalji memmata amana matinolji jaangowo.

en: Prioritize solutions to address psychosocial challenges before teaching: Mobilize available tools to connect schools, parents, teachers, and students with each other.
ff: Hokkugo mangu haa dabareji nattinugo larulaaji hakkilo: moftugo kujeji je ɗon wondi ngam jokkugo jaangirdeji, baabiraɓe, jaanginoɓe, be jaangoɓe oya be oya.

en: Create communities to ensure regular human interactions, enable social caring measures, and address possible psychosocial challenges that students may face when they are isolated.
ff: Wurtinugo ummatoji ngam wanginugo dabareji feere-feere haa kunde yimɓe, waɗugo dabareji suklugo do ummatore, e wilugo saɗirmaji feere je foti memma hakkilo jaangoɓe to ɓe ɗon jooɗi feere maɓɓe.

en: Plan the study schedule of the distance learning programmes: Organise discussions with stakeholders to examine the possible duration of school closures and decide whether the distance learning programme should focus on teaching new knowledge or enhance students’ knowledge of prior lessons.
ff: Waɗugo jaahargalji ngam dabareji ekkitol nayinde: ngewta be mawɓe ngam lartugo neeɓol maɓɓolji jaangirde je foti waɗa be hasdugo to jaahargal ekkitol dayinde wondan do jaanginugo kujeji keese malla lartugo ko ɓe jaangi timmi haa nder suudu jaangirde.

en: Plan the schedule depending on the situation of the affected zones, level of studies, needs of students needs, and availability of parents.
ff: Waɗugo jaahargal do jonde wakkere nde, ta'irde jaangirdeji, haajeji jaangoɓe, be wondugo baabiraɓe.

en: Choose the appropriate learning methodologies based on the status of school closures and home-based quarantines.
ff: Suɓɓugo dabareji jaangirdeji kanduɗum do maɓɓolji jaangirde e do wondugo haa sera haa saare bo'o.

en: Avoid learning methodologies that require face-to-face communication.
ff: Luttugo dabareji ekkitol je ɗon emma ngewte je gite nder gite.

en: Provide support to teachers and parents on the use of digital tools: Organise brief training or orientation sessions for teachers and parents as well, if monitoring and facilitation are needed.
ff: Hokkugo wallende haa jaanginoɓe ba baabiraɓe do kujeji kugal be internati: taskugo geeɓeji ekkitol malla feelore ngam jaanginoɓe be baabiraɓe fu, to aynol be wallende naffan.

en: Help teachers to prepare the basic settings such as solutions to the use of internet data if they are required to provide live streaming of lessons.
ff: Wallugo jaangoɓe taskugo wakkere aranool bana dabareji huwugo be internati to ɓe emmotto waɗugo jaangirde gal wondugo haa yeeso jaangoɓe nder ordo.

en: Blend appropriate approaches and limit the number of applications and platforms: Blend tools or media that are available for most students, both for synchronous communication and lessons, and for asynchronous learning.
ff: Hawtugo dabareji kanduɗum e darna limgal applikasionji e daaldal: Hawtugo kujeji malla dabareji je ɗon ngondi haa ɓurna jaangoɓe fu, ɗiɗi fu ngam haa ngewte be ekkitolji yahida boɗɗum, be jaangirde je ɗon feere.

en: Avoid overloading students and parents by asking them to download and test too many applications or platforms.
ff: Accugo hebbinugo applikasionji malla daaldal haa jaangoɓe be baabiraɓe gal emmugo ɓe hoosugo e waɗɗugo kujeji jur.

en: Develop distance learning rules and monitor students’ learning process: Define the rules with parents and students on distance learning.
ff: Wurtinugo tawretaji jaangirde dayindi be fadugo laahal jaangirde jaangowo: sappinugo tawretaji do jaangirde dayinki haa baabiraɓe be jaangoɓe.

en: Design formative questions, tests, or exercises to monitor closely students’ learning process.
ff: Dida emmolji, lartolji, kuɗe ekkitol ngam fadugo laahal ekkitol jaangoɓe.

en: Try to use tools to support submission of students’ feedback and avoid overloading parents by requesting them to scan and send students’ feedback
ff: Foondugo huwugo be kujeji ngam wallugo jaangowo ngewta be mooɗon e accugo emmugo baabiraɓe gal emmugo ɓe ngam hoosa foto e nelda ngewte jaangoɓe be hoore maɓɓe.

en: Define the duration of distance learning units based on students’ self-regulation skills: Keep a coherent timing according to the level of the students’ self-regulation and metacognitive abilities especially for livestreaming classes.
ff: Hokkugo wakkati ekkitol dayindi do dabare wondugo aandalji jaangoɓe: Wurtinugo jaahargal je ɗon yahida be yaɓɓorde jaangirde be dabareji aandal feere-feere ɓurna fu je jaangirdeji je gite be gite do ordo.

en: Preferably, the unit for primary school students should not be more than 20 minutes, and no longer than 40 minutes for secondary school students.
ff: Ndikka yo'o, ekkitol jaangoɓe jaangirde aranool ta ɓura minti 20, e ta ɓura minti 40 je jaangoɓe jaangirde ɗiɗaɓool.

en: Create communities and enhance connection: Create communities of teachers, parents, and school managers to address sense of loneliness or helplessness, facilitate sharing of experience and discussion on coping strategies when facing learning difficulties.
ff: Wurtinugo ummatoreji e haɓda ngam ngidol: wanginugo ummatoreji jaanginoɓe, baabiraɓe, be arduɓe jaangirde ngam tato ɓe wona feere maɓɓe malla bila wallende, latina saanjol aandal be ngewte kooyɗum do dabareji wurtol to woodi saɗirmaji nder ekkitol.

en: 290 million students out of school due to COVID-19: UNESCO releases first global numbers and mobilizes response, UNESCO.
ff: Jaangoɓe milionji 290 haa yaasi jaangirde ngam COVID-19: UNESCO wurtini aranool limgal duniyaru e hawti jabbuye, UNESCO.

en: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
ff: Aynolji sababu haa wakkere kugal ngam COVID-19

en: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
ff: Aynolji sababu haa wakkere kugal ngam COVID-19 laati dabareji huwidugo do wakkere e jam ɓanndu ngam aynolji nyau koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19).

en: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
ff: Aynolji sababu haa wakkere kugal ɗon saanja be wakkere kugal be irin kugal man, do lartol sababu wondugo, nyaɗugo nyau haa nder ummatore, be kujeji je foti saɗɗina huwooɓe je foti raɓɓa COVID-19.

en: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
ff: U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) wi'i yo'o, irin kuɗe petpetel maray sababuji jur ngam hoosatta baabe jur be ummatore malla be huwooɓe feere, je dabareji aynol nyau aranool feelama, bana lallugo juɗe, sembintinugo huwooɓe joɗɗa haa saare to ɓe nyauɗo, laɓɓinugo lawol pofɗe, be laɓɓugo e laɓɓinugo baabe kugal.

en: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
ff: Kuɗe je sababu naangugo nyau deydey laarani ɓe'en je ɗon ngida be je on aanda malla bana ɗon roondi nyau COVID-19, amma je foti raɓɓa nyau ndu ngam sallinol ummatore je jonta malla gal jaahangal haa lesdi feere.

en: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
ff: Ndu laarani huwoɓe je mari dabare footugo be ummatore bana haa jaangirde, wakkere kugal je yimɓe ɗon jur, wakkeriji je kujeji sippitol jur ɗon mofti haa ton.

en: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
ff: Aynolji sababu geeɓe ndu, haa ɓesdugo haa dabareji aynol nyau je aranool, woodi hendu gal ordoji je ɗon haɗɗa gilɗiji salla, leepol je suddata ɓislol, be marugo limse fadol hoore mum je ɗon woni to on ɗon ngida be goɗɗo je ɗon mari COVID-19.

en: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
ff: OSHA ɗon limma huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu be huwooɓe do mayɓe bana hoore maɓɓe ɗon sappini malla goɗɗo je foti mara COVID-19 laati bana mari sababu maungel, ko ɗon ɓesdina haa sababu je tuuli to huwooɓe ɗon ngaɗa laahalji je ɗon wurtina aerosol do, malla ɗon mofta, malla ɗon memma lekkuji, goɗɗo je ɗon mari malla je foti mara COVID-19.

en: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
ff: Aynolji sababu je kanduɗum ngam irin huwooɓe ngu laarani aynolji injiiniya'en bana cuuɗi je hendu ɗo boɗɗe, be kujeji sudol je ɗon yahida be kugal ngel.

en: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
ff: Nyauji COVID-19 foti mara sababuji jur haa nder wakkere kugal.

en: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
ff: Huwooɓe foti wondatta haa kugal ngam ɓe raɓɓi nyau, ngam ɓe yiɗi suklugo do yimɓe feere, malla ngam hulol naangugo nyau.

en: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
ff: Sappinolji filu foti saanja, ɗiɗi fu do ko laarani kujeji je ɓe ɗon emma, be dabareji keɓɓugo kujeji ndu (bana soddugo haa wakkati je kuje saɗɗay jur, malla gal yimɓe je wartirata ndu haa saare malla haa sallooɓe be moota.

en: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
ff: haa timminol, yarɓol kujeji diga wakkereji je COVID-19 ɗon memma be sembe foti darnotto. Jaahargal taskaram malla jabbuye ngam nyau foti naffa ngam fadugo kuɗe.

en: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
ff: Jaahargalji ɗon usta yahdeji sababu je yahidatta be wakkereji kugal fu be irin kuɗe man, bana hoore je ɗon sappini, kujeji je foti ɓesda sababuji haa saare haa cakka ummatore, be kujeji je foti ɓesda sababuji yimɓe je huwatta feere maɓɓe bana newugo malla nyau feere je ɗon tokkita.

en: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
ff: Ɓe wurtini bo'o aynolji ngam ustugo irin sababuji, be jaahargalji wattugo haa sera ngam ko foti ummina bana sappinol nyauji.

en: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
ff: Taskaram be jaahargalji jabbuye ngam nyau je ɗon raɓɓa foti nasta nder feeloji lesdi malla lammorde.

en: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
ff: Dabareji ngam jabbuye haa nyau ndu laarani aynol sallinol haa huwooɓe, yimɓe je ɗon sukla do yimɓe feere je ɗon mari sababuji ngam nyaɗugo nyauji feere, tokkitindirol filu, be ustugo sababuji feere haa wakkere feere haa nder yahde maɓɓe.

en: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
ff: Nyaɗugo nyau haa nder ummatore je filu ɗon wondi ɗon memma dabareji je hoosama.

en: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
ff: Yaɓɓordeji aynol sababuji laati dabare je ɗon huwida haa wakkereji jam e jam ɓanndu ngam wurtinugo aynolji be geeɓe man e be naffuda man.

en: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
ff: haa wakkere je footay itta sababuji COVID-19, aynolji kanduɗum laati aynollji injiiniya'en, tokkiti be aynol kugal, e haa ragare man kuje sudugo.

en: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
ff: Aynolji injiiniya laarani wattugo huwooɓe haa sera be sababuji je laarani kugal bila larugo gikku huwoowo, e foti wona dabare je ɓuri naffugo.

en: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
ff: Aynolji kugal laati saanjolji nder siyasa kugal malla laahalji je yiɗi hakkilo huwoowo malla jagorɗo.

en: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
ff: Kujeji fadol ɓanndu (PPE) laati bana maray sembe do aynolji injiiniya'en be kugal, amma foti naffa ngam aynugo haa wakkere feere.

en: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
ff: Kala PPE fu sey suɓɓa ndu do sababu haa huwoowo, je ɗon larti kanduɗum (bana ordoji foofugo), ɗon ɓorni be lawol e tumtum, lartama, laɓɓi, e saanja to woodi naffuda be wakkati, itta be lawol, lalla, siga malla sakkina ngam tato raɓɓa.

en: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
ff: haa U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), kuɗe je wala sappinolji jur maray ngidol jur be ummatore malla be huwooɓe feere.

en: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
ff: Dabareji aynol nyau je aranool je feelama haa wakkere kugal fu laarani lallugo juɗe boɗɗum e haa wakkati fu, sembintinugo huwooɓe ngam wondugo haa saare to ɓe ɗon nyauɗo, laɓɓinugo lawol pofɗe gal suddugo sondaaru be ɓislol, hokkugo leepolji be tassawo sakkinugo cuddi, taskugo ngam saanjol baabe jonde malla eggol to woodi haaje man, mbarugo jokke haa huwooɓe tato ɓe huwida be kuje malla ordo yimɓe feere, be laɓɓugo e laɓɓinugo wakkere kugal.

en: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
ff: Maandugo law e wattugo haa sera yimɓe je bana mari nyau laati yaɓɓorde kanduɗum nder fadol huwooɓe, soddooɓe, ngilloɓe, be feere'en haa wakkere kugal.

en: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
ff: Ɗowirɗe Aynol e Lartol Jam ɓanndu (CDC) Lesɗe America ɗon feela yo'o huwooɓe je mari mandolji nyau pofɗe je bana nyaɗay wonda haa saare sey to ɓanndu maɓɓe wullata fahin, mandolji wullol ɓanndu, malla mandolji feere wanngatta fahin haa ɓaawo njamdi 24 bila hoosugo lekki ustugo wullol ɓanndu malla mandolji feere, e yo'o siwtare ngam nyau caɗɗay, hokka jarfuye haa huwooɓe wonda saare ngam suklugo do jeeyaɗo saare maɓɓe je ɗon nyauɗo haa saare, e je howooɓe andi siyasaji ndu.

en: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
ff: haa OSHA, kuɗe je ɗon mari sababuji deydey laarani ɓe'en je yiɗi ɓadittol yimɓe nder kosɗe joowey e go'o (1.8 m) je andi malla je foti mara nyau COVID-19, amma foti nanga nyau SARS-CoV-2 ngam sallinol ummatore haa tarde wakkere filuji, malla ngam goɗɗo neeɓay je warti jaahangal haa lesdi feere be sallinol COVID-19.

en: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
ff: Ndu laarani huwooɓe je ngidi be ummatore bana jaangirdeji, wakkere kugal je ɗon heewi be yimɓe, be wakkereji sippitolji je kujeji ɗon ruffi haa ton jur. Aynolji injiiniya'en ngam kanjuum be geeɓeji je ɗon mari sababu manga ngam nangugo nyau laarani wattugo kujeji laɓɓinugo hendu, ɓesdugo hendu, wattugo keleewolji bana leeda tardugo kuje, e wattugo dammuɗe do moota sippolji. Aynolji kugal je kanjuum be geeɓeji je mari sababuji manga ngam raɓɓugo nyau laarani sembintinugo huwooɓe je nyauɗo wonnda haa saare, waylittugo kawtalji je gite nder gite be ngewte gal ordo, wattugo suudu je foti egga ndu, darnugo jaahangalji je wala naffuda haa wakkereji je nyau COVID-19 ɗon ton, wurtinugo jaahargalji ngewte jaaawal be daaldal hokkugo matinolji keese do sababuji be gikku fadol COVID-19, ekkitugo kugal haa huwooɓe je yiɗi ɓornugo limse be kujeji fadol, hokkugo dabareji be wakkere kugal je yardi laɓɓinol, lallugo juɗe, ustugo nastirde soddooɓe be ummatore haa wakkere kugal, e ɓiilugo foto noy lallugo juɗe be dabareji sudol feere ngam COVID-19. Do irin kugal man, huwooɓe je mari sabajuji raɓɓugo je deydey sey ɓorna kujeji fadol bana kuje suddugo juɗe, ngapaleewol, darugal yeeso malla leepol suddugo yeeso, malla goggleji.

en: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
ff: Huwooɓe haa nder geeɓe ndu mari haaje ordoji foofugo.

en: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
ff: To goɗɗo do'i nyau haa nder pireewol, aynolji kanduɗum ngam aynugo huwooɓe be sallooɓe feere laarani wattugo nyauɗo haa sera be yimɓe feere, dayugo deydey kosɗe 6, suɓɓugo goɗɗo gooto cakka maɓɓe sukla do nyauɗo ndu, e hokka leepol suddugo yeeso haa nyauɗo malla emmugo nyauɗo ndu sudda hunduko mako be kine mako be leepol to o ɗon sonda malla ɓisla.

en: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
ff: Geeɓe Kabin sey ɓorna kuje suddugo juɗe je o sakkina haa ɓaawo suklugo do nyauɗo je ɗon waɗa jaahangal ndu malla memmugo ilam ɓanndu malla baabe je raɓɓotto, to foti waɗa be kujeji fadol feere to nyauɗo ndu mari wullol ɓanndu, sondaaru je timmata malla saɗirma nder pofɗe.

en: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
ff: Kujeji suddugo juɗe sey sakkina haa nder buuhu je joggugo irin kujeji ndu, e baabe je ɗon raɓɓi sey laɓɓina ndu e laɓɓa ndu. Ko laarani kombeewol hortol kujeji filu, bana kombeewol jaahangal be kombeewolji feere je roondatta yimɓe, aynolji nyau laarani yarɓol jaahangol to goɗɗo man nyauɗo, wondugo haa sera e matinugo yimɓe je suklata do jam ɓanndu to a ɗon matti gul

en: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
ff: haa woɗɗa, aynol ndu sallan no haa nder suudu je wati haa sera. Ko laarani jaangirdeji be wakkere jo'inugo ɓikkon, CDC ɗon feela maɓɓolji haa nder wakkati seeɗa ngam laɓɓugo malla laɓɓinugo to goɗɗo je mari nyau wondi no haa suudu jaangirde bila larugo sankittol cakka ummatore.

en: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
ff: To woodi sallinol seeɗa haa deydey ummatore, dabare dayugo ummatore foti naffa bana darnugo jaahangal ngilli, mofturdeji, be hawtirdeji maungel bana waɗugo espor, yimmugo malla nyammugo haa ccuɗi nyamɗe, ɓesdugo baabe haa cakka koroomje, ustugo wakkati yottugo be dilugo, haɗɗugo ngilli je walla naffuda, hoosugo suudu jam ɓanndu ɓikkon je feere ɓe'en je bana mari mandolji ndamba.

en: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
ff: To woodi sallinol arandere haa nder ummatore wakkere, haa ɓaawo dabareji dayugo ummatore, wakkati maɓɓolji jaangirde foti ɓesdama. Ko laarani yimɓe umrore je ɗon ayna do ko ɗon salla ko weeti fu, sababu jam ɓanndu je law hoccama gal CDC.

en: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
ff: Yimɓe umrore ngidan be yimɓe je ɗon mari malla je foti mara nyau COVID-19 feelama ngam tokkugo tawretaji je huwooɓe jam ɓanndu ɗon tokka, bana ɓornugo kujeji fadol.

en: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
ff: To waɗi ɓe hawti haa wakkati nangol ngu, huwooɓe sey laɓɓa e laɓɓina kanda maɓɓe je kugal be kujeji maɓɓe hiddeko huwugo ba man fahin sey fuffa kuje lallugo saare malla sufta, e tokka laahalji kugal je ɗon aandin ko laarani siggugo be sakkinugo PPE e je joggotto malla lottugo limse.

en: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
ff: OSHA ɗon hocca huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu be huwooɓe do mayɓe bana ɗon nde geeɓe je sababuji mauni malla mauni masitin.

en: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
ff: Kuɗe je sababuji laati maungel laarani huwooɓe suklare do jam ɓanndu, wallende, suudu lartol, be hortol jam ɓandu je wondi be nyauɓe je mari malla je foti mara COVID-19.

en: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
ff: Latan sababu je mauni masin to huwooɓe huwi be laahal foofugo aerosol do, malla moftugo malla memmugo leekuji haa, yimɓe je ɗon andi malla foti mara nyau COVID-19.

en: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
ff: Laahalji fuufugo aerosol laarani sallinugo kuje gal daande, laahalji umminugo sondaaru, bronchoscopiji, jaahargal e lartol ni'e feere, malla mofturde leeku.

en: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
ff: Kuɗe sababu huwooɓe do mayɓe laarani taskugo wade yimɓe je andi mari malla foti mari nyau COVID-19 haa wakkati mayde maɓɓe; ndu laati bana sababu maungel masitin to ɓe ɗon seeka wade ngam larugo ko mbari mo. Aynolji injiiniya'en ɓesdotto haa iirin geeɓe sababu ndu bana cuuɗi wondugo sera nyauɓe je andi don mari malla je foti mara nyau COVID-19, bana to laahalji foofugo aerosol ɗon laarani.

en: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
ff: foofugo hendu je feerejo foti naffa haa wakkereji jam ɓanndu feere be suklugo do wade.

en: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
ff: Leekuji sey memmotto be dabareji hakiika Biosafety Level 3.

en: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
ff: Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Duniyaru (WHO) ɗon feela yo'o nyauɓe je ɗon nasta sey wonda feere be feere haa nder wakkereji ndeenugo to ɓe foti mara nyau COVID-19. haa ɓesdugo do PPE, OSHA ɗon feela ordoji foofugo haa yimɓe je ɗon huwa nder kosɗe 6 nyauɓe je ɗon andi mari, malla je tammi marugo SARS-CoV-2, be ɓe'en je ɗon ngaɗa laahalji foofugo aerosol.

en: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
ff: haa Lesɗe America, leepol foofugo N95 je NIOSH jaɓɓi malla je ɓuri sey huwa be majuum haa nder jaahargal fadol pofɗe fu, je ɗon windi bana lartol wawande, ekkitol, be lartolji nyau.

en: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
ff: Ordoji foofugo feere foti hokka fadol je ɓuri e saklata huwoowo. WHO feelata limse je ɗon sudda ɓanndu fu ngam COVID-19 woni nyau pofɗe do nummol bana ɗon salla gal ilam ɓanndu.

en: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
ff: WHO ɗon feela leepol suudugo yeeso seekowo haa huwooɓe nastirde suudu lekki.

en: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
ff: Ko laarani yimɓe je moftatta leekuji pofɗe haa, suklatta do, malla roondatta nyau

en: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
ff: To laahal foofugo aerosol huwidotto, leepol suddugo yeeso seekowo waylittama be ordo N95 malla FFP2.

en: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
ff: Ngam tagle PPE haa nder duniyaru he'ay, WHO ɗon feela ustol haaje PPE gal lartol dayindi, keleewolji bana dammuɗe be darugal, je hokkatta jarfuye nastirde sna haa sukloɓe do nyauɓe COVID-19, huwidugo be PPE sna to kugal man ɗon, huwida be ordo je on ɗon mari bila ittugo ndu haa yakke suklugo do nyauɓe feere-feere je ɗon mari irin lartol ndu, aynugo e fadugo soddooɓe PPE, haɗɗugo

en: WHEREAS on March 4, 2020, I proclaimed a State of Emergency to exist in California as a result of the threat of COVID-19;
ff: haa 4 Maars 2020, mi matini Dabare Jaawal wonda haa California bana sappinol raɓɓol COVID-19;

en: and WHEREAS in a short period of time, COVID-19 has rapidly spread throughout California, necessitating updated and more stringent guidance from federal, state, and local public health officials;
ff: e haa wakkati seeɗa ni, COVID-19 sankitti laugel haa nder California, be marugo haaje lartol be sappinol dabareji nyaɗum haa lesdi, ngomna, be arduɓe jam ɓanndu ummatore wakkere;

en: and WHEREAS for the preservation of public health and safety throughout the entire State of California, I find it necessary for all Californians to heed the State public health directives from the Department of Public Health.
ff: e haa ko laarani aynugo jam ɓanndu e jam ummatore haa nder lesdi California fu, mi tawi boɗɗe haa yimɓe California fu ɗowtina matinolji jam ɓanndu Ngomna haa ummatore ga Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu.

en: NOW, THEREFORE, I, GAVIN NEWSOM, Governor of the State of California, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the State Constitution and statutes of the State of California, and in particular, Government Code sections 8567, 8627, and 8665 do hereby issue the following Order to become effective immediately:
ff: JONTA BO'O, MIN, GAVIN NEWSOM, Ngomna California, be sembe je Umrore be tawretaji Lesdi California hooki yam, e ɓurna bo'o Government Code geeɓe 8567, 8627, be 8665 ɗon wurtina Tawreta ndu e hoccan sembe diga jonta:

en: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT:
ff: NDA KO MI HASDI:

en: 1) To preserve the public health and safety, and to ensure the healthcare delivery system is capable of serving all, and prioritizing those at the highest risk and vulnerability, all residents are directed to immediately heed the current State public health directives, which I ordered the Department of Public Health to develop for the current statewide status of COVID-19.
ff: 1) Aynugo jamɗu e jam ummatore, e dabare suklare do jam ɓanndu foti sukla do ko moy fu, be suklugo ɓurna do ɓe'e je mari sababuji maungel masitin be je wala sembe, ummatore fu sey ɗowtina matinolji Ngomna do jam ɓanndu ndu diga jonta, je mi jarfi Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Ummatore wurtinugo ngam ko

en: Those directives are consistent with the March 19, 2020, Memorandum on Identification of Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers During COVID-19 Response, found at: https://covid19.ca.gov/.
ff: Dabareji ndu ɗon yahida be Memorandum on Identification of Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers During COVID-19 Response je 19 Maars 2020, je tawama haa: https://covid19.ca.gov/.

en: ORDER OF THE STATE PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICER
ff: TAWRETA ARDUƊO JAM ɓanndu LESDI

en: To protect public health, I as State Public Health Officer and Director of the California Department of Public Health order all individuals living in the State of California to stay home or at their place of residence except as needed to maintain continuity of operations of the federal critical infrastructure sectors, as outlined at https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.
ff: Ngam fadugo jam ɓanndu ummatore, Min Arduɗo Jam ɓanndu Lesdi be Ɗowuwo Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu hasdi ko moy fu je nyeeɗatta haa do Lesdi California joɗɗa haa saare malla haa wakkere jonde mako sna to ngam tokkitugo kugal lesdi je laarani kujeji yahde lesdi, bana ɗon limti haa https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

en: In addition, and in consultation with the Director of the Governor's Office of Emergency Services, I may designate additional sectors as critical in order to protect the health and well-being of all Californians.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, e be ngewte be Ɗowuwo Suudu Ngomna je Suklata do Kuɗe Jaawal, foti mi suɓɓa wakkereji feere to woodi haaje ngam fadugo jam ɓanndu e jam woore jeeyaɓe California.

en: Pursuant to the authority under the Health and Safety Code 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 and 120150, this order is to go into effect immediately and shall stay in effect until further notice.
ff: Bana ɗon limti haa nder Umrore Jam ɓanndu e Jam 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 be 120150, tawreta ndu hoccan sembe diga jonta e tokkitan haa to batakkewol feere wurti.

en: The federal government has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors whose assets, systems, and networks, whether physical or virtual, are considered so vital to the United States that their incapacitation or destruction would have a debilitating effect on security, economic security, public health or safety, or any combination thereof.
ff: Ngomna lesdi maandi wakkereji je ɗon mari saɗirmaji 16 je kuɗe, dabareji, be kawtirdeji maɓɓe, ko je ɗon lara be je ko laratta, laati bana kanduɗum haa Lesɗe America je sembe maɓɓe timmi malla woni ɗon mari sababu do jam, jam siggorde, jam ɓanndu malla jam, malla hawtirde feere.

en: I order that Californians working in these 16 critical infrastructure sectors may continue their work because of the importance of these sectors to Californians' health and well-being.
ff: Mi ɗon hasda yo'o ummatore California je ɗon huwa haa wakereji sababu 16 ndu foti tokkita kuɗe maɓɓe ngam naffuda wakkereji ndu haa jam ɓanndu e jam yimɓe California.

en: This Order is being issued to protect the public health of Californians.
ff: Tawreta ndu wurtutto ngam fadugo jam ɓanndu yimɓe California.

en: The California Department of Public Health looks to establish consistency across the state in order to ensure that we mitigate the impact of COVID-19.
ff: Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Ummatore yiɗi teffugo tokkitol haa nder lesdi ngam heɓɓa en usta sembe COVID-19.

en: Our goal is simple, we want to bend the curve, and disrupt the spread of the virus.
ff: Kugal amin ɗon kooyɗum, min yiɗi ustugo yahde, e darnugo sankittol viriis.

en: The supply chain must continue, and Californians must have access to such necessities as food, prescriptions, and health care.
ff: Addugo kujeji sey tokkita, e ummatore California sey mara dabare heɓɓugo irin kujeji ndu bana nyamdu ndu, lekki, jam ɓanndu.

en: When people need to leave their homes or places of residence, whether to obtain or perform the functions above, or to otherwise facilitate authorized necessary activities, they should at all times practice social distancing.
ff: To yimɓe yiɗi wurtugo saare maɓɓe malla wakkere jonde maɓɓe, temma ngam heɓɓugo malla waɗugo ko ɗon limti haa do ndu, malla latinugo kuɗe je ɗon jarfi kooyɗum, sey ko moy fu daya oya be oya.

en: 2) The healthcare delivery system shall prioritize services to serving those who are the sickest and shall prioritize resources, including personal protective equipment, for the providers providing direct care to them.
ff: 2) Dabare suklare do jam ɓandu hokkan arandere sa'a haa kuɗe je suklatta do yimɓe je ɓuri nyaugo e hokkan bo'o sa'a haa dabareji, bana kujeji fadol, haa huwoɓe je suklatta do maɓɓe.

en: 3) The Office of Emergency Services is directed to take necessary steps to ensure compliance with this Order.
ff: 3) Ɗowirɗ e Kuɗe Jaawal feelama ngam hoosugo yaɓɓordeji ngam ɗowtinugo haa Tawreta ndu.

en: 4) This Order shall be enforceable pursuant to California law, including, but not limited to, Government Code section 8665.
ff: 4) Tawreta ndu hoosan sembe bana ko ɗon limti haa nder umrore California, amma haɗɗay haa ton tan, Government Code geeɓe 8665.

en: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that as soon as hereafter possible, this Order be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and that widespread publicity and notice be given of this Order.
ff: laati HASDOTTO BO'O bana ko wowi, Tawreta ndu neldotto haa Ɗowirɗe Windowo Lesdi e sankittoto gal matinolji do Tawreta ndu.

en: This Order is not intended to, and does not, create any rights or benefits, substantive or procedural, enforceable at law or in equity, against the State of California, its agencies, departments, entities, officers, employees, or any other person.
ff: Tawreta ndu wurti ngam, e footay, wangina jarfuji malla ribaji, je wurtatta nder ton malla gal laahal, je yahidata be umrore be wondugo kalkal, do Lesdi California, wakkereji, geeɓeji, toɓeji, arduɓe, huwooɓe maa maɓɓe malla yimɓe feere.

en: IN WITNESS WHEREOF I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State of California to be affixed this 19th day of March 2020.
ff: BANA SEEDOWO KANJUUM mi ɗon waɗa jungo am do man be Mandirɗum Manga Lesdi California do ton haa nyalade 19 Maars 2020 ndu.

en: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO
ff: DIGA: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO

en: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff
ff: haa : Geeɓe Wikimedia Foundation fu

en: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lightening the load and preparing for the future
ff: HOORE NGEWTE: [Covid-19] Ustugo nyau be taskugo jaango

en: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC
ff: wakkati/WAKKERE NELDOL: 14 Maars, 2020, 00:24 UTC

en: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved
ff: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved

en: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
ff: Min tawi hoore amin haa nder larulaaji maungel lewru ndu.

en: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
ff: Nyau COVID-19 laati kuje feere ɗon laɓɓina yo'o jonde amin ɓi'i adama sey joɗɗida oya be oya ngam en ɗon laarani fu ngam ko ɗon salla jonta ndu.

en: We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
ff: Min wala kujeji sappinol do man, amma min andi yo'o jabbuye amin je kanduɗum jooɗi do jurminol uya be oya, huwidol, be kugal nder ummatore je woni cakare jonde ndu.

en: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
ff: Sobiraaku be suklare do ummatore je en lari haa kunde derɗiraaɓe amin gal emailji, ewnolji, be ngewte laati kugal kanduɗum je ɓi'i adama mari sa'a masin je en huwida be man.

en: I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
ff: Footay mi yetta mon e seeya do mooɗon ɓuri ɗo ngam limmugo do mooɗon derɗiraaɓe.

en: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
ff: haa asawere je sallingo, goɗɗo feere sendi be am sembintinugo kugal amin.

en: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
ff: O siftorini yam noy laati kanduɗum haa duniyaru ngam waylittugo gal Wikipedia jonta ndu, e laati mandol sembe ngam dabare ndu wona do hawo e ko moy fu foti heɓɓa ɗum.

en: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
ff: Kugal mooɗon ɗon ngaɗa ɗum foti salla, ko to gal aynugo siteji wonda finditti malla derɗiraaɓe yoɓɓi malla ummatoji jam.

en: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
ff: Duniyaru mari haaje matinolji je Wikipedia ɗon hokka, jonta ɓuri je sallingo.

en: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
ff: Ndu laati wakkati ja naa ko en waɗatta tan, amma noy en ɗon ngaɗa ɗum, waɗan feeretirol do duniyaru.

en: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
ff: Ngam daraja kugal ndu be ko on waɗatta haa nder man, en laritan dabareji amin do noy huwidugo, fuɗɗam haa asawere je warata.

en: Adjustments to our work and schedules
ff: Lartolji do kugal amin be jaahargalji

en: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
ff: Bana Robyn matini seeɗa, c-team hawti kenya ngam ngewtidugo dabare be jaahargal amin je balɗe be lebbi je warango.

en: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
ff: haa nder ngewte ndu, en hoosi ko en tammi wonan jabbol je kanduɗum do ko en ɗon lara jonta be dabare je ɓuri naffugo ngam yahde ummatore haa wakkati ndu.

en: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
ff: Be seeyo fahin, min yiɗi ittugo tampere e fada kugal amin ngam haa abada.

en: If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
ff: To on yiɗi lorugo, bismila.

en: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
ff: haa geeɓe fu, hokkowo kugal, be huwooɓe:

en: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
ff: kugal amin je en foti waɗa ko weeti fu ɗon gal njamɗe 4 nder balɗe, malla njamɗe 20 nder asawere haa matinol feere.

en: We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
ff: En matinay siwtare, to on foti huwa haa gaɗɗa njamɗe je ɗon andi, kugal foti huwida be mon.

en: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
ff: Amma, haa nder duniyaru je jonta ndu, footay goɗɗo famma ko foti yotta jaango, e to a yiɗi suklugo do ngiɗaɗo maaɗa, sodda kujeji, malla yaha haa lekkitajo, jam ɓandu mooɗon laati kugal amin.

en: We are not tracking your time.
ff: En emmatta ko on waɗi be wakkati mooɗon.

en: If you are sick, do not work.
ff: To a nyauɗo, ta huwu.

en: This should go without saying, but we’re saying it.
ff: En maray no haaje yeccugo ɗum, amma en ɗon yecca ɗum.

en: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
ff: Wala balɗe nyau malla PTO je en emmatta, matinu arduɗo maa e wallu geeɓe maa larta jaahargalji ngam fammugo to wakkereji kanduɗum ɗon suddu.

en: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
ff: (To a lartama bana a mari nyau COVID-19, useni matinu Bryau nder T&C Ops ngam heɓɓa walla mon e aanda yo'o a ɗon jam e watta hakkilo ɗowirɗe do maa).

en: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
ff: Yimɓe je huwatta nder njamdi heɓɓan ceede lewru maɓɓe.

en: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
ff: En yecci ɗum timmi,, e ɗon hasdi lartugo hasduji amin haa hokkooɓe kugal amin be derɗiraaɓe amin je ɗon huwa nder njamdi.

en: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
ff: Ko moy fi keɓɓan ceede lewru mako bana ko o ɗon no jaɓɓa haa wakkati je wala jiɓɓol.

en: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
ff: Ko to a nyauɗo e footay a huwa.

en: If you want to work, we support you.
ff: To a yiɗi huwugo, min wallan maa.

en: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
ff: Yimɓe jur ɗon hoosa kugal bana dabare wilugo nummolji maɓɓe nder duniyaru je jonta ndu.

en: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
ff: Ko en ɗon waɗa ndu foti yoɓɓa be sembe, ɓurna be irin wakkati bana je jonta.

en: Again, this is about your self-care.
ff: Fahin, ndu laarani suklugo do maa be hoore maaɗa.

en: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
ff: Ewnandu amin laati yo'o on ngewta arduɗo mooɗon , ngam heɓɓa ko en foti ndena e foti larta nder jaahargal amin.

en: Some work is considered essential.
ff: Kugal feere laati bana kanduɗum.

en: There are some things that we must keep doing.
ff: woodi kujeji feere je sey tokkita waɗugo ɗum.

en: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
ff: SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, be geeɓeji Hoosugo wallende (haa cakka feere'en) ɗon waɗa kugal kanduɗum je foti mara haaje wallende feere.

en: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
ff: Min fuɗɗan laahal feere be geeɓeji fu ngam lartugo dabareji amin je jonta e woylitta kugal amin do ko ɓuri kanduɗum ngamm kugal amin.

en: There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
ff: woodi kugal jur ngam ko moy fu, en suɓɓan kuɗe je ɓuri naffuda tawon.

en: Slowing now won’t hurt later.
ff: Ɗaayugo jonta nawnata jaango.

en: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
ff: En tammay "ɓesdugo mon wakkati nde ɗiɗi ngam jokkitugo" haa ɓaawo nyau duniyaru ndu salli.

en: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
ff: On footay emmotto ngam ɓesdugo njamɗe feere ngam jokkittugo ko en waɗay jonta.

en: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
ff: Min andi yo'o kujeji saanji, e en huwidan ngam lartugo dabareji amin be jaahargalji haa wakkere je naffan.

en: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
ff: Ko ɗon salla be APP (Jaahargal Hittande)?

en: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
ff: Ngam lartugo kugal amin jonta be njamɗe ko en foti huwa haa nder balɗe, min yiɗi lartugo wakkati wurtinol Jaahargal Hittande amin 2020-2021.

en: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
ff: haa nummol amin en yiɗi no juttinugo jaahargal 2019-2020 je ɗon hokka wakkati jur ngam suɓɓugo ceede ngam hokkugo jarfuye haa huwooɓe lara kugal kanduɗum, suklugo do hoore maɓɓe, be suklare do ngiɗaɓe maɓɓe haa wakkati man en hoosan ɓe'en je yiɗi nastugo malla je yiɗi ustugo jaahargal maɓɓe haa nder asaweji je warango.

en: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
ff: Juttinol wakkati ndu ustan be ɗuɗɗum jaahargal kuɗe be jaawal haa nder ummatore man fu.

en: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
ff: En sappinan ko en hasdi haa Arduɗo haa asawere je warango e matinan fadooɓe be geeɓeji haa yaɓɓorde je warango to en heɓɓi jabbol ni.

en: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
ff: Min yetti geeɓe APP ngam fadol mooɗon.

en: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
ff: Wondugo ɗowirɗe, sappinol be laɓɓinol

en: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
ff: haa asawere je sallingo, e ekkiti yo'o gooto cakka derɗiraaɓe amin je ɗon woni haa SF, hoore mako ɗon no sappini haa viriis COVID-19.

en: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
ff: Amma, do hakkikaji amin fu, en hoosi geeɓe je suklatta do laɓɓugo e laɓɓinugo baabe fu je mari viriis haa ɗowirɗe San Francisco.

en: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
ff: Geeɓe ndu huwidi be dabare je mbardugo viriisji je suudu lekki fu ɗon huwida be man ngam laɓɓinugo baabe, be nastirde, be kuje hortol haa do suudu feere.

en: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
ff: Mahdi ndu ɗon huwida be dabare laɓɓinol maaɗa e ɗon huwida be kujeji je ɗon fada jam wonɗɓe.

en: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
ff: Min ɗon seeyi ngam baabal kugal wonan taskuɗum do ndey en loratta.

en: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
ff: Baabal kugal amin je DC haa nder WeWork, je sendi dabare COVID-19 maaɗa be amin be jeeyaɗo geeɓe DC.

en: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
ff: haa asawere je sallingo, suudu kugal amin je DC eggi haa wakkere je ɗon dayi masin je ɗon ɗowtina dabare je sendama be San Francisco.

en: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
ff: Bana derɗiraaɓe amin je ɗon woni haa NYC, min ngewtidi bo'o do hoosugo suudu feere haa Brooklyn.

en: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
ff: Ngewteji ndu ɗon tokkita amma foti ɗaaya.

en: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
ff: Derɗiraaɓe amin feere ɗon huwida diga dayindi nde arandere wakkati.

en: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
ff: Derɗiraaɓe amin je je wawi huwidugo diga dayindi andi yo'o foti wona lartol, e yiɗi hokkugo mon feeloji feere:

en: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
ff: Usta juttol kawtirolji haa ɗuɗɗum man njamdi gooto malla ɗiɗi.

en: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
ff: To woodi haaje kawtirolji je ɓuri juttugo, lare noy en foti ta'a ɗum nder jur do balɗe jur.

en: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
ff: Hokke uja kawtal ndu, ko en ngewtataa do man, e nelde kujeji jaangugo be wakkati

en: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
ff: Ngaɗe vidiyoji ragare man, be kujeji bana Google Docs be Zoom ngam latinugo huwidol be kawtirde kooyɗum.

en: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
ff: Keeɓe ɗowuwo ngam kaja kawtal, goɗɗo je foti fada ngewte ngam emmolji e larta limtol mo je hoccata wolde, be goɗɗo ngam wallugo windugo ko je ɗon limti (malla huwida be windugo).

en: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
ff: Neldu email haa wallende teknik to a mari haaji kuje heeɗitugo je boɗɗe.

en: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
ff: Hoose lorni jam woore mon ngam nyamɗe.

en: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
ff: Jokke #remoties channel nder Slack ngam wolwugo be derɗiraaɓe mooɗon do kugal je sedama

en: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
ff: Geeɓe Kuɗe HR ɗon lara nder dabareji sappinol nder webinar ngam wallugo be kugal je ɗon sendi haa nder Foundation.

en: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
ff: haa nder asawere je sallingo en emmi jaɓɓoɓe ummatore fu willa kujeji ummatore je Wikimedia on hokki ceede, bana editathons, haa wakkati to WHO matini yo'o nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
ff: Min matiniɓe yo'o en fammi emmol amin do willolji be darnolji foti artira ɗum footay timmina kuɗe maɓɓe je ɓe hasdi do man e footay ɓe elta goɗɗo ngam o ɗaayini malla saanji ɗm.

en: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
ff: haa nder asawere je warango en tamman tokkitugo be sappinol Wikimania be kawtiroolji be ngewte ummatore wakkere feere.

en: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
ff: Tammunde yimɓe fu haa nder ummatore lesdi fu woni bana nyurmende ngam darnol amma seeyo ngam laɓɓinol be wawande do ummatoji maɓɓe, Wikimedia be feere.

en: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
ff: Tokkitugo, CRT ɗon huwa ngam wanginugo batakkewol do Meta-Wiki ngam hokkugo daaldal haa ummatore ngam fadugo sembe man e tokkitugo ngewte amin be maɓɓe.

en: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
ff: Wondugo do ko laarani COVID-19.

en: We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
ff: En neldan ewnanduji haa jaahargalji mooɗon Alaamisa je warango, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT ngam kawtal geeɓe je feerejo.

en: We’ll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
ff: En huwidan nder wakkati ndu ngam sendugo lartolji feere, jabba do emmolji mooɗon e majjina wakkati seeɗa ngewtidugo oya be oya.

en: We’re in this together and here to help however we can.
ff: Min ɗon ngondi nder man e en taski wallugo ko moy fu.

en: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
ff: haa wakkati feere, foti a tokkita heɓɓugo matinolji ngam email ndu be matinolji feere je kanduɗum je laarani COVID-19, do Office Wiki.

en: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
ff: CRT lartan batakeji ndu be matinolji fu haa baabe gooto.

en: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
ff: Min ɗon huwa bo'o ngam ngewteji je tumtum be geeɓe je wondi haa nder lesɗe je ɗon memmi masitin jonta.

en: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don’t hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
ff: To woodi emmol maa ɗon do jaahangal, kuɗe, kugal kanduɗum, malla larula ngam jokkitol, malla kuje feere je foti a mara haaje man, useni ta miije ngam matinugo e huwa be CRT.

en: We’re here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
ff: Min ɗon wondi ngam wallugo be hawtugo yimɓe to woodi haaje.

en: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
ff: To a woodi ngewte amana malla je ɗon kanduɗum, useni neldine email haa Bryan Judan - Ɗowuwo HR International Global Operations.

en: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
ff: Wala gooto haa cakka saanjolji ndu wangan bana accugol kugal amin malla kuɗe amin.

en: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
ff: Amma, laati bana aandinol yo'o haa wakkati nde, kugal amin be kuɗe amin sey wona lartama bana ko en meɗɗay sam.

en: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
ff: Ndu laati yaɓɓordeji je en tammi naffan nder wallugo oya be oya ngam heɓɓa tokkitugo huwugo, waallugo yahde amin be ko a mari haaje, be duniyaru fu be kuɗe je ɓe ɗn ndeni.

en: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
ff: Kuɗe amin je en waɗi jaahargal wondan nder reenugo amin haa wakkati man yotta.

en: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
ff: Jonta, laati wakkati wallugo oya be oya e heɓɓa daaldal ngam kugal kanduɗum je waratta haa nder asaweji e temma nder leeɓi je warango.

en: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
ff: Min mari haaje mon fu ngam heɓɓa kuje man yotta, nden kati min mari haaje mon fu ngam suklugo do mooɗon be calaaje mon ngam haa on wona jam haa wakkati je en ewnan mon.

en: Now, please -- wash your hands and don’t touch your face!
ff: Jonta, useni -- lalle juɗe mon e ta memme yeeso mooɗon!

en: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
ff: Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), be luttuɗum Geeɓe Ardugo (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, be Toby N).

en: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is the cause of COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019), a contagious respiratory disease that was first identified in December 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
ff: Viriis SARS-CoV-2 laati gilɗi je wadi COVID-19 (nyau koronaviriis 2019), nyau pofɗe je ɗon raɓɓa je tawama aranool man haa Desambre 2019, haa Wuhan, Hubei, Cayna.

en: The disease is a type of coronavirus, the same family that includes SARS, MERS, and some varieties of the common cold.
ff: Nyau ndu ɗon nder asngol koronaviriis, saare gooto be SARS, MERS, irin ndambaji feere-feere.

en: It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 11 March 2020.
ff: Matinama bana nyau duniyaru gal Geeɓe Jam ɓanndu Duniyaru (WHO) haa 11 Maars 2020.
