en: While much about COVID-19 is still unknown, preliminary data suggests that it is more virulent and contagious than the seasonal flu, and less virulent but more contagious than SARS and MERS.
ff: haa wakkati je kujeji jur COVID-19 aandakke, matinolji aranool ɗon sappina yo'o ɓuri nyaɗugo e raɓɓugo do ndamba wakkati, e lessi nyaɗugo amma ɓuri raɓɓugo do SARS be MERS.

en: Older people and those with underlying conditions are the most at risk of serious complications including death.
ff: Ndotti'en be ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau feere ɓuri marugo sababu nyaɗugo nyau be mayde.

en: Due to the spread of the disease, you are advised not to travel unless necessary, to avoid being infected, quarantined, or stranded by changing restrictions and cancelled flights.
ff: Ngam sankittol nyau, on feelama ngam ta on waɗa jaahangal sna to woodi naffuda, ngam tato on nanga nyau ndu, wonda siggito haa sera, malla majja gal saanjol haɗɗolji be darnol pireewolji.

en: Avoid crowded places whenever possible.
ff: Luttu wakkereji je ummatore ɗon mofti haa to to a foti.

en: This is not just to protect you, but also those you come in contact with.
ff: Ndu naa ngam fadugo mon tan, amma yimɓe je a ngidi be maɓɓe.

en: As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
ff: Bana ɗon salla, walla ko on majjinata jur ngam wondugo haa saare, ngam baabe ngilli ɗuɗɗum haa nder duniyaru ɗon maɓɓa dammuɗe maɓɓe ngam darnugo sankittol nyau ndu.

en: If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.
ff: To a mari haaje waɗugo jaahangal, hakkilu bana a wawi ngam nyauji feere: lallu juɗe maa be wakkati fu, ta memmu yeeso maaɗa, sondu e ɓislu do cakare jokke jungo maaɗa malla nder leepol, e luttu yimɓe je ɗon nyauɗo.

en: Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
ff: Hiddeko a waɗa jaahangal, jaangu ko ɗon matini do man dabareji do jaahangal ɗon saanja umtum haa nder duniyaru.

en: After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
ff: haa ɓaawo jaahangal lartu jam ɓanndu maaɗa e lartu wondugo haa sera be hoore maaɗa ngam ta a sallina nyau haa yimɓe feere.

en: Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.
ff: Hortol be pireewolji hoorugo yimɓe diga lesdi dayindi haa mootaji wakkereji ustotto malla darnotto fu haa nder lesɗe jur ngam emmolji be tawretaji ngomna'en.

en: Many international and regional borders are closed.
ff: Keerolji lesɗe be wakkereji ɗuɗɗum maɓɓotto.

en: If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
ff: To a wonday no saare, e to a ɗon woni haa nder lesdi feere, haɓdu wartugo law; ndu foti laati caɗɗungel ngam darnolji ɗon tokkita.

en: In some cases it may simply not be possible, even if you're healthy and meet the legal requirements for entry.
ff: haa yakke feere maa footay waɗa sam, ko to a ɗon woni jam e mari jarfuji nastugo nder lesdi man.

en: If you can't find a way back to your country, contact your nearest embassy or consulate for assistance.
ff: To footay a warta haa nder lesdi maaɗa, jokkitu fadawo malla ngomna lesdi mooɗon je ɗon ɓadi ngam wallende.

en: They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
ff: foti ɓe taska hortol, teffa pireewool je nastay no nder jaahargal, malla hokka maa ceede jaawal ngam haa a yoɓɓa hortol maaɗa.

en: In case they can't, make preparations in case you need to stay where you are for an extended period.
ff: To ɓe footay ngaɗa ndu, tasku to bana a yiɗi joɗɗugo haa wakkere je a ɗon wondi haa ton nder wakkati seeɗa.

en: If you do find a way back home, be prepared that it may be expensive, inconvenient, and have unusual restrictions (such as no checked baggage).
ff: To a taway dabare wartugo saare, taskittu ngam foti naawa, bila feecugo, e marugo haɗɗolji je on woway be man (bana kujeji maa lartay).

en: As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
ff: haa fuɗɗam Aviiril 2020, limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 ɓadi ni milionre.

en: Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
ff: Ko to nyau man fuɗɗi haa lesdi Cayna, sankitti haa nder duniyaru fu e Cayna ɗon mari nyauɓe je ɗon andi mari be mayɓe seeɗa tan do lesɗe feere.

en: Europe is the new epicenter of the pandemic.
ff: Erop laati ɓundu keese nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.
ff: Lesɗe fu sna ndego-ndego tan matini pettum man nyauɗo gooto, be limtol nyauɓe haa Lesɗe America, Spain, Italy, Jaamani, Faraansa, lesdi Cayna, Iran, be Lesɗe Inglisiya.

en: Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
ff: Sallinol haa wakkere wonotto haa nder lesɗe jur je yimɓe ɗon wondi jur haa wakkereji ndu haa nder duniyaru sna haa nder lesɗi je ɗon tardi be ndiyam haa Pacific.

en: (See updates from the WHO.)
ff: (Laru lartolji matinolji WHO)

en: The full extent of the spread is uncertain, due in part to limited testing.
ff: Fammugo sankittol nyau man footay aanda be fakatre, ngam lartolji je wonay jur.

en: Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.
ff: Lesɗe jur ɗon mari larulaaji ngam kujeji lartol ɗon timma, e yimɓe ngomna heɓɓay lartugo yimɓe fu je ɗon mari sababuji maungel, nden waɗi footay aanda limtol nyauɓe sna non ɓuran je ngomna'en ɗon hokka.

en: Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.
ff: Lesɗe bo'o ɗon feere-feere nder dabareji lartol be matinol, nden kadi foondolji limtolji nyauɓe je ɗon matini hallata tariya do noy nyau man yahidi haa nder wakkereji feere.

en: The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
ff: Viriis ndu ɗon salla gal tuɗe pofɗe be kujeji feere.

en: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
ff: Koronaviriis woni viriis je ɗon manga, bana wi'ugo yo'o wolwugo gonga sallay gal hendu: wondan haa nder daande gal tuɗe.

en: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
ff: Wondugo haa metaa ɗiɗi (kosɗe joowey e go'o) be yimɓe feere he'an ngam sallinol gal lawol ngel.

en: Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.
ff: Sallinol diga kujeji foti waɗa, bana sappinol, to goɗɗo ɓisli, memmi dammugal, e haa ɓaawo man yimɓe feere memmi dammungal ngel e memma yeeso maɓɓe fahin.

en: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
ff: Viriis SARS-CoV-2 foti neɓɓa do takkarde haa njamɗe 24 e do leeda ngam haa balɗe 3.

en: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
ff: Sallinol diga buuwe haa hunduko foti salla bo'o.

en: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
ff: Sappinolji ɗon wi'a yo'o COVID-19 ɗon raɓɓa ko to wala mandolji, nden kadi ndu lartotto haa deydey toy.

en: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
ff: Mandolji je ɓurna laarani wullol ɓanndu, sondaaru jorɓum, be tampere.

en: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
ff: Mandolji feere laarani pofɗe bana daran, huudure do daande, paɓɓooje, naawol ɓanndu, malla illol ndamba.

en: Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
ff: Nyauɓe feere ɗon mari mandolji je nyaɗay, bana ndamba.

en: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
ff: Nyaɗugo nyau man laarani pneumonia, nyau saɗirma nder pofɗe be kujeji ɓanndu je ɗon dara ko ɗon yara haa wade.

en: About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
ff: Deydey 80% nyauji ɗon mari mandolji je nyaɗa, be luttuɗum man foti timmina haa suudi lekki.

en: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
ff: Limtol mayde woni haa kunde 1-3% yimɓe je ɗon mari, ɓurna fu ndotti'en be nyauji feere.

en: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
ff: Limtol mayde yimɓe je ɓuri duuɓi 70 ɓuri amma je yimɓe je maray duuɓi 40 ɗon lessi.

en: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
ff: Yimɓe je ɗon mari sababu maungel be COVID-19 be mandolji je nyaɗum woni ndotti'en be yimɓe ɓanndu maɓɓe maray sembe malla mari nyauji feere bana nyau ɓernde, nyau sukkar, nyau illol iyam be sembe, nyau pofɗe je ɗon tokkitta, sankara.

en: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
ff: Nyauɓe je matinama limmay ɓikkon jur e ɓurna ɓe'en je ɗon be nyau man nyaday sam malla deydey ko do feere'en naangi pneumonia.

en: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
ff: Jemma be naange, huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu ɗon mari sababu je maungel to foondi be yimɓe feere be sammere nyau haa kunde huwooɓe be wakkereji jam ɓanndu.

en: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
ff: wakkati haa kunde wondugo be viriis be fuɗɗam mandolji (wakkati nuftol) ɗon haa cakka balɗe 2 be 14, ko to woodi no nyauɗo feere haa Cayna je mandolji nyau wangi haa ɓaawo balɗe 27.

en: As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
ff: haa Feviriye 2020, wakkati raɓɓol aandakke, amma laati kanduɗum to yimɓe sappinata mandolji nyau ndu.

en: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
ff: woodi sappinol sallinol diga yimɓe je maray mandolji, ko to ekkitol do ndu luggay sam nder teffol.

en: It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
ff: Laɓɓay to foti goɗɗo je meɗɗi raɓɓi viriis foti nanga nyau man fahin haa ɓaawo nyambittol.

en: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
ff: Sababuji je tolli yimɓe je nyamɓitti laɓɓay, amma woodi sappinol ustol sembe fuffu haa nyauɓe feere je nyamɓitti.

en: Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
ff: Lartol viriis ɓurna fu laarani kule hoosugo lekkuje je ɓe ɗon nastina gal kine malla gal daande je lartama haa nder suudu lartol ngam viriis.

en: The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
ff: "Dabare kanduɗum" lartol laarani wurtinol kujeji gene nder leeku e lartugo ndu ngam heɓɓugo toɓeji gene viriis je ɗon aandin.

en: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
ff: Wala lartol je ɗon sappina be fakatre wondugo viriis malla fadooɓe ɓanndu haa nder iyam ko to woodi lartolji do lawol.

en: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
ff: Wala lartol je sappinata fadol ngam viriis ndu.

en: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
ff: Ngomna'en jur haa nder lesdi feeli ummatore maɓɓe ta ɓe waɗa jaahangal je wala naffuda haa wakkati nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
ff: Geeɓeji jaahangalji ɗuɗɗum be caahuji siwtare ɗon walla mon be man ngam ɓe ɗon darna jaahangalji e ɗon ɓesda ceede hortol.

en: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
ff: Ɓurna bo'o lutte kombeewol ngilugo.

en: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
ff: Yimɓe je warti jaahangal be ɓe'en je mari nyauji feere ɗon mari sababu maungel e sey lutta jaahangal je laati sababu haa maɓɓe, bana jaahangal be pireewol haa lesdi dayindi, ngilli haa wakkereji je ɗon heewi be ummatore, e ɓurna fu kombeewolji, ko to haa yaasi wakkereji je nyau man memmi jur.

en: In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
ff: haa nder wakkereji je nyau man ɗon nyaɗi haa ton, ɓurna aandoɓe ɗon feela dayol ummatore.

en: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
ff: Ndu yiɗi wi'ugo ustugo hawtirdeji be yimɓe feere gal dayugo be kosɗe joowey go'o malla metaa ɗiɗi be luttugo geeɓeji ummatore.

en: Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
ff: Wakkereji feere ɗon jaɓɓa mofturdeji petpetel; feere'en ɗon haɗɗa mofturdeji fu.

en: Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
ff: Dabareje je a ɗon feeli ngam hoosugo woni huwugo diga saare to foti waɗa, luttugo mofturde yimɓebe luttugo wurtugo saare maa to wala uja feere je ɗon kanduɗum.

en: If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
ff: To a yiɗi wurtugo, wondugo pettum man metaa ɗiɗi (kosɗe ɗiɗi) be yimɓe feere.

en: In many places these measures are required.
ff: haa wakkereji jur dabareji ndu emmotto.

en: Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
ff: Tokkitu dabare laɓɓinol bana be aynol ndamba.

en: Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
ff: Lallu juɗe maa haa wakkati fu be sabulu e nduyam gulɗam, nden yoru ndu be leepol je ɗo laɓɓi.

en: As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
ff: Nde koronaviriisji laati viriisji je ɗon suddi, lallugo juɗe mooɗon be sabulu ɗon mbarda viriis ndu gal ɓoorugo laaral ɓanndu maaɗa je ɗon tardi be ɓeelere.

en: Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
ff: Lallugo juɗe be lawol man yiɗi yiggugo juɗe pettum man nder segonji 20.

en: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
ff: Yorugo juɗe mon je on lalli timmi be limse ɗon itta gilɗiji do ɓanndu mooɗon (ta juwinu yaɓɓorde man, e ta sendu leepol maa be gooɗo feere).

en: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
ff: To wala sabulu be ndiyam, hoosu kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe je on mari alkol >60%.

en: Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.
ff: Alkol laati mbarowo gilɗi je laugel, amma naa jonta-jonta, kanjuum bo'o sey ndeena sekoni 20 be yiggugo juɗe maaɗa, aandugo yo'o wala baabal je ɗon lutti do laaral ɓanndu maaɗa, e haa ɓaawo man sey a ndeena minti feere, heɓɓa alkol ndu yora fu.

en: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
ff: Ta memmu gite, kine be hunduko maaɗa be juɗe.

en: Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
ff: Yimɓe ɓurna fu ɗon memma yeeso maɓɓe haa minti seeɗa, haa nyalla fu.

en: Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
ff: Foondu waɗugo ndu, e foondu lallugo juɗe maa hiddeko a meema yeeso maaɗa.

en: Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
ff: Fahin bo'o, foondu ta memmu daaldalji, ta memmu ndu lau tawon, ta be jungo meere bo'o.

en: Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
ff: Sondu e ɓislu haa nder cakare jokke jungo maa malla haa nder leepol, e sakkinu leepol man e lallu juɗe maa.

en: Don't stand or sit near people who might be sick.
ff: Ta wondu malla joɗɗu haa koomɓe yimɓe je foti wona nyauɗo.

en: Stay at least one meter – and ideally two meters (six feet) – away.
ff: Wondu pettum man haa metaa gooto, sna non metaa ɗiɗi (kosɗe joowey e go'o), dayɗum.

en: As a quick way to eyeball this distance, imagine that you and the other person both reached your hands towards each other.
ff: Foondugo be gite foti ngaɗa, waɗu bana an be goɗɗo je wondi haa yeeso maa, ko moy furtini jungo maaɗa.

en: Could you touch the other person's hand without taking a step towards that person?
ff: foti a memma jungo mako to a waɗay yaɓɓorde gal yeeso naa?

en: If the answer is yes, then you're too close.
ff: To a jabbi oho, nden a ɗon ɓadi be mako.

en: Clean objects and surfaces that a lot of people touch, such as doorknobs, phones, and television remotes with regular household cleaner.
ff: Laɓɓinu kujeji be daaldalji je yimɓe jur memmi, bana juɗe dammuɗe, telefonji, be telekomandji tele be kuje laɓɓinugo saare.

en: Disinfect the surfaces with a suitable disinfectant, such as diluted household bleach.
ff: Laɓɓu daaldaji be kuje laɓɓugo je boɗɗe, bana wodezaavel.

en: Stay home when you are sick, and avoid contact with other people until your symptoms are gone.
ff: Joɗɗu haa saare to a saatay, e ta wondu be yimɓe feere sey to mandolji nyau ndu timmi fu.

en: Do not share personal items that come into contact with saliva, such as toothbrushes, eating utensils, drinks, water bottles, and towels.
ff: Ta sendu kujeji je hawti be tuɗe, bana kuje yiggugo ni'e, tassowo nyammugo, nyaarugo, koolobaji ndiyam, be leepolji be goɗɗo feere.

en: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
ff: Hoosugo nyiiri haa nder tassowa gooto be sokkali, leegal haa Cayna, maɗɗa sam.

en: Greet people without touching them.
ff: Sanu yimɓe bila memmugo ɓe.

en: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
ff: Luttu harlolji, muɗɗugo hunduko, sanugo be juɗe, hawtugo juɗe, malla hawtugo feere.

en: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
ff: To footay waɗa on hawta be yimɓe, nden lallu juɗe maa hiddeko e haa ɓaawo man.

en: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
ff: Fadata maa ngam koronaviris, amma fadante ngam ndamba, je sababu nangugo ndu ɓuri je COVID-19 haa wakkereji jur.

en: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
ff: Ndu ɗon hisaa maa ngam nummolji bana to a nangi ndamba a tamman yo'o ɗum koronaviriis.

en: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
ff: To a ndottijo malla a ɗon nder geeɓe yimɓe je ɗon mari sababu e a foti hoosugo baatal pneumonia, hoosu baatal man.

en: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
ff: Fadata maa ngam gilɗi pneumonia be viriis je COVID-19, amma nyauɓe COVID-19 feere maayi ngamm bakteriyaji pneumonia je raɓɓi fuffu maɓɓe je maray no sembe timmi, ngam man kadi baatal pneumonia foti hisaa yonki mooɗon.

en: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
ff: Watugo leepol suddugo yeeso feelama haa yimɓe je bana mari nyau ndu be yimɓe ɗon wondi be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau.

en: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
ff: Ko laarani ɓe'en je sappinatta mandolji, WHO feelay leepolji suddugo yeeso, ko to ngomna'en lesɗe feere ɗon ngaɗa ndu.

en: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
ff: Wondugo irin leepolji suddugo yeeso feere ɗon feelama haa lesɗe be berniji feere bana dabareji ustugo sallinol haa kunde ummatore.

en: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
ff: haa nder duniyaru fu, woodi ustol leepolji suddugo yeeso haa do lumo.

en: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
ff: To a ɗon ɓorni leepol suddugo yeeso, ɓornu ɗum be boɗɗum.

en: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
ff: Leepol suddugo yeeso ndu sey sudda kine be hunduko maa bila accugo baabal.

en: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
ff: Lallu juɗe maa hiddeko ɓornugo mask e ta memmu mask to a ɓorni ɗum timmi.

en: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
ff: To a memmi ɗum, lallu juɗe maa lau haa ɓaawo man.

en: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
ff: To leepol suudugo yeeso soffi, ittu e saanju ɗum

en: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
ff: Ittu ndu gal ɓaawo, sakkinu ɗum, haa ɓaawo man lallu juɗe maaɗa.

en: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
ff: Sifturu yo'o leepolji suddugo yeeso yiɗa wi'ugo ta on laɓɓina: tokkitu lallugo juɗe haa wakkati fu.

en: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
ff: Ta moftu maskji haa suudu to a maray haaje man.

en: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
ff: Ustol maskji yiɗi wi'ugo yo'o huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu ɗon mari saɗirma keɓɓugo maskji, je ɗon wata ko moy fu nder sababu.

en: That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
ff: Ndu laarani ordoji N95, je feelakke ngam ummatore, ndu woni kujeji huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu je wondan je maɓɓe ngam huwidugo be man.

en: Leave them for healthcare workers.
ff: Acce ɗum haa huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu.

en: Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
ff: Luttu wakkereji je ɗon mofti ummatore, ɓurna bo'o wakkereji je ɗon maɓɓi e hendu salla haa ton boɗɗum, bana hawtirolji, sappinolji, cuuɗi sippol maungel, hortol ummatore, be deewalji dina'en.

en: Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
ff: Kuɗe je laarani mofturde yimɓe jur, diga ngilli dina'en haa mofturde gimmolji, darnotto haa nder duniyaru fu, ngam dabare darnugo sankittol viriis.

en: Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
ff: Baabe ngilli, filuji, hortolji foti maɓɓa, ɓurna fu haa nder lesɗe je ɗon mari nyau man.

en: Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
ff: Kuɗe feere je darnama, bana sappinolji, kuɗe espor, be jaangirdeji, sey sallotto do hawo, je yiɗi wi'ugo foti a waɗa malla lara ndu bila jaahangal.

en: At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
ff: haa baabe sippugo neebam/kalanjiir, huwe be kujeji suddugo juɗe e laɓɓine ɗum be kuje laɓɓugo to a foti.

en: After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
ff: To a hebbini, laɓɓinu juɗe maa be kuje laɓɓugo juɗe.

en: The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
ff: Ngomna'en Lesɗe America be Kanada ɗon feela luttugo jaahangal be kombeewol ngilli.

en: Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
ff: Nyauji ɗon sankitta law do man, be suklare do jam ɓanndu.

en: Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
ff: haa cakka nyau je salli do kombeewal ngilli, wondugo haa sera be jippinugo yimɓe ɗon saɗi ngam yimɓe ɗuɗɗi nder ton.

en: Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
ff: Ko kombeewolji ngilli je maray nyauɗo je ɗon andi ɓe sallini ɓe jarfuye jippol ngam hullol viriis, be sababu je salli be Diamond Princess haa Japan, je mari no nyau

en: If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
ff: To a tammi foti a raɓɓi nyau, ewnu suudu lekki malla kuɗe jaawal jam ɓanndu do yahugo be hoore maaɗa ngam ta a raɓɓa yimɓe feere.

en: Mention your symptoms and travel history.
ff: Matinu mandolji nyu maa be tariya jaahangal maa.

en: Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
ff: Watu mask jam ɓanndu e tokkitu mandolji yimɓe ngomna be jam ɓanndu.

en: See also: Flight and health
ff: Laru bo'o: Fiirol be jam ɓanndu

en: On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
ff: haa nder pireewol, tokkitu irin dabare laɓɓinol ndu bana haa toy fu: lallu juɗe maa haa wakkati fu, malla kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe je mari alkol to a feecay ummugo do koorowal maaɗa, e ta memmu yeeso maaɗa.

en: Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
ff: Teffooɓe tawi yo'o sallooɓe je wondi haa dammuɗe ɗon mari sababu je lessi ngam hawtugo be nyauɓe.

en: Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
ff: Suɓɓe jonde haa dammugal, e ta wancu nder pireewol haa wakkati fiirol.

en: After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
ff: haa ɓaawo lallugo juɗe mooɗon e hiddeko on joɗɗa, hoose leepolji ustugo ngam laɓɓinugo wakkere je ɗon tardi koorowal.

en: Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
ff: Ustu daaldalji, to koorowal maa ɗon be laaral you foti usta ndu bo'o.

en: Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
ff: Ta ustu koorowal limse, ngam sofnol foti wartira sallinol koyɗum.

en: When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
ff: haa wakkati huwidugo be kuje ustugo, tokkitu matinolji je ɗon windi do ɓaawo man.

en: And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
ff: E siftoru yo'o, viriisji ɗon nasta gal hunduko, kine, be gite, ustugo wakkere nawata, amma wonay bana ko ɗon woylatta laɓɓinol.

en: Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
ff: Lallu juɗe maaɗa e ta memmu yeeso maaɗa.

en: And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
ff: E hoosu leepol ngam memmugo telefon malla kujeji ordo feere.

en: When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
ff: haa wakkati yahugo haa gaɗɗa suudu, hoosu takkarde gaɗɗa suudu ngam maɓɓugo ndiyam be maɓɓitugo dammugal, haa ɓaawo man sakkinu ɗum.

en: Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
ff: Fiirolji haa wakkereji je ɗon memmi ɗon waɗa yaɓɓordeji ngam ustugo sallinol heɓɓa sallooɓe wonda jam.

en: For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
ff: Bana sappinol, foti en ɓesda laɓɓinol wakkere haa wakkati fu, je hokkatta jarfuye haa sukloɓe do jam ɓanndu ɓorna maskji, e je hokkata nyamdu je taskama timmi do nyamɗe je ɓe wulli tan.

en: If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).
ff: To geeɓe sallooɓe ɗon salla diga wakkere je ɗon mari nyau ndu be sembe, huwooɓe piirol ndu foti watta ɓe haa sera dayi be sallooɓe feere (e to ɗon warta no wakkere je ɗon sababu jur, matine huwooɓe piirol ngam majuum).

en: You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
ff: foti ɓe haɗɗa maa ngam saanjogo koorowal haa nder pireewol.

en: This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
ff: Ndu bana, to goɗɗo haa nder pireewol ndu woni bana mari nyau, yimɓe nomna foti lorta ngam teffugo yimɓe je wondi no be mako ngam lartugo ɓe malla wondugo haa sera.

en: COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
ff: COVID-19 hurgotto gal ustugo manndolji be aynugo saɗirmaji.

en: There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
ff: Wala baatal malla hurgol je feerejo je hurgatta koronaviriis keese ndu.

en: Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
ff: Teffol ngam baatal malla lekki je foti hurga ɗum ɗon do lawol.

en: There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
ff: woodi foondolji feere-feere be lekki HIV be lekki je mbaratta viriisji feere ngam hugugo COVID-19.

en: Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
ff: Mandolji je deydey tan foti ustama gal hoosugo paracetamol (acetaminophen).

en: If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
ff: To a mari COVID-19, lesɗeji wattan mon haa sera haa lartolji do mooɗon je ɗon tokkiti sappina yo'o on maray nyau ndu.

en: If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
ff: To wondi no be goɗɗo je mari nyau COVID-19, lesɗe jur wattan mon haa sera nder balɗe 14 diga ragare wakkati sababu e ayna mon to on sappinan mandolji nyau man.

en: Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
ff: Lesɗe feere lartan mon bo'o ko to on maray mandolji nyau.

en: In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.
ff: haa nder lesɗe ɗuɗɗum, dabare jam ɓanndu ɓesdama haa gaɗɗa e waɗa yo'o footay maa ɓe jaɓɓitta limtol nyauɓe tan, woodi sa'a je ɓa salla hurgugo mon ngam wala yimɓe jam ɓanndu je foti sukla do mooɗon, kujeji be ordoji.

en: Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
ff: Lesɗe jur maɓɓi malla usti fiirolji, kombeewalji, be ta'ittugo keerolji be ɗuɗɗum, ɓurnaa fu yahugo be wurtugo wakkereji je ɗon mari nnau ndu.

en: Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.
ff: Lesɗe jur usti malla darni nastirde yimɓe jaahangal je yotti, gal haɗɗugo nastugo (temma be sa'a haa yimɓe lesdi malla je maru jarfuye wondugo haa lesdi ndi) malla emman non ngam wondugo sera, ɓurna fu haa nder balɗe 14.

en: Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
ff: Ko to wondugo sera wonay dole, foti a emmotto a wona sera "be hoore maa" gal wondugo haa saare e a wala fottugo be yimɓe feere.

en: The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
ff: Darnollji je ɓuri tullugo ɗon do yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal be ɓaawo ndu haa nder wakkereji je ɗon mari nyau, amma bo'o lessɗe jur ɗon ɓesda wattugo ndu haa sallooɓe je ɗon nsata.

en: Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
ff: Lesɗe feere haɗɗi hoɗɓe fu malla ɓurna fu ngam nastugo malla usti dabare yimɓe lesdi be wondooɓe dila.

en: What are the affected areas?
ff: Wakkere toy laati ɗon raɓɓi?

en: Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
ff: To, kuje man je ɗon sanja be lau ndu, be kala lesdi/wakkere/geeɓe ɗn mari wakkereji je ɗon mari darnolji.

en: The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
ff: Berniwol Wuhan laati haa do limtol ko moy fu be lesdi Cayna ɓurna fu.

en: Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
ff: Wakkereji feere laarani: Faraansa, Jaamani, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, Lesɗe Inglisiya, Lesɗe America, Wakkere Schengen fu, haa yakke feere be feere'en.

en: Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
ff: Lesɗe feere jo'ini darnolji do wonde jeeya

en: A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
ff: Limtol nastirde je ɗon darni wondi haa IATA.

en: It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.
ff: Larnay darnolji fu, amma ɗon naffa bo'o.

en: Keep up to date—the outbreak and the travel restrictions are changing rapidly.
ff: Famme bo'o wakkati, nyau be darnolji do jaahangal ɗon saanje law.

en: For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.
ff: Ngam waɗɗugo jaahande haa nder balɗe je warango, numme do wa

en: Avoid buying tickets with a connection in an affected area – even changing planes can make you subject to restrictions.
ff: Ta sodde batakkewol jaahangal gal wakkere je ɗon mari nyau, ko saanjol pireewolji maa foti mara darnolji.

en: Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.
ff: Fiirolji foti willake be batakkewol seeɗa ni, to ngam sankittol nyau be dabareji nastirde je ɗon saanja tum, malla ngam yimɓe seeɗa tan ɗon fiira e geeɓeji hortolji ɗon mari larulaaji hebbinugo pireewol.

en: You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
ff: foti bo'o ɓe ɗaayina mon nder njamɗe haa yottol ngam lartol wullol ɓanndu be laahalji e ɗereji, malla bo'o watta mon haa sera nder asawere ɗiɗi.

en: Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.
ff: Taske ngam foti jaahargal jaahangal mooɗon darnotto, bana to on ɗon wurta haa lesdi feere.

en: Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.
ff: Ko to on meeɗay wondugo haa wakkere je ɗon mari nyau woodi sababu joɗɗugo haa wakkere ndu he gaɗɗa ko on hasdi to a don nder suudu be goɗɗo malla dabare hortol be mo je ɗon mari nyau.

en: For example, in late February an Italian doctor on vacation in Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) was diagnosed with COVID-19, and as a result all the guests in the hotel he stayed at were quarantined.
ff: Bana sappinol, haa ragare Feviriye woodi lekkitajo Itali feere do siwtare haa Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) je larti bana mari nyau COVID-19, e bana ni yimɓe fu je wondi haa hotel mako jooɗi fu haa sera.

en: Lockdowns and other internal restrictions
ff: Wondugo haa saare be darnolji je nder feere

en: Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.
ff: Lesɗe feere be wakkereji, ɓurna fu je nyau man nyaɗi haa ton , ɗon wangina wondugo haa saare be darnolji ngam jaawal do wancuru be kuɗe ummatore, ko je yimɓe je wurtay yaasi neeɓay sam.

en: These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.
ff: Ndu laarani nastinol aynolji haa keerol, darnolji do jaahangal nder lesdi, maɓɓol malla ustol kuɗe cuuɗi yamɗe malla cuuɗi kugal, darnol kuɗe ummatore ngam wurtugo saare sna to woodi naffuda uja man.

en: Beyond government restrictions, individual establishments are shutting their doors and cancelling events to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
ff: haa ɓaawo darnolji ngomna, cuuɗi kugal feerejo maɓɓotto dammuɗe maɓɓe be darnugo kuɗe ngam ustugo sankittol viriis.

en: In China, there are extensive restrictions on transportation and activity, which vary widely by province, city, and even by district or village.
ff: haa Cayna, woodi darnolji ɗuɗɗum do hortol br kujeji, je ɗon saanja be lamarorde, berniwol e be distrik malla wuro fu.

en: Many governments recommend against traveling to China at this time.
ff: Ngomna'en jur ɗon feela ta on waɗa jaahangal haa Cayna.

en: If you have no choice, do your research and get up-to-date information about the local situation wherever you are going.
ff: To a wala dabare feere, waɗu teffol e hoosu matinolji je jonta do ko ɗon salla haa nder wakkere man ko toy fu je a ɗon yaha.

en: People who have traveled to Hubei face particularly severe restrictions.
ff: Yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal haa Hubei ɗon mari haɗɗolji je ɓuri tullugo.

en: Examples of restrictions that you may encounter in some parts of China (this is not an exhaustive list):
ff: Sappinolji haɗɗolji je foti on heɓɓa haa wakkere Cayna feere (ndu limtay fu haa do bo'o):

en: 14-day quarantine, self-quarantine, or COVID-19 test upon arrival from other parts of China or from other countries, at your expense
ff: Wondugo haa sera haa nder balɗe 14, wondugo haa sera be hoore mooɗon, malla lartol COVID-19 haa yottol mooɗon to on ummi wakkereji Cayna feere malla lesɗe feere, je nyau man woni haa ton, be ceede maaɗa.

en: questions about your travel and medical history (lying can get you years in prison)
ff: emmolji do tariya jaahangal maaɗa be jam ɓanndu maaɗa (feewugo go hoora maa haa nder suudu fursina e salla duuɓi haa ton)

en: mandatory registration using an online or paper form
ff: windugo inde je dole gal hawo malla do batakkewol

en: requirement to wear a face mask in public
ff: ewnandu ngam ɓornugo mask suudugo yeese haa cakka ummatore

en: people who have been outside of China within 14 days not allowed into public places like malls
ff: yimɓe je wondi haa yaasi Cay nder balɗe 14 wala jarfuye wondugo haa wakkere ummatore bana suddu filu je manga

en: shops only accept mobile payments, not cash
ff: sey sodda kujeji gal ordo, ceede jaɓɓatakke

en: restaurants, transportation and other establishments refusing service to non-Chinese citizens
ff: cuuɗi nyamɗe, hortol be cuuɗi kuɗe feere wallatta yimɓe feere je wonay jeeyaɓe Cayna

en: many forms of transportation reduced or shut down
ff: dabareji horol ɗuɗɗum usti malla maɓɓi

en: mandatory real-name registration for public transit cards
ff: windugo inde be dule ngam karte sallugo ummatore

en: access in and out of a town, village, or city completely blocked
ff: nastol be wurtol berniwol, wuro, malla berni darnakke fu

en: non-resident visitors prohibited from entering apartment complexes
ff: ngilloɓe je wonday haa lesdi ndu haɗɗakke ngam nastugo haa cuuɗi feere

en: only allowed to go outside once every two days to get supplies
ff: mari jarfuye wurtugo nde gooto haa nder balɗe ngam soddugo kujeji

en: businesses, activities, and attractions closed
ff: filuji, kuɗe, wakkereji ngilli maɓɓakke

en: businesses need local government permission to re-open
ff: filuji yiɗi jarfuye ngomna ngam maɓɓitugo

en: restaurants (if they are even open) require a minimum distance between customers
ff: cuuɗi nyamɗe (to ɗon maɓɓiti maa) sey soddooɓe daaya oya be oya

en: selling substandard face masks has a maximum sentence of life imprisonment
ff: sippugo maskji je wonday kanduɗum foti yara dangay haa maya haa ton

en: As of mid-March 2020, Europe is the epicenter of the epidemic, and many European countries have closed their borders to international travel - only border commuters and freight are allowed to cross.
ff: haa cakare Maars 2020, Erop woni ɓundu nyau ndu, be lesɗe Erop ɗuɗɗum maɓɓi keerolji maɓɓe ngam jaahangal diga lesdi feere, sna huwooɓe je wala keerol be pireewol feerejo foti salla.

en: Also businesses other than food stores and pharmacies are closed, and public transport has been reduced or stopped.
ff: Filuji je wonday cuuɗi nyamɗe be je sippol lekki maɓɓakke, hortol ummatore ustakke malla darnakke.

en: In the worst affected countries including Italy, Spain and France, lockdowns like in China in January, have been implemented.
ff: haa lesɗe je nyau ndu tulli memmugo bana Italy, Spain be Faraansa, wondugo saare bana je Cayna haa Zaanviye ndu, ɗon wondi jonta.

en: As well the EU has closed its outer borders.
ff: EU bo'o maɓɓi keereolji maaɗa je yaasi.

en: COVID-19 is prevalent also in North America.
ff: COVID-19 woni bo'o haa Woila America.

en: The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).
ff: Keereolji haa kunde Kanada, Lee America, be Mexico maɓɓakka haa jaahangalji je wonay kanduɗum, e haa nder wakkereji ɗuɗɗum haɗɗol do moftudeji jur ɗon wondi (bana wi'ugo wakkereji bana cuuɗi nyamɗe maɓɓakke, be kuɗe maɓɓakke).

en: Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
ff: Lesɗe, lamorde, be wakkereji jur wurtini tawretaji do wondugo haa saare je yiɗi filuji je wonday kanduɗum maɓɓakke.

en: With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
ff: Be fiirolji jur willakke, hakkiloji je wurti, darnolji je ɗon hasdi, jaahangal haa wakkati koronaviriis foti lata saɗirma.

en: Some routes are not possible.
ff: Laabi feere maa footay waɗa.

en: Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
ff: Feere maran haaje jokkitolji je hannay do ko ɗon no salla tum, darnolji ɗum be ndeenolji jur haa kunde pireewolji.

en: In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
ff: haa wakkere feere yiɗi wi'ugo ceede jaahangal ɗon saɗɗi masitin.

en: On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
ff: haa wakkere feere, kubar mbelka laati fiirolji ɗuɗɗum saɗɗay do je tumtum ngam emmolji usti, e woodi sa'a maungel je a foti keeɓa koorowal je wala goɗɗo haa sera maaɗa.

en: Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
ff: Waɗa jokkitolji maaɗa ɓesda wakkati, ɓurna to wurtugo pireewol lesdi feere ngam nastugo pireewol lesdi e ɓurna to jaahangal maaɗa laarani lesdi je ɗon memmi be gonga.

en: Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
ff: Lartolji, aynolji wullol ɓanndu, batakkaji feere, be ndeenolji foti ɓesda mintiji malla njamɗe hiddeko a mara jarfuye tokkitinugo jaahangal maaɗa.

en: You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
ff: foti saɗɗa a heɓɓa soddugo ɗerewol jaahangal wurtugo malla nastugo wakkere je woodi hakkilolji be darnolji jur.

en: This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
ff: Ndu laati larula manga to a yiɗi wurtugo wakkere je ɗon memmi.

en: For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
ff: Bana sappinol, ɗowirɗeji jur sippata ɗerewol jaahangal ummugo Cayna ngam yahugo Lesdi America (ngam sallugo do'ugo do haɗɗolji malla ngam ndeenugo pireewol sallooɓe haa yaasi).

en: To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
ff: Soddugo ɗerewol jaahangal bana ndu, foti sey a ewna ɗowirɗe pireewol ndu malla huwida be ɗowirɗe je aandakke jur.

en: Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.
ff: Dabare feere bo'o laati soddugo ɗereji jaahangal feere-feere ɗiɗi (bana sappinol, ɗerewol wurtol Cayna haa Cambodiya e ɗiɗaɓool man bo'o diga Cambodiya haa Lesɗe America), amma hakkilu ngam ta ɓe sigga maa haa sera malla majjina kujeji maaɗa.

en: Connecting flights can be a problem.
ff: Jokkitugo pireewolji foti wona larula.

en: The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
ff: Sababu ɗaaggugo haa nder berniwol jokkittol ɓuri do ko wowi jonta, ngam ɗaayolji aynol be lartol be darnolji je ɗon waagare.

en: Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.
ff: Jokkitugo haa nder wakkere je ɗon mari nyau foti yotta haa darnolji nastirde haa yakke feere, e to woni no haa nder wakkere je ɗon mari nyau neeɓay haa nder lesɗe feere footay hokka maa jarfuye saanjugo pireewolji.

en: On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
ff: haa do jaahangalji feere woodi sababu wondugo haa sera haa wakkere feere do lawol.

en: So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
ff: Nden kadi soddu ɗerewol pireewol je yahatta ciir, e to waɗatakke, nummu boɗɗum don toy foti a jokkita.

en: In uncertain times, plans can change.
ff: haa wakkati je aandakke, jaahargalji foti saanja.

en: Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
ff: Fadoɓe lesdi malla ngomna lesdi haa do lesdi feere jur wartiri huwooɓe je maray kugal jur, e ɓe'en feere darni kugal man gabbaa.

en: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
ff: Wallende jaawal sey wonda, ko to foti a ngamna lesdi maaɗa je ɗon haa lesdi feere ko to je wakkere maaɗa don maɓɓi.

en: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.
ff: To a ɗon no jooɗi ngam nyau duniyaru ndu, ngomna lesdi maaɗa haa lesdi feere je ɗon ɓadi foti walla maa nder heɓɓugo pireewol wartugo saare, taska ceede jaawal ngam heɓɓa a sodda ɗerewol jaahangal, malla wurtina passport jaawal.

en: At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
ff: Pettum man bo'o, foti ɓe hokka maa matinol do ko ɗon salla jonta haa nder wakkere e matina mon do dabareji be darnolji jaahangal je ɓe wurtini.

en: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
ff: Kuɗe ngomna lesdi haa lesdi feere je tumtum bana laahal wurtinugo visa be passport foti darnotto malla ustotto haa haaje jaawal, do wakkere be ngomna lesdi man.

en: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
ff: Ko to yimɓe feere ɗon ewna nyau man "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Nyau Wuhan", malla "viriis Cayna", ewnugo bana ni laati bana lasɓinol asngol haa Cayna be haa gite je jippi haa asli Cayna.

en: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
ff: laati kooyɗum ewnugo nyau man bana "Wuhan pneumonia" malla "viriis Cayna" haa wakkereji bana Hong Kong be Taiwan.

en: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
ff: Ngam wondugo jam, ngewte be wolde je umminata hakkilo to bana yiɗi wolwugo do nyau, bana "COVID-19", "Koronaviriis keese" malla bo'o "viriis" malla "nyau duniyaru".

en: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
ff: haa lesɗe je ɗon laffi masin ɓurna fu je yimɓe ngomna ɗon ayna wala aandal boɗɗe, ɗowitinugo tawreta je wala wurtugo, wonde malla wala wurtugo saare ɗon laati bana haɓre, e ɗon waɗa sembe je hannay do ummatore haa yakke feere.

en: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
ff: Heeɗite tawretaji ndu, e lutte mofturde ummatore.

en: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
ff: Bana sappinol nyau koronaviriis, gaanyo be hoɗɓe ummi haa lesɗe jur, aranool amma naa kanjum tan ɗon laarani yimɓe je ɗon naandi yimɓe Cayna.

en: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
ff: woodi larulaaji ngam asgnol jur je ummiki haa nder duniyaru do yimɓe je ummi gal Funaange Asia, haa ɓurna berniji bana New York, London be San Francisco.

en: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
ff: haa Hong Kong, Sinophobia, je ɗon no woni jur timmi, ɓesdi be wangirde nyau duniyaru ndu, be sappinolji je cuuɗi filu be cuuɗi nyamɗe suklata do yimɓe lesdi Cayna e ɗon farta ngewtooɓe wolde Mandarin (sna yimɓe Taiwan tan).

en: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
ff: Yahde gaanyol hoɗɓe ɓesdi bo'o haa Funaange Asia, be cuuɗi nyamɗe be filuji feere haa Japan be Cayna je ɗon salla suklugo do soddooɓe lesdi feere.

en: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
ff: haa Cayna, woodi larulaaji do hoɗɓe je ɓe sallini ɓe suudu gal huwooɓe hotelji, yimɓe je ummi lesdɗe feere, ɓurna fu ɓaaleɓe, je ɓe wurtini ɓe be sembe haa nder saare maɓɓe do hasduye marɗo saare.

en: Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
ff: Matinolji feere do nyau koronaviriis laarani:

en: The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
ff: Ɗowirɗeji Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesɗe America

en: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (daily updates)
ff: Ɗowirɗeji Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesɗe Erop (matinolji lartama tum)

en: United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
ff: Ngomna Lesɗe Inglisiya, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers

en: An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
ff: Karte be sappinol je ɗon woni do internati gal John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering ɓe matinolji lartotto do gite mon

en: Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
ff: Batakkewol darnolji nastirde IATA beThe New York Times

en: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
ff: woodi ngewteji do matinolji be tufle kalluɗum do viriis ɗon salla do internati be feere maa gal yimɓe ngomna, nden kadi sey on hakkila be moy hokki mon matinolji ndu.

en: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
ff: Famme bo'o to matinolji be feeloji fu je on keɓi feelama gal lekkitoɓe be teffoɓe je ɗon andi mari aandal .

en: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
ff: haa nder larula, laati kanduɗum teffugo fammugo matinolji keese, amma wonan bo'o kanduɗum haa jam hakkilo mooɗon larta matinolji je naffata on, o teffe matinolji je wurti gal hunduko je ɗon mari amana.

en: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
ff: To a ɗon no lara matinolji nde ɗiɗi haa nder balɗe, nden kadi joɗɗidu do jaahargal ndu e suklu do waɗɗugo kuje feere, do tokkitugo larugo matinolji haa nder njamɗe 24.

en: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
ff: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) laati neeɓam je ɗon wondi gal yaasi daaldal (laaral cellji) cellji haa nder fuffu, laabi iyam, ɓernde, ɓooye, be teetekki.

en: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
ff: ACE2 ɗon haɗɗa kugal ko laarani neebam waylittol angiotensin (ACE) gal ustugo yahde angiotensin-II be ɓesdugo Ang(1-7) je ɗon wartira ɗum bana lekki je foti naffa nder hurgol nyauji ɓernde. ACE2 bo'o laati bana dammugal haa nder cellji haa koronaviriisji feere.

en: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
ff: Neebam je neɗɗo ɓurna fu ewnotto bana hACE2.

en: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
ff: Neebam 2 je ɗon waylitta Angiotensin laati metalloenzyme je ɗon mari zinc e ɗon woni haa do endothelial be cellji feere.

en: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
ff: ACE2 protein ɗon mari N-terminal peptidase M2 domain be C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.

en: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
ff: ACE2 is laati nastirde woore type I membrane protein, je ɗon mari neebam je ɗon huwa e ɗon woni do cellji haa nder fuffu be kujeji feere.

en: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
ff: Domain ACE2 je gal yaasi cell ɗon ta'i be transmembrane domain gal neebam feere je mbiyotto bana sheddase, be proteinji je ɗon ɗiggi ɗon ila nder iyam e haa ragare man wurtan gal ciile.

en: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
ff: ACE2 ɗon wondi haa ɓurna kujeji ɗaandu: ACE2 ɗon hawti be laaral cell je fuffu je ɓurna cellji type II alveolar, enterocytes teetekki je peetel, ceelji arterial be venous endothelial be cellji arterial smooth muscle haa ɓurna kujeji ɓanndu.

en: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
ff: Jaangirde ACE2 mRNA tawama bo'o haa nder cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, be ɗaaɗon ngaandi.

en: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
ff: Aranool kugal ACE2 laati bana counter balance haa ACE.

en: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting angiotensin II.
ff: ACE ɗon wartira hormone angiotensin I do vasoconstricting angiotensin II.

en: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
ff: ACE2 kanjuum bo'o ɗon wartira carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine diga angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) do vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

en: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
ff: ACE2 foti bo'o wartira lamba peptidji feere bana [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, be ghrelin.

en: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
ff: ACE2 bo'o ɗon mo'ina laaral roondoowo neutral amino acid SLC6A19 e laati bana ɗaaɗol nyau Hartnup.

en: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
ff: Bana transmembrane protein, ACE2 laati bana dammugal woore haa nder cellji koronaviriisji feere, bana HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (viriis je wangini COVID-19).

en: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
ff: Laɓɓinugo bo'o, hawtirde spike S1 protein je SARS-CoV be SARS-CoV2 haa enzymatic domain ACE2 do cellji latan endocytosis be translocation viriisji ɗiɗi ndu be neebam do endosomeji je ɗon wondi haa nder cellji.

en: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
ff: Nastirde ndu yardi fuɗɗorde S protein gal jaɓɓowo serine protease TMPRSS2, je ilam man ɗon do teffol bana dabare hurgol. Ndu waɗi en tammi yo'o ustol yahdeji ACE2, haa nder cellji, foti naffa ngam hurgol nyau ndu.

en: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
ff: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.

en: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
ff: Lartol fu be laritolji ekkitolji fu je wangi haa 11 Zwiiye 2012, tawi yo'o "huwugo be of ACE inhibitors hawti no be ustol 34% sababu pneumonia foondi be aynolji."

en: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
ff: Fahin bo'o, "sababu pneumonia usti haa nyauɓe je hurgotto be ACE inhibitors je ɗon no mari sababu maungel raɓɓugo pneumonia, ɓurna fu haa ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau illol iyam be semɓe be nyau ɓernde.

en: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
ff: Hoosugo ACE inhibitors hawti bo'o be ustol mayde gal pneumonia, ko to sappinolji lessi do sababu pneumonia fu".

en: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
ff: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) woni bana hurgol keese ngam huudure do fuffu je nyaɗay, e bana ɗon hokka sembe haa iyam nder fuffu be hebbinol hendu haa ɓikkon gaduji je ɓe tuffini ɓe gilɗi nyau pofɗe je laarani lipopolysaccharide.

en: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
ff: Reeta yonki rhACE2 haa neɗɗo woni gal njamɗe 10 e fuɗɗam kugal laati minti 30 be ɓedugo haa yahde sababu (wakkati) haa nder njamɗe 24.

en: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
ff: Sappinolji jur ɗon feela yo'o rhACE2 foti wona lekki kanduɗum haa yimɓe je footay jaɓɓa classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) malla haa nyauji je angiotensin II ɗon wa'i. rhACE2 je ɓe tuffi lartama haa nder lartolji suudu lekki ngam hurgol nyau saɗirma nder pofɗe.

en: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).
ff: Koronaviriis je naandi SARS b'Bat WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), je ɓe ɗon ewna haa yakke feere koronaviriis je naandi SARS WIV1, woni asngol koronaviriis (SARSr-CoV) je ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe je nyaɗum je tawama haa nder bilwili je naandi paɗɗe puccu (Rhinolophus sinicus) Cayna.

en: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
ff: Bana naandi koronaviriisji fu, ɓiɓe viriisji mari kosngal RNA woore tan je ɗon suudi haa nder suudu feere.

en: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
ff: Tawol ɗon sappina yo'o bilwili on woni ɓundu SARS-CoV.

en: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
ff: Lartol asngol gene ɗon sappina dabare sallinol SARS diga bilwili haa goɗɗo bila sallugo gal patuuji Cayna bana cakare suudu, bana ɗon tammi haa aran.

en: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
ff: b'COVID-19 apps woni applicasionji je ɓe wurtini ngam wallugo teffugo yimɓe bana jabbuye do nyau koronaviriis 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, bana wi'ugo laahal maandugo yimɓe ("ngidooɓe") je foti wondi no be goɗɗo je ɗon mari nyau.

en: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
ff: Applikasionji jur wangi malla ɗon feeli, be wallende ngomna be hoore mako haa nder wakkareji be lamordeji feere.

en: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
ff: Sappinolji dabare wanginugo applikasionji tawtol wurtama.

en: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
ff: larulaaji ngam amana wangi no'o, ɓurna fu do dabareji je ɗon wondi do tawtugo wakkere jonde yimɓe je ɗon huwa be applikasionji ndu.

en: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
ff: Dabareji je lessi sappinugo matinolji do goɗɗo ɗon huwa be mandolji Bluetooth ngam hoosugo ɓadol be telefonji feere.

en: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
ff: haa 10 Aviiril 2020, Google be Apple matini haa wakkati gootel yo'o ɓe nastinan kujeji ngam mballugo irin applikasionji be Bluetooth haa nder dabareji kugal Android be iOS maɓɓe.

en: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
ff: haa Cayna, ngomna Cayna, hawti be Alipay, wurtini applikasion feere je ɗon hokka jarfuye haa ummatore larta to ɓe ngondi no be yimɓe je mari no COVID-19.

en: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
ff: Yimɓe ɗon huwa be man haa nder berniji Cayna 200. haa Singapore, woodi applikasion je ewnotto TraceTogether.

en: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
ff: Yimɓe IT ummatore on wurtini applikasion man, wangi bana maɓɓiti haa ko moy fu e hokkan ndu haa ngomna. haa Woila Macedoniya woodi applikasion feere je ɗon huwa be Bluetoth je ewnotto "StopKorona!", ngam sappinugo sababuji je temma on wondi be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau e hokka jabbuye law haa arduɓe jam ɓanndu.

en: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
ff: Applikasion wangi gal kugal Geeɓeji Ngewte be Teknik be Jam ɓanndu.

en: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
ff: haa 14 Aviiril 2020, applikasion ndu ɗon no ndeena jaɓɓol Google Play Store be Apple App Store.

en: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
ff: haa 12 Aviiril, ngomna matini yo'o applikasion tawtugo yimɓe haa nder yahde je ɗon nyauɗum, e wondan ngam sendugo haa nder asaweji. Jaahargal irin applikasion ndu ngaɗi timmi haa Ireland, be Faraansa ("StopCovid").

en: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
ff: Australia be New Zealand ɗon larta applikasionji je ɗon wondi do aandal applikasion TraceTogether Singapore be dabare BlueTrace. Russiya tammi wanginugo applikasion waɗugo keleewol wakkerereji ngam nyauɓe COVID-19 je wondi haa Moscow, ngam fammugo be fakatre ɓe wala wurtugo saare.

en: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
ff: Ross Anderson, jaanginowo security engineering haa Cambridge University, limti no larulaaji je kugal je applikasionji foti mara, bana sappinugo goɗɗo bana mari nyau amma wonay gonga, e fottay wonda kanduɗum to ɗon laarani ummatore seeɗa tan.

en: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
ff: Be lintugo larulaaji ngam wangolji waagare applikasionji "koronaviriis" je wonay gonga malla kalluɗum, Apple sappini keerolji je geeɓeji foti ɓesda applikasionji je laarani koronaviriis haa App Store maaɗa, haɗɗugo ndu haa "ngomna" malla geeɓeji je ɗon andi.

en: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
ff: Google be Amazon waɗi irin keleewolji ndu timmi.

en: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
ff: Yimɓe je ɗon no sikka ngam larula je laarani amana holli larula maɓɓe do ko laarani aynol yimɓe fu gal applikasionji koronaviriis, ɓurna fu do to dabare aynol je ɓe wangini ngam darnugo nyau koronaviriis darnotto to nyau man salli.

en: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
ff: Amnesty International be ɓuri geeɓeji 100 feere wurtini haala feere gal ewnugo do keleewolji do irin aynolji ndu.

en: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
ff: Geeɓeji ndu matini larulaaji do kuɗe ngomna:

en: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
ff: aynol foti wona no "kanduɗum, mari naffuda be kalkal";

en: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
ff: juttinol llartol be aynol maran no umroji do darnol;

en: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
ff: kugal be matinolji haɗɗan no do dabareji ngam COVID-19.

en: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
ff: jam matinolji be bila windol inde wonan no siggotto e wona bana ɗon fadi do sappinolji;

en: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
ff: aynol matinolji darnan no lasɓinol be gaanyu je ɗon ɓesda ndu;

en: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
ff: kala sendol matinolji be goɗɗo feere sey umrore hasda do ndu;

en: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
ff: dabareji keerolji wonan ngam huddi be jarfuji ummatore ngam jabbinugo do huddi;

en: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
ff: wondugo yimɓe fu nder dabare ndu gal "jagorɓe kanduɗum" sey emmotto, bana je wawooɓe jam ɓanndu be geeɓe je lasbinama. German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) be Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) wurtini bo'o dabareji.

en: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
ff: Jaahargal Google/Apple yiɗi larugo nder haala aynol je ɗon tokkiti ndu gal ittugo dabare sappinol wakkere je goɗɗo ɗon wondi haa ton nder ordoji maɓɓe haa ɓaawo to wala naffuda fahin.

en: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
ff: Lesɗe feere ɗon no huwida be ordo aynol amma naa be applikasionji, ko ɗon waɗa bila wattugo applikasion feere be dabare je wala goɗɗo tokka maa gal ɓaawo.

en: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
ff: haa Israayila, dabare aynol be ordo jaɓɓama.

en: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
ff: Dabareji je wondi gal aynol wakkere wonde ɗon foti mara larulaaji be matinolji amana yimɓe.

en: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).
ff: Amma, naa kala dabareji fu be ordoji cakare mari haaje nastugo nder matinolji do wonde mooɗon; woodi dabareji siggorde matinolji ngurtama je ɗon salla gal ordoji cakare ngam saanjol ngewte (lare geeɓe je les).

en: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
ff: haa South Korea, woodi dabare je wonday do applikasion naffi ngam lartugo ngidol.

en: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.
ff: haa do huwugo be applikasion je ɗon hokki, ordo ndu mofti matinoljin laritol ndu gal dabare feere-feere bana matinolji wonde telefon be matinolji karte ceede, e hawti ɓe fu ngam wurtinugo batakkeji gal bindi haa yimɓe je foti mara nyau.

en: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.
ff: haa ɓesdugo huwugo be matinolji sappinugo baabal wonde , ngomna wurtini matinolji wondugo maɓɓittama haa ummatore fu, ko ɗon jarfi ngam saanjolji feere be umroji do matinolji haa ɓaawo nyau MERS haa lesdi ndu.

en: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
ff: Matinolji ndu ɗon maɓɓitti haa ummatore gal limgal applikasionji be wedji. Lesɗe bana Jaamani hasdi ngam hawtugo dabareji joggugo matinolji be je cakare.

en: As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
ff: haa 6 Aviiril 2020, matinolji man ngurtay no tawon.

en: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
ff: Laritol wakkere wonde be matinolji je siggotto ɗon andi, be ekkitoji teffooɓe je ɗon lora pettum man 2013. haa 7 Aviiril 2020, ɓuri wawooɓe sappo e ɗiɗi huwidi no do dabareji siggorde matiolji, bana huwugo be Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) ngam teffugo huwoowo be telefonji feere.

en: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
ff: Amma, PEPP-PT woni sembe je hawtama je woodi dabareji ɗiɗi fu je cakare be je sankittito, e wonay dabare woore. Dabareji je ɗon sankittito laarani Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) be feere.

en: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
ff: haa nder dabareji ndu, matinolji je foti heɓta footay wurta ordo, e hawtirde fu don salla do ordo ndu.

en: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.
ff: Privacy Group haa MIT Media Lab ɗon no haɗda do SafePaths, daaldal huwugo be dabareji siggorde maandirɗum haa wakkati mofturde matinolji be huwugo be matinolji wakkere be ngidol ngam aynugo sankittol COVID-19.

en: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
ff: Wondi do teffol deftere je wala kuje haa ton "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" je wurti haa Maars 2020. woodi irin dabare ndu je woni daaldal SafeTrace gal Enigma MPC, geeɓe feere je ɗon huwa do wurtinugo dabareji aandol je tawama bo'o haa MIT Media Lab.

en: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
ff: SafeTrace ɗon huwa be dabareji teknik je jam jarfugo huwooɓe senda matinolji do wakkere be jam ɓanndu be yimɓe feere be ymɓe ngomna, bila hallinugo matinolji maandirɗum

en: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
