ff: haa 5 Aviiril 2020, TCN Coalition fu wangi gal geeɓeji je hawti haa ɓaawo ko laati bana mari irin dabare man be irin yaɓɓordeji ndu, je hasdi ngam ustugo ta'irdeji, e waɗa yo'o aynol sankittol nyau ndu salla gal applikasionji je foti haa keerolji duniyaru fu.

en: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
ff: haa 9 Aviiril 2020, ngomna Singapore matini yo'o o wangini dabare BlueTrace haa yeeso ummatore fu gal applikasion je hokki haa ngomna maaɗa.

en: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
ff: haa 10 Aviiril 2020, Google be Apple, geeɓeji mauɓe je ɗon mari daaldal telefon Android be iOS, matini dabare feere ngam laritol ngidol, je ɓe tammi siggan maadirɗum yimɓe, gal dabarehawtirde Bluetooth Low Energy technology be bindi je ɗon sigga matinolji maandirɗum.

en: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
ff: Fahin bo'o ɓe wurtini cakare dabareji je woni haa nder ordo ndu.

en: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
ff: haa limtol Apple be Google, ordo ndu wurtan nder yaɓɓordeji tati:

en: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
ff: wurtinol kujeji ngam heɓɓa ngomna wangina applikasionji aynol sankittol koronaviriis je ngomna e je ɗon sigga mandirɗum.

en: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
ff: nastinugo kuɗe maaɗa haa nder jaahargal iOS be AndroidGoogle be Apple ngam heɓɓugo jabbuji haa do jaɓɓol be larulaaji aynol gal sendugo haa aranool man tawon dabare mal gal lartollji huwugo ordoji ndu, e haa ɓaawo man ittugo ndu bana haa fuɗɗam to nyau man salli timmi.

en: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
ff: Wurtinol lekki b'COVID-19 laati laahal teffol ngam wurtinugo baatal je aynugo malla lekki je hurgatta je foti usta sembe nyau koronaviriis 2019-20 (COVID-19).

en: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
ff: International Clinical Trials Registry Platform je WHO windi ekkitolji jam ɓanndu 536 ngam wurtinugo hurgolji nyau COVID-19 , be hawtirdeji je mabardugo viriis ngam hurgugo nyauji feere je ɗon do teffol sey larta ndu

en: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
ff: haa Maars, WHO fuɗɗi "SOLIDARITY Trial" haa nder lesɗe 10, be windugo yimɓe je mari nyau COVID-19 ngam lartugo sababuji hurgol,be hawtirdeji kujeji je mbardatta viriis nay be naffuda je ɓuri kanduɗum.

en: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
ff: Lartol fu fuɗɗi haa Aviiril 2020 ngam lartugo yahde foondolji baatal be lekki hurgugo COVID-19. Wurtinugo baatal malla lekki ɗon mari yaɓɓordeji jur, ɓurna fu hoosan duuɓi joowey ngam jam be naffuda hawtirdeji lekki man.

en: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
ff: Wurtinugo lekki laati laahal wanginugo baatal malla lekki hurgugo nyau keese je ɗon raɓɓa yimɓe haa do lumo to woodi hawtirde lekki je aranool ɗon maandi gal laahal tawol.

en: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
ff: laarani teffol do gilɗiji be daabaji haa nder suudu lartol, emmugo fadol, bana gal FDA, ngam teffugo lekki keese lata foondotto haa suudu lekkita do neɗɗo, e foti mara yaɓɓorde heɓɓugo jaɓɓol fadol be wurtinugo lekki keese haa do lumo.

en: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
ff: Wurtinol baatal malla lekki je mbardatta viriis COVID-19 ɗon fuɗɗa be tawugo lekki gooto be dabare prophylactic baatal ndu malla kuɗe mbardugo viriis je ɗon yeeɗa.

en: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
ff: Kuujeji feere keese (NCE, je mbiyotto bo'o kujeji molecular keese malla NME) laati hawtirde kujeji je wangi gal laahal tawol lekki ngam aandinugo baatal malla foondoowo mbarugo viriis.

en: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
ff: Ndu ɗon yahida be kugal tawugo lekki nyau COVID-19.

en: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
ff: haa fuɗɗam wurtinol baatal malla lekki, wala kuje jur ɗon aandin do jam, nyaɗol, pharmacokinetikjin be noy NCE man huwan haa nder ɓanndu.

en: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
ff: laati kugal e dole nder laahal wurtinol lekki ngam larta kujeji je ɗon limti ndu fu hiddeko foondol do neɗɗo ngam jam be naffuda.

en: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
ff: Dabare kanduɗum haa nder wurtinol lekki laati hokkugo limtol be jaahargal hoosugo lekki man haa neɗɗo haa arandere man ("arandere-haa-neɗɗo" [FIH] First Human Dose [FHD], je ɗon no aandin bana "aranool-haa-goɗɗo" [FIM]).

en: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, wurtinol lekki sey sappina mandolji ko ɗon limti haa nder NCE: ko ɗon woni haa nder man, wondugo man, be jillol.

en: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
ff: Yimɓe je waɗatta lekki ndu sey huwa boɗɗum do laahal maɓɓe hiddeko wurtinugo ndu be miligamji, haa wurtinugo de kilogramji malla tonji.

en: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
ff: Fahin bo'o, ɓe larta lekki ngam dabare caahugo, bana capsolji, ɓolti-ɓolti, tuffama haa nder kuusel ɓanndu, haa nder laaral ɓanndu, malla nder lawol iyam.

en: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
ff: Hawti, laahalji ndu ɗon andi haa wakkati hiddeko nastugo, malla wondugo haa suudu lartol bana hawtirde, taggol, be lartol (CMC).

en: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
ff: Ndu hawti fu laati lartolji ngam fammugo hallugo kuje hawtirde lekki hiddeko aranool foondol haa neɗɗo.

en: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
ff: Ngomna Kanada matini wurtinugo milionji CA$275 ngam wallugo teffolji 96 ngam heɓɓugo dabare nattinugo COVID-19, be foondolji baatal jur haa jam'iareji Kanada, be jaahargalji maɓɓitugo "siggorde baatal" ngam baatalji keese to bana nyau koronaviriis ndu lori fahin.

en: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
ff: Jaahargalji foondol laarani duuɓi tati, yaɓɓordeji ɗuɗɗum gal jaɓɓol lekki, be nayaɓool, yaɓɓorde lartol do aynol baatal malla hurgol lekki:

en: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
ff: Foondol yaɓɓorde I, ɓurna fu do yardooɓe je jammu, holla jam be limtol

en: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
ff: Foondol yaɓɓorde II yiɗi wurtinugo aranool jaangirde naffuda e lara jam haa cakka ummatore seeɗa je ɗon mari nyau je NCE tindinni.

en: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
ff: Foondol yaɓɓorde III ɗon yajji, foondolji larugo ngam aandugo jam be naffuda haa cakka ummatore yimɓe ɗuɗɗum je ɗon mari COVID-19.

en: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
ff: To jam be naffuda holli kanduɗum, lartol haa do yimɓe foti dara haa yaɓɓoorde ndu e NCE tokkan be yaɓɓorde hokkugo lekki keese (NDA) ngam fuɗɗam sippol.

en: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
ff: Foondol yaɓɓorde IV laati ragare foondolji je foti wona larula je laarani FDA, je ewnotto bo'o ekkitolji aynol je ɓaawo lumo.

en: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
ff: haa ɓesdugo do lartolji je ɗon emmi ngam nastinugo baatal keese malla lekki je mbardatta viriis haa nder suudu lekki haa arandere man, yimɓe je waɗatta leeki sey hallende be wakkati lartama be boɗɗ, bana sababuji do kujeji feere je aandakka tawon (danyugo , nuftugo, dabare fadol, haa cakka feere'en).

en: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
ff: haa nder Lesɗe Amerika, laahal ndu ewnotto "hokkugo lekki keese" malla NDA.

en: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
ff: Foondol haa nder suudi lekki je ɗon do yahde foti saanja bana "kuje lartotto" to bana matinolji je ɗon moofta nder foondol ɗon sappina to ɗon naffa malla naffata nder hurgol.

en: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
ff: Foondolji Solidarity and European Discovery fu do yimɓe je ɗon wondi haa suudu lekki je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 je ɗon nyaɗi ɗon hokka dabare lartol ngam saanjugo kujeji lartol haa wakkati sappinolji dabareji amin je nay ndu ɗon wurta:

en: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
ff: Dabare lartolji haa yakke foondolji yaɓɓorde II-III do hurgol foondooɓe foti usta wakkati foondolji e hoosa yimɓe seeɗ tan, to foti bo'o nelda hasduji ngam darnugo law malla jallugo, be fadugo lartol saanjolji ngam ko laarani foondol je feerejo haa kunde wakkereji maaɗa haa do lesɗe feere.

en: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
ff: Foondooɓe lekki keese (NCE) ɓurna fu dara haa nder yahde maɓɓe, temma ngam ɓe ɗon nyaɗi jur malla ngam ɓe sappinatta naffuda ngam hurgol nyau ndu, bana sappini haa foondolji Yaɓɓorde II-III nder suudu lekki.

en: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
ff: Limtol darnolji do lawol je hawti be yahde lekki ɗon limti bana "jippol limtol", je ɗon mari haaje hasduji haa wakkati fuɗɗam yahdeji wanginol lekki haa "mbara" ekkiltolji law ngam tato majjina ceede meere.

en: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
ff: woodi ekkitol feere haa 2010 je larti ceede je lutti be je wurti nder jibba ngam wanginugo lekki feere haa do lumo gal miliarji 1.8$ be milionji 870$.

en: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
ff: Ceede je foondolji wurtinol lekkiji sankara 10 hoosi haa 2015-16 woni gal milionji 648$.

en: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
ff: haa 2016 lartol lekki foondooɓe 106 haa nder suudu lekkita, ceede je mo je lekki mako naffi e yardotto haa nder foondolji Yaɓɓorde hawti fu miliarji 2.6$ (haa dallarji 2018), ceede je ɗon wa'a hittande fu be 8.5%.

en: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
ff: Foondolji 7 ɗon no larta fahin kekkiji je yardotto no bana ɗon hurga paɓɓooje, be ekkitolji nay do hydroxychloroquine malla chloroquine phosphate.

en: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
ff: Lekki mbardugo viriisji je lartotto ɓurna fu kanjuum on teffol Cayna woni do man, be foondolji Yaɓɓorde III 9 do remdesivir gal lesɗe jur ngam matinol ndu haa ragare Aviiril.

en: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
ff: Be fadol Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation be huwooɓe je ruffi milionji US$125 million be ɗowirde Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu, Therapeutics Accelerator COVID-19 fuɗɗi haa Maars, ko wartiri teffoɓe wurtinol lekki kooyɗum ngam maandugo, lartugo, wurtinugo, ɓesda hurgolji law.

en: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
ff: Clinical Research Coalition COVID-19 je wurti ngam fadugo e yaawina sappinolji diga foondolji haa suudu lekki lesdi feere do hurgolji je foti ɓuri naffugo.

en: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
ff: haa fuɗɗam 2020, hawtirde lekki je mbardatta viriis jur ngam hurgugo nyauji feere lartotto malla wurtama haa nder dabareji teffol ngam nattinugo nyau COVID-19.

en: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
ff: Ko laarani lekki je ɗon yardi timmi (bana hydroxychloroquine ngam paɓɓooje), foondolji Yaɓɓorde III-IV ɗon sappina nde temmere do temmere haa ujineji yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 dabare lartugo haa do lekki je ɗon aandin timmi ɗon hurga nyau COVID-19.

en: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
ff: haa fuɗɗam Aviiril 2020, foondooɓe lekki 103 wondi no haa Yaɓɓorde hiddeko suudu lekki malla I-IV, be sappinolji lartol foondooɓe lekki 29 je ɗon ndeeni haa Aviiril.

en: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
ff: haa Maars, Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu (WHO) fuɗɗi be "Solidarity trial" je ɗon fadi haa nder lesɗe 10 ngam lartugo ndu haa cakka ujineji nyauɓe COVID-19 foti naffuda lekki mbarugo viriis be ko foti usta gilɗiji lartakke haa jonta ngam nyau COVI-19.

en: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
ff: woodi gooto haa cakka lekkiji ndu ɗon usta limtol mayde naa?

en: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
ff: woodi gooto haa cakka lekkiji ndu usta wakkati wondugo nyauɗo haa suudu lekki naa?

en: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
ff: Hurgolji ɗon memma yimɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19 be pneumonia je ɗon mari haje fartugo hendu malla wondi do suklare je nyaɗum naa?

en: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
ff: Irin lekki ndu foti usta nyau COVID-19 naa haa cakka huwooɓe jam ɓanndu be ummatore je ɗon mari sababuji marugo nyau je nyaɗum naa? Nastinugo yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 laati kooyɗum gal huwugo be nastirde matinolji, bana jarfuye je ɗon aandin haa do web WHO.

en: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
ff: haa ɓaawo to huwooɓe fammi lekki ɗon wondi haa suudu lekki, web WHO ɗon hoosa nyauɓe bana ni tan ngam gooto cakka lekki foonlji malla haa dabare hurgol suudu lekki ngam hurgugo COVID-19.

en: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
ff: Lekkitajo je ɗon foonda ɗon winda e hokka matinolji do nyauɗo be dabare hurgol, e timmina nastirde matinolji gal web Solidarity WHO.

en: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
ff: Kawtal aynol do jam lekkitooɓe WHO fu ɗon larta sapinolji je hiddeko ngam wallugo be hasduji be naffuda lekki foondolji, e saanja dabare foondol malla feela hurgol je ɗon naffa.

en: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
ff: woodi irin ekkitol ndu je woni do web Solidarity, ewnotto "Discovery", fuɗɗi haa Maars haa nder lesɗe 7 gal INSERM (Paris, Faraansa). haa lewru Maars, ceede teffol ngam foondol Solidarity yotti milionji US$108 haa yimɓe, geeɓeji, ngomna'en 203 000, be lesɗe 45 do nder ɗowirɗe siggugo ceede malla foondugo.

en: Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
ff: Lekki foondolji jur do ekkitol bana hurgolji "wallende" ngam ustugo mandolji haa wakkati nyau, bana NSAID malla bronchodilatorji, wonday haa nder tabaalji les ndu.

en: Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
ff: Foondolji Yaɓɓorde II feere je fuɗɗi law malla foondooɓe hurgol ɗuɗɗum haa foondolji Yaɓɓorde I, nastay nder limgal fu.

en: Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
ff: Lekki foondol haa foondolji Yaɓɓorde I-II ɗon mari limtol jallol je lessi (les 12%) ngam sallugo yahdeji foondol ngam yardugo ndu.

en: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
ff: Hydroxychloroquine ɓuri wondugo do chloroquine haa Lesɗe America.

en: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
ff: Ko to lesɗe jur nastini chloroquine malla hydroxychloroquine ngam hurgol yimɓe je ɗon woni haa suudu lekki je ɗon mari COVID-19, haa Maars 2020 lekki man maray jarfuye gal foondolji haa suudu lekki haa nder Lesɗe America.

en: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
ff: Chloroquine feelama gal arduɓe jam ɓanndu Cayna, South Korea be Italy ngam hurgol COVID-19, ko to geeɓeji be US CDC sappini feere ngam yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau ɓernde malla nyau sukkar.

en: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
ff: Lekki ɗiɗi fu ɗon mari kuɗe kanduɗum be hoosugo lekki ndu, je ɗon memma limtol hurgol be ustol nyau.

en: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.
ff: Yimɓe feere, maɓɓe jaɓɓata lekki ndu. haa 12 Aviiril, foondol hiddeko salli haa suudu lekki feere haa Brazil darnotto haa wakkati je yimɓe jur hoosi chloroquine jur ngam nyau COVID-19 holli yo'o ɓernde maɓɓe saanji fi'ugo, ko waɗi yimɓe 11 maayi.

en: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".
ff: Foondolji Cayna haa Wuhan be Shenzhen wi'i sappinugo yo'o favipiravir "ɓuri naffugo".

en: Of 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
ff: haa nder nyauɓe 35 haa Shenzhen larti bana maray nyau haa ɓaawo balɗe 4, haa wakkati nde juttugo nyau man laati balɗe 11 haa kunde nyauɓe je hoosay.

en: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
ff: haa nder ekkitol feere je salli haa Wuhan nyauɓe 240 be pneumonia, reeta maɓɓe hoosi favipiravir e reeta feere hoosi umifenovir.

en: The term "preclinical research" is defined by laboratory studies in vitro and in vivo, indicating a beginning stage for development of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as experiments to determine effective doses and toxicity, before a candidate compound is advanced for safety and efficacy evaluation in humans.
ff: Wolde "teffol hiddeko suduu lekki" yiɗi wi'ugo yo'o haa wolde ekkitolji suudu lartolji bana in vitro be in vivi, je ɗon holla fuɗɗam yahde nder wanginugo baatal, lekki mbardugo viriis malla gilɗe be kosngal woore, bana sappinugo limtol hoccol be hallende, hiddeko hawtirde foondowo tokkita be lartol jam be naffuda haa neɗɗo.

en: Some antibiotics may be repurposed as COVID-19 treatments:
ff: Antibiotikji feere foti lartama fahin ngam hurgugo COVID-19.

en: In March 2020, the main protease of the SARS-CoV-2 virus was identified as a target for post-infection drugs.
ff: haa Maars, arandere protease viriis SARS-CoV-2 maandotto bana lekki je hoosugo haɓawo hurgol.

en: This enzyme is essential to the host cell to reproduce the ribonucleic acid of the virus.
ff: Neebam ndu kanduɗum ngam haa cell jaɓɓowo ngam waɗittugo ribonucleic acid viriis.

en: To find the enzyme, scientists used the genome published by Chinese researchers in January 2020 to isolate the main protease.
ff: Ngam tawugo neebam ndu, aandooɓe hoosi genome je teffooɓe Cayna sappini haa Zaanviye 2020 ngam wurtinugo arandere protease.

en: As a potential combination therapy, they are used together in two Phase III arms of the 2020 global Solidarity project on COVID-19.
ff: Bana kawtal lekki hurgol, ɓe hoccama haa juɗe ɗiɗi Yaɓɓorde III kuɗe Solidarity 2020 fu do COVID-19.

en: A preliminary study in China of combined lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in people hospitalized for COVID-19.
ff: Aranool ekkitol haa Cayna do hawtirde lopinavir be ritonavir taway sababu haa nyauɓe je wondi haa suudu lekki ngam COVID.

en: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
ff: Lortirugo b'Drug (je ɗon aandin bana laritugo lekki fahin, re-profiling, re-tasking malla saanjugo hurgol) woni laritugo hasduye aranool do lekki je ɗon jarfi timmi ngam hurgol nyau feere malla mandoji nyau feere je ngaɗotto do man aran.

en: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
ff: Nda teffol aandal nder wolde gooto je ɗon tokkiti ngam wurtinugo lekki je ɗon jam e ɗon naffa ngam hurgugo nyau COVID-19.

en: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
ff: Dabareji teffol feere laarani wanginol baatal be plasma COVID-19. SARS-CoV ɗon mari proteinji 66 je foti hawta be lekki, kala fu ɗon mari baabe hawtirugo jur.

en: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
ff: Lartugo baabe hawtirdeji ndu kuɗe kanduɗum nde do wurtinugo lekki mbardugo viriis je ɗon naffa ngam proteinji COVID-19.

en: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
ff: haa kunde proteinji SARS-CoV-2 je ɓuri woɗɗugo wondi protease je ɗon naandi papain, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, be ADP ribophosphatase.

en: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
ff: Hussein AA, et al. jaangi hawtirdeji lekki foondol je o hoosi e larti naandol suudu haa ɓaawo man, e sappini naandolji jur be lekki je jarfotto ngam yaawinugo ko foti wona lekki kanduɗum je mbardatta SARS-CoV-2 haa nder ekkitol mako je hiddeko ngam feelugo haa nder dabare ekkitol haa suudu lekki.

en: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
ff: Chloroquine woni lekki paɓɓooje je ɗon feeli ngam nyauji feere bo'o.

en: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
ff: haa 18 Maars, WHO matini yo'o chloroquine be hydroxychloroquine foti wona haa cakka lekki je don nder ekkitol foondol haa suudu lekki Solidarity.

en: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
ff: Ngomna New York Andrew Cuomo matini yo'o foondolji New York State do chloroquine be hydroxychloroquine foti fuɗɗa haa 24 Maars. haa 28 Maars, FDA jarfi hoccol hydroxychloroquine sulfate be chloroquine phosphate to woodi jaawal Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

en: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
ff: Laahal foondolji haa suudu lekki FDA jarfay hurgol ngol tawon e ɗon jarfi sna be hasduye EUA bana hurgol foondol tan to woodi jaawal be hurgol haa nyauɓe je wondi haa suudu lekki amma je footay keɓɓa hurgol haa lartol suudu lekki.

en: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
ff: CDC wi'i yo'o "hoosugo, hokkugo, malla neeɓugo hydroxychloroquine ngam prophylaxis mmala hurgol nyau SARS-CoV-2" jarfakke tawon.

en: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
ff: Lekkitoɓe wi'i yo'o ɓe ɗon hokka lekki man to "wala dabare feere".

en: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
ff: Geeɓe teffol Turkia'en feere haa Istanbul ɗon sallina ekkitol feere do chloroquine be zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C be vitamin D.

en: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
ff: Ekkitolji feere maungel ɗon do lawol haa Duke University be University of Oxford.

en: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
ff: NYU Langone Medical School ɗon waɗa foondol do jam e naffuda hoosugo hydroxychloroquine bana dabare aynol.

en: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
ff: Foondolji haa suudu lekki Cayna haa Wuhan be Shenzhen wi'i yo'o favipiravir ɗon "naffa masin".

en: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
ff: Nyauɓe 35 haa Shenzhen larti bana maray nyau haa nder balɗe 4, e juttol nyau man bo'o balɗe 11 haa cakka nyauɓe 45 je hoosay ɗum.

en: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
ff: haa nder ekkitol feereha Wuhan haa do nyauɓe 240 be pneumonia, reeta maɓɓe hoosi favipiravir be reeta maɓɓe hoosi umifenovir.

en: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
ff: Italian Pharmaceutical Agency matini ummatore yo'o sappinolji do wallende lekki ndu moftay tawon e jarfay.

en: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
ff: haa 2 Aviiril, Jaamani matini yo'o o soddan lekki haa Japan ngam ɗon mofti haa ton, soje'en ngam addugo lekki man haa suuɗi lekki jam'iareji, e lekki man wonan ngam hurgugo nyauɓe COVID-19.

en: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
ff: haa South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe arti ngomna Trump ngam soddugo lekki. Lekki foti wona maray sembe jur haa hurgol nyauɓe je nyau maɓɓe ɗon nyaɗi, e viriis man nufti timmi.

en: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
ff: foti wonatta boɗɗu haa rewɓe be reedu hoosa ndu malla ɓe'en je yiɗi hoosugo reedu.

en: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
ff: Ekkitol feere do lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), hawtirde lopinavir be ritonavir je ɗon mbarda viriis, wi'i yo'o "wala naffuda je tawama".

en: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
ff: Lekki ndi wurti ngam tuttugo HIV gal nuftugo gal hawtugo be protease.

en: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
ff: Geeɓe teffooɓe haa University of Colorado yiɗi saanjugo lekki ngam heɓɓugo hawtirde je foti hawta be protease SARS-CoV. woodi lasbinolji haa kunde ummatore teffooɓe ngam ɗowugo kujeji ngam laritugo lekki je wurtini ngam HIV/AIDS.

en: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
ff: WHO watti lopinavir/ritonavir haa nder foondol lesdi feere-feere Solidarity .

en: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
ff: Remdesivir waɗɗotto e wurtinama gal Gilead Sciences bana hurgol nyau viriis Ebola be nyauji viriis Marburg. Gilead Sciences tawi fahin bo'o Remdesivir ɗon mari kuɗe je ɗon mbarda viriis in vitro do viriisji jur bana filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, be korona.

en: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
ff: Larula gooto ngam hurgol viriis woni neeɓugo gal saanjolji, ko foti yara haa nyau je ɓuri nyaɗugo be sallinol.

en: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
ff: Ekkitolji feere je fuɗɗi hiddeko foondol ɗon wi'a yo'o remdesivir foti mara keleewol gene ngam neeɓugo. woodi foondolji haa suudu lekki je ɗon salla jonta, bana ɗiɗi je ɗon fadi gal Cleveland University Hospitals; gooto ngam yimɓe be nyau deydey be feere ngam ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau je ɓuri nyaɗugo.

en: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
ff: woodi foondolji haa suudu lekki tati je vitamin C je sallan nder lawol iyam haa yimɓe je ɗon wondi haa suudu lekki e ɗon mari COVID-19 je nyaɗungel; placebo je ɗon ayni ɗiɗi (Cayna, Kanada) be gooto je wala aynugo (Italy).

en: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
ff: New York State fuɗɗi foondolji ngam antibiotik azithromycin haa 24 Maars 2020.

en: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
ff: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) ɗon waɗa jaahargal do foondolji haa suudu lekki ngam Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), corticosteroid je mustugo ngam nyau dule, ngam hurgol nyauɓe je maray mandolji nyau tawon je raɓɓi koronaviriis keese.

en: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
ff: Irin angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, foondol Yaɓɓorde II ɗon do sallugo be nyauɓe 200 je ɓe suɓɓan no haa cakka ɓe'en je nyau man nyaɗi masin, wondi haa suudu lekki haa Denmark, Jaamani, be Ostriya ngam fammugo naffuda hurgol.

en: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
ff: Teffooɓe haa Montreal Heart Institute haa Kanada ɗon jaanga kugal colchicine ngam ustugo huudure be nyaji fuffu haa nyauɓe je ɗon mari mandolji COVID-19 deydey.

en: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
ff: Ekkitol, ewnotto COLCORONA, ɗon hoosa mauɓe 6000 je mari duuɓi malla ɓuri je tawotto mari nyau COVID-19 e mari mandolji je maray haaje yahugo haa suudu lekki.

en: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
ff: Rewɓe je ɗon be reedu malla je ɗon musina malla mo je maray dabare siwtugo footay hoosa.

en: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
ff: Anticoagulantji jur ɗon do lartol haa Italy.

en: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
ff: Heparin je ɗon mari molecule je ɗon lessi ɗon waagare nder hurgol nyauɓe, ko waɗi Italian Medecine Agency wurtina dabareji ngam huwugo be man.

en: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
ff: Wakkere ekkitol feere do nyauɓe 300 je ɗon do teffugo kugal enoxaparin sodium haa prophylaxis be dabare hoosugo matinama haa italy haa 14 Aviiril.

en: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
ff: Nde SARS-CoV-2 laati viriis, hakiika aandal wondi ngam laritugo lekki je mbardatta viriis je wangi hiddeko nyauji bana MERS, SARS, be viriis West Nile.

en: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
ff: Ribavirin: ribavirin feelama ngam hurgol COVID-19 bana limtol batakkewol sappinol 7 Cayna

en: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
ff: Umifenovir: umifenovir feelama ngam hurgol COVID-19 bana limtol batakkewol sappinol 7 Cayna

en: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
ff: Antibiotikji feere je ɗon maandi bana foti larita ndu bana dabare hurgol COVID-19:

en: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
ff: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Cayna jaɓɓi.

en: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
ff: Fahin bo'o foondolji haa Italy be Cayna. e lare Tocilizumab#COVID-19.

en: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.
ff: Laɓɓay haa jonta to larulaaji je ummikki haa wakkati reedu laarani nyau sukkar, nyau ɓernde, iyam je ɗon ɗacca law malla ilam iyam be sembe foti wona sababu je ɗon ɓesda nyau haa rewɓe je ɗon be reedu. Ngam matinolji je wonay jur, sallinol gal do haa ta'irde tataɓool foti wondatta, malla ɗon yotta ndego-ndego.

en: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
ff: Wala matinolji haa jonta do reedu je yotti law.

en: Little evidence exists to permit any solid conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection in pregnancy.
ff: Sappinolji pamaron wondi ngam jabbuyeji do nyau COVID-19 haa rewɓe be reedu.

en: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
ff: woodi rewɓe 43 haa New York je larti bana mari nyau COVID-19 sappini irin mandolji be mauɓe je wonday be reedu: 86% ɗon mari nyau je ɗon deydey, 9.3 ɗon no mari nyau je nyaɗum be 4.7 je mari nyau je ɓuri nyaɗugo.

en: Fetal distress was reported in two.
ff: haa kunde maɓɓ ɗiɗi mari no larula be ɓingel.

en: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
ff: Wala goɗɗo haa cakka rewɓe ndu mari pneumonia COVID-19 je ɗon nyaɗi malla maayi.

en: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.
ff: Fu maɓɓe mari no reedu ɓesni fu e wala mo je hollini asphyxia ɓingel keese.

en: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
ff: Leekuji kossam, ndiyam reedu, iyam jabburu, be leeku tuɗe ɓingel danyinki lartotto ngam SARS-CoV-2, e sappinolji fu holli wala nyau. haa nder ekkitol feere rewɓe be reedu 15, ɓurna nyauɓe ɗon no sappina wullol ɓanndu be sondaaru, gal wakkere feere bo'o lartolji suudu lartol mari no lymphocytopenia 12.

en: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
ff: Sappinolji ta'irdeji be ordo nyauɓe ndu yahidi be sappinolji nyauɓe je wala reedu je sallingo, be yiɓre bana darugal haa fuɗɗorde man.

en: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
ff: Fotoji laynol haa ɓaawo ɓesnugo hollay yahde pneumonia. Batakkeji hubaru matini yo'o ɓuri rewɓe 100 be COVID-19 foti ɓesni, e haa Maars 2020, wala mayde daada je matinama.

en: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
ff: Laahalji maɓɓe ɗon feela kadi kala debbo je ɗon mari reedu je nasti haa suudu lekki be nyau COVID-19 sey hokke balɗe 10 ngam heparin je mari molecul prophylactic je lessi haa ɓaawo wurtol haa suudu lekki.

en: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
ff: Wala matinolji je ɗon laarani nyau COVID-19 ngam ɓesnugo.

en: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
ff: Woɗi debbo feere je mari COVID-19 ɓesni ɓingel debbo be IgM ɗon wa'i haa ɓaawo dayinki, ko ɗon holla yo'o o raɓɓi nyau ndu haa reedu e ɗon sappina bo'o sallinol diga do haa les haa yakke feere.

en: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
ff: Ekkitol feere be daadaji 6 je ɗon andi nyau COVID-19 sappinay mandolji SARS-CoV-19 haa daande malla neebam ɓanndu ɓikkon maɓɓe amma fadooɓe ɓanndu ɗon no haa nder leeku iyam, bana IgM haa cakka ɓikkon ɗiɗi.

en: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
ff: Ndu sallatta tum diga daada haa ɓingel haa reedu sey teffolji tokkita ngam fammugo to viriis ta'itti suudu ɓingel malla suuɗi ɓikkon rewɓe haa nder jaangirde ndu woni no.

en: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
ff: Nde COVID-19 ɗon mari naandolji be SARS-CoV be MERS-CoV, foti sababuji maɓɓe do reedu naanda.

en: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
ff: Nay nder joowey e ɗiɗi ruffi haa aranool ta'irde, ɗiɗi haa nder joowey mari darnol nder maunugo ɓingel haa nder reedu nder ta'irde ɗiɗaɓool, be danyinki hiddeko wakkati man.

en: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
ff: Wala mo je mari nyau SARS-CoV haa kunde ɓikkon je ɓe danyi.

en: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
ff: Matinol do nyauɓe MERS-CoV haa rewɗɓe be reedu sappo haa Saudi Arabiya sappini yo'o mandolji nyau foti sanja, diga kooyɗum haa nyaɗum.

en: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
ff: Sappinol wondi kanduɗum haa ɓurna nyauɓe fu, amma limtol mayde ɗikkon laati 27%. Lartol keese holli yo'o COVID-19 woni bana mari limtol mayde je lessi haa daadiraɓe be ɓikkon do SARS be MERS amma foti sababuji feere do dayinki haa ɓaawo asaweji reedu 28.

en: The World Health Organization and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
ff: Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu be Ɗowirɗeji do Aynol e Lartol Nyau lesɗe America ɗon feela rewɓe be reedu ngaɗa kuje bana ummatore feere ngamm ta be nanga nyau bana suddu hunduko to bana ɗon sonda, ta joɗɗide be nyauɓe, lallugo juɗe be sabulu be ndiyam malla kuje laɓɓinugo.

en: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
ff: Emmolji feere je sallini haa Shangai haa kunde rewɓe be reedu haa nder ta'irdeji feere-feere ɗon maandi bana ewnandu kanduɗum ngam nastirde do hawo haa matinolji do jam ɓanndu be kuɗe.

en: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
ff: Yimɓe je ɗon ndeena jippol ɓingel maɓɓe yardi no emmugo feelore gal hawo than ɓe'en je ɓesni timmi. RCOG be RCM ɗon feela yo'o ngidol gite be gite sey wonda haa ɓaawo balɗe 7 diga fuɗɗam mandolji nyau COVID-19 malla balɗe 14 to goɗɗo feere haa saare ɗon mari maandolji nyau.

en: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
ff: Wullo ɓanndu wangi haa nyauɓe tati je maray mandolji.

en: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
ff: Nyauɗo gooto je larti bana maay nyau laati ɗon sappina mandolji nyau postpartum e larti mari nyau balɗe tati haa ɓaawo larto je sappini o maray no nyau.

en: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
ff: Lekkitaɓe je ngaɗatta lartol feeli yo'o ngam ustugo nyau e hokka PPE, ngam limgal nyauɓe je sappinata mondolji nyau, sey waɗa lartol nyauɓe je ɗon be reedu fu.

en: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
ff: Fahin, ɓe feeli yo'o yimɓe je bana mari nyau malla mari COVI-19 sey larta wonde ɓinge haa reedu tum be ordoji.

en: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
ff: Huwugo be tassawu dayugo nder ndiyam feelakke haa yimɓe je bana mari nyau malla je ɗon andi mari COVID-19 ngam sababu sallinugo gal buuwe.

en: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
ff: haa Lesɗe Inglisiya, feelore ngomna wi'i yo'o hakiika sendugo daada be ɓingel je maray nyau sey hoosa ndu be boɗɗe e sey wonda haa baabal feere haa wakkati postpartum je suklare ngam dayinki wala naffuda. Jaangirde haa Cayna feeli sendugo daadiraɓe je nyauɓe be ɓikkon haa nder balɗe 14.

en: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
ff: haa Lesɗe America woodi feelore je ɓikkon je ɓa danyi keesum be daadiraɓe sey wonda sendama haa nder wakkati seeɗa sey to hakkilo ngam sallinol nyau timmi, e to footay waɗa sey daada wona metaa ɗiɗi be mako.

en: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
ff: Aynol b'COVID-19 laarani sankittol nyau koronaviriis ngam wanginugo dabare yahde nyau.

en: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
ff: Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu (WHO) feeli aynol tum, do teffugo irin nyauɓe, lartol e teffol yimɓe je on ngidi be maɓɓe haa nder sallinolji fu.

en: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
ff: Aynol COVID-19 wonan do laritugo yahde nyau ndu, larta nyauɓe keese be laugel, e do matinolji ndu, hokka matinolji do nyau ndu ngam lartugo sababu je yahidatta be man e taska ngam nyau ndu.

en: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
ff: Aynol nyau wondi do mandolji nyau goɗɗo je ɗon naandi be COVID-19.

en: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
ff: haa maars 2020, WHO feeli ndu bana ɗon limti ndu:

en: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
ff: foti mara: "Goɗɗo je lartay boɗɗum haa nyau COVID-19" malla "goɗɗo je foti mari e je lartol footay salla ngam uja feere".

en: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
ff: andi mari: "Goɗɗo je larti mari nyau COVID-19, ko to o wala sappinugo mandolji nyau".

en: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
ff: Ngidol ɓanndu be goɗɗo je foti mara malla mari nyau;

en: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
ff: Suklare do nyauɗo je foti mara malla je mari nyau COVID-19 je ɗon andi bila ɓornugo dabareji fadol ɓanndu;

en: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
ff: Kujeji feere bana ɗon limti gal lartolji sababu". WHO ɗon feela matinugo yimɓe je foti mara malla je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 haa nder njamɗe 48 maandirɗum.

en: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
ff: Lesɗe sey matina do goɗɗo do goɗɗo bana ko wowa, amma to footay waɗa ngam dabareji wala, moftugo matinolji haa nder asawere foti waɗa.

en: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
ff: Geeɓeji feere wangini applikasioji waagare ngam aynol mandolji nyau, je yimɓe foti matina mandolji nyau maɓɓe ngam wallugo teffooɓe maanda wakkereji je mandolji COVID-19 ɗon mofti

en: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
ff: Aynol yahde viriis ngaɗotto gal huwidugo be lartol molecul ngam COVID-19.

en: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
ff: WHO wurtini kujeji ngam cuuɗi lartol do noy ngaɗugo lartol COVID-19.

en: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
ff: haa nder Kawtal Lesɗe Erop, yimɓe je lartotto haa suudu lartol e je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 ɗon matini haa nder njamdi 24.

en: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
ff: Pettum man lesɗe 24 wurtini aynol gal ordoji haa ummatore maɓɓe.

en: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
ff: Dabareji aynol gal ordoji laarani applikasioji, matinolji do wakkere be kujeji feere.

en: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
ff: Ɗowirɗe Aynol e Lartol Nyau haa Lesɗe America ɗon larta matinolji jaahangal yimɓe gal hoccugo matinolji sallooɓe.

en: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
ff: haa Hong Kong, yimɓe ngomna ɗon emma kuje wattugo haa jungo be applikasion ngam waɗɗooɓe jaahangal fu.

en: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
ff: Applikasion GPS ɗon walla ngam lartugo wonde yimɓe haa South Korea ngam tato watta goɗɗo haa sera meere, gal neldol mandol haa goɗɗo man be yimɓe ngomna yimɓe wurti wakkere ndu.

en: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
ff: haa Singapore, yimɓe sey matina wakkere wonde maa

en: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
ff: Thailand ɗon huwa be applikasion be karte SIM ngam waɗɗooɓe jaahangal fu ngam aynol wonde maɓɓe haa sera.

en: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
ff: Geeɓe jarfuji neɗɗo lasbini irin dabareji man feere, gal emmugo ngomna'en to ɓe hoosa nyau duniyaru ndu bana suddol nastinugo dabare aynugo yimɓe gal ordoji.

en: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
ff: Baatal b'A COVID-19 laati bana baatal je aandakke boɗɗum ngam nyau koronaviriis 2019 (COVID-19).

en: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
ff: Ko to wala baatal je timmini foondolji haa suudu lekki, woodi dabareji feere-feere nder yahde ngam wurtinugo irin baatal ndu.

en: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
ff: haa Feviriye 2020, Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu (WHO) wi'i o tammay baatal SARS-CoV-2, viriis je hokki nyau ndu, wonda hiddeko leebi 18.

en: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
ff: Baatalji foondol joowey ɗon no do ekkitolji jam Yaɓɓorde I haa Aviiril.

en: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
ff: COVID-19 wangi haa Desambre 2020.

en: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
ff: Sankittol nyau man haa nder duniyaru salli haa 2020, je waɗi ceede jur nasti e aandooɓe ɗon teffa wurtinol baatal.

en: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Geeɓeji jur ɗon huwida be genomeji ngam wurtinugo baatalji nyau SARS-CoV-2.

en: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
ff: Wurti haa Aviiril, feeloji dabare CEPI ngam wanginugo baatal laati jaawal, dabare tagle, huwidugo ummatore jur, keɓɓal ko moy fu.

en: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
ff: haa Aviril, aandooɓe CEPI matini daaldaji dabareji 10 ɗon no nder teffol be wanginnol haa fuɗɗam 2020 ngam wurtinugo baatal je ɗon naffa ngam COVID-19.

en: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
ff: Daaldal kanduɗum ɗon nder ekkitolji jam Yaɓɓorde I je ɗon laarani:

en: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
ff: nucleic acid (DNA be RNA) (wanginoowo Yaɓɓorde I be baatal foondol: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

en: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
ff: viriis nyau (wanginowo Yaɓɓorde I be baatal foondol: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

en: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
ff: Bana ɗon matini gal aandooɓe CEPI haa Aviiril, baatalji foondol hawti fu 115 ɗon do taskugo, be 78 laati bana kuɗe je ɗon yahida (79, haa sappinol Milken Institute), be 37 feere ɗon matini, amma be matinolji ummatore ɗon wondi (je nastan haa nder jaahargal malla ɗon suɓɓi).

en: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
ff: Foondol Yaɓɓorɗe I-II ɗon sallina arandere lartolji jam be immunogenecity, laati bana caacaa, aynotto be placebo, e haa wakkereji ɗuɗɗum, haa yakke maandugo hoosugo ndu be boɗɗe.

en: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
ff: Foondolji Yaɓɓorɗe III nastini ummatore jur, be geeɓe aynol, e larita naffuda baatal ngam aynugo nyau, e ngam aynugo sababuji je ɗon yahida be man.

en: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
ff: haa cakka baatal foondolji 79 do wurtinol (je ɗon aandin haa fuɗɗam Aviiril 2020), 74 nastay haa nder lartol neɗɗo tawon (haa jonta nder teffol "hiddeko suudu lekki").

en: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
ff: Gal 24 Zaanviye 2020 haa Australia, University of Queensland matini yo'o o ɗon no teffa molecule je foti wangina baatal je foti saanja proteinji viriis ndu ngam heɓɓa ɓanndu noota.

en: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
ff: Gal 24 Zaanviye 2020 haa Kanada, International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) haa University Saskatchewan matini yo'o fuɗɗam kugal do baatal, je yiɗi sallinugo foondol do neɗɗo haa 2021.

en: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
ff: Kuɗe wurtinugo baatal matinama haa Ɗowirɗe Aynol e Lartol Nyau Cayna haa 26 Zaanviye 2020, e University of Hong Kong haa 28 Zaanviye.

en: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
ff: Gal 29 Zaanviye 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, je Hanneke Schuitemaker laati arduɗo majuum, wi'i o fuɗɗi huwidugo do baatal ngu.

en: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
ff: Janssen ɗon huwida do baatal gal hunduko be bero mako, Vaxart.

en: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
ff: haa 18 Maars, Emmergent BioSolution matini huwidugo be Vaxart ngam wurtinugo baatal.

en: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
ff: haa 8 Feviriye 2020, suudu lartol OncoGen in Romania wurtini batakkewol feere do dabare wurtinugo baatal be irin teknik je baatal neoantigen hurgol sankara.

en: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
ff: haa 25 Maars ɗowuwo geeɓe teffol matini yo'o ɓe timmini lartol baatal e fuɗɗi be lartolji timmi.

en: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
ff: haa 27 Feviriye 2020, Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, matini yo'o ɓe ɗon fuɗɗa kuɗe do teffol baatal ngam wanginugo baatal li-Key peptide ngam nyau COVID-19.

en: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
ff: Ɓe yiɗi wurtinugo baatal foondol je foti en larta do yimɓe "haa nder balɗe 90".

en: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
ff: haa 5 Maars 2020, Washington University in St. Louis matini kuɗe mako ngam wurtinugo baatal.

en: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
ff: haa nyalade 5 lewru maars, Arduɗo Geebe Teffol Soje Jam Bandu Lesɗi America haa Fort Detrick be Suudu Jaangirde Teffol Soje Walter Reed haa Silver Spring, ɗiɗi fu haa Marvland je hirnaange, matini yo'o ɓe ɗon huwa ngam wurtinugo baatal.

en: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
ff: Gal 10 Maars 2020, Emergent Biosolutions matini huwidugo be Novavax Inc.

en: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
ff: ngam dabare wanginugo e wurtinugo baatal.

en: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
ff: Bero'en mako matini yo'o jaahargal lartol hiddeko suddu lekki be foondol Yaɓɓorde I haa suudu lekki gal Zwiiye 2020.

en: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
ff: haa 12 Maars 2020, Geeɓe jam ɓanndu India matini yo'o ɓe ɗon huwa be baatalji 11, e ko to yaawi maa foti neeɓa duuɓi be reeta malla duuɓi ɗiɗi ngam wurtinugo baatal.

en: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
ff: haa 12 Maars 2020, Medicago, biotechnology company haa Quebec City, Quebec, matini kugal do wurtinugo kuje feere je ɗon naandi koronaviriis je Canadian Institutes for Health Research hokki ceede seeɗa.

en: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
ff: Baatal foondol ɗon haa nder suudu teffol, be lartolji do yimɓe ɗon hasdi ngam Zwiiye malla Uut 2020.

en: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
ff: haa fuɗɗam asawere ndu, The Guardian matini yo'o Jagorɗo Lesɗe America Donald Trump hokki haa CureVac "ceede ɗuɗɗum ngam wurtinugo baatal COVID-19", je ngomna Jaamani yarday sam.

en: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
ff: haa 17 Maars 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer matini huwidugo be German company BioNTech ngam wurtinugo baatal mRNA.

en: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
ff: Baatal foondol mRNA BNT162, jonta haa nder lartol hidekko suddu lekki be foondolji je hasdi wurtugo haa fuɗɗam Aviiril 2020.

en: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
ff: haa Italy haa 17 Maars 2020, Takis Biotech, biotech company Italy matini yo'o ɓe maran sappinolji lartol hiddeko suudu lekki haa Aviiril 2020 e baatal foondol je ragare foti fuɗɗa hiddeko timminol hittande nde.

en: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
ff: haa Faransa haa 19 Maars 2020, Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) matini wurtinugo milionji US$4.9 ngam teffol do baatal COVID-19 be geeɓe bana Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), be University of Pittsburgh, ko ɗon hawti moftol ceede CEPI ngam wanginugo baatal COVID-19 haa milionji US$29.

en: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
ff: Geeji feere je CEPI ɗon huwida be maɓɓe ngam wurtinol baatal nyau COVID-19 laati Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, University of Hong Kong, University of Oxford, be University of Queensland.

en: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
ff: haa 20 Maars 2020, yimɓe ngomna Russiya matini yo'o aandooɓe fuɗɗi lartolji do daabaji be baatalji foondol joowey go'o.

en: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
ff: Teffooɓe Imperial College London researchers matini haa 20 Maars 2020 yo'o ɓe ɗn no waɗa dabare wurtinugo baatal NRA je ɗon yajja feere maaɗa ngam COVID-19.

en: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
ff: Ko foti wona baatal ndu huwidotto haa nder balɗe 14 diga jaɓɓugo kuje man haa Cayna.

en: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
ff: haa ragare Maars, ngomna Kanada matini wurtinugo milionji C$275 bana wallende kuɗe teffol 96 ngam dabareji jam ɓanndu ngam COVID-19, be baatalji foondol jur haa nder geeɓeji be jam'iareji Kanadiya'en bana dabareji Medicago and University of Saskatchewan.

en: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
ff: haa wakkati ndu, ngomna Kanada matini wurtinugo milionji C$192 ngam wanginugo baatal COVID-19, be jaahargalji mahugo "siggorde baatalji" ngam baatalji keese ɗuɗɗum je foti naffa to nyau koronaviriis feere wangi.

en: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
ff: haa 2 Aviiril 2020, teffooɓe haa University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine matini ngam lartugo PittCoVacc, baatal COVID-19 haa doomɓi, gal wi'ugo yo'o "MNA wurtini geeɓe baatalji SARS-CoV-2 S1 je ɗon tuuta fadooɓe ɓanndu je ɗon mari antigene je ɗon mari semɓe [haa nder doomɓi] je fuɗɗan asaweji 2 haa ɓaawo fadol."

en: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
ff: haa Kanada haa 16 Aviril 2020, Jam'iare Waterloo School of Pharmacy matini sappinol DNA ko foti wona baatal je laati bana lekki foofugo haa nder kine.

en: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
ff: Huwugo be bacteriophageji, DNA naffan ngam nuftugo haa nder bakteriyaji neɗɗo ngam wurtinugo coolaaje je naandi viriis je wala nyaɗugo, je foti sembintina dabare fadol ɓanndu ngam wurtinugo fadooɓe ɓanndu ngam viriis SARS-CoV-2.

en: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
ff: haa Maars 2020, ngomna Lesɗe America, suudu tagle, be jam'iareji hawti sembe maɓɓe ngam nastugo haa nder ordoji nyaɗum gal IBM, hawti be dabareji huwidol do hawo Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, be Google.

en: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
ff: Baatalji feere ɗon mari sababuji feere, e ewnotto bo'o sababuji je ɗon saanja.

en: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
ff: Bana wi'ugo ɓe foti mara ribaji haa gaɗɗa nyau je ɗon ayna.

en: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
ff: Foondol feere haa Australia ɗon teffa nastinugo huwooɓe jam ɓanndu 4170.

en: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
ff: foti bo'o baatalji je do wurtugo foti wonatta jam malla mara naffuda.

en: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
ff: Teffolji arandere ngam lartugo naffitirki baatal gal hoosugo irin COVID-19 je yahidan be daabaji bana doombi ACE2-transgenic., daabaji suudu lartolji feere, be wandu'en je nastay nder asngol neɗɗo, sappina haaje ngam dabareji darnugo biosafety-level 3 ngam memmugo viriisji je ɗon nyeeɗa, be fadol duniyaru ngam hollugo dabareji jam je ɗon andi.

en: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
ff: Baatalji ngam SARS be MERS lartama haa nder naandolji je wonay goɗɗo.

en: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
ff: haa 2020, wala hurgol malla baatal aynugo ngam SARS je sappinama ɗon jam e naffan neɗɗo.

en: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
ff: Bana sappinol batakkeji teffoln2005 be 2006, maandirɗum be wanginol baataji keese be lekki hurgol SARS laati aranool nummol ngomna'en be geeɓeji jam ɓanndu ummatore haa nder lesdi. Fahin, wala baatal je ɗon aandin ngam MERS.

en: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
ff: haa wakkati je MERS wangi, yimɓe tammi yo'o teffolji do SARS foti dabare feere ngam wurtinugo baatalji malla lekki nyau MERS-CoV.

en: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
ff: haa 20 Maars 2020, woodi no baatal MERS (je wondi do DNA) je timmini foondolji yaɓɓorde I haa suudu lekki, be feere en tati, je fu woni baatalji viriis, adenoviriis, (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), be MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S) woore.

en: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
ff: Sappinolji bindi haa hubaru ummatore wurtini ngewte dabare gal wi'ugo viriis je ɗon wondi haa ɓaawo COVID-19 ɗon no andi e baatal man ɗon timmi.

en: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
ff: Aandinolji je ɗon limti haa do daaldal ummatore ɗon lorta haa aandinolji je ɗon no wondi aran ngam ta'irde geneji ngam asli coronaviriis feere bana koronaviriis SARS.

en: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
ff: Koronaviriisji b' laati geeɓe irin viriisji je ɗon hokka nyauji haa daabaje be cooli.

en: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
ff: haa nder nder neɗɗo, koronaviriis ɗon hokka nyau lawol pofɗe je foti umma diga seeɗa haa mayde.

en: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
ff: Nyauji je nyaɗay jur laarani nyau bana ndamba (je foti mara ujaji feere, ɓurna fu rhinoviriisji), haa wakkati feere asli feere foti hokka SARS, MERS, BE COVID-19.

en: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
ff: Mandolji haa nder daabaji feere ɗon saanja: haa goortoɗe, ɓe ɗon hokka nyau lawol pofɗe dow, haa naa'i be gaduji bo'o ɗon hokka caarol.

en: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
ff: Wala baatal malla lekki mbarugo virisji ngam aynugo malla hurgugo neɗɗo ngam nyau koronaviriis.

en: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
ff: Koroonaviriis ɗon woni haa asngol Orthocoronavirinae, geeɓe Coronaviridae, calaaje Nidovirales, e lamorde Riboviria.

en: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
ff: Be laati viriisji je ɗon suddi genome je ɗon mari RNA be kosngal gooto be nucleocapsid be ɓanndu yirlama.

en: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
ff: Maunugo genome koronaviriis ɗon fuɗɗa diga kilobaseji 26 haa 32, gooto haa cakka viriisji RNA je ɓuri yajjugo.

en: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
ff: Ɓe ɗon mari bana gi'e haa do do ɓanndu maɓɓe, je to wati nder electon micrographji ɗon waɗa bana naandi foto naange je ɗon jayna ko waɗi inde maɓɓe.

en: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
ff: Koronaviriisji tawotto aranool gal 1930 haa wakkati je ɓe tawi nyau pofde haa nder goortoɗe saare bana wangi gal viriis bronchitis je ɗon raɓɓa (IBV).

en: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
ff: Gal 1940, woodi koronaviriisji daabaji feere, viriis hengre doombi (MHV) be viriis gartroenteritis je ɗon raɓɓa (TGEV), tawotto. Koronaviriisji neɗɗo tawama ja 1960.

en: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
ff: Arandere je ɗon jaangini wurti haa nyauɓe je mari no ndamba meere, je ewnotto koronaviriis 229E be koronaviriis neɗɗo OC43.

en: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
ff: Arandere fotoji maɓɓe wurti gal jaanginoowo viriis Scotland June Almeida haa St. Thomas Hospital haa London.

en: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
ff: Koronaviriis neɗɗo feere mandotto diga nden, bana SARS-CoV haa 2003, HCoV NL63 haa 2004, HKU1 haa 2005, MERS-CoV haa 2012, be SARS-CoV-2 haa 2019.

en: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
ff: Ɓurna fu ɗon memma nyauji lawol pofɗe.

en: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
ff: Inde man wurti aranool man haa 1968 gal geeɓe jaanginooɓe viriisji je aandakke haa nder batakkewol Nature ngam ewnugo calaaje viriisji keese.

en: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
ff: Inde ndu hoccitti do wondugo ɓiɓe viriisji ndu (viriis man je raɓɓatta) gal electron microskopy, je ɗon mari bana gi'e je fuɗɗi do ɓanndu maaɗa je ɓiɓe lekki, je wangi bana naange je ɗon jalɓitta.

en: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
