ff: Ndu woni bana ni ngam gi'e peplomerji viriis, je laati proteinji do ɓanndu viriis ndu.

en: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
ff: Koronaviriisji woni bana ɓiɓe lekki bana gi'e ɗon fuɗɗi do ɓanndu maɓɓe je wurti gal laaral ɓanndu.

en: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
ff: Laaral viriis haa electron micrographji ɗon lara bana bawo electronji je woni ɗiɗi. Laaral viriis ɗon ɗiɗi e tardi ba ɓeelere je ɗon sigga proteinji laaral (M), Laaral (E) be hoore (S).

en: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
ff: Laaral ɓanndu je ɗon ɗiɗi bana ɓeelere, proteinji laaral, be nucleocapsid ɗon fadda viriis to o wurti ɓanndu suudu siggorde maaɗa..

en: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
ff: Koronaviriisji ɗon mari genome je positive, be kosngal RNA gooto.

en: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
ff: Maunugo genome koronaviriis ɗon fuɗɗa diga kilobaseji 26.4 haa 31.7.

en: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
ff: Maunugo genome woni bana je ɓuri maunugo haa kunde viriisji RNA.

en: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
ff: Jaangugo frameji 1a be 1b je ɗon maɓɓitti, je ɗon hoosa genomeji ɗiɗi do tati, lamba polyprotein replicase/transcriptase.

en: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
ff: Polyprotein replicase/transcriptase senda ɓanndu maɓɓe ngam lata proteinji je wala tagle. Kuje jaangirde je warango lamban ɓurna proteinji tagle ngel: hoore, laaral, laaral, be nucleocappsid.

en: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
ff: Ta'irde haa kunde jaangirde ndu laati jaangirdeji proteinji feere.

en: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
ff: Limtol proteinji feere be kugal maɓɓe laati feerejo be irin koronaviriis.

en: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
ff: Raɓɓende ɗo fuɗɗa to glycoprotein hooer (S) hawti be jaɓɓowo cell maaɗa je feere ndu.

en: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
ff: haa ɓaawo hawtirol, protease cell jaɓɓowo ɗon ta'a e ummina protein hoore je ɗon woni.

en: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
ff: Do protease cell jaɓɓowo je ɗon woni, ta'irde be umminki ɗo waɗa viriis nasta cell jaɓɓowo gal endocytosis malla hawtirde laaral viriis be kuusel ɓanndu jaɓɓowo. haa wakkati nastirde haa nder cell jaɓɓowo, viriis ɓooran, genome maaɗa ɗon nasta haa cytoplasm cell.

en: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
ff: Ko mbiyotto host ribosome ɗon lornita arandere ko goɗɗo foti jaanga haa do gilɗi ndu e ɗon latina ɗum bana poliprotein je juttungel.

en: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
ff: Polyprotein ɗon mari proteasji maaɗa je ɗon ta'a polyprotein do proteinji je maray ɓanndu.

en: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
ff: Limgal nonstructural proteinji ɗon hawta ngam wurtinugo multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).

en: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
ff: Aranool protein replicase-transcriptase laati RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).

en: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
ff: laarani haa nder nuftol e jaangirde RNA haa kosɗe RNA.

en: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
ff: Proteinji feere je maray ɓanndu haa nder kuje wallan nder nuftol e laahal jaangirde.

en: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
ff: Protein exoribonuclease nonstructural, bana sappinol, ɗon hokka amana haa nuftol gal hokkugo dabare jaangirde je RNA polymerase RNA woda. Gooto haa cakka kuɗe maɓɓe arandere woni nuftugo genome viriis.

en: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
ff: RdRp sendan lartol negative-sense genomic RNA diga positive-sense genomic RNA.

en: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
ff: Ndu ɗon tokkitiri be nuftol positive-sense genomic RNA haa negative-sense genomic RNA.

en: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
ff: Kugal kanduɗum kuje ndu woni jaangugo genome viriis.

en: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
ff: RdRp ɗon hawta lartol negative-sense subgenomic RNA moleculeji haa positive-sense genomic RNA.

en: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
ff: Ndu ɗon tokkiti be irin negative-sense subgenomic RNA moleculeji haa positive-sense mRNAs je ɗon naandi.

en: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
ff: Positive-sense genomic RNA je nuftama latan genome viriis je waratta.

en: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
ff: mRNAs laati jaangirde gene gooto nder tati ragare genome viriis haa ɓaawo aranol jaangirde ndu.

en: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
ff: mRNAs ndu lornama gal jaɓɓowo ribosomeji haa nder structural proteinji be proteinji feere.

en: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
ff: lornugo RNA ɗon salla nder retikulum endoplasmic.

en: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
ff: Viral structural proteins S, E, be M ɗon yahda gal lawol tuttol haa nder suudu Golgi je cakare.

en: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
ff: haa ton, M proteinji M ɗon nelda kuɗe protein-protein mari haaje mofturde viriisji gal tokkitol hawtirde maɓɓe be nucleocapsid.

en: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
ff: Viriisji asngol yoffotto haa host cell gal exocytosis gal lawol wurtol tuttol.

en: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
ff: Kuɗe koronaviriis spike protein be host cell receptor kanduɗum nder fammugo tissue tropism, raɓɓ, asngol e caalage viriis.

en: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
ff: Koronaviriis SARS, bana sappinol, ɗon memma cellji gal hawtugo be angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.

en: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
ff: Inde jaangirde koronaviriis woni Orthocoronavirinae malla Coronavirinae.

en: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
ff: Koronaviriis ɗon nasta nder geeɓe Coronaviridae, tokkitol Nidovirales, be asli Riboviria.

en: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
ff: Inde Betacoronavirus; irin geeɓe: Murine coronavirus

en: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
ff: Asli: Betacoronavirus 1 (Koronaviriis naa'i, Koronaviriis Neɗɗo OC43), Neɗɗo HKU1, Murine koronaviriis, Pipistrellus koronaviriis bilwili HKU5, Rousettus koronaviriis bilwili HKU9, koronaviriis je ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe nyaɗum (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris koronaviriis bilwili HKU4, koronaviriis je ɗon hokka nyau je saɗirma nder pofɗe cakare Funaange, koronaviriis 1 camnagel (EriCoV)

en: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
ff: Asli: Beluga whale koronaviriiss SW1, viriis Infectious bronchitis

en: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
ff: Maama asngol koronaviriis je wangi neeɓay (MRCA) waɗi bana yahan gal 8000 BCE, ko to irin feere ɗon yara maama je ɓurna fu gal duuɓi milionji 55 malla ɓuri, je yiɗi sappinugo yahidottol juttungel be bilwili be cooli.

en: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
ff: Maama asngol alphakoronaviriis je wangi neeɓay ndu wonan gal 2400 BCE, asngol betakoronaviriis haa 3300 BCE, asngol gammakoronaviriis haa 2800 BCE, be asngol ddeltakoronaviriis gal 3000 BCE.

en: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
ff: Limtol geeɓeji bilwili siggorde be cooli, be hawtirde maɓɓe, sappini yahde be sankittol koronaviriisji je juttungel. Koronaviriis neɗɗo ɗuɗɗum ummi haa bilwili.

en: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
ff: Neeɓay ɗo, koronaviriis alpaka be koronaviriis neɗɗo 229E waylitti haa wakkati feere hiddeko 1960.

en: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
ff: MERS-CoV wangi haa neɗɗo diga bilwili be suudu cakare mako ngeeloba.

en: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
ff: MERS-CoV, ko to laarani asli koronaviriis bilwili jur maa, bana waylitti haa maɓɓe diga ujineje ɗuɗɗum.

en: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
ff: Koronaviriis bilwili je ɓuri ɓadugo be SARS-CoV waylitti haa 1986.

en: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
ff: Lawol yahde ndu koronaviriis SARS be koronaviriisji bilwili, ɗon sappina yo'o koronaviriisji SARS yahidi no haa nder bilwili diga ɓoyma.

en: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
ff: haa 1790, koronaviriis pucci waylitti diga koronaviriis naa'i haa ɓaawo hawtirde maɓɓe.

en: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
ff: haa ɓaawo man gal 1890, koronaviriis neɗɗo OC43 waylitti diga koronaviriis naa'i haa ɓaawo hawtirde maɓɓe.

en: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
ff: Yimɓe tammi yo'o nyau ndamba je 1890 je memmei duniyaru fu foti wangi gal kuje feere, amma naa gal viriis ndamba, ngam wakkati man, mandolji neuronji, be gilɗi je foti wangini nyau duniyaru ndu je aandakke.

en: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
ff: Koronaviriis neɗɗo OC43 do hokkugo nyauji pofɗe woni bana ɗon fiija nder sallinugo nyauji neuronji.

en: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
ff: Gal 1950, koronaviriis OC43 fuɗɗi waylittugo haa yotta genotypeji ndu.

en: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
ff: Bana lartol wangirde maaɗa, viriis hengre doombi (koronaviriis Murine), je ɗon memma hengre doomru be kugal ngandi, ɗon hawti be koronaviriis neɗɗo OC43 be koronaviriis naa'i.

en: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
ff: Koronaviriis neɗɗo HKU1, bana viriisji je en limti haa do ndu, wangi gal yaamooɓe.

en: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
ff: Koronaviriis ɗon saanja ɗuɗɗum do ko ɗon wangina ɗum.

en: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
ff: Feere foti mbara ɓuran 30 nder 100 haa cakka nyauɓe, bana MERS-CoV, e feere laati bana nyaɗay, bana ndamba tan.

en: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
ff: Koronaviriisji foti hokka ndamba be ɓurna mandolji bana wullol baandu, be daande be huudure ngam adenoidji ɗon uppi.

en: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
ff: Koronaviriisji foti hokka pneumonia (pneumonia viriis aranool malla pneumonia bakteriyaji ɗiɗaɓool) be bronchitis (bronchitis viriis aranool malla bronchitis bakteriyaji ɗiɗiɓool).

en: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
ff: Koronaviriis neɗɗo je tawama haa 2003, SARS-CoV, je ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe je nyaɗum (SARS), ɗon mari mandol nyau feerejo ngam ɗon raɓɓa lawol pofɗe je do be je les. Asli koronaviriis neɗɗo joowey e go'o ɗon aandin, be asngol gootoo je ɗon sendi nde calaaje ɗiɗi, ko wartiri ndu koronaviriisji neɗɗo joowey e ɗiɗi.

en: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
ff: Nay haa cakka koronaviriisji ndu ɗon tokkita doggugo haa cakka ummatore e ɓurna fu ɗon wangina mandolji ndamba je nyaɗay haa mauɓe be ɓikkon haa nder duniyaru fu: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.

en: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.
ff: Koronaviriisji ɗon hokka 15% ndamɗa meere.

en: The majority of colds are caused by rhinoviruses.
ff: Ndambaji ɓurna fu wangi gal rhinoviriisji.

en: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.
ff: Koronaviriisji nay je nyaɗay sam ɗon mari yahde be wakkati e ɗon wanga haa yakke peewol haa wakkereji feere.

en: There is no preference towards a particular season in tropical climates.
ff: Wala saanjol be wakkatiji nde gal tropikji.

en: Four human coronaviruses produce symptoms that are generally mild:
ff: Koronaviriisji neɗɗo nay ɗon sappina mandolji je ɓurna fu ɗon:

en: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).
ff: Viriis hoosi inde SARS coronaviriis (SARS-CoV).

en: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
ff: Yimɓe ɓuran 8000 raɓɓi nyau ndu, je sappo nder temere haa cakka maɓɓe maayi.

en: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
ff: haa septambre 2012, woodi koronaviriis keese wangi, aranool man inde man Koronaviriis 2012 Keese, amma jonta hoosi inde koronaviriis cakare Funaange je ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe (MERS-CoV)

en: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.
ff: Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam Ɓaanɗu daasi hakkilo duniyarru fu haa ɓaawo man.

en: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
ff: Matinolji WHO je ɗon larti haa 28 Septambre 2012 mbi'i viriis ndu bana woway sallugo diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo.

en: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.
ff: Amma, haa 12 Me 2013, woodi nyau man je salli diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo wangi haa Faraansa e Ardudo ko laarani Kujeji Ummatore be Jam Ɓaandudu lesdi Faraansa on matini.

en: In addition, cases of human-to-human transmission were reported by the Ministry of Health in Tunisia.
ff: haa ɓesdugo, nyauɓe je sallinol neɗɗo haa neɗɗo matinama gal Aduɗo jam ɓanndu haa Tunisiya.

en: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
ff: Nyauɓe ɗiɗi je ɗon andi mari nyau laarani yimɓe je nangi nyau haa baabirawo maɓɓe je maynama, je nyawi haa ɓaawo ngilli haa Qatar be Saudi Arabiya.

en: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.
ff: Ngam ndu, laati bana viriis man mari larula sallugo diga neɗɗo haa neɗɗo, ngam ɓurna yimɓe je mari nyau sallinatta viriis.

en: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
ff: Ragare inde viriis nyau koronaviriis cakare Funaange je ɗon hokka saɗirma nder pofɗe (MERS-CoV).

en: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
ff: Nyauɓe Lesɗi America (ɗiɗi fu nyamɓitti) wangi haa Me 2014. haa Me 2015, woodi nyau feere wangi haa Republic of Korea, to goɗɗo feere je waɗi jaahangal he cakare Funaange, ngilli cuuɗi lekki nay haa wakkere Seoul ngam hurgugo nyau mako.

en: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.
ff: Ndu wartiri gooto cakka nyau MERS-CoV je ɓuri yajjugo haa yaasi cakare Funaange

en: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
ff: haa Desambre 2019, nyauɓe MERS-CoV 2 468 ɗon andi bana ni gal lartolji suudu lartol, 851 haa kunde maɓɓe maynama, limtol mayde ɓadi 34.5%.

en: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
ff: haa Desambre 2019, wangol pneumonia matinama haa Wuhan, Cayna.

en: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
ff: haa 31 Desambre 2019, nyau wangi bana asngol koronaviriis keese, je ɓe hokki mo inde 2019-n-CoV tawon gal Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu.

en: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
ff: Teffoɓe feere tammi yo'o Huanan Seafood Market foti naa kanjuum on woni ɓundu sallinol viriis ndu haa neɗɗo. haa 17 Aviiril 2020, yimɓe pettum man 153 822 maynama be 2 240 191 nangi nyau pneumonia koronaviriis je ɗon andi.

en: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
ff: Asngol Wuhan ɗon maandi no bana Betakoronaviriis haa nder geeɓe 2B be ɓadi 70% naandu gene SARS-CoV.

en: The virus has a 96% similarity to a bat coronavirus, so it is widely suspected to originate from bats as well.
ff: Viriis ndu ɗon naandi be 96% be koronaviriis bilwili feere, nden kadi yimɓe jur ɗon tammi wangi gal bilwili.

en: The pandemic has resulted in travel restrictions and nationwide lockdowns in several countries.
ff: Nyau duniyaru ndu wangini haɗɗolji jaahangal be je wurtugo haa nder lesɗe fu.

en: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.
ff: koronaviriis maandotto bana wurtinugo maandolji haa nder jam ɓanndu daabaji diga 1930.

en: Except for avian infectious bronchitis, the major related diseases have mainly an intestinal location.
ff: Sna je bronchitis cooli je ɗon raɓɓa, ɓurna nyauji man ɗon wondi haa nder wakkere teeteki.

en: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.
ff: Koronaviriisji ɗon raɓɓa lawol pofɗe je do be gastrointestinal daabaji be cooli.

en: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.
ff: Fahin bo'o ɓe ɗon wangina nyauji feere haa daabaji je daabaji saare, feere'en bo'o foti wona nyaɗum e laati sababu haa wakkere durugo.

en: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
ff: haa goortoɗe, viriis bronchitis je ɗɓon raɓɓa (IBV), woodi koronaviriis feere, larnay lawol pofɗe tan amma lawol siile.

en: The virus can spread to different organs throughout the chicken.
ff: Viriis ndu foti sankitta haa nder kujeji ɓanndu feere fu haa goortoɗe.

en: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
ff: Koronaviriis je ɓurna fu laarani daabaji saare bana koronaviriis gaduji (koronaviriis gastroenteritis je ɗon raɓɓe, TGE) be koronaviriis naa'i, be sappinol fu be caarol haa ɓikkon daabaji.

en: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
ff: Koronaviriis paturu: irin ɗiɗi, koronaviriis paturu ɗon raɓɓa goɗɗo amma nyaɗay masin, amma sanjol laugel viriis ndu foti lata nyau paturu peritonitis (FIP), nyau je ɗon mbara yimbe jur.

en: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
ff: Fahin bo'o, woodi irin koronaviriisji ɗiɗi je ɗon raɓɓa, jiire: koronaviriis enteric jiire ɗon hokka nyau reedu je ɗon andi bana ndamba daabaji enteritis (ECE), be wangol viriis man keese je ɓuri nyaɗugo (bana FIP haa paatuji je ɗon andi bana koronnaviriis systemic ferret (FSC).

en: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
ff: woodi irin koronaviriis paatuji ɗiɗi (CCoV), gooto je ɗon hokka nyau reedu e je ɗon tawi bana je hokkata nyau pofɗe.

en: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
ff: Viriis henre Doomdu (MHV) woni koronaviriis je ɗon hokka nyau murine be limtol mayde, ɓurna fu haa cakka doombi suddu lartol

en: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
ff: Viriis Sialodacryoadenitis (SDAV) woni coronaviris je ɗon nyaɗi masin haa doomruweela suudu lartol je foti yimɓe sallina haa kunde maɓɓe gal ngidol malla gal hendu.

en: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
ff: Asli MHV feere ɗon hokka demyelinating encephalitis je ɗon yahida haa doombi je hoccama bana irin murine haa sclerosis jur.

en: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
ff: Dabare teffol kanduɗum wondi do laɓɓinugo fuɗɗam pathogenesis viriis koronaviriis irin daabaji ndu, ɓurna fu gal jaanginooɓe viriisji je yardi ekkitol nyauji dabaji.

en: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
ff: Koronaviisus gaduji (koronaviriis reedu gaduji, TGEV).

en: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
ff: Koronaviriis naa'i (BCV), je ɗon hokka nyau teeteki haa ɓikkon naa'i.

en: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
ff: Koronaviriis paaturu (FCoV) ɗon hokka nyau teeteki seeɗa haa paatuji be nyau reedu Paatuji je ɗon nyaɗi (irin viriis man je feere).

en: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
ff: irin koronviriis paatuji je ɗon ɗiɗi ndu (CCoV) (gooto ɗon raɓɓa teeteki, feere tawama haa nder nyau pofɗe).

en: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
ff: Koronaviriis paula (TCV) ɗon raɓɓa teeteki paulaji.

en: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
ff: Koronaviriis Jiire ɗon raɓɓa jirre be ndamba nder teeteki.

en: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
ff: Koronaviriis systemic Jiire ɗon hokka irin nyau systemic haa jiire.

en: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
ff: Koronaviriis systemic boojel ɗon memma reedu be teeteki be caarol haa ɓikkon boojelji Erop.

en: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
ff: Viriis nyau caarol gaduji (PED malla PEDV), waangi haa nder duniyaru.

en: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
ff: Nyau koronaviriis b' 2019 (COVID-19) laati nyau je ɗon raɓɓa be saɗirma nder pofɗe je wangi gal koronaviiris 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

en: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
ff: Mandolji je ɓurna laarani wullol ɓanndu, sondaaru, be pofɗe bana daran.

en: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
ff: Mandolji feere foti laarani tampere, nawne ɓanndu, caarol, daande be huudure, majjinol haccenga, nawne reedu.

en: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
ff: wakkati diga raɓɓol haa fuɗɗam mandolji ɗon gal balɗe joowey amma foti yaha diga balɗe ɗiɗi haa sappo e nay.

en: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
ff: Nyauɓe ɓurna fu ɗon mari mandolji je nyaɗay, amma feere foti yotta haa pneumonia be nyau kujeji reedu feere-feere.

en: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
ff: haa 17 Aviiril 2020, ɓuri nyauɓe milionji 2.24 matinama bana mari nyau haa nder lesɗe be wakkereji 210, be ɓuri yimɓe 153 000 maynama.

en: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
ff: Yimɓe ɓuri 568 000 nyamɓitti. Viriis sankitti haa kunde ummatore haa aranool man gal wondidugo, ɓurna fu gal tuɗe je ɗon toɓa haa yakke sondaaru, ɓislol, malla ngewte.

en: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
ff: haa yakke je tuɗe ɗon toɓa haa wakkati foofugo, ɗon do'a haa lesdi malla haa do daaldal naa hoorama ngam raɓɓugo yimɓe gal hendu.

en: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
ff: Yimɓe foti nanga nyau gal memmugo baabe je ɗon raɓɓi e haa ɓaawo man memma gite gite, kine malla hunduko maɓɓe.

en: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
ff: Viriis ndu foti yeeɗa do daldal haa njamdi 72.

en: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
ff: Nyau ndu ɓuri raɓɓugo haa arandere balɗe tati diga fuɗɗorde nyau ndu, ko to sankittol foti wona hiddeko wangol mandolji be gal ragare nyau ndu. Dabare lartol je yimɓe ɓuri aandugo woni jaangirde polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) gal ɓaawo gal ilam kine malla daande.

en: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
ff: Wondugo be leepolji suddugo yeeso ɗon feeli haa yimɓe je tammi marugo viriis be ɓe'en je suklata do maɓɓe.

en: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
ff: Wondugo be leepol suddugo yeeso gal ummatore ɗon saanja, be arduɓe feere je yarday yimɓe ɓorna ɗum, feere'en bo'o ɗon feela ɓornugo ɗum, e feere bo'o ɗon dula ɓornugo ndu.

en: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
ff: haa jonta, walla baatal malla lekki hurgol viriis je ɗon andi ngam COVID-19.

en: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
ff: Sallinol nyau haa cakka ummatore ɗon matinama he ɓurna lesɗe fu nder wakkereji WHO.

en: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
ff: Yimɓe je viriis raɓɓi ɓe foti marata mandolji nyau malla sappina mandolji bana je ndamba bana wullol baandu, sondaaru, tampere, be pofɗe bana daran.

en: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
ff: Mandolji fuɗɗam laarani saɗirma pofɗe, naawol malla harlol ɓernde je ɗon neeɓa, harbol, saɗirma be finnugo, saanjol yeeso be hunduko; to mandolji ndu wangi sey a ɓadita yimɓe jam ɓanndu.

en: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
ff: haa yakke feere, mandolji pofɗe do bana ɓislugo, illol kine malla daande be huudure foti wona.

en: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
ff: Mandolji reedu malla teeteki bana tuuta, tuttol be caarol woni be limtol je ɗon saanja tum.

en: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
ff: Nyauɓe feere haa Cayna sappini haa arandere harlol ɓernde be duwinol ɓernde.

en: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
ff: haa feere'en, nyau man foti waylitta do pneumonia, saɗirma kujeji reedu jur be wade.

en: This is called the incubation period.
ff: Ndu ewnotto wakkati nuftol.

en: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
ff: wakkati nuftol COVID-19 woni balɗe joowey haa joowey go'o amma foti wona haa kunde balɗe ɗiɗi haa 14.

en: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
ff: 97.5% yimɓe je sappini mandolji waɗan bana ni haa nder balɗe 11.5 nyau ndu. Batakkeji hubaruji ɗon sappina yo'o naa kala moy fu je mari nyau on sappinatta mandolji ndu.

en: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
ff: Kugal irin roondooɓe haa nder sallinol aandake boɗɗum tawon; amma, arandere sappinolji ɗon holla yo'o foti ɓe naffa nder sankittugo nyau ndu.

en: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
ff: Ta'irde yimɓe je ɗon mari gilɗi ndu amma sappinata mandolji nyau ngu aandake e laati lartotto haande, ngam Ɗowirdeji Aynol be Fadol Nyau (KCDC) wi'i yo'o 20 nder 100 sappinay mandolji haa wakkati jonde maɓɓe haa suudu lekki.

en: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
ff: China's National Health Commission fuɗɗi nastinugo nyauɓe je sappinata mandolji nyau haa nder nyauɓe balɗe haa 1 Aviiril; haa cakka nyauɓe 166 haa nder balɗe nde, 130 (78%) sappinatta no mandolji nyau haa wakkati lartol.

en: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
ff: Didi fu tuutol be tuuɗe foti ronda gildi duɗɗum.

en: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
ff: Wolwugo be sembe ɗon toɓina tuɗe jur do wolwugo be leesare.

en: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
ff: Ekkitol feere haa Singapore tawi yo'o sondaaru je sudday foti waɗa tuɗe do'a e foti yaha metaaji 4.5 (kosɗe).

en: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
ff: Ko to viriis hortakke gal hendu, National Academy of Science holli yo'o sallinol gal hendu foti waɗa, e hoccooɓe hendu je ɗon jo'ini haa dammuɗe jawleruji ɗon no roondi lekkuji je ɗon mari viris RNA.

en: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
ff: Laahalji jam ɓanndu feere bana nastinugo kuje gal daande be ummitinugo ɓernde be fuffu (CPR) foti wangina ilam pofɗe je foti wurta be pofɗe e bana ni hendu sankitta ndu.

en: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
ff: haa yakke je woodi larulaaji ngam fammugo to foti salla gal buuwe, sababu ndu tammi lessi; haa yakke je sankittol foti salla hiddeko mandolji wanga, sababu ndu lessi.

en: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
ff: Ɗowirɗe Aynol be Lartol Nyau (ECDC) wi'i ko to wanay laɓɗe fammugo noy nyau man foti sankitta be kooyɗum, goɗɗo gooto foti raɓɓa yimɓe ɗiɗi malla tati. Viriis foti nyeeɗa do daaldalji nder njamɗe haa balɗe.

en: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
ff: Viriis ndu tawama bana foti maanda ɗum nder balɗe woore haa do takkarde, ngam haa balɗe tati do leeda (polypylene) be nyama larta (AISI 304), e haa njamɗe do 99% cardi.

en: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
ff: Amma, ndu ɗon saanja be peewol be gulɗam.

en: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
ff: Sabulu be omo ɗon naffa bo'o to hocci be lawol man; kujeji sabulu ɗon ɓoora ɓeelere je ɗon tardi gilɗi ndu, itta ɗum, e willa ɓe do ɓanndu be daaldalji feere.

en: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
ff: Dabareji feere bana benzalkonium chloride be chlorhexidine gluconate (kuje laɓɓinugo seekkowo), maray sembe jur. Ekkitol feere haa Hong Kong, leeku tuɗe ɗon no hoosa ɓurna balɗe ɗiɗi haa ɓaawo fuɗɗam wondugo haa suudu lekki.

en: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
ff: haa nder cakka nyauɓe nay do joowey, aranool leeku sappini limtol viriis je ɓuri fu, be joowey e woore nyauɗo sappini limtol viriisji je ɓuri haa ɗiɗaɓre balɗe lartol.

en: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
ff: Koronaviriis 2 (SARS-CoV-2) je ɗon hokka nyau saɗirma pofɗe woni koronaviriis keese be je saɗirma pofɗe, tawama arandere haa yimɓe tati be pneumonia je hawti be sammere nyau pofɗe haa Wuhan.

en: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
ff: Mandolji viriis SARS-CoV keese ɗon salla bana je koronaviriis.

en: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
ff: haa yaasi ɓanndu neɗɗo, sabulu saare ɗon mbarda viriis man, je ɗon feetina nguffu je ɗon fadi mo. SARS-CoV-2 ɗon naandi be arandere SARS-CoV.

en: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
ff: Fuffu laati ko je COVID-19 ɗon memma jur ngam viriis ɗon nasta cellji jaɓɓoowo gal neebam angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), je ɓuri wondugo haa type II alveolar cellji fuffu.

en: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
ff: Viriis ndu ɗon hoosa daaldal glycoprotein feerejo ewnotto "hoore" (peplomer) ngam hawtugo be ACE2 e nastugo nder cell jaɓɓowo.

en: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
ff: Huudure seeɗa do ɓernde tawama haa 12% yimɓe je mari nyau e je wondi haa suudu lekki haa Wuhan, Cayna, e ɗon woni ɓurna fu haa nder nyau ndu.

en: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
ff: Limtolji mandolji nyau ɓernde ɗon wa'i, ngam jabbuye do dabare hurgugo huudure be fadol haa wakkati yahde nyau, amma huudure myokard foti bo'o larna jaɓɓoowo ACE2 haa nder ɓernde.

en: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
ff: Jaɓɓoowo ACE2 ɗon sappini haa nder ɓernde e ɗon naffa nder kugal ɓernde.

en: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
ff: Be tawi yo'o woodi kuje feere ɗon fuɗa haa nder iyam maɓɓe (31%) e ko mbiyotto thromboembolism (25%) tawama haa nyauɓe ICU je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 e foti en yecca yahay. Lartol ɓanndu nyauɓe COVID-19 je maynama sappini nawnol fuffu (DAD), e ndiyam iyam je ɗon mari ko nyauwata ndu ɗon no ila nder fuffu.

en: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
ff: Ko to SARS-COV-2 ɗon mari tropism ngam ACE2-expressing epithelial cellji lawol pofɗe, nyauɓe be COVID-19 je nyaɗi ɗon mari mandolji yajjugo huudure ndu.

en: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
ff: Ba wi'ugo, pathogenic GM-CSF-je ɗon ruffa T-cellji bana ɗon yahida be nastirde inflammatory IL-6-je ɗon fuffa monocyteji be mandolji fuffu je nyaɗum haa nyauɓe COVID-19.

en: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
ff: Illol lymphocyt haa toon bo'o matinama haa nder mayde.

en: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
ff: WHO wangini dabareji lartol nyau ndu.

en: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
ff: Dabare lartol je ɗon andi woni real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

en: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
ff: Lartol ndu ngaɗama ɓurna fu be leeku pofɗe je ɓe ɗon hoosa gal ilam kine malla je daande; amma, foti bo'o hoosa leeku ndamba malla ilam kine.

en: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
ff: Sappinolji ɓurna fu ɗon wanga haa nder njamɗe seeɗa malla balɗe ɗiɗi.

en: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
ff: Lartolji iyam foti naffa, amma kanjuum yiɗi sey hoosa leekuji ɗiɗi je hoccama asaweji ɗiɗi be sappinolji ndu je wangata law.

en: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
ff: Teffooɓe Cayna foti no wurtinugo asli koronaviriis feere e sappini ta'irde gene heɓɓa cuuɗi lartol haa nder duniyaru foti wangina lartolji polymerase chain reaction (PCR) ngam maandugo nyau viriis ndu.

en: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
ff: haa Aviiril 2020, lartolji fadooɓe ɓanndu (je foti maanda nyauji e to goɗɗo nangi no nyau ara) ɗon no do yahde, amma je naa yimɓe fu on huwatta be man tawon.

en: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
ff: Ekkitol yimɓe Cayna be lartol sappini yo'o goonakku maaɗa woni 60 haa 70% tan.

en: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
ff: FDA haa Lesɗe America yardi aranol lartol haa wakkere jam ɓanndu haa 21 Maars 2020 ngam huwugo be man haa ragare lewru. Dabare lartol je waangi gal Zhongnan Hospital Wuhan University feeli laahalji maandugo nyauji gal mandolji nyau be sababu nyau.

en: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
ff: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities be sallinol yaasi, je yahiday be ɓaawo tawama ɓurna fu haa nder aranool nyau.

en: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
ff: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (uppugo lobular septal be illol je ɗon saanja haa nder alveolji), be sattugo foti wona to bana nyau ndu ɗon yahda.

en: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
ff: Wala matinolji ɗuɗɗum do huudure petpetel be yahde COVID-19 ɓanndu.

en: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
ff: Sappinolji mandolji aranool haa lartol mayde woni:

en: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
ff: Makroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, sattugo fuffu be uppugo fuffu

en: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
ff: Pneumonia viriis fotti sappina saɗirmaji nay:

en: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
ff: pneumonia je deydey: uppugo fuffu, pneumocyte hyperplasia, maunugo pneumocyteji, huudure interstitial be illol lymphocyte be wondugo cell je ɗon mauni be mari ɓiɓe jur

en: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
ff: pneumonia nyaɗum: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) be diffuse alveolar exudateji.

en: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
ff: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.

en: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
ff: pneumonia je hurgotto: kawtirde exudateji haa nder alveolar cavities be pulmonary interstitial fibrosis

en: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
ff: Iyam : ɗacce intravascular sankitti (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction

en: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
ff: Dabareji aynol ngam ustugo sa'iji raɓɓugo nyau laarani wondugo haa saare, luttugo kawtirde ummatore, lallugo juɗe be sabulu be ndiyam haa wakkati fu haa nder sekonji 20 pettum man, laɓɓinugo lawol pofɗe be aynol tato on memma gite, kine malla hunduko be juɗe je lallay.

en: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
ff: CDC ɗon feela suddugo hunduko be kine to a ɗon sonda malla ɓislugo e ɗon feela bo'o nder jokke jungo mooɗon to wala leepol.

en: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
ff: Lallugo juɗe haa ɓaawo sondaaru malla ɓislol feelama.

en: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
ff: CDC feeli ɓornugo limse suddugo yeeso haa wakkere ummatore, ngam ustugo raɓɓol gal yimɓe je sappinata mandolji tawon. Dabareji dayol be ummatore yiɗi ustugo ngidol be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau haa nder wakkareji je yimɓe ɗuɗɗi haa ton gal maɓɓugo cuuɗi jaangirde be baabe kugal, ustugo jaahangalji be haɗɗugo mofturdeji ummatore.

en: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
ff: Dabareji dayol laarani bo'o wondugo haa pettum man kosɗe 6 (1.8 m) be goɗɗo.

en: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
ff: Wala lekki je ɗon andi be fakatre ngam aynol nyau COVID-19. Ngam baatal footay wanga hiddeko 2021 haa pettum man, dabare aynugo do COVID-19 laati ustugo yahde nyau, je ɗon andi bana "jippinugo yahde".

en: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
ff: CDC feeli bo'o yimɓe lalla juɗe maɓɓe haa wakkati fu be sabulu be ndiyam nder sekonji 20 pettum man, ɓurna bo'o to a yeehi haa gaɗɗa malla to bana juɗe ɗon mari cuddi, hiddeko nyammugo e haa ɓaawo foofugo kine, sondugo malla ɓislugo.

en: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
ff: O ɗon feela bo'o huwugo be kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe je mari alkol pettum man 60%, amma sey sna to sabulu be ndiyam wala. haa wakkereji je wala sippol kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe, WHO ɗon hokka mon daɓare waɗugo ɗum be hoore mooɗon.

en: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
ff: haa nder laahalji ndu, kugal mbardol gilɗiji ndu wangi gal ethanol malla isopropanol.

en: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
ff: Hydrogen peroxide naffan ngam nattinugo bakteriyaji haa nder alkol; latay "kuje je wondi ngam laɓɓinugo juɗe".

en: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
ff: Glycerol ɗon ɓesdi bana kuje sofnol.

en: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
ff: Yimɓe hokkama suklare ngam fadol, je foti larna hurgol be njaaram, wallende be heendu, be wallugo kujeji ɓanndu feere je ɗon kanduɗum.

en: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
ff: CDC ɗon feela yo'o ɓe'en je tammi roondugo viriis ɓoorna mask suudugo yeeso.

en: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
ff: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) naffiki no ngam hurgugo sababu pofɗe, amma ribaji maaɗa ɗon do lartol haa jonta.

en: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
ff: Laɓɓinol ɓanndu be jonde e nyamɗe boɗɗe feelama ngam ɓesdugo fadol.

en: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
ff: Hurgolji walllende foti naffa be maandolji je nyaɗay haa fuɗɗam nyau. WHO be Chinese National Health Commission wangini feeloji ngam suklugo do yimɓe je ɗon woni haa nder suudu lekki je mari COVID-19.

en: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
ff: Huwooɓe be jaawal malla ɗon sukla do fuffu haa Lesɗe America wurtini feeloji haa geeɓeji jur ngam wallende meere, IBCC.

en: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
ff: haa Aviiril 2020, woda hurgol COVID-19 je kkanduɗum.

en: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
ff: Ko laarani matinolji, huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu feeli paracetamol (acetaminophen) do ibuprofen haa nyauɓe.

en: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
ff: Sey huwa be hakiika ngam ustugo sababu raɓɓugo gilɗi, ɓurna fu haa nder wakkerji jam ɓaanɗu haa yakke waɗugo laahalji je foti foti wurtina pofɗe, bana nastinol kuje haa nder daande malla fartol hendu be jungo.

en: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
ff: haa huwoɓe je sulata do jam ɓanndu yimɓ be COVID-19, CDC ɗon feela wattugo goɗɗo man haa nder Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) haa ɓesdugo do kugal be hakiika. CDC ɗon wangini dabareji ngam fadol hoore mum (PPE) haa wakkati nyau duniyaru ndu.

en: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
ff: Kujeji je ɗon feeli ngam ɓornugo: ngapaleewol PPE, ordo foofugo malla mask suddugo yeeso, kuje fadugo gite, be kujeji suddugo juɗe. To woodi, ordo pofɗe (do mask sudugo yeeso) ɓuri naffugo.

en: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
ff: Ordoji foofugo N95 jarfama ngam huwugo haa wakkereji tagle kujeji amma FDA jarfi maskji ndu nder kugal Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).

en: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
ff: Kugal maɓɓe laati fadugo ngam kujeji je hendu roondi bana coolaaje amma naffuda man ngam gilɗi je ɗon aandin footay hokka jabbuye je fakatre.

en: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
ff: To maskji wala, CDC ɗon feela ɓornugo kuje fadugo yeeso malla, bana dabare je ragare, maskji je waɗama haa saare.

en: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
ff: Nyauɓe COVID-19 ɓurna fu ɗon emma fartol hendu be ordo malla dabare feere, NS

en: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
ff: Irin wallende pofɗe haa yimɓe je mari nyau COVID-19 be saɗirma nder pofɗe ɗon do ekkitol ngam yimɓe je ɗon woni haa suudu lekki, be sappinol je foti acca nastirde kuje foofugo haa nder daande be ilam kine je nyaɗum be saɗirmaji pofɗe.

en: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
ff: To ɗiɗi fu ɗon yara haa ribaji fu je naffata yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau man maasin wala fammugo tawon.

en: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
ff: Lekkitoɓe feere yardi wondugo be fartol hendu be ordo to woodi ngam dabare ndu ɗon usta sankittol kujeji je heendu foti horta to foondi be ilam kine je nyaɗum. Nyau ndu ɓuri nyaɗugo haa ndotti'en (ɓe'en je ɓuri duuɓi 60, ɓurna fu ɓe'en je ɓuri duuɓi 80).

en: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
ff: Lesɗe je ɗon mari aandal e risku ɗuɗɗum maray leesoji suudi lekki je yimbe fu, kanjuum wadi footay yimɓe fu heɓɓa nyambitol to limgal nyauɓe COVID-19 je mari haaje wondugo haa suudu lekki wa'i.

en: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
ff: Ekkitol feere haa Cayna sappini yo'o 5% neldotto haa geeɓe suklare nyaɗum, 2.3% mari no haaje fartol heendu gal ordo, be 1.4% maynama.

en: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
ff: haa Cayna, ɓadi 30% yimɓe haa suudu lekki be COVID-19 neldotto haa ICU.

en: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
ff: Fartol gal ordo latan caɗɗungel masitin to saɗirma nder pofɗe ɗon fuɗɗa (ARDS) haa COVID-19 be hendu je ɗon lata caɗɗum masitin.

en: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
ff: Ordoji waɗugo heendu je foti ayna harloji be PEEP je mauni naffan ngam ɓesdugo heendu haa yakke ustugo sababu huudure do fuffu be pneunomothorax ngam ordo fartugo hendu.

en: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
ff: PEEP foti tawakke haa nder ordoji pofɗe je aran.

en: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
ff: Teffol ngam tammunde hurgolji fuɗɗi haa Zaanviye 2020 be lekki mbardugo viriisji jur ɗon do foondolji haa suudu lekki.

en: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
ff: Remdesivir laati bana ɓuri naffugo.

en: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
ff: Ko to lekki keese foti yotta haa 2021 hiddeko wurtugo, lekki jur ɗon do lartol e laati jaɓɓama ngam kugal feere malla ɗon do lartol je dayɗum timmi.

en: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
ff: Lekki mbardugo viriis foti foondotto haa yimɓe be nyau nyaɗum.

en: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
ff: WHO feeli foondooɓe wonda haa nder lartol naffuda be jam hurgolji je foti yotta. FDA hokki jarfuye be wakkati haa neebam iyam bana hurgol foondol haa nyauɓe je nyau maɓɓe ɓuri nyaɗugo.

en: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
ff: Sallinay ekkitolji suudu lekki je aandin no ngam sappinugo laati kanduɗum e woodi naffitirki ngam nyau.

en: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
ff: haa Feviriye 2020, Cayna wurtini applikasion feere je aynata sankittol nyau ndu.

en: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
ff: Howooɓe be majuum emmotto ngam nastinugo lamba mandirɗum maɓɓe.

en: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
ff: Applikasion ndu foti maanda "ngidol je ɓaditi" gal huwidugo be matinolji aynol e nden kadi bana sababu raɓɓugo nyau.

en: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
ff: Kala huwoowo be majuum foti larta wonde yimɓe feere tati je ɗon mari.

en: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
ff: To woodi sababu feere ɗon tawi, applikasion ndu feelatta mon wondugo sera tan, amma matinan bo'o huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu wakkere ndu. Matinolji lartol ɗuɗɗum do matinolji telefon, dabare maandirɗum yeeso, tokkitol wakkere woonde be aandal ordo naffan ngam tawittugo yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau be yimɓe be yimɓe je ɓe ngidi be maɓɓe haa South Koorea, Taiwan be Singapore.

en: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
ff: haa Maars 2020, ngomna Israyila hokki jarfuye haa geeɓeji jam ngam tokkitugo mandolji telefon yimɓe bana mari nyau koronaviriis.

en: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
ff: Dabare ndu hoosama ngam aynugo do wondugo haa sera be fadugo ɓe'en je foti ngida be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau.

en: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
ff: Fahin haa Maars 2020, Deutsche Telekon sendi matinolji mandol wakkereji telefon je ɗon hawti be geeɓe ngomna lesdi Jaamani, Robert Koch Institute, ngam teffugo e aynugo sankittol viriis.

en: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
ff: Russiya wangini dabare maandirɗum yeeso ngam maandugu yimɓe je yiɗa wondugo haa sera.

en: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
ff: Arduɗo do jam ɓanndu lesdi Italy Giulio Gallera wi'i arduɓe telefon matini mo'o yo'o "40% yimɓe ɗon tokkita tarugo".

en: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
ff: Ngomna Jaamani sallini ekkitol gal yurnol matinolji haa nder njamɗe be yimɓe 42000.

en: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
ff: Fahin, Jagorɗo Estoniya, Kersti Kaljulaid, ewni yimɓe jur ngam dabareji ummatore nder aandalji kanduɗum do sankittol koronaviriis.

en: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
ff: Yimɓe foti heɓɓa larula ngam wondugo haa sera, haɗɗol jaahangalji, sababuji hurgol be hulol nyau man.

en: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
ff: BBC lorniti ko Rory O'Connor be wi'ugo, "Wondugo haa sera ummatore je ɓuri, wondugo feerejo, nummol do jam ɓanndu, tampere be ustol mardi laati bana dulluru ngam gaanyugo jam hakkilo e jam woore yimɓe".

en: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
ff: Nyau ndu foti yocca yahde deydey be mandolji seeɗa malla woda, je ɗon naandi irin nyauji lawol pofɗe je do bana ndamba meere.

en: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
ff: Nyauɓe je ɗon mari nyau deydey tan ɓurna fu nyamɓittan haa nder asawere ɗiɗi, ɓe'en je mari nyau je nyaɗi malla je ɓuri nyauɗugo foti hoosa asaweji tati haa joowey e go'o haa nyamɓitta.

en: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
ff: Rewɓe be reedu foti mara sababuji ɓuri nyaɗugo ngam COVID-19 do mandolji je tawama do irin koronaviriis ndu, bana SARS be MERS, amma matinolji do COVID-19 woda. haa yimɓe feere, COVID-19 foti memma fuffu e hokka pneumonia.

en: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
ff: haa ɓe'en je nyau ɗon torra masin, COVID-19 foti yotta haa nyau pofɗe je deydey (ARDS) ko ɗon wada saɗirma nder pofɗe, duwinol malla nyau kujeji feere nder ɓanndu.

en: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
ff: Saɗirmaji be COVID-19 laarani nawnol ɓanndu, ɗajjugo malla nawnugo bernde, ɓooye be hengre.

en: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
ff: Ɗajjol iyam je wonay be lawol, be ɓesdare wakkati prothrombin, sappinotto haa 6% ɓe'en je neldama haa suudu lekki be COVID-19, be 4% ɓooye je huwata boɗɗum haa nder geeɓe.

en: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
ff: Ɓadi 20-30% yimɓe je mari COVID-19 ɗon sappina neebam hengre (transaminaseji) mauni.

en: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
ff: haa limte batakkewol ndu, wakkati cakare digga fuɗɗam mandolji haa wade woni no balɗe sappo, be joowey wondi haa suudu lekki.

en: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
ff: amma, nyauɓe je ɓe neldi haa nder ICU ɗon mari wakkati balɓe joowey e ɗiɗi haa kunde wondugo haa suudu lekki be mayde.

en: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
ff: haa nder ekkitol arandere nyauɓe, wakkati cakare diga fuɗɗam mandolji haa mayde laati no balɗe 14, be balɗe yahan diga joowey e go'o haa 41.

en: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
ff: haa nder ekkitol National Health Commission (NHC) Cayna, worɓe mari no limtol mayde 2.8% e rewɓe mari no limtol wade 1.7%.

en: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
ff: Lartolji tariya nyau ndu haa nder leeku fuffu mayɗo ɗon sappina diffuse alveolar damage be cellular fibromyxoid exudateji haa nder fuffu ɗiɗi fu.

en: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
ff: Saanjolji viriis haa nder cellji tawama haa nder pneumocyteji.

en: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
ff: Foto fuffu naandi no nyau saɗirma pofɗe (ARDS).

en: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
ff: haa kunde 11.8% mayɓe je ɗon matini gal National Health Commission Cayna, memmol ɓernde matinotto be limtol tropinin malla darnol ɓernde.

en: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
ff: haa sappinol matinolji Maars haa Lesɗe America, 89% je ɓe'en je wondi haa suudu lekki e mari saɗirmaji feere. Wondugo dabareji jam ɓanndu jonde ummatore be mardi wakkere ndu foti memma limtol mayde

en: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
ff: Limtol mayde ngam saɗirma ɗon saanja ngam feeretirolji wekkereji ndu, amma bo'o ngam larulaaji yahde laahal.

en: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
ff: Limgal nyauɓe je maray larula jur foti ɓesda limtol mayde.

en: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
ff: Amma, ko je mayde laati sappinol nyauɓe je nangi nyau ndu ara foti wi'a yo'o limtol mayde jonta ɗon lessi.

en: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
ff: Foɗɗooɓe woni no bana ɗon sappina mandolji nyau je nyaɗum haa COVID-19 nde 1.4 be ɓadi nde 2.4 je bana ɓuri marugo haaje suklare feere malla maya to foondi be ɓe'en je wala foɗɗugo. woodi larulaaji je wangi ngam ko nyau man accatta haa ɓaawo to hurgi.

en: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
ff: Hong Kong Hospital Authority sappini jippol 20% be 30% haa nder sembe fuffu haa yimɓe je nyamɓitti nder nyau ndu, be lartol fuffu je ɗon no holla sampittol.

en: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
ff: Ndu foti yara haa nyau suklugo do jam ɓandu haa ɓaawo nyamɓittol.

en: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
ff: haa Maars 2020, yimɓe aanda no to nyau je sallingo ɗon hokka fadol haa yimɓe je yamɓittama.

en: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
ff: Fadol laati bana foti, do gikku koronaviriisji feere, amma nyauɓe je nyamɓitti haa COVID-19 tokkitotto be lartolji je ɗon sappina o ɗon mari nyau woni.

en: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
ff: Irin hurgolji ndu tammi bana nyau feere je ɗon ɗaayi do wonugo raɓɓol keese.

en: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
ff: Viriis ndu ɗon tammi bana woni haa ladde e wangi gal daabaji, gal nyau je hebbi timmi.

en: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
ff: En aanda gal toy wanngi, amma gal lewru Desambre 2019 yaajugo nyau man salli ɓurna yimɓe, oya haa oya.

en: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
ff: Jaangirde arandere nyauɓe 41 je ɗon andi mari COVID-19, je wurti haa Zaanviye 2020 haa Lancet, sappini wakkati je mandolji je ɓuri wangugo be laugel haa 1 Desambre 2019.

en: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
ff: Sappinolji WHO sappini arandere fuɗɗam wangol mandolji haa 8 Desambre 2019.

en: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
ff: Dabareji ɗuɗɗum ɗon ɓurna naffa ngam limtol mayɓe.

en: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
ff: Limtolji ndu ɗon saanja be wakkere e be wakkati e memmotto gal lartolji, daraja dabare jam ɓanndu, suɓɓolji hurgol, wakkati diga fuɗɗam aranool wangirde nyau be gikku ummatore bana duuɓi, baadal be jam ɓanndu fu.

en: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
ff: haa ragare 2019, WHO hokki jaawal lamba nyau ICD-10 U07.1 ngam mayde diga fammugo nyau SARS-CoV-2 haa nder suudu lartol be U07.1 ngam mayde je tawake haa suudu lekki malla gal nyau COVID-19 bila SARS-CoV-2 je nastay haa suudu lekki. Limtol nyauɓe haa kunde maybe laarani limgal yimɓe je maynama sendugo man be limgal yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau man haa nder wakkati je ɗon aandin.

en: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
ff: Wondugo do sappinolji Johns Hopkins University, limtol wade do nyauɗo woni 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) diga 17 Aviiril 2020.

en: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
ff: Limgal ɗon saanja be wakkere. Dabareji feere laarani limtol mayde (CFR), je ɗon sappina limgal yimɓe je mari no nyau e maayi, be limtol raɓɓol (IFR), je ɗon holla limtol yimɓe (je larti be lartay) je maayi ngam nyau feere.

en: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
ff: Sappinolji ndu larnay wakkati e ɗon tokkita ummatore feerejo ngam nyau gal hurgol nyau.

en: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
ff: Ko to naa kala moy fu foti ummina kujeji fadugo ɓanndu, wondugo maɓɓe foti hokka matinolji do noy yimɓe jur raɓɓi nyau ndu.

en: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
ff: haa nder cakare nyau haa Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, wuro pamaron be yimɓe 4600, be 80 (1.7%) maynama timmi.

en: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
ff: haa Gangelt, nyau sankitti gal juldeji Carnival, e raɓɓi ummatore sukkaɓe, be limtol mayde seeɗa tan, e naa kala mayɗo ngam COVID-19 nastan haa nder geeɓe ndu.

en: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
ff: Fahin bo'o, dabare jam ɓanndu Jaamani ɓuray tawon.

en: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
ff: haa Netherlands, ɓadi 3% foti mara fadooɓe ɓanndu, bana ko ɗo sappina iyam hokkooɓe.

en: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
ff: 69 (0.004% ummatore) andi bana maayi ngam COVID-19.

en: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
ff: Sembe nyau be.limtol mayde ɗon feere-feere haa kunde worɓe be rewɓe

en: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
ff: Limtol mayde ɓuri maunugo haa worɓe haa nder ekkitolji je salli haa Cayna be Italy.

en: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
ff: Sababu je ɓuri maunugo haa worɓe ɗon gal duuɓi 50, be feeretirol haa kunde worɓe be rewɓe haa duuɓi 90.

en: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
ff: haa Cayna, limtol mayde woni worɓe 2.8 nder temere be worɓe 1.7 haa nder temere.

en: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
ff: Ujaji gonga ngam feeretirol worɓe be rewɓe aandakke, amma geneji be gikku foti wona uja ndu.

en: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
ff: Feeretirolji fadol ɓanndu haa kunde worɓe be rewɓe, lessugo be foɗɗol haa rewɓe be worɓe je ɗon sappina sababuji nyau bana nyau illol iyam be semɓe diga sukkajo do rewɓe foti ɓesdi no limtol mayde jur haa worɓe.

en: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
ff: haa Erop, 57% yimɓe je mari nyau woni worɓe be 72% nyauɓe je maayi ngam COVID-19 woni worɓe.

en: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
ff: haa Aviiril 2020, ngomna Lesɗe America larata matinolji je laarani baadal nyauji COVID-19.

en: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
ff: Teffol sappini yo'o nyauji viriis bana Ebola, HIV, ndamba be SARS ɗon memma worɓe be rewɓe be feerejo.

en: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
ff: Ɗuɗɗum cakka huwooɓe do jam ɓanndu, lekkitaɓe, rewbe, e ɓe ɗon mari sa'a maungel ngam wondugo haa yeeso viriis.

en: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
ff: Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu matini haa 11 Feviriye 2020 yo'o inde nyau ndu wonan "COVID-19".

en: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
ff: Arduɗo WHO Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus holli yo'o CO yiɗi wi'ugo Korona, VI bo'o viriis, D ngam nyau, be 19 ngam wakkati aranool wangol nyau ndu: 31 Desambre 2019.

en: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
ff: Inde ndu suɓɓotto ngam tato hawta be inde wakkere feerejo (bana Cayna), asngol daaba malla gee

en: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
ff: WHO ɗon ɓesda bo'o "viriis COVID-19" be "viriis je ɗon hokka COVID-19" haa nder ngewte ummatore maaɗa.

en: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
ff: Nyau be viriis ɗiɗi fu ɗon ewni bana "koronaviriis".

en: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
ff: haa fuɗɗam wangol nyau haa Wuha, Cayna, viriis be nyau ewnotto no bana "koronaviriis" be "koronaviriis Wuhan".

en: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
ff: haa Zaanviye 2020, WHO feeli nyau pofɗe je deydey 2019-nCov be 2019-nCoV bana inde je hiddeko viriis be nyau bana feeloji fadol 2015 ngam watugo inde wakkere nyau be viriis.

en: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
ff: Inde gonga COVID-19 be SARS-CoV-2 wurti haa 11 Feviriye 2020.

en: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
ff: Ngam dabareji je ɗon mari keerolji haa nder soddugo kujeji, taggooɓe kujeji ɗon wurtina kujeji je laarani jam ɓanndu bana kujeji hoosugo leeku be ordoji pofɗe.

en: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
ff: haa nder sappinol gooto, haa wakkati je suudu lekki feere haa Italy emmi kuje ordo fartugo hendu nder jaawal, sippoowo footay wangina ɗum haa nder wakkati je ɗon emmi, sippoowo feere haa wakkere je wala inde larti kuje man e wurtini 100 be jemma.

en: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
