ff: haa ɓaawo arandere nyau COVID-19, ngewte tufle, matinolji je yahay malla lasbinugo matinollji ɗon no dogga do internati ngam ko laarani wangirde, yahde, aynol, hurgol be mandolji nyau.

en: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
ff: Yimɓe laati bana foti sankitta viriis haa nder daabaji feere.

en: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
ff: Ekkitol ndu heɓɓay sappinolji nuftol viriisji haa nder gaduji, kanarji, be goortoɗe.

en: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
ff: Wala lekki malla baatal je jarfi foti hurga nyau.

en: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
ff: Teffol haa nder duniyaru do baatalji be lekki haa COVID-19 ɗon haɓda ngam wurtinugo ndu gal geeɓeji, geeɓe jam'iareji be teffooɓe tagooɓe.

en: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
ff: haa Maars, Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam ɓanndu fuɗɗi be "SOLIDARITY Trial" ngam lartugo sababuji hurgol hawtirde lekki nay je ɗon sappina naffitirki ɗuɗɗum.

en: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
ff: Wala baatal je ɗon wondi, amma geeɓeji jur ɗon huwa do baatalji foondol be sembe

en: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
ff: Kuɗe sallingo do SARS-Cov naffi ngam SARS-CoV BE sars cOv-2 ɗiɗi fu ɗon huwa be ACE2 ngam nastugo nder ɓali neɗɗo.

en: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
ff: woodi dabareji baatal da lartol jonta.

en: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
ff: Aranool, teffooɓe yiɗi wanginugo baatal viriis man sam.

en: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
ff: Huwidugo be irin viriis ndu, ko to huwata malla maynama, yiɗi findinugo jabbuye ngam haɓre haa nder ɓanndu neɗɗo haa nyau COVID-19 keese.

en: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
ff: Dabare ɗiɗaɓool, geeɓe baatalji, yiɗi wurtinugo baatal je ɗon findina fadol ɓanndu ngam geeɓeji viriis feere.

en: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
ff: Bana ko laarani SARS-CoV-2, irin teffol don laarani protein S-spike je don mballita virris nasta nder neebam je jabbitata ACE2.

en: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
ff: Dabare tataɓool laati je baatalji nucleic acid (DNA malla RNA, dabare keese ngam wanginugo baatal).

en: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
ff: Bataalji foondol haa cakka gooto dabareji ndu sey larta ngam jam be naffitirki. haa 16 Maars 2020, aranool lartol baatal fuɗɗi be foondooɓe nay haa nay.

en: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
ff: Baatal ɗon mari lamɓa gene je wala sababu je hoosi haa viriis je ɗon hokka viriis. Fadoowo ɓanndu feelama bana baatal je foti hurga SARS-CoV-2, amma teffooɓe feere yarday ndu.

en: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
ff: woodi ɓuri foondolji suudu lekki 300 do teffol diga Aviiril 2020.

en: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
ff: Foondolji joowey e ɗiɗi ɗon larta lekki je ɗon yardi nder hurgolji paɓɓooje, be ekkitolji nay do hydroxychloroquine malla chloroquine.

en: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
ff: Lekki mbardugo viriisji je ɗon larti woni laahal ɓurna teffolji haa Cayna, be foondolji Yaɓɓorde III do remdesivir haa nder lesɗe jur ngam lartol ragare Aviiril.

en: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
ff: Lartol huwidugo do baatal be lekki COVID-19 je warangu fuɗɗi wangugo, diga lewru Aviiril 2020.

en: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
ff: woodi tammunde sappinol ngam naffitirki gal remdesivir, haa Maars 2020.

en: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
ff: Yahde haa nder foondol haa suudu lekki tawama haa nyauɓe je ɗon hoosa remdesivir be hakiika.

en: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
ff: Foondolji Yaɓɓorde III haa suudu lekki je salli haa Lesɗe America, Cayna be Italy. Chloroquine, haa aran ɗon no naffa ngam hurgol malaria, lartotto haa Cayna haa Feviriye 2020, be sappinolji aranool.

en: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
ff: Amma, woodi ewnanduji ngam lartol teffol ndu.

en: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
ff: Arduɓe Jam ɓanndu Korea be Cayna ɗon feela hoosugo chloroquine.

en: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
ff: Amma, Wuhan Institute of Virology, feelugo hoosugo lekki dose gram woore haa nder balɗe, ɗon matina yo'o dose ndu mari sababu ɗuɗɗum e foti mbara.

en: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
ff: haa 28 Maars 2020, FDA wurtini jarfuye ngam jaawal do hydroxychloroquine be chloroquine bila aandinugo haa lekkitoɓe je ɗon sukla do hurgol yimɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19. Batakkewol sappinol 7 ɗon laarani interferon, ribavirin malla umifenovir ngam hurgugo COVID-19.

en: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
ff: Arandere matinolji holli yo'o doseji ribavirin ɗon woodi naffitirki do tuttol SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.

en: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
ff: Nitazoxanide feelama ngam ekkitolji in vivo haa ɓaawo sappinol concentration tuttol SARS-CoV-2 ɗon lessi. Ekkitolji sappini yo'o ta'ugo arandere protein spike gal transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) laati kanduɗum ngam SARS-CoV-2 gal kugal be jaɓɓowo ACE2.

en: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
ff: Ekkitolji do chloroquine be hydroxychloroquine be malla bila azithromycin ɗon woodi keleewolji je haɗɗi ummatore lekki amin ngam jaɓɓugo ndu bila ekkitolji feere. Oseltamivir tuttata SARS-CoV-2 in vitro e kugal ngel aandakke haa nder hurgol COVID-19.

en: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
ff: Dullure cytokine foti wona sababu haa nder yahdeji COVID-19 feere je nyaɗum.

en: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
ff: woodi sappinol yo'o hydroxychloroquine foti mara dabareji wilugo dullure cytokine. Tocilizumab nastinama haa nder dabareji hurgol gal China's National Health Commission haa ɓaawo timminol ekkitol feere pamaron.

en: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
ff: Don sallina ta'irde 2 je lartol bila subol haa nder lesdi Italy haa bawo sappinol be tawi nyau haa yimbe be nyau je don nyadi.

en: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
ff: Hawti be lartol neebam ferriitin iyam ngam maandugo dulluru cytokine, kugal man laati haɗɗugo irin yahdeji ndu, je laati bana ɗaaɗol mayde haa yimɓe feere je ɗon mari nyau ndu.

en: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
ff: Jaɓɓowo interleukin-6 antagonist ɗonj jarfi gal FDA do ekkitolji je sallingo ngam hurgol steroid refractory cytokine je wangi gal hurgol cell CAR T, he 2017.

en: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
ff: Haande, walla sappinol bana ni, je aandintiri be fakatre yo'o tocilizumab laati kanduɗum ngam hurgol CRS.

en: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
ff: Sallinugo fadooɓe ɓanndu je ɗon laɓɓi e hawti je ɓanndu yimɓe je hurgotto ngam COVID-19 wangini haa yimɓe je mari haaje man ɗon do lartol bana dabare fadol bila aandugo.

en: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
ff: Dabare ndu fondotto ngam SARS amma hokkay ɓibe.

en: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
ff: Mbardugo viriis laati bana dabare kugal gal ndu hurgol gal fadoowo ɓanndu je aandakke foti wangina fadol ngam SARS-CoV-2.

en: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
ff: Kujeji feere, bana ko mbiyotto cellular cytotoxity e/malla nyamtidugo, foti wona.

en: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
ff: Irin dabareji hurgol gal fadoowo ɓanndu je aandakke, bana sappinol, gal fadooɓe ɓanndu je mari kosngal gooto, ɗon yahde.

en: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
ff: Wurtinol neebam iyam haa goɗɗo je ɗon do hurgol, je laati ndiyam iyam he hoccama haa nyauɓe je nyamɓitti e ɗon mari faɗooɓe ɓanndu do viriis, foti ɓesdotto ngam jabbugo be laugel.

en: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
ff: Nyau koronaviriis, geeɓe mandolji je ɗon hawti

en: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
ff: Li Wenliang, lekkitajo haa Central Hospital Wuhan, je nangi nyau COVID-19 e je maayi haa ɓaawo je o ewni hakkilo yimɓe do sankittol viris.
